2016-11-04.lead_paragraph: For his bookshop and website One Grand Books, the editor Aaron Hicklin asked people to name the 10 books they’d take with them if they were marooned on a desert island. The next in the series is the musician and writer Kim Gordon, whose new album, “No Waves” — released by Body/Head, her duo with Bill Nace — is out Nov. 11.  She shares her list exclusively with T.
2016-11-04.headline_main: My 10 Favorite Books: Kim Gordon

2016-11-04.abstract: If the election is making you consider leaving the United States, expats have a few words of advice on how to travel as if you’re moving rather than going on vacation.
2016-11-04.snippet: If the election is making you consider leaving the United States, expats have a few words of advice on how to travel as if you’re moving rather than going on vacation.
2016-11-04.lead_paragraph: Rob Calabrese, a Canadian radio disc jockey, launched a website earlier this year inviting Americans to take refuge on a Nova Scotia island. The site, Cape Breton if Donald Trump Wins, has received two million visits and so many inquiries about emigrating that it now offers a link to the Canadian government’s application. (President Obama even mentioned it during a state dinner with Justin Trudeau, the Canadian prime minister.) The site was, of course, a response to a familiar refrain, the threat to move abroad if politics doesn’t go your way. During this presidential campaign, people took to Twitter to vow to move to Canada, and the use of the search phrase “move to Canada” surged on Google.
2016-11-04.headline_main: Dreading a President Clinton or Trump? How to Try a New Country

2016-11-04.abstract: In a Manhattan bar crawl, the reality TV stars fixed drinks and provided a real-life diversion from a stressful world.
2016-11-04.snippet: In a Manhattan bar crawl, the reality TV stars fixed drinks and provided a real-life diversion from a stressful world.
2016-11-04.lead_paragraph: In the middle of an anxiety-inducing World Series Game 7, six days out from a presidential election, a bar crawl in New York City offered a brief glimpse into an alternate universe governed by some very well-known bartenders.
2016-11-04.headline_main: ‘Vanderpump Rules’ Cast Pours It On During a Bar Crawl

2016-11-04.abstract: Angela Mao was as famous as Bruce Lee when she was a martial arts film star during the 1970s. Then she seemed to vanish. It turns out she’s been in Queens this whole time.
2016-11-04.snippet: Angela Mao was as famous as Bruce Lee when she was a martial arts film star during the 1970s. Then she seemed to vanish. It turns out she’s been in Queens this whole time.

2016-11-04.headline_main: Searching for Lady Kung Fu

2016-11-04.abstract: Pat Conroy’s “A Lowcountry Heart,” a posthumous essay collection that includes some material from his charmingly capricious blog, is No. 11 on the hardcover nonfiction list.
2016-11-04.snippet: Pat Conroy’s “A Lowcountry Heart,” a posthumous essay collection that includes some material from his charmingly capricious blog, is No. 11 on the hardcover nonfiction list.
2016-11-04.lead_paragraph: A Lesser Tribe: For a few years before he died of pancreatic cancer last March, the novelist Pat Conroy maintained a charmingly capricious blog on his website. Fans may recognize some of its contents in “A Lowcountry Heart,” a posthumous essay collection new at No. 11 in hardcover nonfiction, including a tribute to the writer Ann Patchett that takes the long way to its destination. Here’s a sample detour, about physical beauty in the publishing world: “Late in my time at Houghton Mifflin, two young women arrived on the scene who were the talk of the company — Susan Minot with a novel called ‘Monkeys’ and Ann Patchett with one called ‘The Patron Saint of Liars.’ Both were talented, all agreed, but both were also drop dead beautiful.
2016-11-04.headline_main: The Story Behind This Week’s Best Sellers

2016-11-04.abstract: Michael Connelly continues to think up creative ways to keep his old war horse Harry Bosch on the job.
2016-11-04.snippet: Michael Connelly continues to think up creative ways to keep his old war horse Harry Bosch on the job.
2016-11-04.lead_paragraph: Sooner or later, Harry Bosch will have to turn in his gun and retire from police work, but until that time Michael Connelly continues to think up creative ways to keep his old war horse on the job. In THE WRONG SIDE OF GOODBYE (Little, Brown, $29), Bosch is doing part-time volunteer work for the undermanned police force of San Fernando, an independent town completely surrounded by the city of Los Angeles. “Look at me,” he remarks, “scratching and fighting to keep a badge on my belt at my age.” The work isn’t too taxing, but in going through several years’ worth of reports on sexual assaults, he notes a pattern common to four of these unsolved cases, which can only mean that a serial rapist is on the loose. And despite a bland sobriquet (“the Screen Cutter”) that makes him sound like the village handyman, this predator is likely to become ever more violent.
2016-11-04.headline_main: The Latest and Best in Crime Fiction

2016-11-04.abstract: Since 1979, Frank DePaola’s store in Astoria, Queens, has built a loyal following with its pastas, sauces, cheeses, oils and charcuterie.
2016-11-04.snippet: Since 1979, Frank DePaola’s store in Astoria, Queens, has built a loyal following with its pastas, sauces, cheeses, oils and charcuterie.
2016-11-04.lead_paragraph: On a recent Sunday in Astoria, Queens, Sal DePaola looked out the windows of Sorriso Italian Salumeria, a box of a store with its walls nearly bursting with Italian foodstuffs. Gesturing toward the street, he lamented that some of the area’s residents seem set in their daily routines, too focused to even notice the humble storefront.
2016-11-04.headline_main: It’s All Smiles at Sorriso Italian Market in Queens

2016-11-04.abstract: Ms. Bove, who has a new solo show at David Zwirner, says she thinks of her inner self as large. Well, her sculptures are even larger, much larger.
2016-11-04.snippet: Ms. Bove, who has a new solo show at David Zwirner, says she thinks of her inner self as large. Well, her sculptures are even larger, much larger.
2016-11-04.lead_paragraph: A visit to the sculptor Carol Bove’s studio in a former brick factory near the Brooklyn waterfront does not exactly make Rimbaud’s advice for the true artist — to engage in a “boundless and systematized disorganization of all the senses” — leap to mind. A huge manufacturing floor dominated by an overhead gantry that looks as if it could hoist a subway car, the place instead evokes distinctly unpoetic phrases like “productivity gains” and “customer fulfillment strategies.”
2016-11-04.headline_main: Sculpture’s Woman of Steel, Carol Bove

2016-11-04.lead_paragraph: When the photographer Melissa Bunni Elian looked at an aerial image of Yonkers, she saw two cities: Atop the New York suburb’s many hills were tree-lined streets and stately homes; beneath them lay a dense grid of buildings. “One area was basically a park, and the other was concrete,” said Ms. Elian, who grew up in Yonkers. “That really spoke to me of the inequality in America.”

2016-11-04.abstract: For the 33-year-old waitress, athlete and single mother, running comes first (before the sun rises) so she can fit in as many hours as possible with her daughter.
2016-11-04.snippet: For the 33-year-old waitress, athlete and single mother, running comes first (before the sun rises) so she can fit in as many hours as possible with her daughter.
2016-11-04.lead_paragraph: Domenica Ramos immigrated to New York City from Ecuador in 2001. In 2013, she started starting running to cope with the stress of single motherhood and quickly became a Boston Marathon qualifier, finishing her fourth marathon last month in Chicago with a time of 3 hours 24 minutes 12 seconds. A resident of Hamilton Heights in Manhattan, Ms. Ramos, 33, balances training with 12-hour waitressing shifts and caring for her 6-year-old daughter, Gabriela. She was hoping to finish the New York City Marathon in 3 hours 20 minutes. Recently, however, a mild injury flared up, threatening to slow Ms. Ramos down, but not stop her: “Deeply in my heart,” she said, “I want to line up at the start and run this marathon.”
2016-11-04.headline_main: How Domenica Ramos, Marathon Runner, Spends Her Sundays

2016-11-04.lead_paragraph: Turnout for early voting is up among Latino voters, compared with the 2012 election, in Florida and other swing states. That’s a relief for Hillary Clinton and her supporters. It’s also an opportunity for the small army of organizers, data analysts and researchers who try to better understand and refine the methods for getting people to the polls. Through Tuesday, they will field-test methods that could shape the demographic future of the major parties.

2016-11-04.abstract: A by-no-means exhaustive list of items we like (especially now that there’s a chill in the air).
2016-11-04.snippet: A by-no-means exhaustive list of items we like (especially now that there’s a chill in the air).
2016-11-04.lead_paragraph: If Ariana Bohling’s alpaca slippers look insanely soft, it’s because they are. Available exclusively at NoLita’s eco-friendly design boutique Côte à Coast, they are made in Peru, where alpacas are a protected species, from animals that die naturally while roaming freely in their native habitat. The slippers are beyond cozy, not to mention the bonus entertainment factor: They make your feet look like Dr. Seuss characters. $175, available in men’s and women’s sizes,  350 Bowery, New York, NY. — MARY KAYE SCHILLING
2016-11-04.headline_main: Four Cozy Things T Editors Are Really Into Right Now

2016-11-04.abstract: In “Kings of War,” the director Ivo van Hove adapts five history plays into a conflagration of corruption, factionalism and political viciousness.
2016-11-04.snippet: In “Kings of War,” the director Ivo van Hove adapts five history plays into a conflagration of corruption, factionalism and political viciousness.
2016-11-04.lead_paragraph: During the more than four thrilling hours of Ivo van Hove’s “Kings of War,” an omnibus adaptation of five Shakespearean history plays at the Brooklyn Academy of Music, you may feel that those disturbing noises coming from the stage are just echoes of what you’re hearing in your own head these days. Sometimes there’s the amplified ticking of a clock, a bursting heartbeat, a mismatched thrum of tentacular chords or a brass fanfare sliding into sinister dissonance.
2016-11-04.headline_main: Review: Shakespeare’s Take on the Game of Thrones

2016-11-04.snippet: Here’s what you need to know at the end of the day.
2016-11-04.lead_paragraph: (Want to get this briefing by email? Here’s the sign-up.)
2016-11-04.headline_main: Clinton, Trump, Christie: Your Friday Evening Briefing

2016-11-04.abstract: Readers solve the case of a painter with terrible headaches.
2016-11-04.snippet: Readers solve the case of a painter with terrible headaches.
2016-11-04.lead_paragraph: Yesterday we challenged Well readers to take on the case of a 63-year-old artist who, over the course of several months, developed excruciating headaches, along with changes in his personality, his thinking, even in the way he painted. We provided you with some of the doctor’s notes and medical imaging results that led the doctor who finally made the diagnosis in the right direction.
2016-11-04.headline_main: Think Like a Doctor: The Painter’s Headaches Solved!

2016-11-04.abstract: We asked to see photos of your marathon training, and you delivered. Here's what #MyRunLooksLike.
2016-11-04.snippet: We asked to see photos of your marathon training, and you delivered. Here's what #MyRunLooksLike.
2016-11-04.lead_paragraph: We asked to see photos of your marathon training, and you delivered. Here's what #MyRunLooksLike.
2016-11-04.headline_main: #MyRunLooksLike: The Road to the Marathon Start Line

2016-11-04.abstract: Andrew Caspersen, a Wall Street executive from a well-off family, received a far shorter sentence than prosecutors sought after a doctor testified he had a gambling addiction.
2016-11-04.snippet: Andrew Caspersen, a Wall Street executive from a well-off family, received a far shorter sentence than prosecutors sought after a doctor testified he had a gambling addiction.
2016-11-04.lead_paragraph: Andrew Caspersen, the disgraced scion of a wealthy Wall Street family, was sentenced on Friday to four years in prison for robbing his friends, family members and a large hedge fund foundation in a Ponzi-like scheme.
2016-11-04.headline_main: Wall St. Scion Gets 4 Years in Prison for Fraud

2016-11-04.abstract: C’mon, man, these are the Cubs; they’ll surely cooperate, as they have for the past 108 years.
2016-11-04.snippet: C’mon, man, these are the Cubs; they’ll surely cooperate, as they have for the past 108 years.
2016-11-04.lead_paragraph: Times Insider delivers behind-the-scenes insights into how news, features and opinion come together at The New York Times. Here, Wayne Kamidoi, a Times art director, reveals the very special image that was planned for the Sports section front had the Cleveland Indians triumphed in the World Series.
2016-11-04.headline_main: The World Series Sports Page That Wasn’t

2016-11-04.abstract: What a World Series — especially if you’ve played for both the Cubs and Terry Francona.
2016-11-04.snippet: What a World Series — especially if you’ve played for both the Cubs and Terry Francona.
2016-11-04.lead_paragraph: As a baseball analyst for ESPN, I have to remain neutral, but that doesn’t erase my history. I was a Chicago Cub, and I also played for Terry Francona, now the Cleveland Indians manager, what seems like a lifetime ago. So amid the excitement of seeing my first professional organization have a chance to win it all, and get further than I ever reached in my major-league career, I knew that someone had to lose. And I had friends on both sides.
2016-11-04.headline_main: United Loyalties

2016-11-04.abstract: The jury in South Carolina viewed the cellphone footage that spurred Mr. Slager’s prosecution and became a symbol of the national debate over race and policing.
2016-11-04.snippet: The jury in South Carolina viewed the cellphone footage that spurred Mr. Slager’s prosecution and became a symbol of the national debate over race and policing.
2016-11-04.lead_paragraph: CHARLESTON, S.C. — Before court began here on Friday, the county’s chief prosecutor stepped into the gallery and spoke quietly to the family of Walter L. Scott, a black man who was shot and killed by a white police officer last year.
2016-11-04.headline_main: Tense Jurors in Michael Slager Trial See Video of Killing of Walter Scott

2016-11-04.abstract: HBO was eager to tap Mr. Simmons’s base of readers of his sports column, but that audience failed to materialize.
2016-11-04.snippet: HBO was eager to tap Mr. Simmons’s base of readers of his sports column, but that audience failed to materialize.
2016-11-04.lead_paragraph: After premiering to sky-high expectations this summer, Bill Simmons’s weekly HBO show has been canceled.
2016-11-04.headline_main: Bill Simmons’s HBO Program Is Canceled

2016-11-04.abstract: A federal judge, rejecting a challenge by Republican operatives, prohibited three counties from revoking registrations just before the presidential election.
2016-11-04.snippet: A federal judge, rejecting a challenge by Republican operatives, prohibited three counties from revoking registrations just before the presidential election.
2016-11-04.lead_paragraph: A federal judge barred three North Carolina counties on Friday from revoking the voting rights of thousands of residents whose eligibility to cast ballots had been challenged by Republican political operatives only weeks before the presidential election.
2016-11-04.headline_main: Ruling Preserves Voting Rights for Thousands in North Carolina

2016-11-04.abstract: An Indians fan looks back on the World Series, without rancor or second-guessing, and finds it will take time to recover.
2016-11-04.snippet: An Indians fan looks back on the World Series, without rancor or second-guessing, and finds it will take time to recover.
2016-11-04.lead_paragraph: CLEVELAND — This one hurt.
2016-11-04.headline_main: Looking Back (Sigh) at the End (Sigh) of the Indians’ Great Season (Sigh)

2016-11-04.abstract: Dr. Seeley worked to provide equal opportunity to young people, through political actions and community alliances, for more than 50 years.
2016-11-04.snippet: Dr. Seeley worked to provide equal opportunity to young people, through political actions and community alliances, for more than 50 years.
2016-11-04.lead_paragraph: David S. Seeley, a lawyer and educator who devoted his career in government and academia to racially integrating the United States’ schools and to upgrading them through a collaborative movement involving students, teachers, parents and community organizations, died on Oct. 30 on Staten Island. He was 85.
2016-11-04.headline_main: David Seeley, Educator Who Fought Against Segregation, Dies at 85

2016-11-04.abstract: Mr. Bryant, who retired from basketball, has entered several other ventures.
2016-11-04.snippet: Mr. Bryant, who retired from basketball, has entered several other ventures.
2016-11-04.lead_paragraph: Los Angeles — Ancient Buddhists believed reincarnation was instantaneous upon death. Jewish texts have long foretold an afterlife of revolving souls. Many Catholics swear by the transformative power of holy water. For sports celebrities, reinvention is much easier. Sometimes all it takes is a shoe launch and presto — the end is a beginning.
2016-11-04.headline_main: Kobe Bryant’s Next Step, New Shoes and Moves With Los Angeles Artists

2016-11-04.abstract: The information contained in the chain in 2009 was later declared to be classified by the State Department.
2016-11-04.snippet: The information contained in the chain in 2009 was later declared to be classified by the State Department.
2016-11-04.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Hillary Clinton forwarded a chain of emails in 2009 to her daughter, Chelsea, that included information, most likely about climate talks, that the State Department later declared to be classified, according to a new batch of emails released on Friday.
2016-11-04.headline_main: Clinton Forwarded Daughter Email Chain Most Likely About Climate Talks

2016-11-05.abstract: Miller, after quadruple-bypass surgery, returned for his 44th season calling Kings games, though other broadcasters like Jiggs McDonald will fill in for some road games.
2016-11-05.snippet: Miller, after quadruple-bypass surgery, returned for his 44th season calling Kings games, though other broadcasters like Jiggs McDonald will fill in for some road games.
2016-11-05.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES — Before their home opener last month, the Los Angeles Kings kicked off a yearlong celebration of their 50th anniversary with a pregame ceremony that featured many of the team’s greats, including Wayne Gretzky. But one of the loudest ovations was accorded Bob Miller, a Hall of Fame broadcaster who enters his 44th season as the voice of the Kings.
2016-11-05.headline_main: Bob Miller, a Veteran Los Angeles Announcer Younger Than Vin Scully and Unready to Retire

2016-11-05.abstract: At a hearing with state lawmakers, the new leader of the agency, Steven Santoro, called the issues “unacceptable” and pledged improvements.
2016-11-05.snippet: At a hearing with state lawmakers, the new leader of the agency, Steven Santoro, called the issues “unacceptable” and pledged improvements.
2016-11-05.lead_paragraph: TRENTON — A federal investigation of New Jersey Transit’s railroad this year revealed that workers used personal cellphones while on duty and train crews failed to properly test brakes or blow horns at crossings, among other problems, the agency’s executive director told state legislators at a hearing here on Friday.
2016-11-05.headline_main: Federal Investigation of New Jersey Transit Finds Numerous Safety Violations

2016-11-05.abstract: You say you have some last-minute questions?
2016-11-05.snippet: You say you have some last-minute questions?
2016-11-05.lead_paragraph: O.K., guys. It’s election time. You probably have a few last-minute questions. Fire away.
2016-11-05.headline_main: Last Gasp Election Briefing

2016-11-05.abstract: As a result of an investigation, the federal Education Department announced that the city agreed to revamp its procedures.
2016-11-05.snippet: As a result of an investigation, the federal Education Department announced that the city agreed to revamp its procedures.
2016-11-05.lead_paragraph: Public schools are required to educate children with disabilities in regular classrooms as much as possible, but according to a federal investigation, the Yonkers school system routinely flouted that rule. And instead of creating a specific plan for each student, as is required, the district essentially copied and pasted language from one child’s file to the next.
2016-11-05.headline_main: Yonkers Schools Flouted Rules on Special Education, U.S. Agency Says

2016-11-05.abstract: As the region has become more congested and expensive, there are growing demands to rein in the physical space that many technologists call home.
2016-11-05.snippet: As the region has become more congested and expensive, there are growing demands to rein in the physical space that many technologists call home.
2016-11-05.lead_paragraph: CUPERTINO, Calif. — Silicon Valley is bent on disrupting the world. Its products affect how millions upon millions of people live and work. But when it comes to the physical space that many technologists call home, there are increasing demands to leave things alone.
2016-11-05.headline_main: ‘We Almost Have Riots’: Tensions Flare in Silicon Valley Over Growth

2016-11-05.abstract: “Vail Dance Festival: ReMix NYC” features ballet rarities and premieres, including Alexei Ratmansky’s “Fandango,” as well as collaborations like Lil Buck and Yo-Yo Ma.
2016-11-05.snippet: “Vail Dance Festival: ReMix NYC” features ballet rarities and premieres, including Alexei Ratmansky’s “Fandango,” as well as collaborations like Lil Buck and Yo-Yo Ma.
2016-11-05.lead_paragraph: Damian Woetzel, impressively ambitious, has been making dance history for 10 years in Vail, Colo. As artistic director of the two-week Vail International Dance Festival, he assembles each August a top-class gathering of performers in multiple genres. No single program is performed twice. World premieres by front-rank choreographers (notably Alexei Ratmansky and Christopher Wheeldon) occur. So do unexpected partnerships between dancers from different companies and far-apart disciplines.
2016-11-05.headline_main: Review: From Balanchine to Jookin, a Sampler of Summer Souvenirs

2016-11-05.abstract: Inside the ring, Air Time — a 1,650-pound black-and-white compact car of an animal — lives up to his name, but outside it he is a timid creature easily spooked by even his own shadow.
2016-11-05.snippet: Inside the ring, Air Time — a 1,650-pound black-and-white compact car of an animal — lives up to his name, but outside it he is a timid creature easily spooked by even his own shadow.
2016-11-05.lead_paragraph: Here’s a secret about the toughest, most feared bull on the professional bull-riding circuit: He’s a big baby.
2016-11-05.headline_main: What Is Bull Riding’s Scariest Beast Afraid Of? You Name It

2016-11-05.abstract: The battle for Mosul raged on Friday and streams of civilians continued an exodus from the city.
2016-11-05.snippet: The battle for Mosul raged on Friday and streams of civilians continued an exodus from the city.
2016-11-05.lead_paragraph: The battle for Mosul, Iraq, raged on Friday and streams of civilians continued an exodus from the city.
2016-11-05.headline_main: Seeking Shelter After Fleeing Mosul

2016-11-05.abstract: The former Bulls Derrick Rose and Joakim Noah returned to Chicago on Friday night and were greeted by boos and cheers as they helped the Knicks win, 117-104.
2016-11-05.snippet: The former Bulls Derrick Rose and Joakim Noah returned to Chicago on Friday night and were greeted by boos and cheers as they helped the Knicks win, 117-104.
2016-11-05.lead_paragraph: CHICAGO — Tyler Pleiss was home from college on April 28, 2012, a date that sticks in the minds of many here. Pleiss was on the couch at his parents’ home in Omaha, watching the Bulls rough up the Philadelphia 76ers in a first-round playoff game. Thinking the game was essentially over, he had lost interest. And then it happened.
2016-11-05.headline_main: An Odd Homecoming Precedes a Knicks Road Win

2016-11-05.abstract: Fewer people experience a “natural death” anymore. Doctors should rethink their opposition to right-to-die laws.
2016-11-05.snippet: Fewer people experience a “natural death” anymore. Doctors should rethink their opposition to right-to-die laws.
2016-11-05.lead_paragraph: DURHAM, N.C. — Out of nowhere, a patient I recently met in my clinic told me, “If my heart stops, doctor, just let me go.”
2016-11-05.headline_main: On Assisted Suicide, Going Beyond ‘Do No Harm’

2016-11-05.abstract: In denouncing him as a liar, the media didn’t go far enough.
2016-11-05.snippet: In denouncing him as a liar, the media didn’t go far enough.
2016-11-05.lead_paragraph: As the Republican candidate for president in 2016, Donald J. Trump has accomplished many things. He engaged in rhetorical tactics unprecedented in recent American electoral history. He was straightforwardly misogynistic. He repeatedly endorsed obviously false claims. There were frequent open discussions of the intentions behind his many odd comments, retractions, semi-retractions and outright false statements.
2016-11-05.headline_main: Beyond Lying: Donald Trump’s Authoritarian Reality

2016-11-05.abstract: This was the season Major League Baseball was going to get serious about reducing fan injuries, by extending protective netting. A woman’s injury in Game 7 of the World Series proved otherwise.
2016-11-05.snippet: This was the season Major League Baseball was going to get serious about reducing fan injuries, by extending protective netting. A woman’s injury in Game 7 of the World Series proved otherwise.
2016-11-05.lead_paragraph: At Wednesday night’s glorious Game 7, there was only one real down moment for baseball. In the top of the seventh inning, a fan was knocked out cold by a scorching foul ball.
2016-11-05.headline_main: Lost in Game 7’s Dazzle, Another Fan’s Senseless Injury

2016-11-05.abstract: Moving to reduce the number of New Yorkers in shelters, Mayor Bill de Blasio’s administration is requiring developers that got 421-a subsidies to give some units to homeless people.
2016-11-05.snippet: Moving to reduce the number of New Yorkers in shelters, Mayor Bill de Blasio’s administration is requiring developers that got 421-a subsidies to give some units to homeless people.
2016-11-05.lead_paragraph: As the number of New Yorkers living in shelters continues to rise, the administration of Mayor Bill de Blasio has told real estate developers they must make room for the homeless in buildings that received tax breaks under a program designed to increase the stock of affordable housing.
2016-11-05.headline_main: Builders That Got Tax Breaks Must Set Aside Some Units for Homeless, City Says

2016-11-05.abstract: Assigning sexually demeaning rankings to incoming members of the women’s soccer team leads the prestigious university to cancel the remainder of the men’s season.
2016-11-05.snippet: Assigning sexually demeaning rankings to incoming members of the women’s soccer team leads the prestigious university to cancel the remainder of the men’s season.
2016-11-05.lead_paragraph: CAMBRIDGE, Mass. — They rated the women on a sexual appeal scale of 1 to 10, including explicit descriptions of their physical traits and musings about the women’s preferred sexual positions.
2016-11-05.headline_main: Harvard Men’s Soccer Team Is Sidelined for Vulgar ‘Scouting Report’

2016-11-05.abstract: Pete Kostelnick, who recently set a record for running across the United States, is among Americans shattering marks in a historically reclusive sport.
2016-11-05.snippet: Pete Kostelnick, who recently set a record for running across the United States, is among Americans shattering marks in a historically reclusive sport.
2016-11-05.lead_paragraph: It wasn’t the truck plowing into his support crew’s van that rattled him, or the fever that left his teeth chattering into the night or even the severe desert sunburn that streaked his flesh pink. But when tendinitis seized his ankle and crept up his shins until they swelled, Pete Kostelnick second-guessed himself for trying to log the fastest run across America ever recorded. He was still only in Nevada.
2016-11-05.headline_main: Faster, Farther, More Frequent: Ultramarathon Runners Keep Pushing Limits

2016-11-05.abstract: In Iowa and Florida, it’s actually been Republican supporters accused of fraud. Yet their party continues to try to disenfranchise minority voters.
2016-11-05.snippet: In Iowa and Florida, it’s actually been Republican supporters accused of fraud. Yet their party continues to try to disenfranchise minority voters.
2016-11-05.lead_paragraph: In recent years Republicans in state legislatures have expressed grave concern about voter fraud as they presented a “solution” of tough voter ID laws and other restrictions that deprive low-income and minority voters of the ballot. Many of these voter-suppression measures have become law despite clear evidence that voter fraud is practically nonexistent.
2016-11-05.headline_main: Republicans and the Myth of Election Fraud

2016-11-05.abstract: An F.B.I. bulletin said that Al Qaeda might be planning attacks for Monday, but an official said there was skepticism about the credibility of the information.
2016-11-05.snippet: An F.B.I. bulletin said that Al Qaeda might be planning attacks for Monday, but an official said there was skepticism about the credibility of the information.
2016-11-05.lead_paragraph: The Police Department will be on heightened alert in coming days in response to a warning about possible terrorist activity that could occur the day before the presidential election, Mayor Bill de Blasio said on Friday.
2016-11-05.headline_main: New York Police on Alert After Warning of Terror Attack Before Election

2016-11-05.abstract: Quotation of the day for Saturday, November 5, 2016.
2016-11-05.snippet: Quotation of the day for Saturday, November 5, 2016.
2016-11-05.lead_paragraph: “Let me be clear once again. I had no knowledge prior to or during these lane realignments, and had no role in authorizing them. No believable evidence was presented to contradict that fact.”
2016-11-05.headline_main: Quotation of the Day

2016-11-05.abstract: A rare visit to the city’s western side revealed weariness and violence despite President Bashar al-Assad’s claims that residents are safe.
2016-11-05.snippet: A rare visit to the city’s western side revealed weariness and violence despite President Bashar al-Assad’s claims that residents are safe.
2016-11-05.lead_paragraph: ALEPPO, Syria — The government-held side of Aleppo looks halfway normal: bustling with restaurants, parks, hotel swimming pools and commuters. President Bashar al-Assad’s main pitch to his people is that they are safer in the territory he controls, a far cry from the bombs and hunger on the rebels’ half of the storied and strategic city.
2016-11-05.headline_main: ‘I Saw My Father Dying’: A View From Aleppo’s Government-Held Side

2016-11-05.abstract: Li Cunxin, the artistic director of the Australian company, said Mr. Scarlett would create new works for the ballet and stage some of his existing pieces, including “No Man’s Land.”
2016-11-05.snippet: Li Cunxin, the artistic director of the Australian company, said Mr. Scarlett would create new works for the ballet and stage some of his existing pieces, including “No Man’s Land.”
2016-11-05.lead_paragraph: The British choreographer Liam Scarlett, an important name in the ballet world, will become an artistic associate of the Queensland Ballet in 2017. The appointment, announced on Friday by Li Cunxin, the artistic director of the Australian company, follows the ballet’s work with Mr. Scarlett in April on his production of “A Midsummer Night’s Dream.”
2016-11-05.headline_main: Liam Scarlett Named to Queensland Ballet Post

2016-11-05.abstract: Ambassador David Pressman, who helped shape Obama administration policy on South Sudan, said he was “horrified and disgusted” at the violence.
2016-11-05.snippet: Ambassador David Pressman, who helped shape Obama administration policy on South Sudan, said he was “horrified and disgusted” at the violence.
2016-11-05.lead_paragraph: UNITED NATIONS — An American diplomat who helped shape the Obama administration’s efforts to steer South Sudan to independence in 2011 says he is appalled by the actions of its leaders, including those he personally knows.
2016-11-05.headline_main: U.S. Diplomat Who Helped South Sudan Says He’s Appalled by Strife There

2016-11-05.abstract: The hotel and condominium tower is in receivership after the owners failed to make debt payments for a year and a court ruled that investors were deceived.
2016-11-05.snippet: The hotel and condominium tower is in receivership after the owners failed to make debt payments for a year and a court ruled that investors were deceived.
2016-11-05.lead_paragraph: TORONTO — The first building in Canada to bear the name of Donald J. Trump — a 65-story hotel and condominium in downtown Toronto — did not get off to an auspicious start. Shortly after it opened in 2012, it started shedding glass, and for the first of many times, the police had to close the surrounding streets because of falling debris.
2016-11-05.headline_main: Trump Tower in Toronto Is in Receivership After Poor Sales

2016-11-05.abstract: Krav maga lessons started as research but became an enjoyable punishment.
2016-11-05.snippet: Krav maga lessons started as research but became an enjoyable punishment.
2016-11-05.lead_paragraph: My lessons in krav maga — a self-defense system — started with workouts that left me gasping for breath, including a nearly endless number of push-ups and burpees. Whenever I was about to give up, my instructor, Serge, would say, “Don’t give up, you do it!” He was clearly a man who wouldn’t take no for an answer, and I didn’t want to disappoint him.
2016-11-05.headline_main: Self-Defense for Novelists

2016-11-05.abstract: David Phillips returns with a Saturday challenge, and a unique new building at Hampshire College in Massachusetts offers clues of its own.
2016-11-05.snippet: David Phillips returns with a Saturday challenge, and a unique new building at Hampshire College in Massachusetts offers clues of its own.
2016-11-05.lead_paragraph: SATURDAY PUZZLE — David Phillips seems to be primarily a late-week constructor, but he’s ventured into weekday constructing as well. He needs only a Monday and a Wednesday puzzle to have hit for the cycle.
2016-11-05.headline_main: Not Going by the Book

2016-11-05.abstract: The candidate refuses to acknowledge what the official data show: that the country is doing better than it was just a few years ago.
2016-11-05.snippet: The candidate refuses to acknowledge what the official data show: that the country is doing better than it was just a few years ago.
2016-11-05.lead_paragraph: To listen to Donald Trump describe the American economy is to hear about a horrifying alternate reality in which the recession that started at the end of 2007 is still with us. The truth is very different. The recovery that began in the middle of 2009, though not perfect, has steadily created jobs and lifted wages.
2016-11-05.headline_main: Donald Trump’s Denial of Economic Reality

2016-11-05.abstract: Ballot initiatives in four states seek to circumvent the gun lobby’s intimidation of state legislators.
2016-11-05.snippet: Ballot initiatives in four states seek to circumvent the gun lobby’s intimidation of state legislators.
2016-11-05.lead_paragraph: While Congress shamefully fails to face up to the toll of gun carnage, California’s lawmakers and voters are forging ahead with innovative safety measures, including mandatory background checks for the purchase of ammunition, not just guns.
2016-11-05.headline_main: The Revival of Gun Controls Out West

2016-11-05.abstract: Donald Trump has made it difficult to avoid describing his behavior as racist.
2016-11-05.snippet: Donald Trump has made it difficult to avoid describing his behavior as racist.
2016-11-05.lead_paragraph: The Donald Trump campaign inadvertently performed a public service when it exposed the weakness and vulnerability of the euphemisms long used by political journalists. News organizations have been forced to acknowledge that phrases like “stretched the truth” and “fudged the facts” are useless for describing a candidate who speaks falsely in virtually every breath. Genteel circumlocution has given way to calling out lies as lies.
2016-11-05.headline_main: The Election That Obliterated Euphemisms

2016-11-05.abstract: Mr. Steiner worked a broad variety of jobs and was, among other things, a poker champion.
2016-11-05.snippet: Mr. Steiner worked a broad variety of jobs and was, among other things, a poker champion.
2016-11-05.lead_paragraph: Rick Steiner, a Broadway producer who compiled a remarkable string of box-office hits that included “The Producers,” “Hairspray” and “Jersey Boys,” died on Thursday at his home in Cincinnati. He was 69.
2016-11-05.headline_main: Rick Steiner, Producer of Broadway Hits, Dies at 69

2016-11-05.abstract: In the last full week of the campaign, Hillary Clinton and Donald J. Trump both held rallies in swing states around the country.
2016-11-05.snippet: In the last full week of the campaign, Hillary Clinton and Donald J. Trump both held rallies in swing states around the country.
2016-11-05.lead_paragraph: In the last full week of the campaign, Hillary Clinton and Donald J. Trump both held rallies in swing states around the country.
2016-11-05.headline_main: On the Trail: Week of Oct. 31

2016-11-05.abstract: The Greek prime minister, apparently with an eye on debt-relief talks, replaced the ministers of energy and labor but retained his finance minister.
2016-11-05.snippet: The Greek prime minister, apparently with an eye on debt-relief talks, replaced the ministers of energy and labor but retained his finance minister.
2016-11-05.lead_paragraph: ATHENS — Prime Minister Alexis Tsipras of Greece shuffled his cabinet on Friday, dismissing ministers who have objected to economic changes and austerity measures demanded by the country’s creditors.
2016-11-05.headline_main: Alexis Tsipras Shakes Up Cabinet to Soothe Greece’s Creditors

2016-11-05.abstract: After retiring from the Navy, Admiral La Rocque founded a think tank to promote peace and to monitor the influence of the military-industrial complex.
2016-11-05.snippet: After retiring from the Navy, Admiral La Rocque founded a think tank to promote peace and to monitor the influence of the military-industrial complex.
2016-11-05.lead_paragraph: Rear Adm. Gene La Rocque, a decorated Navy veteran who spoke out against the wastes of war, was labeled a traitor by some and went on to found the Center for Defense Information, a private think tank that was described as both pro-peace and pro-military, died on Monday in Washington. He was 98.
2016-11-05.headline_main: Gene La Rocque, Decorated Veteran Who Condemned Waste of War, Dies at 98

2016-11-05.abstract: Frank Baker of St. Paul was bitten by a police dog and kicked by an officer in June, an encounter captured on newly released dash camera footage.
2016-11-05.snippet: Frank Baker of St. Paul was bitten by a police dog and kicked by an officer in June, an encounter captured on newly released dash camera footage.
2016-11-05.lead_paragraph: On the day in June that Todd Axtell became police chief in St. Paul, he happened to meet Frank Baker, a local resident who wished him well in his new job. Then, the next night, a police dog bit Mr. Baker on the leg and a police officer kicked him, leaving him hospitalized for two weeks with collapsed lungs and large lacerations.
2016-11-05.headline_main: After Violent Encounter Between Police and a Black Man, Something Rare — An Apology

2016-11-05.abstract: A town that hosted thousands of travelers after Sept. 11 is the subject of a musical opening this month in Toronto. Plus, revelations that the police spied on journalists.
2016-11-05.snippet: A town that hosted thousands of travelers after Sept. 11 is the subject of a musical opening this month in Toronto. Plus, revelations that the police spied on journalists.
2016-11-05.lead_paragraph: When terrorist attacks grounded air travel on Sept. 11, 2001, Gander, Newfoundland, population 11,000, found itself playing host to 6,700 stranded travelers, most of them American. While that made the town famous for hospitality worldwide, its residents tend to play down their contributions.
2016-11-05.headline_main: Canada Today: Espionage, and Newfoundland’s Hospitality Comes to the Stage

2016-11-05.abstract: Donald J. Trump campaigned in New Hampshire, North Carolina and Pennsylvania while Hillary Clinton campaigned in Detroit and Pennsylvania before holding a concert with Beyonce and JAY Z in Cleveland.
2016-11-05.snippet: Donald J. Trump campaigned in New Hampshire, North Carolina and Pennsylvania while Hillary Clinton campaigned in Detroit and Pennsylvania before holding a concert with Beyonce and JAY Z in Cleveland.
2016-11-05.lead_paragraph: Donald J. Trump campaigned in New Hampshire, North Carolina and Pennsylvania while Hillary Clinton campaigned in Detroit and Pennsylvania before holding a concert with Beyonce and JAY Z in Cleveland.
2016-11-05.headline_main: On the Trail: Friday, Nov. 4

2016-11-05.abstract: Hillary Clinton and Donald J. Trump campaigned in Florida, with Mrs. Clinton basking in the rain and Mr. Trump sharing the stage with a (very) young fan.
2016-11-05.snippet: Hillary Clinton and Donald J. Trump campaigned in Florida, with Mrs. Clinton basking in the rain and Mr. Trump sharing the stage with a (very) young fan.
2016-11-05.lead_paragraph: A man was apprehended at a Donald Trump rally in Reno, Nev., on Saturday night, after someone shouted about a gun, but no weapon was found and the man was released.

2016-11-05.abstract: Murray can pass Novak Djokovic, who lost in the Paris Masters quarterfinals on Friday.
2016-11-05.snippet: Murray can pass Novak Djokovic, who lost in the Paris Masters quarterfinals on Friday.
2016-11-05.lead_paragraph: Novak Djokovic, a three-time defending champion, lost in the Paris Masters quarterfinals on Friday, leaving his No. 1 ranking open to being snatched by Andy Murray. Murray can rise from No. 2 to No. 1 in the ATP list for the first time if he reaches the final. He beat No. 11 Tomas Berdych, 7-6 (9), 7-5, to reach the semifinal, where his opponent will be Milos Raonic.
2016-11-05.headline_main: Win Puts Andy Murray on Verge of No. 1 Ranking

2016-11-05.abstract: John Bernd inspired a series exploring the impact of the AIDS epidemic on dance.
2016-11-05.snippet: John Bernd inspired a series exploring the impact of the AIDS epidemic on dance.
2016-11-05.lead_paragraph: The dancers performing at Danspace Project over the weekend were too young to have known John Bernd, the choreographer whose work they were interpreting. Yet in “Variations on Themes From Lost and Found: Scenes From a Life and Other Works by John Bernd,” which opened on Thursday, they seemed to be communing with the spirit of an old friend, coaxing him into the room, so that everyone there could know him.
2016-11-05.headline_main: Dancing Back the Spirit of an Old Friend

2016-11-05.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The emails to Michelle Obama began flooding in minutes after she spoke out at an October rally in New Hampshire, her voice shaking, about Donald J. Trump’s treatment of women. Sexual assault victims recounted their trauma, fathers poured out anxieties about unhealthy influences on their sons, and a distraught parent agonized over how to explain rape to a 10-year-old.

2016-11-05.abstract: Online shopping is easy, fast and completely devoid of any experiential pleasure.
2016-11-05.snippet: Online shopping is easy, fast and completely devoid of any experiential pleasure.
2016-11-05.lead_paragraph: When I was 6, my aunt took me shopping at Hutzler’s, the fancy department store in my hometown, Baltimore. Although it was the mid-1970s, ladies with blue-tinted hair ate sandwiches without crusts in the tearoom. And as we shopped, I wandered through what seemed like endless displays of textures, shapes, colors and smells.
2016-11-05.headline_main: The Case for Shopping in Real Life

2016-11-05.abstract: Western Michigan is 9-0, but the program’s success will most likely not provide a chance to play for a national championship and could result in the loss of its coach.
2016-11-05.snippet: Western Michigan is 9-0, but the program’s success will most likely not provide a chance to play for a national championship and could result in the loss of its coach.
2016-11-05.lead_paragraph: KALAMAZOO, Mich. — When Western Michigan hired P. J. Fleck before the 2013 season, he was, at 32, the youngest head coach in the Football Bowl Subdivision. With indomitable energy, offensive smarts — he had been a receivers coach in the N.F.L. — and a penchant for quirky motivational mantras like “Row The Boat,” he has turned the Broncos from a 1-11 doormat in his first year to a 9-0 team that is No. 17 in this week’s Associated Press poll.
2016-11-05.headline_main: Western Michigan’s Perfect Record Could Give Way to Pain Off the Field

Eventually, we started collecting the reports and seeking more information about 403(b)s, which are like 401(k)s for people who work at charities, universities and the like.

2016-11-05.abstract: A landlord can sue any or all of those named on the lease, so it’s best to keep paying the rent.
2016-11-05.snippet: A landlord can sue any or all of those named on the lease, so it’s best to keep paying the rent.
2016-11-05.lead_paragraph: Q. My boyfriend and I were both named on the lease of a garage apartment that we shared in Woodmere, N.Y. He died in July 2014 and I remained in the apartment, continuing to pay the full rent. Is my boyfriend’s estate liable for the balance of his half of the rent for the remainder of the term of the lease? I filed a claim with the surrogate court, but I am still waiting for a response.
2016-11-05.headline_main: A Roommate Dies; Must His Estate Pay the Rent?

2016-11-05.abstract: The rise can be attributed to increased public awareness and changes in British law stemming from a perception-based definition of what constitutes a hate crime.

2016-11-05.abstract: Although Jonathan Blum had spent his legal career advising businesses, turning his passion into a company wasn’t as straightforward as he had expected.
2016-11-05.snippet: Although Jonathan Blum had spent his legal career advising businesses, turning his passion into a company wasn’t as straightforward as he had expected.
2016-11-05.lead_paragraph: In 2014, Jonathan Blum, a corporate lawyer in the Bay Area, rented a U-Haul truck and loaded it with three pallets of soy sauce bottles. Mr. Blum, 49, had recently begun importing the sauce from Japan for his new business, Shiso Soy. This should have been a triumphant moment in his long quest to bring high-quality, artisanal Japanese soy sauces to the United States. Instead, he was headed to the town dump.
2016-11-05.headline_main: A Lawyer With a Taste for Soy Sauce and a High Tolerance for Pain

2016-11-05.abstract: Emily Cox and Henry Rathvon bring us some mixed up clues, cryptically speaking.
2016-11-05.snippet: Emily Cox and Henry Rathvon bring us some mixed up clues, cryptically speaking.
2016-11-05.lead_paragraph: There is usually more than one way to get to a cryptic crossword answer (I know this, because you’ve told me when I’m wrong even when I manage to wiggle my way to the right answer), although the recipe is always the same. There is a definition or synonym for the answer, some indication that you need to do something like anagram a part of the clue and then the part of the clue that needs to have something done to it. Your job, as the solver, is to figure out which part is which.
2016-11-05.headline_main: Variety: Cryptic Crossword

2016-11-05.abstract: Black lawyers, racial justice groups and liberal donors, led by the hedge fund billionaire George Soros, are combining forces to try to propel more African-American district attorneys into office.
2016-11-05.snippet: Black lawyers, racial justice groups and liberal donors, led by the hedge fund billionaire George Soros, are combining forces to try to propel more African-American district attorneys into office.

2016-11-05.abstract: Hillary Clinton’s team hammered away at Donald J. Trump’s character. The Trump campaign offered a portrait of him as a loving father.
2016-11-05.snippet: Hillary Clinton’s team hammered away at Donald J. Trump’s character. The Trump campaign offered a portrait of him as a loving father.
2016-11-05.lead_paragraph: The final week of the 2016 presidential race has seen a blitz of television ads in swing states, with more than $86 million in airtime reserved by the campaigns and their allies. Both campaigns are airing ads devoted to winning over women.
2016-11-05.headline_main: Women Are the Focus in Campaigns’ Last Advertising Push

2016-11-05.abstract: With the Cubs ending their 108-year title drought this past week, the Curse needs to reside somewhere else, and Buffalo and San Diego top the list.
2016-11-05.snippet: With the Cubs ending their 108-year title drought this past week, the Curse needs to reside somewhere else, and Buffalo and San Diego top the list.
2016-11-05.lead_paragraph: The Curse is homeless, and it is hungry.
2016-11-05.headline_main: The Curse Needs a New Home. Snow or Surf?

2016-11-05.abstract: There are many good reasons to vote for her, even if Donald Trump weren’t her opponent.
2016-11-05.snippet: There are many good reasons to vote for her, even if Donald Trump weren’t her opponent.
2016-11-05.lead_paragraph: ONE of the great misperceptions of this political year, among many Democrats and Republicans alike, is that Hillary Clinton is a third-rate candidate with no core or convictions — oops, wrong word, but you get the point.
2016-11-05.headline_main: ‘I’m With Her’: The Strengths of Hillary Clinton

2016-11-05.abstract: “We only need to sit back and let these candidates show themselves how idiotic they are,” said Hamidreza Taraghi, a conservative analyst.
2016-11-05.snippet: “We only need to sit back and let these candidates show themselves how idiotic they are,” said Hamidreza Taraghi, a conservative analyst.
2016-11-05.lead_paragraph: TEHRAN — In the past, Iranians looking to mock the United States would burn cardboard effigies of Uncle Sam or Lady Liberty. But in recent months, as the American presidential election took a series of bizarre turns, Iranians seeking to make fun of the “Great Satan” have ditched the arts and crafts and simply switched on their TV sets.
2016-11-05.headline_main: Iran’s Latest Propaganda Tool: The Clinton-Trump Debates on Live TV

2016-11-05.abstract: The 2016 candidates have left many readers disaffected. “I will show up at my polling place with a clothespin on my nose,” says one.
2016-11-05.snippet: The 2016 candidates have left many readers disaffected. “I will show up at my polling place with a clothespin on my nose,” says one.
2016-11-05.lead_paragraph: Readers reflect on their deliberations in a race that has left many unhappy with the options.
2016-11-05.headline_main: The Election Choices

2016-11-05.abstract: A proposed lifetime ban on migrants who attempt to reach Australia by boat is absurd, shortsighted and cruel.
2016-11-05.snippet: A proposed lifetime ban on migrants who attempt to reach Australia by boat is absurd, shortsighted and cruel.
2016-11-05.lead_paragraph: The government of Australia has come under withering criticism for its harsh anywhere-but-here approach to refugees and other migrants who attempt to reach the country by boat. But instead of revisiting a cruel and costly policy — which involves sending everyone intercepted at sea to offshore prisons — Prime Minister Malcolm Turnbull has decided to double down.
2016-11-05.headline_main: Australia Doubles Down on Cruel Refugee Policy

2016-11-05.abstract: How the thinning out of families created fertile ground for Trump.
2016-11-05.snippet: How the thinning out of families created fertile ground for Trump.
2016-11-05.lead_paragraph: HOW did we get here? How did it come to this? Not just to the Donald Trump phenomenon, but to the whole choice facing us on Tuesday, in which a managerial liberalism and an authoritarian nationalism — two visions of the president as essentially a Great Protector: a feisty grandmother or fierce sky father — are contending for the votes of an ostensibly free people?
2016-11-05.headline_main: The Post-Familial Election

2016-11-05.abstract: If the G.O.P. loses the presidential election, its reconstruction must begin Nov. 9. If it wins, we have to start over.
2016-11-05.snippet: If the G.O.P. loses the presidential election, its reconstruction must begin Nov. 9. If it wins, we have to start over.
2016-11-05.lead_paragraph: With only hours left before Election Day, here’s the painful, self-evident truth facing lifelong Republicans like me: The 2016 presidential campaign has revealed dark and disturbing things about not only Donald J. Trump but also the party that nominated him.
2016-11-05.headline_main: Is There Life After Trump?

2016-11-05.abstract: The recent moves are important, but will the country’s poor be able to hang on until changes are seen?
2016-11-05.snippet: The recent moves are important, but will the country’s poor be able to hang on until changes are seen?
2016-11-05.lead_paragraph: Egypt took an important step toward saving its economy from collapse when it decided on Thursday to allow its currency to float freely, thus paving the way for a $12 billion loan from the International Monetary Fund. Yet much more remains to be done to bring the country back from the edge of economic disaster, where it has teetered since the 2011 Arab uprising, which pretty much destroyed tourism and ushered in years of political instability.
2016-11-05.headline_main: Egypt Averts Economic Collapse, for Now

2016-11-05.abstract: Averting the worst effects of this year’s political storm means electing Hillary Clinton.
2016-11-05.snippet: Averting the worst effects of this year’s political storm means electing Hillary Clinton.
2016-11-05.lead_paragraph: The United States has seen worse than Donald Trump. It has endured political crises and corruption, war abroad and bloodshed at home. But that doesn’t make it any easier to contemplate the catastrophe that looms if we wake up Wednesday morning to President-elect Trump.
2016-11-05.headline_main: Imagining America on Nov. 9

2016-11-05.abstract: There is a salve for broken politics, bitter voters and bad choices: royalty.
2016-11-05.snippet: There is a salve for broken politics, bitter voters and bad choices: royalty.
2016-11-05.lead_paragraph: Southmoor, England — As a foreigner with dual British and Russian citizenship, it is not for me to comment at length on the merits of the rival candidates for the presidency of the United States. But it seems uncontroversial to say that neither appears to be a Washington or a Lincoln, and that the elective presidency is coming under increasingly critical examination.
2016-11-05.headline_main: Consider a Monarchy, America

2016-11-05.abstract: Designed for the railroad era, they have no place in our globalized, interconnected world.
2016-11-05.snippet: Designed for the railroad era, they have no place in our globalized, interconnected world.
2016-11-05.lead_paragraph: We will awaken Sunday to yet another disturbance in the chronosphere — our twice-yearly jolt from resetting the clocks, mechanical and biological. Thanks to daylight saving time, we get a dose of jet lag without going anywhere.
2016-11-05.headline_main: Time to Dump Time Zones

2016-11-05.abstract: The remote chance of a Donald Trump win is only one reason to tremble.
2016-11-05.snippet: The remote chance of a Donald Trump win is only one reason to tremble.
2016-11-05.lead_paragraph: COLUMBUS, Ohio — Tuesday nears, after such epic ugliness. “It’s almost over,” friends say. “We’ll finally be done with this.” What a lovely thought. What a naïve fantasy.
2016-11-05.headline_main: Why This Election Terrifies Me

2016-11-05.abstract: It has been a long, long, long year and a mad, mad, mad election. Time to vote.
2016-11-05.snippet: It has been a long, long, long year and a mad, mad, mad election. Time to vote.
2016-11-05.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — When historians write about this bizarre, ugly and dispiriting campaign — and oh, my, will they ever! — the epic dark saga will unfold this way: A man, filled with fear and insecurity, created a hatemongering character and followed it out the window. And a woman, filled with fear and insecurity, hunkered down and repeated bad patterns rather than reimagining herself in an open, bold way.
2016-11-05.headline_main: The End Is Nigh

2016-11-05.abstract: Hillary Clinton’s candidacy shows that women have changed. Men haven’t. What happens next?
2016-11-05.snippet: Hillary Clinton’s candidacy shows that women have changed. Men haven’t. What happens next?
2016-11-05.lead_paragraph: On Nov. 8, Americans may elect our first female president. While many of us are exhilarated at the idea of this feminist victory, the toll we’ve paid for coming so close to that historic barrier has been the most graphically sexist election in living memory.
2016-11-05.headline_main: The Men Feminists Left Behind

2016-11-05.abstract: Why is an act of foreign interference in an American election on a scale we’ve never seen the also-ran of Times coverage?
2016-11-05.snippet: Why is an act of foreign interference in an American election on a scale we’ve never seen the also-ran of Times coverage?
2016-11-05.lead_paragraph: LAST winter, as primary voters in Iowa and New Hampshire headed to the polls, a covert and cunning Russian plot was underway to disrupt the American political process. With aliases like Guccifer 2.0 and Fancy Bear, Russian hackers were targeting critical computer systems.
2016-11-05.headline_main: A Muted Alarm Bell Over Russian Election Hacking

2016-11-05.abstract: The 57,000-member Culinary Union, which is 56 percent Latino and includes guest room attendants, is a powerful supporter of Nevada Democrats.
2016-11-05.snippet: The 57,000-member Culinary Union, which is 56 percent Latino and includes guest room attendants, is a powerful supporter of Nevada Democrats.
2016-11-05.lead_paragraph: LAS VEGAS — She begins her day in black, the natural black before dawn and the requisite black of her uniform: the T-shirt, the pants, the socks, the shoes with slip-resistant treads, all black. The outfit announces deference.
2016-11-05.headline_main: Latina Hotel Workers Harness Force of Labor and of Politics in Las Vegas

2016-11-05.abstract: At least five dead coalition soldiers, 14 dead Taliban and 36 dead civilians after a battle near Kunduz — and then there are the unanswered questions.
2016-11-05.snippet: At least five dead coalition soldiers, 14 dead Taliban and 36 dead civilians after a battle near Kunduz — and then there are the unanswered questions.
2016-11-05.lead_paragraph: BOZ QANDAHARI, Afghanistan — A day after a battle in this village on the outskirts of Kunduz, residents readily pointed out the smears of what they said was American blood on a packed-dirt street. But they were less forthcoming about whether there had been any Taliban in their neighborhood when the Americans were killed on Thursday.
2016-11-05.headline_main: On Street Where U.S. Soldiers Died, Afghans Say: Taliban? What Taliban?

2016-11-05.abstract: The pop star’s appearance with the Dixie Chicks at the Country Music Association Awards was powerful — and sly.
2016-11-05.snippet: The pop star’s appearance with the Dixie Chicks at the Country Music Association Awards was powerful — and sly.
2016-11-05.lead_paragraph: I feel bad for anyone who still hasn’t learned to speak Beyoncé. Her language is the body. It’s stagecraft. It’s Instagram posts. She doesn’t speak; she signifies. And her performance on Friday at a Hillary Clinton rally in Cleveland won excitement and dismay over the possibility that she had reached some partisan peak by announcing that she was officially “with her.”
2016-11-05.headline_main: Beyoncé’s True Political Statement This Week? It Wasn’t at a Clinton Rally

2016-11-05.abstract: Colleagues and neighbors of Sgt. Paul Tuozzolo, who was killed in a gunfight on Friday, expressed their condolences.
2016-11-05.snippet: Colleagues and neighbors of Sgt. Paul Tuozzolo, who was killed in a gunfight on Friday, expressed their condolences.
2016-11-05.lead_paragraph: To those who knew him, Sgt. Paul Tuozzolo was one of the good guys.
2016-11-05.headline_main: Sergeant Who Was Killed in the Bronx Is Recalled as a Genial Family Man

2016-11-05.abstract: Five central characters in the team’s title chase reflect on their experiences during the dramatic postseason.
2016-11-05.snippet: Five central characters in the team’s title chase reflect on their experiences during the dramatic postseason.
2016-11-05.lead_paragraph: About a month ago, when the Chicago Cubs had baseball’s best regular-season record but were still far better known for what they had not won, I spent a week embedded with five central characters in the team’s taut drama. It was a way of assessing the temperament and zeitgeist of the club, and by extension its national following.
2016-11-05.headline_main: In the Cubs’ New Kingdom, Bliss and Wonder Reign at Every Level

2016-11-05.abstract: Would he be into this White House thing for the country’s benefit or his own? His business record reveals a willingness to change course to suit his needs.
2016-11-05.snippet: Would he be into this White House thing for the country’s benefit or his own? His business record reveals a willingness to change course to suit his needs.
2016-11-05.lead_paragraph: When Donald J. Trump was building casinos in Atlantic City in the 1990s, he spoke of his dream of bringing jobs and development to the hard-luck community. In the end, after all the bankruptcies, layoffs and stiffed contractors, it was Mr. Trump who walked away with tens of millions of dollars in management fees and huge tax deductions that may have helped him avoid paying personal income taxes for nearly two decades.
2016-11-05.headline_main: Thin Line Splits Donald Trump’s Politics and Businesses

2016-11-05.abstract: If you’re looking for a classic biopic, a documentary or a foreign language drama, Monica Castillo has recommendations for this pre-Election Day weekend.
2016-11-05.snippet: If you’re looking for a classic biopic, a documentary or a foreign language drama, Monica Castillo has recommendations for this pre-Election Day weekend.
2016-11-05.lead_paragraph: We’re finally in the homestretch of the 2016 presidential election. And while you’re waiting to vote on Nov. 8, here are a few political movies to pass the time. Or to soothe your anxiety, if that’s what you need.
2016-11-05.headline_main: Three Political Movies to Stream This Weekend

2016-11-05.abstract: The music that gave our lives meaning can bring comfort at the end.
2016-11-05.snippet: The music that gave our lives meaning can bring comfort at the end.
2016-11-05.lead_paragraph: Now that I’m approaching my mid-40s, I’ve finally gotten around to some basic end-of-life planning. Health care proxy? Check. Power of attorney? Signed. My playlist for dying? It’s done.
2016-11-05.headline_main: My Deathbed Playlist (and Yours)

2016-11-05.abstract: Days from the end of a grueling presidential contest, Mrs. Clinton relinquished her script at a Florida rally.
2016-11-05.snippet: Days from the end of a grueling presidential contest, Mrs. Clinton relinquished her script at a Florida rally.
2016-11-05.lead_paragraph: The moment lasts about 45 seconds.
2016-11-05.headline_main: In 1 Unscripted Moment, Hillary Clinton Finds Joy in the Rain

2016-11-05.abstract: Hillary Clinton sought to galvanize Latino voters on Saturday, as early voting signaled their turnout was swelling in states that Donald J. Trump needs to win.
2016-11-05.snippet: Hillary Clinton sought to galvanize Latino voters on Saturday, as early voting signaled their turnout was swelling in states that Donald J. Trump needs to win.
2016-11-05.lead_paragraph: PEMBROKE PINES, Fla. — Hispanic voters in key states surged to cast their ballots in the final days of early voting this weekend, a demonstration of political power that lifted Hillary Clinton’s presidential hopes and threatened to block Donald J. Trump’s path to the White House.
2016-11-05.headline_main: Hillary Clinton Appears to Gain Late Momentum on Surge of Latino Voters

2016-11-05.abstract: It’s still not obvious where and how Donald Trump would win. Based on his travel schedule, his campaign might not know either.
2016-11-05.snippet: It’s still not obvious where and how Donald Trump would win. Based on his travel schedule, his campaign might not know either.
2016-11-05.lead_paragraph: Over the last few days of the race, Donald J. Trump intends to travel all over the country. He's going to Florida, North Carolina, Nevada, Colorado, Iowa, Michigan, Wisconsin, Pennsylvania, New Hampshire and even Minnesota, he said Saturday.
2016-11-05.headline_main: Clinton Has Solid Lead in Electoral College; Trump’s Winning Map Is Unclear

2016-11-05.abstract: Joe DiPietro wants you to rush through this puzzle.
2016-11-05.snippet: Joe DiPietro wants you to rush through this puzzle.
2016-11-05.lead_paragraph: SUNDAY PUZZLE — Sunday crosswords tend toward the punny, with long theme entries that rely on wordplay and clues that need to describe the entry nearly perfectly in order for solvers to be on the same wavelength as the constructor.
2016-11-05.headline_main: It’s All an Elision

2016-11-05.abstract: The Republican electorate has fractured over the policy views and personal history of Donald J. Trump.
2016-11-05.snippet: The Republican electorate has fractured over the policy views and personal history of Donald J. Trump.
2016-11-05.lead_paragraph: The Republican electorate has fractured over the policy views and personal history of Donald J. Trump.
2016-11-05.headline_main: A Guide to the Republican Herd, A Divided Pack of Elephants

2016-11-05.abstract: After a hard-fought primary season the Democrats have plenty of internal wounds to heal.
2016-11-05.snippet: After a hard-fought primary season the Democrats have plenty of internal wounds to heal.
2016-11-05.lead_paragraph: After a hard-fought primary season the Democrats have plenty of internal wounds to heal.
2016-11-05.headline_main: A Guide to the Democratic Herd, An Unwieldy Group of Donkeys

2016-11-05.abstract: Whether or not Clinton wins the election, the Democratic Party will need to confront its formidable ideological schisms.
2016-11-05.snippet: Whether or not Clinton wins the election, the Democratic Party will need to confront its formidable ideological schisms.
2016-11-05.lead_paragraph: It is hard to begrudge Democrats their gloating about the state of the Republican Party as the campaign enters its final hours. By most measures, Donald J. Trump appears headed for defeat. Win or lose, the Republican Party is scattered and divided, and faces wrenching post-Election Day battles over its future.
2016-11-05.headline_main: Don’t Gloat, Democrats

2016-11-05.abstract: Staff Sgt. Jimmy Moriarty, who was fatally shot along with two other American trainers on Friday, had told relatives the day before that everything was “hunky-dory.”
2016-11-05.snippet: Staff Sgt. Jimmy Moriarty, who was fatally shot along with two other American trainers on Friday, had told relatives the day before that everything was “hunky-dory.”
2016-11-05.lead_paragraph: JERUSALEM — On Thursday, Staff Sgt. Jimmy Moriarty, an American Special Forces soldier on a training mission in Jordan, called his sister to check in. Everything was “hunky-dory,” as his father put it. In just two weeks, he would be home.
2016-11-05.headline_main: Few Answers for the Family of a U.S. Soldier Slain in Jordan

2016-11-06.abstract: The review by the office of Eric T. Schneiderman will include whether Ariel Galarza, who died on Wednesday, was armed when a police officer used an electric stun gun on him.
2016-11-06.snippet: The review by the office of Eric T. Schneiderman will include whether Ariel Galarza, who died on Wednesday, was armed when a police officer used an electric stun gun on him.
2016-11-06.lead_paragraph: The office of the New York attorney general, Eric T. Schneiderman, has opened an investigation into the death of Ariel Galarza, a 49-year-old Bronx man who died on Wednesday after a police sergeant used an electric stun gun on him.
2016-11-06.headline_main: New York Attorney General to Investigate Taser Death of Bronx Man

2016-11-06.abstract: Chrome, widely regarded as the best horse in the world, finished a close second in the Breeders’ Cup Classic, losing his first race in seven starts this year.
2016-11-06.snippet: Chrome, widely regarded as the best horse in the world, finished a close second in the Breeders’ Cup Classic, losing his first race in seven starts this year.
2016-11-06.lead_paragraph: ARCADIA, Calif. — The 33rd running of the Breeders’ Cup Classic was supposed to be the coronation of California Chrome, widely regarded as not only the best horse on the planet but also one of the most beloved. He is the Horatio Alger of the equine set, a determined athlete who outran his modest pedigree and endured the chaos often foisted upon him by the humans around him.
2016-11-06.headline_main: Breeders’ Cup: Arrogate’s Win Ends California Chrome’s Perfect Year

2016-11-06.abstract: After a campaign season defined by voter weariness with and distrust of Mrs. Clinton, which old hands might follow her to the White House — and should they?
2016-11-06.snippet: After a campaign season defined by voter weariness with and distrust of Mrs. Clinton, which old hands might follow her to the White House — and should they?
2016-11-06.lead_paragraph: In the final sprint of her campaign, troubled by an F.B.I. inquiry and narrowing polls, Hillary Clinton has held tightly to a handful of advisers who have spent their careers protecting her interests, defending her reputation, and at times sullying it — and their own.
2016-11-06.headline_main: If Hillary Clinton Moves to Oval Office, Aides’ Baggage May Be Heavy

2016-11-06.abstract: A man thought to have a gun was apprehended on Saturday night at a Trump rally in Reno, Nev., but no weapon was found, the Secret Service said, and the man was released.
2016-11-06.snippet: A man thought to have a gun was apprehended on Saturday night at a Trump rally in Reno, Nev., but no weapon was found, the Secret Service said, and the man was released.
2016-11-06.lead_paragraph: RENO, Nev. — In a startling scene, Donald J. Trump was rushed offstage by members of his Secret Service detail during a rally on Saturday night in Reno, Nev., after a person in the crowd shouted that someone had a gun.
2016-11-06.headline_main: Donald Trump Rushed Offstage by Secret Service Agents

2016-11-06.abstract: Question 2, if approved, would allow the state to expand charter schools. A pitched battle over the measure reflects the passions that the debate has aroused nationwide.

2016-11-06.abstract: Ralph Cicerone, a leading atmospheric scientist who became a leading champion of science in Washington, has died at 73.
2016-11-06.snippet: Ralph Cicerone, a leading atmospheric scientist who became a leading champion of science in Washington, has died at 73.
2016-11-06.lead_paragraph: I’m saddened to have to mark the death on Saturday of Ralph J. Cicerone, a brilliant atmospheric scientist who skillfully shifted into academic leadership as chancellor of the University of California, Irvine, but really hit his stride through a decade, just ended in June, as president of the National Academy of Sciences.
2016-11-06.headline_main: Gone Too Soon – Ralph Cicerone, a Quiet Force for Scientific Progress in a Divisive Climate

James passed the Hall of Famer Hakeem Olajuwon, who finished his career with 26,946 points.
2016-11-06.headline_main: LeBron James Passes Hakeem Olajuwon for 10th in Career N.B.A. Points

2016-11-06.abstract: The couple, who met at work in 2013, were married at the Parker Palm Springs in California.

2016-11-06.abstract: Thankfully, the election is imminent. I hope a Hillary Clinton presidency is too.
2016-11-06.snippet: Thankfully, the election is imminent. I hope a Hillary Clinton presidency is too.
2016-11-06.lead_paragraph: I have tried, for the duration of this election, to stay informed, without being obsessive. It hasn’t been easy. The media has been frenzied, at best, particularly as they cover Donald J. Trump. Early on, cable news networks aired entire Trump events before he was even his party’s nominee. They created an unhealthy demand for “news” that they were more than happy to supply. There is no escape.
2016-11-06.headline_main: Voting With My Head and Heart

2016-11-06.abstract: Politicians worldwide have discovered that nostalgia can be a powerful motivator.
2016-11-06.snippet: Politicians worldwide have discovered that nostalgia can be a powerful motivator.
2016-11-06.lead_paragraph: Hope, said the philosopher Francis Bacon, is a good breakfast, but an ill supper. Only a quarter-century ago, hope was an active force in world politics. The Cold War ended peacefully, and functioning constitutional democracies took root in Eastern Europe. The European Union was formally established, and membership was steadily extended eastward. The Oslo accords between Israel and the Palestinians were signed, and Nelson Mandela became president of South Africa after spending three decades in prison.
2016-11-06.headline_main: Our Reactionary Age

2016-11-06.abstract: Before African states began withdrawing from the court, the court was moving away from cases on the continent.
2016-11-06.snippet: Before African states began withdrawing from the court, the court was moving away from cases on the continent.
2016-11-06.lead_paragraph: In just a few weeks, Burundi, South Africa and Gambia have announced that they would withdraw from the International Criminal Court, a permanent tribunal investigating war crimes, genocide and crimes against humanity. Since its creation in 1998, the I.C.C. has been hobbled by the refusal of major countries like the United States, China and Russia to subject themselves to its jurisdiction. But the recent defections by member states, on grounds that the court is biased and undermines peace, seem like an unprecedented blow to its legitimacy.
2016-11-06.headline_main: The ICC, Out of Africa

2016-11-06.abstract: On both sides of the Atlantic, we are feeling a nausea Sartre knew well.
2016-11-06.snippet: On both sides of the Atlantic, we are feeling a nausea Sartre knew well.
2016-11-06.lead_paragraph: LONDON — During these last days of the seemingly endless election campaign, we are all living with enormous and ever-rising levels of anxiety. The days pass in a fever of worry, with waves of nausea that subside only to return and rob us of our breath. Many people are having difficulty sleeping. Many others wake up in fright, their bodies drenched with the sweat of Trump terrors. What will America look like after Tuesday? What will the world look like?
2016-11-06.headline_main: On Election Eve, a Brexistential Dread

2016-11-06.lead_paragraph: EAST HAMPTON, N.Y. — Sometimes, Valerie Smith reminds herself that she is not a pollster, she is just selling cups — plastic drinking cups with the presidential candidates’ names. But she has been keeping track, just like a pollster, and hoping that her cup count is as reliable as it was in the last three presidential races.

2016-11-06.lead_paragraph: When Michael Cooper, one of more than 50,000 runners in Sunday’s New York City Marathon, left his home in Perth, on the west coast of Australia, on Wednesday, he started the timer on his smartphone.
