2016-11-09.abstract: The violinist Andrew Bulbrook chooses his favorite page from Morton Feldman’s String Quartet No. 2, which the Calder Quartet will perform on Saturday.
2016-11-09.snippet: The violinist Andrew Bulbrook chooses his favorite page from Morton Feldman’s String Quartet No. 2, which the Calder Quartet will perform on Saturday.
2016-11-09.lead_paragraph: A funny notion, selecting a single, favorite page from Morton Feldman’s String Quartet No. 2. After all, this 1983 opus of titanic duration and fearsome reputation can last anywhere from under four hours to over six, depending on repeats and tempo. Requiring unyielding concentration and unceasing precision to fulfill the composer’s demands, it pushes the bounds of what is physically possible.
2016-11-09.headline_main: Exploring a Cathartic Moment in a Lengthy String Quartet

2016-11-09.abstract: A Massachusetts federal judge ruled Tuesday that American International Group, Mr. Cosby’s homeowner’s insurance company, must cover the fees.
2016-11-09.snippet: A Massachusetts federal judge ruled Tuesday that American International Group, Mr. Cosby’s homeowner’s insurance company, must cover the fees.
2016-11-09.lead_paragraph: Bill Cosby’s homeowner’s insurance company, American International Group, must pay his legal fees in three defamation lawsuits brought by nine women who say he branded them liars when they accused him of sexual assault, a Massachusetts federal judge ruled Tuesday.
2016-11-09.headline_main: Court Rules That A.I.G. Must Pay Cosby’s Legal Fees in 3 Lawsuits

2016-11-09.abstract: In Michael Connelly’s latest Harry Bosch book, his investigator is on the hunt for a serial rapist while also searching for a billionaire’s heir.
2016-11-09.snippet: In Michael Connelly’s latest Harry Bosch book, his investigator is on the hunt for a serial rapist while also searching for a billionaire’s heir.
2016-11-09.lead_paragraph: Each of Michael Connelly’s Harry Bosch books has a way of referring to earlier ones in the series, as when his latest, “The Wrong Side of Goodbye,” brings up something about a plastic surgeon. That surgeon figured in “The Crossing,” one of the series’s better recent installments. And it came out only a year ago. Still, I had to look it up, because the characters aren’t what make Mr. Connelly’s books worthwhile. The classic mystery plotting and streamlined storytelling are what render him so readable. Of all the big-name writers who dominate this genre, Mr. Connelly is the most solid, old-school pro.
2016-11-09.headline_main: Review: Michael Connelly’s ‘The Wrong Side of Goodbye,’ a Mystery Traveling the Freeways

2016-11-09.abstract: Researchers tracked narwhals and found that they reconstruct their underwater world with more resolution that most other animals on the planet.
2016-11-09.snippet: Researchers tracked narwhals and found that they reconstruct their underwater world with more resolution that most other animals on the planet.
2016-11-09.lead_paragraph: The narwhal is not an aquatic unicorn. It’s not magical, or mythical. It’s just a whale with two teeth, one of which happens to be really long on males. But it’s not just its snaggletooth — which can be up to nine feet long — that makes this Arctic sea creature unbelievable. The narwhal sees with sound — and it’s exceptionally good at it too, according to a study published Wednesday in the journal PLOS One.
2016-11-09.headline_main: Narwhals, Tusked Whales of the Arctic, See With Sound. Really Well.

2016-11-09.abstract: After writing four vampire novels, Ms. Meyer seems to have grown allergic to repeating herself. “I get a little bored,” she said in an interview.
2016-11-09.snippet: After writing four vampire novels, Ms. Meyer seems to have grown allergic to repeating herself. “I get a little bored,” she said in an interview.
2016-11-09.lead_paragraph: Stephenie Meyer’s millions of fans have come to expect certain supernatural flourishes from her novels, which feature shape-shifters, vampires and werewolves, even vampire-werewolf hybrids. (Her 2008 novel, “The Host,” centered on parasitic aliens that occupy human bodies, and even that was too blandly terrestrial for some readers.)
2016-11-09.headline_main: Sorry, ‘Twilight’ Fans, Stephenie Meyer’s Latest Is a Twisted Spy Thriller

2016-11-09.abstract: The Irish government says European antitrust officials were wrong to force the iPhone maker to give up what they consider unfair concessions.
2016-11-09.snippet: The Irish government says European antitrust officials were wrong to force the iPhone maker to give up what they consider unfair concessions.
2016-11-09.lead_paragraph: The Irish government on Wednesday filed an appeal seeking to stop efforts by European authorities to force Apple to pay the country $14.3 billion to cover what antitrust officials say are unpaid taxes.
2016-11-09.headline_main: Dublin Appeals $14.3 Billion Tax Charge Against Apple

2016-11-09.abstract: Elections determine power, not truth.
2016-11-09.snippet: Elections determine power, not truth.
2016-11-09.lead_paragraph: Anyone who claims to be philosophical and detached after yesterday is either lying or has something very wrong with him (or her, but I doubt many women are in that camp.) It’s a disaster on multiple levels, and the damage will echo down the decades if not the generations. And like anyone on my side of this debate, I keep feeling waves of grief.
2016-11-09.headline_main: Now What? Personal Thoughts

2016-11-09.abstract: The departure of Adam Bain and reshuffling of his duties and aides are part of a significant shake-up under Jack Dorsey, who became C.E.O. last year.
2016-11-09.snippet: The departure of Adam Bain and reshuffling of his duties and aides are part of a significant shake-up under Jack Dorsey, who became C.E.O. last year.
2016-11-09.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — For many months, Twitter has been trying to reshape itself as a growing social media service. That attempt now includes reshaping the company’s top ranks.
2016-11-09.headline_main: Twitter’s Chief Operating Officer to Step Down

2016-11-09.abstract: Supporters of Hillary Clinton who gathered outside the New Yorker hotel in Manhattan before her concession speech expressed their trepidation about the years ahead.
2016-11-09.snippet: Supporters of Hillary Clinton who gathered outside the New Yorker hotel in Manhattan before her concession speech expressed their trepidation about the years ahead.
2016-11-09.lead_paragraph: Under a drizzling gray sky, they arrived in droves on Wednesday to bid an anguished farewell to the woman they had dreamed of calling Madam President. The streets abutting the New Yorker hotel in Manhattan teemed with the bereft, with the emotionally and politically wounded seeking solace, camaraderie and some kind of reassurance that they could weather Hillary Clinton’s astonishing loss to Donald J. Trump.
2016-11-09.headline_main: Crowd Awaiting Clinton Is Stunned by Her Loss and Fearful of the Future

2016-11-09.abstract: Federico Rios, un fotógrafo colombiano, se ha dedicado a retratar la cotidianidad de las Farc.

2016-11-09.headline_main: How to Make Your Fall Outfit Fresh in an Instant

2016-11-09.abstract: Moves in the bond market suggest that investors see the economic ground shifting in the wake of Donald J. Trump’s surprise victory.
2016-11-09.snippet: Moves in the bond market suggest that investors see the economic ground shifting in the wake of Donald J. Trump’s surprise victory.
2016-11-09.lead_paragraph: The bond market is, as a rule, a more reliable guide to what global investors believe the future will look like than the erratic stock market.
2016-11-09.headline_main: The Market Is Betting Trump Will Bring Higher Inflation and Interest Rates

2016-11-09.abstract: The second album by Ms. Sandé cries from the heart, ponders spirituality, earns its big buildups and proves she is not a debutante anymore.
2016-11-09.snippet: The second album by Ms. Sandé cries from the heart, ponders spirituality, earns its big buildups and proves she is not a debutante anymore.
2016-11-09.lead_paragraph: Longing, pain, loneliness and a need to believe pour out of “Long Live the Angels,” the second album by the Scottish singer Emeli Sandé. It’s a clear, accomplished cry from the heart, exorcising its sorrows by declaring them bluntly. “Loving you the way I do — it hurts,” she belts in “Hurts,” the album’s first single and one of its very few up-tempo songs, a burst of post-breakup rage and recrimination propelled by relentless handclaps and cinematic orchestral crescendos.
2016-11-09.headline_main: Emeli Sandé’s ‘Long Live the Angels’ Is Uncluttered and Strong

2016-11-09.abstract: Poised to open in January, the Museum of the Second World War in Gdansk has become a political and cultural battlefield, pitting historians against a conservative government.
2016-11-09.snippet: Poised to open in January, the Museum of the Second World War in Gdansk has become a political and cultural battlefield, pitting historians against a conservative government.
2016-11-09.lead_paragraph: GDANSK, Poland — Conceived nearly a decade ago in a moment of pan-European optimism, the Museum of the Second World War here seeks to tell a story of devastation that transcended national boundaries. Its collection includes Soviet and American tanks; keys to the homes of Jews murdered by their Polish neighbors in the village of Jedwabne; flags from the Polish Home Army, which fought the Nazis; and an Enigma encoding machine.
2016-11-09.headline_main: A Museum Becomes a Battlefield Over Poland’s History

2016-11-09.abstract: Many supporters said they hoped for great things under a Trump presidency — though many also said they had no idea what they were in for.
2016-11-09.snippet: Many supporters said they hoped for great things under a Trump presidency — though many also said they had no idea what they were in for.
2016-11-09.lead_paragraph: RALEIGH, N.C. — Coursing beneath the boisterous chanting of the president-elect’s name Tuesday night — that single syllable that will now forever conjure more than just a gilded real estate empire — were the more nuanced hopes, fears and expectations of the Americans who shocked the world, and even themselves, by electing Donald J. Trump president of the United States.
2016-11-09.headline_main: For Trump Voters, Uncertainty Mixes With Elation

2016-11-09.lead_paragraph: “I would love to see more trans stories by trans people in every theater,” the playwright MJ Kaufman said. “That’d be great.”
2016-11-09.headline_main: Transgender Playwrights: ‘We Should Get to Tell Our Own Stories First’

2016-11-09.abstract: Allan J. Lichtman, a historian, discusses how his simple method for predicting presidential elections foresaw the success of Donald J. Trump.
2016-11-09.snippet: Allan J. Lichtman, a historian, discusses how his simple method for predicting presidential elections foresaw the success of Donald J. Trump.
2016-11-09.lead_paragraph: The story of the 2016 election is one of a stunning defeat, not just for Hillary Clinton, but also for the pollsters, pundits and data-driven journalists who overwhelmingly predicted her victory.
2016-11-09.headline_main: Yes, He Thought Trump Would Win. No, He Didn’t Use Hard Data.

2016-11-09.abstract: Puppet designers and actors talk about the zany challenges of creating and manipulating an ever-more-maniacal puppet onstage in productions of “Hand to God.”
2016-11-09.snippet: Puppet designers and actors talk about the zany challenges of creating and manipulating an ever-more-maniacal puppet onstage in productions of “Hand to God.”
2016-11-09.lead_paragraph: There are two main characters in “Hand to God,” the irreverent Tony Award-nominated comedy by Robert Askins. One is a shy and slightly repressed teenager named Jason. The other is Jason’s sock puppet, Tyrone, an “Elmo-y” figure (as described in the script) who may be possessed by the Devil. He spouts profanities, terrorizes Jason’s churchgoing friends and mother and grows more demonic as the play goes on.
2016-11-09.headline_main: Meet America’s Favorite Satanic Sock Puppet

2016-11-09.abstract: A new show on the Rolling Stones, “Exhibitionism,” opens in New York, and makes clear that Mick, Keith and company invented the very image of the modern rock star.
2016-11-09.snippet: A new show on the Rolling Stones, “Exhibitionism,” opens in New York, and makes clear that Mick, Keith and company invented the very image of the modern rock star.

2016-11-09.headline_main: How the Rolling Stones Became Fashion Icons

2016-11-09.snippet: Mr. Mesches was a scenic artist in Hollywood when his work for the Communist Party came to the attention of the bureau in 1945.
2016-11-09.lead_paragraph: Arnold Mesches, a socially conscious painter whose political activities were recorded by the F.B.I. for more than 25 years in a thick dossier that he later used for his series “The F.B.I. Files,” died on Nov. 5 at his home in Gainesville, Fla. He was 93.

2016-11-10.abstract: Professor Eliach, who survived the Nazi massacres of Jews in her Lithuanian town, went on to document their lives in a canyon of photographs at the United States Holocaust Memorial Museum.
2016-11-10.snippet: Professor Eliach, who survived the Nazi massacres of Jews in her Lithuanian town, went on to document their lives in a canyon of photographs at the United States Holocaust Memorial Museum.
2016-11-10.lead_paragraph: Yaffa Eliach, who as a 4-year-old survived the Nazi massacres of Jews in her Lithuanian town, and went on to document their daily life in a kaleidoscopic book and a haunting, three-story canyon of photographs at the United States Holocaust Memorial Museum in Washington, died on Tuesday at her home in Manhattan. She was 79.
2016-11-10.headline_main: Yaffa Eliach, Historian Who Captured Faces of the Holocaust, Dies at 79

2016-11-10.abstract: Two federal judges in Manhattan have started a program to educate students, and adults, about the judicial system.
2016-11-10.snippet: Two federal judges in Manhattan have started a program to educate students, and adults, about the judicial system.
2016-11-10.lead_paragraph: The divide between the criminal justice system and much of the public has become an urgent topic of conversation in recent years, with voices rising from all sides.
2016-11-10.headline_main: Teaching Students That Judge Judy Is Not a Supreme Court Justice

2016-11-10.abstract: The victims, a married couple, had been reported missing in December and were found on the land of a man linked to several murders.
2016-11-10.snippet: The victims, a married couple, had been reported missing in December and were found on the land of a man linked to several murders.
2016-11-10.lead_paragraph: A Spartanburg, S.C., couple who were reported missing last year have been identified as the people whose bodies were found on the property of a South Carolina man linked to seven murders, officials said on Wednesday. It appears that both people had been shot to death, officials said.
2016-11-10.headline_main: South Carolina Identifies Bodies Found on Suspect’s Property

2016-11-10.abstract: Citizens supported some progressive measures at the ballot box, even as they were electing Donald Trump.
2016-11-10.snippet: Citizens supported some progressive measures at the ballot box, even as they were electing Donald Trump.
2016-11-10.lead_paragraph: Frustrated by a do-nothing Congress, voters took policy matters into their own hands on Tuesday by passing state ballot proposals to legalize marijuana, approve new transportation projects, raise state minimum wages and strengthen gun control laws. That these progressive measures won is an indication that voters are moving left on many issues, despite Donald Trump’s victory.
2016-11-10.headline_main: State Voters With Minds of Their Own

2016-11-10.abstract: With its rotation ravaged by injuries last season, the team is looking at measures such as a six-man rotation to protect its most important resource.
2016-11-10.snippet: With its rotation ravaged by injuries last season, the team is looking at measures such as a six-man rotation to protect its most important resource.
2016-11-10.lead_paragraph: SCOTTSDALE, Ariz. — The Mets made it as far as the National League wild-card game in October, but the dominant theme of their 2016 season was the crippled state of the team’s once-fearsome starting rotation.
2016-11-10.headline_main: Rest Assured: The Mets Are Focusing on Young Pitchers’ Health

2016-11-10.abstract: Mr. Kocsis revamped the Hungarian National Philharmonic Orchestra and played with orchestras in New York, Berlin, Chicago, London, San Francisco and elsewhere.
2016-11-10.snippet: Mr. Kocsis revamped the Hungarian National Philharmonic Orchestra and played with orchestras in New York, Berlin, Chicago, London, San Francisco and elsewhere.
2016-11-10.lead_paragraph: Zoltan Kocsis, a pianist and conductor who revamped the Hungarian National Philharmonic Orchestra and was internationally known for his incandescent renditions of Schubert, Beethoven and other composers, died on Sunday at his home in Budapest. He was 64.
2016-11-10.headline_main: Zoltan Kocsis, Pianist and Conductor, Dies at 64

2016-11-10.snippet: Mr. Coutard, known for his mobile camera on films like “Breathless,” was said to have had the “rare ability to realize the very different objectives of each of the major directors he has worked with.”

2016-11-10.snippet: While black and Hispanic or Latino women voted overwhelmingly for Hillary Clinton, 53 percent of white women who voted picked Mr. Trump, exit data show.

2016-11-10.abstract: After the graceful concession of Hillary Clinton, we must turn our attention to causes that still need fighting for.
2016-11-10.snippet: After the graceful concession of Hillary Clinton, we must turn our attention to causes that still need fighting for.
2016-11-10.lead_paragraph: The system is rigged, folks, he kept saying. But the rigging seems to have failed on Tuesday, when it made Donald Trump the president-elect, and again on Wednesday, when his rival, Hillary Clinton, and President Obama publicly congratulated him, wished him all success and pledged to get out of his way.

2016-11-10.abstract: Stunned by their good electoral fortunes, Republicans said they were eager to repeal the Affordable Care Act, cut taxes and confirm conservative judges.
2016-11-10.snippet: Stunned by their good electoral fortunes, Republicans said they were eager to repeal the Affordable Care Act, cut taxes and confirm conservative judges.

Trump’s, repealing the Affordable Care Act, cutting taxes, confirming conservative judges, shrinking government programs and rolling back regulations.

2016-11-10.abstract: The election of Donald J. Trump joins Brexit as part of a middle-class and blue-collar insurrection against global free trade that could ultimately backfire.
2016-11-10.snippet: The election of Donald J. Trump joins Brexit as part of a middle-class and blue-collar insurrection against global free trade that could ultimately backfire.

2016-11-10.abstract: Here are some practical considerations to help cope.

2016-11-10.abstract: More than 900 plaques offer the historically inclined London rambler a useful means of navigating the sprawling city and its layered history.
2016-11-10.snippet: More than 900 plaques offer the historically inclined London rambler a useful means of navigating the sprawling city and its layered history.
2016-11-10.lead_paragraph: Head south: past the gas station, the chicken shop and the bodybuilder gym, through a thicket of enormous public housing estates, constructed in varying shades of beige and beiger and brown. It’s quiet on this stretch of Vallance Road in London’s East End, a concrete artery connecting disparate neighborhoods. A short walk northwest brings you to Bethnal Green Academy, from which three British schoolgirls fled to Syria to join the Islamic State last year. An equal distance southwest lands you at Fournier Street: home to a different kind of enfant terrible — the British artist Tracey Emin, whose most famous work, “My Bed” (1999), featured Ms. Emin’s own authentically unmade bed, strewn with cigarettes and used condoms.
2016-11-10.headline_main: In London, Blue Plaques Mark the Noted and Notorious

Inside Afghanistan, tens of thousands have become internally displaced in recent months as fighting between the Taliban and government security forces rages in several provinces. The refugee crisis could reach unprecedented numbers, with as many as 1.5 million returning home, many involuntarily, by the end of the year, according to humanitarian organizations.

2016-11-10.abstract: I opposed Donald J. Trump but accept him as my president. That doesn’t mean I’ll accept everything he does.
2016-11-10.snippet: I opposed Donald J. Trump but accept him as my president. That doesn’t mean I’ll accept everything he does.
2016-11-10.lead_paragraph: Atlanta — Donald J. Trump will be the next president of the United States. I got it absolutely wrong. I have been writing since February that he would not win. The great paradox of this election for me is that I never saw Mr. Trump as a legitimate contender in the primaries because I believed the polling was wrong, but it was right all along. In the general election, I presumed he would never win because the polling was right, but it was wrong all along.

Putin of Russia congratulated the victor and looked forward to “constructive dialogue.” China’s president, Xi Jinping, waited a little longer, sending Mr. Trump a similarly measured message of hope and appealing for “cooperation for mutual gain.”

2016-11-10.abstract: Ryan Weideman, a photographer who took a taxi shift to make ends meet, turned his camera on his fares during the 1980s and ’90s.
2016-11-10.snippet: Ryan Weideman, a photographer who took a taxi shift to make ends meet, turned his camera on his fares during the 1980s and ’90s.
2016-11-10.lead_paragraph: The inside of a New York taxicab is a place where the public realm blurs with the private, especially on the overnight shift. People fight, make love, eat takeout, throw up, fall asleep, concoct plans for world domination or a good night’s sleep. Many act as if the driver is not there. Ryan Weideman, a photographer who drove a taxi shift to make ends meet, decided to let them know that he was. It was 1980, four years after the movie “Taxi Driver” was released, and Mr. Weideman had a master’s degree in fine arts and a tenuous grasp of New York City geography. He also had a camera and the best studio he could ask for: a roomy old Checker cab that was his from 5 p.m. to 5 a.m. on weekends, when traffic thinned and tips were not always something he could count on. Turning the camera on his fares was a way to displace his rage at the inequities that come with a taxi, where the customer holds all the power and the driver does all the work. Sometimes he snapped people at the beginning of a ride, sometimes after he reached their destination. He mounted a strobe light onto the cab’s sun visor using rubber bands. He wasn’t fancy. Usually he asked permission, but at least once he said simply, “Don’t move, I’m a photographer,” and started shooting.
2016-11-10.headline_main: A Taxi Driver’s Photos of New York

Trump’s election might mean the end of the West as we know it.

2016-11-10.abstract: From the archives of The International Herald Tribune: Montana elects a woman, Jeannette Rankin, to Congress for the first time in U.S. history, in November 1916.
2016-11-10.snippet: From the archives of The International Herald Tribune: Montana elects a woman, Jeannette Rankin, to Congress for the first time in U.S. history, in November 1916.
2016-11-10.lead_paragraph: NEW YORK — Miss Jeannette Rankin, Independent candidate, has been elected Representative from Montana. This is the first time in the history of the United States that a woman has been elected a member of Congress. Miss Rankin is the suffrage campaigner through whose untiring efforts the women won the fight for the ballot in Montana. The Representative-elect had a strong lead on both the Democratic and Republican candidates. — The New York Herald, European Edition, Nov. 10, 1916
2016-11-10.headline_main: 1916: Montana Elects a Woman to Congress

2016-11-10.abstract: Two gold-sculpted medallions rotate in ebony surrounded by precious stones.
2016-11-10.snippet: Two gold-sculpted medallions rotate in ebony surrounded by precious stones.
2016-11-10.lead_paragraph: Great jewels are made to be noticed, but in the hands of the young French designer Elie Top, the art becomes one of concealment. The elegant and mustachioed Top, who had for years designed Lanvin’s fashionable baubles, engineers much of his own namesake haute joaillerie with a mechanical precision that allows the wearer to change personalities as vividly as a peacock. Two round medallions that stud this one-of-a-kind Makassar ebony pendant are sculptured from gold. With the opening of a clasp, they rotate into the wood to reveal an intricate underside set with diamonds and colored stones like malachite, lapis, topaz and amethyst. Part of a collection called Desdémone, after the wife of Shakespeare’s passionate Moor, this substantial necklace evokes a warrior’s shield or delicate medieval stained glass.
2016-11-10.headline_main: A One-of-a-Kind Pendant, From a Fashion Favorite

2016-11-10.lead_paragraph: When Donald J. Trump takes office on Jan. 20, he will have immense but not unlimited power at his disposal. He could, for example, shift enforcement priorities against unauthorized immigrants, probably bar Muslims from entering the country, raise tariffs, withdraw forces from the Middle East, and tear up trade treaties and military alliances.
2016-11-10.headline_main: Are There Limits to Trump’s Power?

2016-11-10.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — “The Art of the Qur’an: Treasures From the Museum of Turkish and Islamic Arts,” at the Arthur M. 2016-11-10.headline_main: Zadie Smith’s New Novel Takes on Dance, Fame and Friendship

2016-11-10.abstract: Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s surprise ban on 500 and 1,000 rupee bills, aimed at tax avoidance and money laundering, is making life difficult for the average Indian.
2016-11-10.snippet: Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s surprise ban on 500 and 1,000 rupee bills, aimed at tax avoidance and money laundering, is making life difficult for the average Indian.
2016-11-10.lead_paragraph: NEW DELHI — Thousands of security forces were deployed on Thursday to keep the peace at India’s banks, where crowds of people had formed jittery, snaking lines in the early morning, desperate to exchange now-useless currency notes.
2016-11-10.headline_main: Crowds Line Up at India’s Banks to Exchange Banned Rupee Notes

2016-11-10.abstract: More than most, the tech industry was unready for the election of Donald J. Trump. Now it faces the prospect of feeling like a wary outsider. Is it?
2016-11-10.snippet: More than most, the tech industry was unready for the election of Donald J. Trump. Now it faces the prospect of feeling like a wary outsider. Is it?
2016-11-10.lead_paragraph: Silicon Valley loves disruption — just not, it turns out, disruptions of a certain kind.
2016-11-10.headline_main: Daily Report: The Valley Awakens to Trump

2016-11-10.abstract: Most modern smartphones allow you to assign individual alert noises to each contact who calls or sends you a text message.
2016-11-10.snippet: Most modern smartphones allow you to assign individual alert noises to each contact who calls or sends you a text message.
2016-11-10.lead_paragraph: Q. On an iPhone, is there a way to assign specific text alert sounds to different people so that you can tell who is texting without looking at the screen? The Sound settings let you assign only one text tone and one ringtone for everyone.
2016-11-10.headline_main: Recognize Callers and Texters by Sound

2016-11-10.abstract: The social network for professionals was found to have violated a law requiring it to store local users’ data within the country.
2016-11-10.snippet: The social network for professionals was found to have violated a law requiring it to store local users’ data within the country.
2016-11-10.lead_paragraph: LinkedIn, the social networking site for professionals that will soon be bought by Microsoft, is to be blocked in Russia after a local court ruled on Thursday that it had breached the country’s data protection rules, a sign of growing tensions for American tech companies operating in the country.
2016-11-10.headline_main: Russia Prepares to Block LinkedIn After Court Ruling

2016-11-10.abstract: Businesses and corporations hopeful that gridlock will end in Washington have started turning to lobbying firms on K Street to help them navigate the change.
2016-11-10.snippet: Businesses and corporations hopeful that gridlock will end in Washington have started turning to lobbying firms on K Street to help them navigate the change.
2016-11-10.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Trent Lott, the former Republican senator from Mississippi, had gleefully flown back from Florida, where he had been working for the campaign of Donald J. Trump. Now a powerful lobbyist, his phone had been buzzing nonstop and he was busy helping to organize a briefing Thursday morning for dozens of corporate clients.
2016-11-10.headline_main: With Trump’s Election, a Bonanza for Washington Lobbyists

2016-11-10.abstract: After The Times reported on AIBA’s financial problems last week, the federation said the loan was largely the work of a deputy who was fired in 2015.
2016-11-10.snippet: After The Times reported on AIBA’s financial problems last week, the federation said the loan was largely the work of a deputy who was fired in 2015.
2016-11-10.lead_paragraph: The president of boxing’s international federation was closely involved in guiding a $10 million loan to the organization, a transaction that ultimately led to such financial disarray that investigators from an auditing firm recommended that the group find a criminal lawyer, according to documents recently obtained by The New York Times.
2016-11-10.headline_main: President of Boxing’s Governing Body Knew of Loan, Documents Show

2016-11-10.abstract: Defying expectations, the stock market rebounded as investors cheered the changes a Donald Trump administration was likely to bring.
2016-11-10.snippet: Defying expectations, the stock market rebounded as investors cheered the changes a Donald Trump administration was likely to bring.

2016-11-10.abstract: It was what I was taught at Wesleyan that persuaded me.
2016-11-10.snippet: It was what I was taught at Wesleyan that persuaded me.
2016-11-10.lead_paragraph: MIDDLETOWN, Conn. — As the needle on the New York Times presidential predictor swung from a certain victory for Hillary Clinton to an upset win for Donald J. Trump on Tuesday, I began to think about how my campus, Wesleyan University, would react to the news.
2016-11-10.headline_main: My Liberal University Cemented My Vote for Trump

2016-11-10.abstract: High triglyceride levels, which may increase the risk of a heart attack, are tied to a potentially fatal inflammation of the pancreas as well.
2016-11-10.snippet: High triglyceride levels, which may increase the risk of a heart attack, are tied to a potentially fatal inflammation of the pancreas as well.
2016-11-10.lead_paragraph: People are often advised to keep levels of triglycerides, a type of blood fat, in check to lower the risk of a heart attack. But high triglyceride levels may be linked to another problem as well: acute pancreatitis, a sudden and potentially fatal inflammation of the pancreas.
2016-11-10.headline_main: High Triglycerides Tied to Pancreatitis Risk

2016-11-10.snippet: A chef engineers treats for her young East Village audience.
2016-11-10.lead_paragraph: The soju cocktails come in plastic pouches with straws thrust in, like debauched Capri Suns. The cubes inside look like ice but glow. In the long, dark dining room, they double as votive candles, lighting faces from below: dinner as séance.
2016-11-10.headline_main: At Thursday Kitchen, Cocktails Glow and Korean Food Relaxes

2016-11-10.abstract: An age of online shopping has, surprisingly, led to an exciting time for shoppers to get back out onto city streets to explore new, innovative shops.
2016-11-10.snippet: An age of online shopping has, surprisingly, led to an exciting time for shoppers to get back out onto city streets to explore new, innovative shops.

2016-11-10.abstract: New books about military history include looks at firearms and Native Americans, Pax Romana, Pearl Harbor and more.
2016-11-10.snippet: New books about military history include looks at firearms and Native Americans, Pax Romana, Pearl Harbor and more.
2016-11-10.lead_paragraph: A good measure of a work of history is whether it changes the way we understand its subject. By that measure, David J. Silverman succeeds admirably in THUNDERSTICKS: Firearms and the Violent Transformation of Native America (Belknap/Harvard University, $29.95).
2016-11-10.headline_main: Thomas Ricks on the Season’s Military History

2016-11-10.abstract: In the end, even the most powerful female politician in America couldn’t escape the shadow of the male libido.
2016-11-10.snippet: In the end, even the most powerful female politician in America couldn’t escape the shadow of the male libido.
2016-11-10.lead_paragraph: When millions of women cast their votes for Hillary Clinton on Tuesday, they may have been thinking about male power as much as female equality — about the sleazebags who never heard “no,” or the male bosses who lowballed them in salary negotiations, or those men in positions of authority who patronized them or ignored them altogether. There was a sense of collective curiosity and anticipation: Would having a woman serve in the most powerful role in the country make any of those scenarios less likely for women going forward?
2016-11-10.headline_main: Hillary Clinton, a Woman Dogged by Men’s Misdeeds

2016-11-10.abstract: A collection of organizers, games, discussion starters, maps and more to use as warm-up activities, curriculum extensions, skill-builders, substitute lessons, or just for fun.

2016-11-10.abstract: Ms. Bernier’s long life of journalism, famous friends and other encounters gave her talks an uncommonly wide sweep.
2016-11-10.snippet: Ms. Bernier’s long life of journalism, famous friends and other encounters gave her talks an uncommonly wide sweep.
2016-11-10.lead_paragraph: Rosamond Bernier, who transformed the museum art lecture into a dazzling entertainment by blending scholarship, a flair for the dramatic and tales of her days as a free-spirited journalist and friend to Picasso, Matisse and other 20th-century artists, died on Wednesday at her home in Manhattan. She was 100.
2016-11-10.headline_main: Rosamond Bernier, Art Insider Who Turned Lectures Into Theater, Dies at 100

2016-11-10.headline_main: Denis Villeneuve of ‘Arrival’ Leans In to Strong Heroines

With 42 defendants publicly charged to date, the conviction marked a halfway point.

2016-11-10.snippet: A health care revolution in developing nations started with some uncomfortable trial and error.

2016-11-10.headline_main: How an Indian Innovator Reverse-Engineered the Making of Sanitary Pads

2016-11-10.abstract: An examination of our current obsession with redesigning everything.
2016-11-10.snippet: An examination of our current obsession with redesigning everything.
2016-11-10.lead_paragraph: A little-known fact about The New York Times Magazine is that it is printed on the weekend before the one on which it is distributed. This means that the contents of this week’s issue were finalized several days before Election Day. You will find no direct reflections on the results of the voting in these articles. And yet, the uncertainty of the outcome at the time we published them suits the theme of this special issue: our current mania with redesigning, tweaking, optimizing, improving, refreshing and updating everything. In the age of branding, the quadrennial choosing of an American president has come to feel like an exercise in product relaunch, and both candidates — Hillary Clinton and the eventual victor, Donald Trump — each represented a new and unprecedented proposal for the face we would show the world.
2016-11-10.headline_main: Make It New

2016-11-10.abstract: The combination was not a surprise. Each firm brings complementary expertise, and revenue has suffered in the changing legal landscape.
2016-11-10.snippet: The combination was not a surprise. Each firm brings complementary expertise, and revenue has suffered in the changing legal landscape.
2016-11-10.lead_paragraph: Two prominent law firms, Arnold & Porter and Kaye Scholer, winding up months of talks, announced on Thursday that they would combine to become a firm with more than 1,000 lawyers effective Jan. 1. The new firm will be called Arnold & Porter Kaye Scholer.
2016-11-10.headline_main: Law Firm Arnold & Porter to Merge With Rival Kaye Scholer

2016-11-10.abstract: Canada Goose, spotted on runways of late, is opening a flagship in New York.
2016-11-10.snippet: Canada Goose, spotted on runways of late, is opening a flagship in New York.
2016-11-10.lead_paragraph: Lately Canada Goose, the 59-year-old outerwear brand best known for its fur-trimmed black parkas, has been found not just in wintry climes but on runways. In February, Marc Jacobs paired one of his floor-grazing sequined skirts with a men’s Manitoba coat, adding feathers, while Vetements deconstructed and puffed up two classic styles. Opening Ceremony’s (slimmer) takes were eye-catching for their use of color and print — think purple paisley. This month, Canada Goose becomes a full-fledged member of the downtown scene with the inauguration of a SoHo flagship. (It opens on the heels of a Toronto outpost, the company’s first stand-alone store.) Amid raw marble detailing sourced from British Columbia, shoppers can rest on soft maple benches by the Ontario millworker DB Johnson and other seating from the Montreal-based Montauk Sofa company. They’ll also find a celebration of soapstone-carved polar bear sculptures by the contemporary Aboriginal artist Jason Carter. “Storytelling was a crucial part of the design,” says chief executive officer Dani Reiss. “Stories like how we were there when Laurie Skreslet was the first Canadian to summit Mt. Everest.” Add to that tales of the brand’s fashion-world ascent.
2016-11-10.headline_main: An Outerwear Brand Finds Its Place in Fashion — and in SoHo

2016-11-10.abstract: Wesley Lowery, one of the Pulitzer-winning Washington Post reporters covering the rash of police shootings in 2014 and 2015, tells his story.
2016-11-10.snippet: Wesley Lowery, one of the Pulitzer-winning Washington Post reporters covering the rash of police shootings in 2014 and 2015, tells his story.
2016-11-10.lead_paragraph: The reporters who covered the civil-rights struggle in America in the 1950s and ’60s were said to be working the race beat. A new generation of reporters has risen to cover a grim and new-seeming iteration of that beat: police shootings of unarmed black men.
2016-11-10.headline_main: Review: ‘They Can’t Kill Us All’ Tallies the Unarmed Black Men Shot by Police

2016-11-10.abstract: The election of Meng Hongwei, the first Chinese official to lead Interpol, set off alarm bells among rights activists over the potential misuse of the police organization.
2016-11-10.snippet: The election of Meng Hongwei, the first Chinese official to lead Interpol, set off alarm bells among rights activists over the potential misuse of the police organization.
2016-11-10.lead_paragraph: HONG KONG — Interpol has chosen a top Chinese security official as its new president, raising alarms from human rights groups concerned that the appointment will lead to abuse of the global police organization’s powers to issue international arrest warrants.
2016-11-10.headline_main: Interpol Names Chinese Police Official as Its New President

2016-11-10.abstract: Dickey, 42, the knuckleball pitcher who won a Cy Young Award with the Mets in 2012, had contemplated retirement.
2016-11-10.snippet: Dickey, 42, the knuckleball pitcher who won a Cy Young Award with the Mets in 2012, had contemplated retirement.
2016-11-10.lead_paragraph: R. A. Dickey, the 42-year-old knuckleball pitcher, signed a one-year free-agent deal to pitch for the Atlanta Braves, a team with a rich history of knuckleballers.
2016-11-10.headline_main: R. A. Dickey Isn’t Done; Signs One-Year Deal With Atlanta Braves

2016-11-10.abstract: Start with coffee from Cafe Integral and start wandering. You’ll find books, vintage clothing, discounted designers and modern jewelry.
2016-11-10.snippet: Start with coffee from Cafe Integral and start wandering. You’ll find books, vintage clothing, discounted designers and modern jewelry.
2016-11-10.lead_paragraph: Start exploring NoLIta with a little fuel from Café Integral at 149 Elizabeth Street. Nicaraguan coffee is roasted in New York, and nut milks like almond, cashew and coconut are made in-house. The Almond Milk Latte ($6) has been life changing, tasting not like store-bought almond milk, but like warm, creamy almonds. You’ll also rarely find a line here, which makes starting your day that much better.
2016-11-10.headline_main: For Locally Owned Stores, Head to NoLIta

2016-11-10.abstract: The latest assault on Yahoo’s reputation gives Verizon extra firepower to snag a better deal.
2016-11-10.snippet: The latest assault on Yahoo’s reputation gives Verizon extra firepower to snag a better deal.
2016-11-10.lead_paragraph: Yahoo is providing more wiggle room for Verizon Communications.
2016-11-10.headline_main: Yahoo’s Breach Gives Verizon Leverage in Deal Talks

2016-11-10.abstract: The couple has collaborated on structural pieces which will be the focus of a new show at MOCA in Los Angeles.
2016-11-10.snippet: The couple has collaborated on structural pieces which will be the focus of a new show at MOCA in Los Angeles.
2016-11-10.lead_paragraph: The couple has collaborated on structural pieces which will be the focus of a new show at MOCA in Los Angeles.
2016-11-10.headline_main: Highlights of Rick Owens’s and Michèle Lamy’s Furniture

2016-11-10.abstract: The designer’s pieces will be the focus of an upcoming show at the Museum of Contemporary Art, Los Angeles. He talks to T about craftsmanship, fashion — and comfort.
2016-11-10.snippet: The designer’s pieces will be the focus of an upcoming show at the Museum of Contemporary Art, Los Angeles. He talks to T about craftsmanship, fashion — and comfort.
2016-11-10.lead_paragraph: Plenty of people don’t realize that Rick Owens creates furniture, as well as fashion, and that he’s done so since 2007. That’s partly because Owens consciously keeps the pieces out of most of his stores; and partly because, even in situ, it doesn’t look like furniture. Instead, they resemble angular, faceted rocks made of materials as diverse as Carrara marble or plywood, maybe embedded with a moose antler. Owens’s own bed — one of an edition of three — is a monumental tomblike structure of alabaster slabs which, when combined with its matching daybed, weighs two tons.
2016-11-10.headline_main: Rick Owens’s Monumental — if Not Entirely Cozy — Furniture

2016-11-10.abstract: The neighborhood blends old and new, with millennials living next door to decades-long residents. The shopping scene reflects a little of both, too.
2016-11-10.snippet: The neighborhood blends old and new, with millennials living next door to decades-long residents. The shopping scene reflects a little of both, too.
2016-11-10.lead_paragraph: Adaptations (109 Franklin Street) is a vintage furniture store that focuses mostly on pieces from the 1970s: boxy wooden cabinets, platform sofas, macramé wall hangings and eight-track-friendly stereo receivers. Arranged like a home, with a bedroom nook in back, the store has an unintimidating atmosphere and prices that are not astronomical for items that are in excellent condition. To pair with the vintage finds there are new, plush upholstered ottomans, which the shop makes to order in a variety of fabrics.
2016-11-10.headline_main: Low-Key Greenpoint Has a Little of Everything

2016-11-10.abstract: Mr. Schock, who resigned in 2015, was indicted by a federal grand jury on 24 counts, including wire fraud and theft of government funds.
2016-11-10.snippet: Mr. Schock, who resigned in 2015, was indicted by a federal grand jury on 24 counts, including wire fraud and theft of government funds.
2016-11-10.lead_paragraph: Aaron Schock, the former Republican representative from Illinois whose taste for first-class travel and a “Downton Abbey”-themed office design led to questions about his judgment and adherence to spending rules, was indicted on Thursday by a federal grand jury on 24 counts, including wire fraud and theft of government funds.
2016-11-10.headline_main: Aaron Schock, Ex-Illinois Congressman, Is Indicted

2016-11-10.abstract: The New York senator, the new minority leader, will need the conciliatory skills he has developed over the years, faced with Republican control of Congress and the White House.
2016-11-10.snippet: The New York senator, the new minority leader, will need the conciliatory skills he has developed over the years, faced with Republican control of Congress and the White House.
2016-11-10.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — In 2012, Senator Chuck Schumer, Democrat of New York, made an arresting offer to Senator Scott Brown, the Massachusetts Republican whose 2010 special-election victory had upended President Obama’s agenda. Help Democrats pass legislation to blunt the force of money in politics, he said, and they would not mount a serious challenge to Mr. Brown’s re-election.
2016-11-10.headline_main: Chuck Schumer Prepares for His Next Challenge: Leading Senate Democrats

2016-11-10.abstract: Full of small and alluring independent boutiques, it’s a must-see for anyone who likes to shop at locally owned stores and experience the heart and charm of New York City.
2016-11-10.snippet: Full of small and alluring independent boutiques, it’s a must-see for anyone who likes to shop at locally owned stores and experience the heart and charm of New York City.
2016-11-10.lead_paragraph: Start south of Delancey Street on Orchard and slowly make your way north. It’s easy to spend a full day here, as there are also numerous galleries. The Tenement Museum (103 Orchard Street) is also not to be missed. It offers excellent tours of the neighborhood that provide an even more immersive experience.
2016-11-10.headline_main: Lower East Side, Effortlessly Cool

2016-11-10.abstract: While it’s a bit spread out, a vibrant retail scene includes dynamic stores popping up on blocks that are otherwise either residential or industrial.
2016-11-10.snippet: While it’s a bit spread out, a vibrant retail scene includes dynamic stores popping up on blocks that are otherwise either residential or industrial.
2016-11-10.lead_paragraph: Joya Studio (19 Vanderbilt Avenue), near the Navy Yard, produces scented candles for more than 100 brands, from tastemaker designer labels to Nike. Since February, the front section of its manufacturing facility has been transformed into a boutique that’s evocative of a high-end art gallery, with hanging oak display cases backed with slabs of hot-rolled steel. (Periodically, the cases slide aside, making room for the delivery trucks that pull into the cavernous space.) Joya’s owner, Frederick Bouchardy, fills the store with personal picks, including the Claude Galien cologne his grandfather wore, Le Baigneur beard and face oil, thick leather coasters and a selection of art books.
2016-11-10.headline_main: Clinton Hill, a Welcome Stroll

2016-11-10.abstract: Suggested reading by book critics and editors at The New York Times.
2016-11-10.snippet: Suggested reading by book critics and editors at The New York Times.
2016-11-10.lead_paragraph: However you feel about the results of this week’s election, there’s no arguing that it was a long and brutal campaign season. Let’s take refuge in stories, and in the long view of history.
2016-11-10.headline_main: 9 New Books We Recommend This Week

2016-11-10.abstract: A New York teacher is keeping alive his mother’s collection of costumes, ornaments and other objects.
2016-11-10.snippet: A New York teacher is keeping alive his mother’s collection of costumes, ornaments and other objects.
2016-11-10.lead_paragraph: The belly dancer Serena Wilson was so fascinated with the dance form that she wrote books about it with her husband, Alan. In their 1994 study, “The Legacy of Little Egypt: A History of the Belly Dance in America,” they described how Middle Eastern and North African performers drew crowds at Chicago and New York theaters in the 1890s and early 1900s, and how entrepreneurial Americans started learning the moves.
2016-11-10.headline_main: A Wriggle in Time: Historical Artifacts of Belly Dancing

2016-11-10.abstract: Soccer prospects near the United States-Mexico border face an early decision about their careers that comes with long-term consequences.
2016-11-10.snippet: Soccer prospects near the United States-Mexico border face an early decision about their careers that comes with long-term consequences.
2016-11-10.lead_paragraph: EL PASO — Night fell, and the thick, heavy air was cut by a sharp, chilling breeze, the sort of West Texas wind that made it feel as if the whole city had a fever. Was it hot out, or cold? The children on the field at Pico Norte Park — little more than a bumpy, narrow strip of grass lined for soccer — wore uniforms and quickly broke a sweat; the parents ringing the sideline wore jeans and long sleeves as they watched and cheered and occasionally shivered.
2016-11-10.headline_main: ‘It Is America. But I Want to Play in Mexico.’

2016-11-10.abstract: Also, my brother’s wife won’t come to my wedding, saying she’s afraid to fly. I don’t accept that.
2016-11-10.snippet: Also, my brother’s wife won’t come to my wedding, saying she’s afraid to fly. I don’t accept that.
2016-11-10.lead_paragraph: My problem? You and idiots like you, full of straight white male privilege, who never understood the life-or-death stakes of sexism, racism and homophobia in our recent election. I heard you on the radio last week, sounding like a fool, telling people who had fought over the presidential election (and cut ties with family and friends) to look for the best in each other and talk it out. Why is it always on the victims to explain ourselves to straight men and white people? I’ve had it! After this election, I want nothing to do with any jerk who voted for Trump or limousine liberals like you. Why should I?
2016-11-10.headline_main: Mending Fences (Even When You Really Don’t Want To)

2016-11-10.abstract: At least two people were killed and 84 wounded when the insurgents struck with a suicide car bomb near a hotel being used by German diplomats, Afghan officials said.
2016-11-10.snippet: At least two people were killed and 84 wounded when the insurgents struck with a suicide car bomb near a hotel being used by German diplomats, Afghan officials said.
2016-11-10.lead_paragraph: KUNDUZ, Afghanistan — Taliban insurgents struck at the German Consulate in the northern commercial hub of Mazar-i-Sharif late Thursday night, killing at least two people and wounding at least 90, Afghan officials said.
2016-11-10.headline_main: Taliban Strike German Consulate in Afghan City of Mazar-i-Sharif

2016-11-10.abstract: Sixty percent of all voters in the nation live in a county that was won in a landslide in 2016.
