2016-11-13.lead_paragraph: SITTWE, Myanmar — Violence between the Rohingya, a persecuted Muslim population, and Myanmar’s security forces escalated over the weekend as two soldiers were killed by crudely armed attackers, said government officials and Muslim residents. In retaliation, troops of the Buddhist-majority government used helicopters to fire at the attackers in dense forest in northwestern Myanmar, a government spokesman said.
2016-11-13.headline_main: Violence Escalates Between Myanmar Forces and Rohingya

2016-11-13.abstract: Archbishop Joseph Tobin faces many challenges in his new post in Newark, including shifting demographics and criticism drawn by his predecessor.
2016-11-13.snippet: Archbishop Joseph Tobin faces many challenges in his new post in Newark, including shifting demographics and criticism drawn by his predecessor.
2016-11-13.lead_paragraph: NEWARK — Bishop Manuel A. Cruz opened with a head count. “Four,” he said, looking out at the four parishioners in a small chapel behind the soaring Gothic sanctuary of the Cathedral Basilica of the Sacred Heart here. “The perfect number, because it is the number we are here.”
2016-11-13.headline_main: In Troubled Newark Archdiocese, Hoping Its New Leader Is a Pastor, Not a Prince

2016-11-13.abstract: The Amy Adams film beat expectations, buoyed by reviews. Over all, North American ticket sales were up 47 percent compared with the same weekend in 2015.
2016-11-13.snippet: The Amy Adams film beat expectations, buoyed by reviews. Over all, North American ticket sales were up 47 percent compared with the same weekend in 2015.
2016-11-13.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES — Whether because of Veterans Day school closings, a postelection need to escape into fantasy or an unusually wide range of multiplex offerings, Hollywood had a very good weekend at the box office: Ticket sales in North America were up 47 percent compared with the same weekend last year, according to comScore.
2016-11-13.headline_main: ‘Arrival’ Comes On Strong in a Generally Robust Box Office Weekend

2016-11-13.abstract: Auriemma dropped in on San Antonio during training camp to learn from the culture that Popovich has created for the Spurs.
2016-11-13.snippet: Auriemma dropped in on San Antonio during training camp to learn from the culture that Popovich has created for the Spurs.
2016-11-13.lead_paragraph: STORRS, Conn. — Two of the most successful coaches in basketball history had admired each other only from afar, from across the amateur/professional and gender divides. They decided to do something about it.
2016-11-13.headline_main: UConn’s Geno Auriemma Looks Into a Mirror and Sees Gregg Popovich

2016-11-13.abstract: A penetrating silence enveloped Paris on Sunday as thousands of people massed under a leaden sky to remember the victims of the Nov. 13, 2015, attacks.
2016-11-13.snippet: A penetrating silence enveloped Paris on Sunday as thousands of people massed under a leaden sky to remember the victims of the Nov. 13, 2015, attacks.
2016-11-13.lead_paragraph: PARIS — No bells tolled. No fists were raised. No sirens blared.
2016-11-13.headline_main: From Bataclan to Street Cafes, Paris Is Quiet but Resolute as It Mourns on Anniversary of Attacks

2016-11-13.abstract: Junior high and high school coaches from China participated in a three-month residency as part of a partnership involving the Chinese government, the Pac-12 and the University of Utah.
2016-11-13.snippet: Junior high and high school coaches from China participated in a three-month residency as part of a partnership involving the Chinese government, the Pac-12 and the University of Utah.
2016-11-13.lead_paragraph: SALT LAKE CITY — About 15 coaches filed onto the mezzanine-like balcony overlooking a basketball practice court. They wore warm-up apparel and sneakers. As the Utes men’s team began its practice, some took notes in small Moleskine notebooks; others consulted printouts of set plays.
2016-11-13.headline_main: Chinese Coaches Take Lessons in Hardwood Diplomacy in America

2016-11-13.abstract: Gay players have added campy humor and flamboyantly themed tournaments to a winter sport’s traditions of friendly competition and drinking.
2016-11-13.snippet: Gay players have added campy humor and flamboyantly themed tournaments to a winter sport’s traditions of friendly competition and drinking.
2016-11-13.lead_paragraph: VANCOUVER, British Columbia — It happens all the time: Young gay people leave their small towns and head to the big city, where they can find love, acceptance and, in Canada at least, a curling league to call their own. Yes, the winter sport that involves ice, round rocks and a good deal of sweeping has a passionate following among those who have come out of the closet, taking their brooms with them.
2016-11-13.headline_main: Canada’s Gay Curling Leagues Take Pride on Ice

2016-11-13.abstract: Rumen Radev, a former air force commander with no previous political experience, seemed headed for a decisive victory in a runoff election.
2016-11-13.snippet: Rumen Radev, a former air force commander with no previous political experience, seemed headed for a decisive victory in a runoff election.
2016-11-13.lead_paragraph: SOFIA, Bulgaria — A pro-Russia former air force commander with no previous political experience appeared headed for a decisive victory on Sunday in a runoff election to become Bulgaria’s president. The results prompted the current governing party’s prime minister to say he would resign, setting the stage for early elections in the spring.
2016-11-13.headline_main: Pro-Russia Candidate Appears Likely to Win Bulgarian Presidency

2016-11-13.abstract: Jakob Michelsen is thriving at SonderjyskE as teams in Denmark, amid a downturn, adopt changes in their hiring practices, their approaches and even the league structure.
2016-11-13.snippet: Jakob Michelsen is thriving at SonderjyskE as teams in Denmark, amid a downturn, adopt changes in their hiring practices, their approaches and even the league structure.
2016-11-13.lead_paragraph: HADERSLEV, Denmark — Neither parallel tells quite the whole story, in truth, but both seem to have stuck.
2016-11-13.headline_main: A Coach Is Forging a New Path in Danish Soccer

2016-11-13.abstract: The appointments created rival centers of power and elevated the voice of Mr. Bannon, whose longtime website, Breitbart News, has traded in conspiracy theories and sometimes racist messages.
2016-11-13.snippet: The appointments created rival centers of power and elevated the voice of Mr. Bannon, whose longtime website, Breitbart News, has traded in conspiracy theories and sometimes racist messages.
2016-11-13.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President-elect Donald J. Trump on Sunday chose Reince Priebus, the chairman of the Republican National Committee and a loyal campaign adviser, to be his White House chief of staff, turning to a Washington insider whose friendship with the House speaker, Paul D. Ryan, could help secure early legislative victories.
2016-11-13.headline_main: Donald Trump Picks Reince Priebus as Chief of Staff and Stephen Bannon as Strategist

2016-11-13.abstract: Here’s what you need to know to start your day.
2016-11-13.snippet: Here’s what you need to know to start your day.
2016-11-13.lead_paragraph: Good morning.
2016-11-13.headline_main: Donald Trump, New Zealand, Facebook: Your Monday Briefing

2016-11-13.abstract: National Geographic’s new series is a hybrid of documentary and space drama. It’s an interesting attempt but feels ill-timed to the moment.
2016-11-13.snippet: National Geographic’s new series is a hybrid of documentary and space drama. It’s an interesting attempt but feels ill-timed to the moment.
2016-11-13.lead_paragraph: Timing is everything, and “Mars,” a six-episode experiment in hybridization that begins Monday on the National Geographic Channel, feels as if it is landing at a particularly inopportune moment.
2016-11-13.headline_main: Review: ‘Mars’ Blends Fact and Fiction, but Has a Bumpy Liftoff

2016-11-13.abstract: Even people who are at the worst risk can benefit by not smoking, exercising moderately and eating a healthy diet, researchers say.
2016-11-13.snippet: Even people who are at the worst risk can benefit by not smoking, exercising moderately and eating a healthy diet, researchers say.
2016-11-13.lead_paragraph: Is genetics destiny when it comes to heart disease?
2016-11-13.headline_main: Genetic Heart Disease Risk Eased by Healthy Habits, Study Finds

2016-11-13.abstract: A question has long hung over Celebrex: Did it cause heart attacks? Now, a clinical trial suggests it may be safer than drugs like ibuprofen and naproxen.
2016-11-13.snippet: A question has long hung over Celebrex: Did it cause heart attacks? Now, a clinical trial suggests it may be safer than drugs like ibuprofen and naproxen.
2016-11-13.lead_paragraph: The drugs seemed miraculous when they were introduced in 1999, and they soon became blockbusters, with billion-dollar sales. Vioxx, made by Merck, and Celebrex, made by Pfizer, could quell pain and inflammation just as well as drugs like ibuprofen and naproxen, but they did not cause ulcers and gastrointestinal bleeding.
2016-11-13.headline_main: Celebrex Is Found to Be No Riskier for Hearts Than Other Pain Drugs

2016-11-13.abstract: GSK does more than its competitors to make important drugs available in developing countries, according to an updated ranking.
2016-11-13.snippet: GSK does more than its competitors to make important drugs available in developing countries, according to an updated ranking.
2016-11-13.lead_paragraph: The pharmaceutical giant GSK, which has held first place in the Access to Medicine Index ever since its introduction in 2008, was ranked first again this week.
2016-11-13.headline_main: Which Big Drug Companies Are Helping the Poor? Here’s the List

2016-11-13.abstract: On Monday, the president will begin a trip that will take him to Greece, Germany and Peru. At every stop, he is sure to be asked how he got the election so wrong.
2016-11-13.snippet: On Monday, the president will begin a trip that will take him to Greece, Germany and Peru. At every stop, he is sure to be asked how he got the election so wrong.
2016-11-13.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — On his last foreign trip while in office, President Obama will have a lot of explaining to do.
2016-11-13.headline_main: Obama Heads Overseas, Where Topic of Trump Will Follow Him

2016-11-13.abstract: There’s plenty to like in the new Acorn TV series, which takes place in 1946 England, but the show would have done better to rely more on actual history.
2016-11-13.snippet: There’s plenty to like in the new Acorn TV series, which takes place in 1946 England, but the show would have done better to rely more on actual history.
2016-11-13.lead_paragraph: Judging from “Close to the Enemy,” a new drama from the streaming service Acorn TV, an outbreak of coyness swept England in the difficult year after World War II ended. It’s a well-made, deftly acted period drama, but one built on an irksome plotting philosophy: Why be direct when you can be cryptic?
2016-11-13.headline_main: Review: ‘Close to the Enemy’ Is One Cryptic Postwar Drama

2016-11-13.abstract: The choreographer turned to the visual artist Daniel Arsham and the musician Pharrell Williams for this venture. It’s admirably ambitious, yet confused.
2016-11-13.snippet: The choreographer turned to the visual artist Daniel Arsham and the musician Pharrell Williams for this venture. It’s admirably ambitious, yet confused.
2016-11-13.lead_paragraph: The choreographer Jonah Bokaer has written that “Rules of the Game,” his latest collaborative venture, “is about how to ‘tag’ deeply creative minds into (never onto) the very fluid medium of choreography.” Those minds belong to him, the visual artist Daniel Arsham and the musician Pharrell Williams, who came together to produce the admirably ambitious yet confused work that had its New York premiere at the Howard Gilman Opera House of the Brooklyn Academy of Music on Thursday.
2016-11-13.headline_main: Review: Jonah Bokaer’s ‘Rules of the Game,’ a Collaboration at Odds With Itself

2016-11-13.abstract: Sadler’s Wells London Production was behind this uninspiring evening, comprising works by Arthur Pita, Sidi Larbi Cherkaoui and Russell Maliphant.
2016-11-13.snippet: Sadler’s Wells London Production was behind this uninspiring evening, comprising works by Arthur Pita, Sidi Larbi Cherkaoui and Russell Maliphant.
2016-11-13.lead_paragraph: The ballerina Natalia Osipova has celebrity. But when it comes to choosing repertory to express another side of her artistry through contemporary dance — that all-too-familiar code for extending a career — she needs help.
2016-11-13.headline_main: Review: Natalia Osipova and Artists Stick to the Familiar at City Center

2016-11-13.abstract: The president-elect said his immigration priority was to deport up to three million undocumented immigrants rather than 11 million and that his border wall might be a fence in places.
2016-11-13.snippet: The president-elect said his immigration priority was to deport up to three million undocumented immigrants rather than 11 million and that his border wall might be a fence in places.
2016-11-13.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President-elect Donald J. Trump appeared to soften some of his hardest-line campaign positions on immigration on Sunday, but he also restated his pledge to roll back abortion rights and used Twitter to lash out at his critics, leaving open the possibility that he would continue using social media in the Oval Office and radically change the way presidents speak to Americans.
2016-11-13.headline_main: Donald Trump Appears to Soften Stance on Immigration, but Not on Abortion

2016-11-13.abstract: Simon Morrison’s new book serves as a backstage pass to the past and present of the renowned ballet company.
2016-11-13.snippet: Simon Morrison’s new book serves as a backstage pass to the past and present of the renowned ballet company.
2016-11-13.lead_paragraph: Simon Morrison’s “Bolshoi Confidential: Secrets of the Russian Ballet From the Rule of the Tsars to Today” delivers what its title promises: struggles and intrigues, crimes and punishments, imperial jewels and Soviet medals. Based on extensive research in libraries and archives, and conversations heard at Russian kitchen tables, Mr. Morrison’s book gives a historical tour behind the scenes of one of the world’s most glorious ballet institutions, from 1776, when the Bolshoi was founded by Michael Maddox, an English adventurer in Russia, to the attack with acid on Sergei Filin, the Bolshoi’s artistic director, in 2013.
2016-11-13.headline_main: Review: ‘Bolshoi Confidential’ Peers Down the Centuries and Past the Pirouettes

2016-11-13.abstract: Petty got the start in a surprise move and showed off a strong arm, but a late interception effectively dashed any last remnant of hope for the Jets to make the playoffs.
2016-11-13.snippet: Petty got the start in a surprise move and showed off a strong arm, but a late interception effectively dashed any last remnant of hope for the Jets to make the playoffs.
2016-11-13.lead_paragraph: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J. — The heels of the Jets’ linemen skimmed along their goal line. They had been pushed as far back as they could go.
2016-11-13.headline_main: Bryce Petty Shows Promise, but Rams Deal Jets More Disappointment

2016-11-13.abstract: European Union foreign ministers met on Sunday to discuss potential ramifications of Mr. Trump’s win. Many of his statements have left some European nations vulnerable.
2016-11-13.snippet: European Union foreign ministers met on Sunday to discuss potential ramifications of Mr. Trump’s win. Many of his statements have left some European nations vulnerable.
2016-11-13.lead_paragraph: BRUSSELS — An emergency meeting of European Union foreign ministers on Sunday was the latest sign of the global disquiet in the wake of the election of Donald J. Trump, who has questioned some of the central tenets of American foreign policy.
2016-11-13.headline_main: European Leaders Gather to Grapple With Donald Trump’s Victory

2016-11-13.abstract: Mr. Oliver, who stars in “Attorney Street,” the latest installment of his solo trilogy, takes a melancholy stroll around his former neighborhood.
2016-11-13.snippet: Mr. Oliver, who stars in “Attorney Street,” the latest installment of his solo trilogy, takes a melancholy stroll around his former neighborhood.
2016-11-13.lead_paragraph: The actor Edgar Oliver doesn’t often find himself on the block of East 10th Street, in the East Village, where he lived for 34 years. But one weekend this month he went there twice — on Saturday, hoping to see a homeless friend who used to rent a room next door, and on Sunday to meet me for a ramble around the neighborhood.
2016-11-13.headline_main: Edgar Oliver, Actor and Raconteur, Hews to His East Village Past

2016-11-13.abstract: Fund-raisers with a link to pop culture are on the rise. But are they effective?
2016-11-13.snippet: Fund-raisers with a link to pop culture are on the rise. But are they effective?
2016-11-13.lead_paragraph: Americans who were around for the dawning of the “Age of Aquarius” will probably remember the Concert for Bangladesh, held on Aug. 1, 1971, at Madison Square Garden. Pop music royalty reigned in New York that day.
2016-11-13.headline_main: Philanthropy That Comes From a Click

2016-11-13.abstract: Zhouqin Burnikel starts off our solving week.
2016-11-13.snippet: Zhouqin Burnikel starts off our solving week.
2016-11-13.lead_paragraph: MONDAY PUZZLE — Major takeaway on today’s puzzle by Zhouqin Burnikel: We English-speaking people base the phrasing of a lot of our actions on animals.
2016-11-13.headline_main: Goofing Off

2016-11-13.abstract: The following tax-exempt fixed-income issues are scheduled for pricing this week.
2016-11-13.snippet: The following tax-exempt fixed-income issues are scheduled for pricing this week.
2016-11-13.lead_paragraph: The Treasury’s schedule of financing this week includes Monday’s regular weekly auction of new three- and six-month bills and an auction of four-week bills on Tuesday.
2016-11-13.headline_main: Treasury Auctions Set for the Week of Nov. 14

2016-11-13.abstract: Political scholars offering the “first historical assessment” of the Obama presidency gather to make revisions after the stunning election.
2016-11-13.snippet: Political scholars offering the “first historical assessment” of the Obama presidency gather to make revisions after the stunning election.
2016-11-13.lead_paragraph: PRINCETON, N.J. — Journalism may be the first draft of history. But on Friday, a group of scholars gathered here for what might be an editing session on the second.
2016-11-13.headline_main: Historians Assess Obama’s Legacy Under Trump’s Shadow

2016-11-13.abstract: The sales of Impressionist, Modern and contemporary art that start Monday offer the first test of how the art market will react to a Trump presidency.
2016-11-13.snippet: The sales of Impressionist, Modern and contemporary art that start Monday offer the first test of how the art market will react to a Trump presidency.
2016-11-13.lead_paragraph: At Rockefeller Center on Sunday, milling outside Christie’s sales rooms — where private clients sipped mimosas as they took in one of Monet’s grainstacks — people in the art world sounded guardedly optimistic about how the auctions will perform this week, after a period of uncertainty exacerbated by the contentious American presidential election, Britain’s “Brexit” vote in June and China’s slowing economy.
2016-11-13.headline_main: The Art Market’s Reaction to Trump? Sales This Week Offer First Test

2016-11-13.abstract: The country is experiencing a boom in renewable energy, but some government officials are pushing instead for nuclear power to wean the nation off coal.
2016-11-13.snippet: The country is experiencing a boom in renewable energy, but some government officials are pushing instead for nuclear power to wean the nation off coal.
2016-11-13.lead_paragraph: UPINGTON, South Africa — In one of the most sun-drenched corners of the planet, a 670-foot tower rises above a desert dotted with 4,160 mirrors. Tracking the sun throughout the day, the mirrors, called heliostats, redirect the sun’s rays into the tower, where water is heated to generate steam — and electricity.
2016-11-13.headline_main: Windmills or Reactor Cores? Inside South Africa’s Energy Clash

2016-11-13.abstract: “Ocean Warriors” will have its premiere on Dec. 4 and aims to reveal the crime and violence that often go unpunished in international waters.
2016-11-13.snippet: “Ocean Warriors” will have its premiere on Dec. 4 and aims to reveal the crime and violence that often go unpunished in international waters.
2016-11-13.lead_paragraph: Robert Redford and Paul Allen are the executive producers of a new Animal Planet series on ocean conservation. Entitled “Ocean Warriors,” the series traces activists, journalists and scientists working to fight poachers and organized crime in oceans across the globe.
2016-11-13.headline_main: Ocean Conservation Series Coming to Animal Planet

2016-11-13.abstract: If approved by Parliament, legislation would transfer the rights for the use of private land into Israeli hands and force Palestinian landowners to accept compensation.
2016-11-13.snippet: If approved by Parliament, legislation would transfer the rights for the use of private land into Israeli hands and force Palestinian landowners to accept compensation.
2016-11-13.lead_paragraph: JERUSALEM — An Israeli ministerial committee on Sunday approved a contentious bill that would allow for the retroactive legalization of Jewish settlement outposts built on privately owned Palestinian land in the occupied West Bank. The measure breaks a longstanding taboo, and in the view of many experts, it defies international law.
2016-11-13.headline_main: Bill to Legalize West Bank Settlements Advances in Israel

2016-11-13.abstract: Winners of this annual prize, which honors young artists in theater and dance, will be announced on Jan. 9.
2016-11-13.snippet: Winners of this annual prize, which honors young artists in theater and dance, will be announced on Jan. 9.
2016-11-13.lead_paragraph: Nominees have been announced for the 2016 Clive Barnes Award, the prize for young artists in theater and dance.
2016-11-13.headline_main: Clive Barnes Award Nominees Include Stars of ‘Spamilton’

2016-11-13.abstract: Newman’s Own gives all its profit to charity, but that message on its labels didn’t seem to stand out to a generation known to favor companies with social consciences.
2016-11-13.snippet: Newman’s Own gives all its profit to charity, but that message on its labels didn’t seem to stand out to a generation known to favor companies with social consciences.
2016-11-13.lead_paragraph: WESTPORT, Conn. — Newman’s Own was having trouble getting the word out about its philanthropy.
2016-11-13.headline_main: Paul Newman Who? Salad Dressing Company Adjusts to Reach Millennials

2016-11-13.abstract: In an unprecedented intervention, Beijing recently quashed the results of an election in Hong Kong.
2016-11-13.snippet: In an unprecedented intervention, Beijing recently quashed the results of an election in Hong Kong.
2016-11-13.lead_paragraph: Two months after tumultuous legislative elections, and two years after the pro-democracy Umbrella Movement paralyzed the city center, Hong Kong is in the throes of another great political crisis.
2016-11-13.headline_main: Beijing Tightens Its Grip in Hong Kong Again

2016-11-13.abstract: Dozens of chaplains on campuses across the country play a vital dual role: helping Muslim students feel welcome, and introducing Islam to non-Muslims.
2016-11-13.snippet: Dozens of chaplains on campuses across the country play a vital dual role: helping Muslim students feel welcome, and introducing Islam to non-Muslims.
2016-11-13.lead_paragraph: MINNEAPOLIS — Emma Blom grew up in the Scandinavian heartland of rural Minnesota, reliably attending her small town’s Lutheran church. She spent each childhood summer in vacation Bible school and played the piano for Sunday worship services. “Borning Cry” was her grandmother’s favorite hymn.
2016-11-13.headline_main: Muslim College Chaplains Extend a Hand Across Religious Divides

2016-11-13.abstract: Before Trump’s election in America exposed the failures of democracy, they had been revealed in Modi’s India.
2016-11-13.snippet: Before Trump’s election in America exposed the failures of democracy, they had been revealed in Modi’s India.
2016-11-13.lead_paragraph: Brexit, Erdogan, Putin and now Trump. Something is rotten in the state of democracy.
2016-11-13.headline_main: The Incendiary Appeal of Demagoguery in Our Time

2016-11-14.abstract: After Brexit and Trump, the National Front’s leader foresees a trifecta for the West’s far right when France votes next spring.
2016-11-14.snippet: After Brexit and Trump, the National Front’s leader foresees a trifecta for the West’s far right when France votes next spring.
2016-11-14.lead_paragraph: PARIS — Last Wednesday, as the world sought to absorb the news of Donald J. Trump’s electoral triumph, France’s far-right leader Marine Le Pen was up early, already commenting on Twitter. Even before the American president-elect gave his victory speech, she rushed to congratulate him and “the free American people.” This was hardly surprising, since Ms. Le Pen, the leader of the National Front, is hoping to become the next French president.
2016-11-14.headline_main: For Le Pen, the Impossible Now Seems Possible

2016-11-14.abstract: His voice quivering, the prime minister responded to biting criticism of his decision to ban large notes in circulation in an effort to fight corruption.
2016-11-14.snippet: His voice quivering, the prime minister responded to biting criticism of his decision to ban large notes in circulation in an effort to fight corruption.
2016-11-14.lead_paragraph: MUMBAI, India — Voice quivering, Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Sunday dramatically countered criticism of his surprise ban on most currency in circulation in India, a bold attack on corruption that crippled business at stores and markets around the country as millions scrambled for cash to meet even basic needs.
2016-11-14.headline_main: Narendra Modi Defends Currency Move as Millions in India Scramble for Cash

2016-11-14.abstract: The Securities and Exchange Commission will collect 13F forms, allowing analysts to see which sectors investors were betting on at the end of the third quarter.
2016-11-14.snippet: The Securities and Exchange Commission will collect 13F forms, allowing analysts to see which sectors investors were betting on at the end of the third quarter.
2016-11-14.lead_paragraph: Here’s a look at what’s coming up this week:
2016-11-14.headline_main: Traders to Compare Notes With Wall Street’s Richest Investors

2016-11-14.abstract: The unsettling reality for Beijing is that Donald Trump has a variety of ways to get back at China for trade practices that he views as unfair.
2016-11-14.snippet: The unsettling reality for Beijing is that Donald Trump has a variety of ways to get back at China for trade practices that he views as unfair.
2016-11-14.lead_paragraph: The unsettling reality for Beijing is that Donald Trump has a variety of ways to get back at China for trade practices that he views as unfair.
2016-11-14.headline_main: Heng on Trump’s Election and Its Implications for China

2016-11-14.abstract: Most Californians agree that it costs too much to live in the state. Mountain View, Google’s hometown, is trying to do something about that.
2016-11-14.snippet: Most Californians agree that it costs too much to live in the state. Mountain View, Google’s hometown, is trying to do something about that.
2016-11-14.lead_paragraph: MOUNTAIN VIEW, Calif. — If there is anything that just about every Californian agrees with, it is that it costs too much to live in the state. Over the last few years, the price of buying a home or renting an apartment has become so burdensome that it pervades almost every issue, from the state’s elevated poverty rate to the debate about multimillion-dollar tear-downs to the lines of recreational vehicles parked on Silicon Valley side streets.
2016-11-14.headline_main: Teslas in the Trailer Park: A California City Faces Its Housing Squeeze

2016-11-14.abstract: The Saudi-led coalition is hitting civilian targets, like factories, bridges and power stations, that critics say have no clear link to the rebels. In the rubble, the remains of American munitions have been found.
2016-11-14.snippet: The Saudi-led coalition is hitting civilian targets, like factories, bridges and power stations, that critics say have no clear link to the rebels. In the rubble, the remains of American munitions have been found.
2016-11-14.lead_paragraph: SANA, Yemen — For decades, Mustafa Elaghil’s family produced snack foods popular in Yemen, chips and corn curls in bright packaging decorated with the image of Ernie from “Sesame Street.”
2016-11-14.headline_main: U.S. Fingerprints on Attacks Obliterating Yemen’s Economy

2016-11-14.abstract: In a word, yes. But if established procedures to change laws hold, it would be extremely difficult, requiring Supreme Court action or a change in the Constitution.
2016-11-14.snippet: In a word, yes. But if established procedures to change laws hold, it would be extremely difficult, requiring Supreme Court action or a change in the Constitution.
2016-11-14.lead_paragraph: When Donald J. Trump said in February that he would “open up our libel laws” if he became president to make it easier to sue news organizations for unfavorable coverage, the declaration sent shock waves through the media world.
2016-11-14.headline_main: Can Libel Laws Be Changed Under Trump?

2016-11-14.snippet: After eight years in semiretirement, a woman gets a magical feeling when she returns to work on what turns out to be the first day of school.
2016-11-14.lead_paragraph: Dear Diary:
2016-11-14.headline_main: Thrilled to Be Back on the Subway

2016-11-14.abstract: President Obama’s arrival in Washington coincided with an urban renaissance, an influx of young people and an explosion in restaurants. Many there worry that Mr. Trump will set the city back.
2016-11-14.snippet: President Obama’s arrival in Washington coincided with an urban renaissance, an influx of young people and an explosion in restaurants. Many there worry that Mr. Trump will set the city back.
2016-11-14.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Michelle Obama has burned off her date-night meals at Washington’s new generation of acclaimed restaurants by pedaling at SoulCycle. President Obama has shopped for Jonathan Franzen novels with his daughters at local independent bookstores. Obama administration staff members, their barhopping chronicled in the gossip pages, have hit the 14th Street hot spots hard.
2016-11-14.headline_main: A Newly Vibrant Washington Fears That Trump Will Drain Its Culture

2016-11-14.abstract: Visitors are being urged not to share their snacks with the animals, which have become something of a tourist attraction in Manhattan.

2016-11-14.lead_paragraph: Like a little crew of old-time bandits, the first few raccoon faces poked out of the underbrush on a recent evening in Central Park, their masked, button eyes glowing with each flash of a smartphone camera. Undaunted, several of the animals scuttled onto the walkway toward the picture takers. They were followed by more raccoons — and then still more.

He had already vowed to change the libel laws to make it easier to sue journalists, and his personal insults were becoming more vicious. (One news correspondent was a “sleaze”; another was “third rate.”)

Trump vowed to refill the cells of the Guantánamo Bay prison and said American terrorism suspects should be sent there for military prosecution. He called for targeting mosques for surveillance, escalating airstrikes aimed at terrorists and taking out their civilian family members, and bringing back waterboarding and a “hell of a lot worse” — not only because “torture works,” but because even “if it doesn’t work, they deserve it anyway.”

2016-11-14.lead_paragraph: TOKYO — Japanese economic growth accelerated strongly in the third quarter. Japan has the world’s third-largest economy, but it has been struggling to lift a lackluster growth rate and escape the trap of deflation — sagging consumer prices associated with weak output and declining living standards. So what went right last quarter? And will it last?
2016-11-14.headline_main: Why Japan’s Economy Posted Surprisingly Strong Growth

2016-11-14.abstract: This one-man show revolves around a man who has apparently simply dialed a wrong number and then stays on the line to talk. And talk.
2016-11-14.snippet: This one-man show revolves around a man who has apparently simply dialed a wrong number and then stays on the line to talk. And talk.
2016-11-14.lead_paragraph: Try tracking all the conversations going on in Daniel Kitson’s “Mouse: The Persistence of an Unlikely Thought,” which opened on Sunday at St. Ann’s Warehouse in Brooklyn, and your mind will probably short-circuit. There is, to start with the obvious, the dialogue between the title creature (of unknown gender) of this solo performance piece and the woman (of unspecified name) who discovers it on her staircase.
2016-11-14.headline_main: Review: Daniel Kitson’s ‘Mouse’ Tells Its Tales Over a Speakerphone

2016-11-14.abstract: The truth regarding a popular fan theory comes to light, as do the lengths Dr. Ford will travel to protect his vision.
2016-11-14.snippet: The truth regarding a popular fan theory comes to light, as do the lengths Dr. Ford will travel to protect his vision.
2016-11-14.lead_paragraph: And so a popular fan theory comes to fruition: One of the park’s behind-the-scenes engineers is an android, and that android is Bernard, the head of Westworld’s programming division. Bernard won’t likely be the last, but he was always the most obvious, given his close association with Ford, his surreptitious exchanges with Dolores, and the circumstances surrounding his son’s death, which have been shrouded in vagueness, like a half-completed memory. Jeffrey Wright specializes in playing intense, introspective characters, but the slight lack of affect he’s brought to Bernard has long hinted at the synthetic hardware within. The story about his son, like Maeve’s memories of her daughter, has given Bernard the dimensionality of a human, but not quite the authentic depth.
2016-11-14.headline_main: ‘Westworld’ Season 1, Episode 7: They Cannot See

2016-11-14.abstract: The host Stephen J. Dubner and panelists consider mules, their defenders and other wonders of the natural world, including marine animals that will either live forever or kill you — or both.

2016-11-14.lead_paragraph: In 1885, a 5-year-old Douglas MacArthur spotted a certain African animal roaming across the American Southwest. That’s because 50 years earlier, Army officers wanted to test out the animal as an upgrade to the typical mules and horses they used as pack animals. The replacements worked out extraordinarily well — but then the Civil War intervened, and the program was abandoned. (Plus, the mule lobby wasn’t too thrilled about these outsider animals coming to take over what they argued the mules were doing perfectly well.)
2016-11-14.headline_main: Just How Powerful Was the ‘Mule Lobby’? (Yes, There Was One)

2016-11-14.abstract: Issa and Molly deal with the aftermath of their own mistakes in starkly different ways.
2016-11-14.snippet: Issa and Molly deal with the aftermath of their own mistakes in starkly different ways.
2016-11-14.lead_paragraph: A powerful, even overwhelming, feeling comes with recognizing yourself in a TV show. As the medium grows more diverse, there is greater opportunity for this. Recently, I’ve found myself in various conversations about whether the lead characters of “Insecure” are “relatable.” As a black woman, I actually don’t relate to Issa and Molly at all. We come from drastically different cultural backgrounds, our goals take on different shapes and our romantic pitfalls exist on opposing wavelengths.
2016-11-14.headline_main: ‘Insecure’ Season 1, Episode 6: A Real One

Later that same winter day the reply arrived: “I wanted to stand with those who clearly see G-d’s holy broken world for what it is, and still find the courage or the heart to praise it. You don’t always get what you want. You’re not always up for the challenge. But in this case — it was given to me. For which I am deeply grateful.”

2016-11-14.abstract: With the Kurdish pesh merga on the road to Mosul.
2016-11-14.snippet: With the Kurdish pesh merga on the road to Mosul.
2016-11-14.lead_paragraph: Before dawn on a Sunday late last month, a battalion of pesh merga soldiers — about 600 Kurdish men, along with a few women — gathered in the shadow of Bashiqa Mountain, on the western edge of the autonomous region of Iraqi Kurdistan. They were sons, daughters, fathers, grandfathers. They wore an assortment of camouflage fatigues and traditional Kurdish flowing pants, waist sashes and head scarves. They carried antique Kalashnikovs and new assault rifles. Few had helmets, and fewer had body armor. Strapped to their backs and belts and legs were daggers, revolvers, axes. Some of them had received the call to duty only the day before and were driven to the front by family or rode overnight in taxis.
2016-11-14.headline_main: ‘They Will Have to Die Now’

2016-11-14.lead_paragraph: Mexico City — To get about on a bicycle in Mexico City is an experience ranging from complicated to downright scary. The cracked and broken paving makes it torture to ride anywhere, specially if you’re constantly dodging hostile cars and trucks. It’s frequently said that “Mexico City is not Amsterdam.” Drivers in Amsterdam share the streets with bicycles and pedestrians as a matter of course; here, it seems we do so because we’re forced to. Nevertheless, we inhabitants of Mexico City have the same right as any Dutch citizen to enjoy a complete network of bike lanes to get around the city.
2016-11-14.headline_main: Who Owns the Street in Mexico City?

2016-11-14.abstract: Most devices connect to the television through an HDMI port, but you can find gear to work with the composite connections used by legacy TV sets.
2016-11-14.snippet: Most devices connect to the television through an HDMI port, but you can find gear to work with the composite connections used by legacy TV sets.
2016-11-14.lead_paragraph: Q. I have an analog television in the kitchen that predates the digital HDTV revolution. I’d like to attach an inexpensive streaming device like the Amazon Fire TV Stick to it, but the specifications say an HDMI port is required. Am I out of luck?
2016-11-14.headline_main: How to Stream Video on an Older TV

2016-11-14.abstract: The announcement is no surprise to climate scientists, as experts at NASA had already projected that the year would be the third bringing record heat.

2016-11-14.lead_paragraph: Sunday night’s “Westworld” reveal is already generating heaps of discussion. Even for the many viewers who saw it coming, there’s plenty to process this morning. Once you’ve read Scott Tobias’s recap, here’s a handful of essential pieces on what the new development means, how the series’ creators and stars conceived the climactic scene, and where the reveal leaves the many fan theories currently in play.
2016-11-14.headline_main: What to Read About the Big ‘Westworld’ Reveal

2016-11-14.abstract: The soprano performed a powerful program at the Metropolitan Opera that focused on the Underground Railroad, and rewarded the audience with five encores.
2016-11-14.snippet: The soprano performed a powerful program at the Metropolitan Opera that focused on the Underground Railroad, and rewarded the audience with five encores.
2016-11-14.lead_paragraph: After the bitterness of the soprano Kathleen Battle’s rift with the Metropolitan Opera in 1994, it looked as if she would never return to the company’s stage. That year, Joseph Volpe, then the Met’s general manager, in an extraordinarily blunt statement, dismissed her from a production of Donizetti’s “La Fille du Régiment” for “unprofessional actions” during rehearsals that were “profoundly detrimental” to artistic collaborations among cast members. She was dropped from the Met’s roster for good, it seemed.
2016-11-14.headline_main: Review: Kathleen Battle Returns to the Met After 22 Years. It Was Worth the Wait.

2016-11-14.abstract: The latest wave of new titles provides us with time-efficient high-mindedness.
2016-11-14.snippet: The latest wave of new titles provides us with time-efficient high-mindedness.
2016-11-14.lead_paragraph: You may have noticed them at the register of your local bookseller — very small, handsome paperback books of irregular trim, with plain covers in bold colors. Often stopping short at a breezy 150 pages, they make a point of being concise, and are meant to be dispatched in one or two sittings. As soon as you have finished beginning, you begin ending.
2016-11-14.headline_main: The Pleasure (and Popularity) of Really Short Books

Bannon, a nationalist media mogul, to a top White House position, even as President Obama described Mr. Trump as “pragmatic,” not ideological, and held out hope that he would rise to the challenge of the presidency.

2016-11-14.abstract: By the end of this week, all blood banks in the continental United States must begin testing donated blood for contamination with the virus.
2016-11-14.snippet: By the end of this week, all blood banks in the continental United States must begin testing donated blood for contamination with the virus.
2016-11-14.lead_paragraph: By the end of this week, all blood banks in the continental United States must begin testing donated blood for contamination with the Zika virus. Many banks are doing so already, and the early results indicate that the country has dodged a bullet — for now.
2016-11-14.headline_main: Zika Infection in U.S. Is Still Rare So Far, Blood Donations Indicate

2016-11-14.abstract: The “advice of counsel” defense is raised with increased regularity in white-collar crime cases, often coupled with its close cousin – acting in good faith.
2016-11-14.snippet: The “advice of counsel” defense is raised with increased regularity in white-collar crime cases, often coupled with its close cousin – acting in good faith.
2016-11-14.lead_paragraph: Lawyers are ubiquitous in the business world, advising at every stage, from the formation of a company through its operating stage to its eventual demise, whether by acquisition or perhaps dissolution in bankruptcy. When corporate executives get in trouble, it is common for them to claim that their lawyers said it was permissible to act that way.
2016-11-14.headline_main: Martin Shkreli May Point the Finger at His Lawyers

2016-11-14.abstract: Ms. Ifill reported for The Washington Post, The New York Times and NBC News before becoming a PBS presence and debate moderator.
2016-11-14.snippet: Ms. Ifill reported for The Washington Post, The New York Times and NBC News before becoming a PBS presence and debate moderator.
2016-11-14.lead_paragraph: Gwen Ifill, a groundbreaking journalist who covered the White House, Congress and national campaigns during three decades for The Washington Post, The New York Times, NBC and, most prominently, PBS, died on Monday at a hospice in Washington. She was 61.
2016-11-14.headline_main: Gwen Ifill, Political Reporter and Co-Anchor of ‘PBS NewsHour,’ Dies at 61

2016-11-14.abstract: In voting to leave the European Union, Britain has injected substantial uncertainty into the calculations of international business.
2016-11-14.snippet: In voting to leave the European Union, Britain has injected substantial uncertainty into the calculations of international business.
2016-11-14.lead_paragraph: SUNDERLAND, England — Among the consequences Britain unleashed in voting to abandon the European Union was making Tom Hurst’s job vastly more challenging.

2016-11-14.abstract: The president of Blackstone teamed up with a labor economist to help average Americans create secure nest eggs for their postwork lives.
2016-11-14.snippet: The president of Blackstone teamed up with a labor economist to help average Americans create secure nest eggs for their postwork lives.
2016-11-14.lead_paragraph: Early last year, Hamilton E.  James, president of the private equity giant Blackstone, received a bit of a jolt. Mr. James, at 65, was eligible to collect Social Security payments, but when he went to check his benefits, he could not believe what he saw.
2016-11-14.headline_main: A Concerned Billionaire Develops a Plan for Retirements

2016-11-14.abstract: The remains of President Lech Kaczynski, his wife and other victims are to be re-examined, but critics say the investigation is politically motivated.
2016-11-14.snippet: The remains of President Lech Kaczynski, his wife and other victims are to be re-examined, but critics say the investigation is politically motivated.
2016-11-14.lead_paragraph: WARSAW — The bodies of Poland’s former president and his wife were exhumed Monday evening as part of an investigation into an April 2010 plane crash in Russia that killed the couple — after years of speculation, backed by little evidence, that the crash was not an accident.
2016-11-14.headline_main: Poland Exhumes Ex-President’s Body in Inquiry of 2010 Plane Crash

2016-11-14.abstract: The Lions are barred from competing while the university investigates texts sent by team members that included the use of racist, misogynistic and homophobic terms.
2016-11-14.snippet: The Lions are barred from competing while the university investigates texts sent by team members that included the use of racist, misogynistic and homophobic terms.
2016-11-14.lead_paragraph: Columbia University’s wrestling team, which bills itself as the nation’s oldest intercollegiate program, has had its season suspended by the university while officials investigate text messages sent by team members that included the frequent use of racist, misogynistic and homophobic terms.
2016-11-14.headline_main: Columbia Suspends Wrestling Season Over Lewd and Racist Text Messages

2016-11-14.abstract: The new industry mixing finance and technology has no clear capital, but major international cities and lesser ones are vying to attract companies.
2016-11-14.snippet: The new industry mixing finance and technology has no clear capital, but major international cities and lesser ones are vying to attract companies.
2016-11-14.lead_paragraph: The hub of the technology industry is Silicon Valley. In finance, the world capitals have long been London and New York.
2016-11-14.headline_main: Where Finance and Technology Come Together

2016-11-14.abstract: The double-portrait will be displayed beginning Nov. 29 at the Stieglitz Art and Industry Academy in St. Petersburg.
2016-11-14.snippet: The double-portrait will be displayed beginning Nov. 29 at the Stieglitz Art and Industry Academy in St. Petersburg.
2016-11-14.lead_paragraph: On the eve of the centennial of the 1917 October Revolution, restoration experts at the Stieglitz Art and Industry Academy in St. Petersburg have uncovered a “double portrait” reflecting Russia’s diametrical history under both Imperialism and Communism: A full-size portrait of Vladimir Lenin from 1924 painted on the back side of a 1896 Imperial portrait of Czar Nicholas II. The portraits will be displayed, on opposite sides of the same canvas, beginning Nov. 29 on a stand in the Stieglitz academy’s entrance hall.
2016-11-14.headline_main: Portrait of Czar Nicholas II Discovered Beneath Portrait of Lenin

2016-11-14.abstract: Six performances, including a festive 1970 jam session, recall several aspects of the musician’s career.
2016-11-14.snippet: Six performances, including a festive 1970 jam session, recall several aspects of the musician’s career.
2016-11-14.lead_paragraph: There’s some remarkable footage of Leon Russell from late 1970, the year he released his self-titled debut solo album. Taken from an hourlong special, “Homewood,” originally broadcast on Los Angeles public television, it circulated in bootleg editions for decades before the audio surfaced on CD this year in what appears to be a sanctioned release.
2016-11-14.headline_main: Leon Russell, From Rising to Resurgent

2016-11-14.abstract: The president said Mr. Trump should reach out to voters alienated by his campaign, and declined to comment on the selection of Stephen K. Bannon as senior counselor.
2016-11-14.snippet: The president said Mr. Trump should reach out to voters alienated by his campaign, and declined to comment on the selection of Stephen K. Bannon as senior counselor.
2016-11-14.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Obama said on Monday that he had urged President-elect Donald J. Trump to reach out to minority groups, women and others who were alienated by his campaign, during the president’s first news conference since Mr. Trump won the election in a stunning upset that has imperiled Mr. Obama’s legacy.
2016-11-14.headline_main: Obama Urges Donald Trump to Send ‘Signals of Unity’ to Minority Groups and Women

2016-11-14.abstract: Democrats need to borrow his tactics.
2016-11-14.snippet: Democrats need to borrow his tactics.
2016-11-14.lead_paragraph: For more than a year, Americans were glued to their smartphones as Donald J. Trump tweeted and retweeted misogynistic, racist, anti-Semitic and xenophobic speech. It was not a strategy that any digital campaign expert would ever advise. Often, it felt more like a reality-show stunt than a real campaign.
2016-11-14.headline_main: Donald Trump Trolled Us All. We Should Learn From It.

2016-11-14.abstract: Clouds have descended over Mexico, miring the nation in a state of anguish and paralysis over what the incoming United States president has in store for it.
2016-11-14.snippet: Clouds have descended over Mexico, miring the nation in a state of anguish and paralysis over what the incoming United States president has in store for it.
2016-11-14.lead_paragraph: MEXICO CITY — Ever since the election of Donald J. Trump to the American presidency, Juan Pardinas, a Mexican academic, has been thinking back to his childhood.
2016-11-14.headline_main: After Trump’s Win, an Anxious Mexico Asks: What’s Next?

2016-11-14.abstract: “Working in Process/New Bodies” captured the collaboration between Sara Mearns, of New York City Ballet, and the choreographer Jodi Melnick.
2016-11-14.snippet: “Working in Process/New Bodies” captured the collaboration between Sara Mearns, of New York City Ballet, and the choreographer Jodi Melnick.
2016-11-14.lead_paragraph: Quite often, a star ballerina, itching to expand her repertory, hires a choreographer from outside of ballet. Quite rarely does anything good arise from such an arrangement. That track record gives the success of the collaboration between Sara Mearns and Jodi Melnick the freshness of a minor miracle.
2016-11-14.headline_main: Review: Ballet and Modern Dance Meet, and Ultimately Embrace

2016-11-14.abstract: The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau demanded documents from two firms offering “contracts for deed,” transactions aimed at lower-income buyers.

2016-11-14.lead_paragraph: BEIJING — It took all of five minutes for Wang Lei, a gruff veteran of the People’s Liberation Army, to start humming and stomping his feet.
2016-11-14.headline_main: With Odes to Military March, China Puts Nationalism Into Overdrive

2016-11-14.abstract: The $8 billion price looks fair for a company that will jump-start Samsung’s presence in the connected-car supplier market.
2016-11-14.snippet: The $8 billion price looks fair for a company that will jump-start Samsung’s presence in the connected-car supplier market.
2016-11-14.lead_paragraph: Samsung is riding a stallion instead of a unicorn into the driverless revolution. Despite no stated cost savings, the 28 percent premium the Korean electronics group agreed to pay for Harman International, a connected-car supplier, is reasonable. Companies like Google are investing heavily to invent the automotive future as General Motors and others bet on risky start-ups. This deal suggests there are safer ways to play a mega-trend in the making.
2016-11-14.headline_main: Samsung Takes Sensible Course in Bid for Harman International

2016-11-14.abstract: You know all about the cuneiform written by scribes thousands of years ago. Of course, you do. A museum staff member created a modern take on the language, in the form of cookies.
2016-11-14.snippet: You know all about the cuneiform written by scribes thousands of years ago. Of course, you do. A museum staff member created a modern take on the language, in the form of cookies.
2016-11-14.lead_paragraph: If you spend your days amid ancient clay tablets with one of the earliest forms of written language, the thought might occur to you: Wouldn’t it be fun to bake your own tablets out of gingerbread for the office holiday party?
2016-11-14.headline_main: Ah, Finally, Ancient Clay Tablets for Dessert

2016-11-14.abstract: A grandfather’s tales connect the dots of a family’s life and make sense of the past in Mr. Chabon’s latest novel.
2016-11-14.snippet: A grandfather’s tales connect the dots of a family’s life and make sense of the past in Mr. Chabon’s latest novel.
2016-11-14.lead_paragraph: Storytelling matters desperately to Michael Chabon’s characters. It’s a way to remake an unhappy reality and exert control (“Werewolves in Their Youth”), a means of grappling with personal or historical disaster (“The Amazing Adventures of Kavalier & Clay”), or, in the case of his elegiac and deeply poignant new novel, “Moonglow,” a tool for connecting the dots of a family’s life and making sense of the past.
2016-11-14.headline_main: In Michael Chabon’s ‘Moonglow,’ Deathbed Stories Illuminate an Era

See her make a crack pipe out of a light bulb! Devout fans of “Downton Abbey” will want to check it out just for the freak-show appeal.
2016-11-14.headline_main: Review: With ‘Good Behavior,’ Lady Mary Takes a Lowlife Turn

2016-11-14.abstract: Seagull, run by Johanna Fateman of the band Le Tigre, is an inclusive space that counts Brooke Shields, Eileen Myles and Tavi Gevinson as regulars.
2016-11-14.snippet: Seagull, run by Johanna Fateman of the band Le Tigre, is an inclusive space that counts Brooke Shields, Eileen Myles and Tavi Gevinson as regulars.
2016-11-14.lead_paragraph: Johanna Fateman is most famous as a musician — she was the founder, with Kathleen Hanna, of the germinal feminist dance-punk band Le Tigre — but she has always worn multiple hats. A mother, business owner and art critic, Fateman recently picked up the title of New Yorker columnist when the magazine invited her to write regularly for its “Goings On About Town” section. “The majority of my time and mental energy is definitely spent in writing,” Fateman says. “Of course, Le Tigre will always be something people want to talk about.”
2016-11-14.headline_main: A Radical Feminist Hair Salon With Serious Cool-Girl Cred

Trump has elevated the hard-right nationalist movement that Mr. Bannon has nurtured for years from the fringes of American politics to its very heart, a remarkable shift that has further intensified concern about the new administration’s direction.

2016-11-14.abstract: Here’s what you need to know to start your day.
