2016-11-14.lead_paragraph: Good morning.
2016-11-14.headline_main: Donald Trump, Julian Assange, Gwen Ifill: Your Tuesday Briefing

2016-11-14.abstract: The authorities in Wisconsin have appealed a judge’s ruling that overturned Mr. Dassey’s conviction, which was featured in the Netflix documentary.
2016-11-14.snippet: The authorities in Wisconsin have appealed a judge’s ruling that overturned Mr. Dassey’s conviction, which was featured in the Netflix documentary.
2016-11-14.lead_paragraph: Brendan Dassey, one of two Wisconsin men who were found guilty in 2007 in the sexual assault and killing of a photographer and who were featured in the Netflix documentary “Making a Murderer,” should be freed from prison while the state appeals a ruling overturning his conviction, a federal judge ruled on Monday.
2016-11-14.headline_main: Brendan Dassey of ‘Making a Murderer’ Is to Be Freed While State Appeals Ruling

2016-11-14.abstract: Untreated sewage fuels algal blooms in the world’s largest freshwater lake, home to scores of unique plant and animal species.
2016-11-14.snippet: Untreated sewage fuels algal blooms in the world’s largest freshwater lake, home to scores of unique plant and animal species.
2016-11-14.lead_paragraph: LAKE BAIKAL, Russia — Yury Azhichakov set out early by bike for Senogda Bay, his favorite beach, on the northwestern shore of Lake Baikal in Siberia. The world’s oldest, deepest and most voluminous lake, Baikal holds 20 percent of the planet’s unfrozen freshwater. It is often described as the world’s cleanest lake.
2016-11-14.headline_main: Vast and Pristine, Russia’s Lake Baikal Is Invaded by Harmful Algae

2016-11-14.abstract: A failure to secure debt relief before 2017 could spell a new round of political and economic instability in the country, and Europe as a whole.
2016-11-14.snippet: A failure to secure debt relief before 2017 could spell a new round of political and economic instability in the country, and Europe as a whole.
2016-11-14.lead_paragraph: PARIS — Before last week, Greece expected that it might benefit from what was supposed to be a triumphal valedictory lap by President Obama as he lands in Athens on Tuesday to kick off his final world tour.
2016-11-14.headline_main: Greece, Seeking Dose of Stability, Is Rattled by Trump’s Win

2016-11-14.abstract: The mortgage giants’ government conservatorship irks investors, who assert the arrangement deprives them of dividends.
2016-11-14.snippet: The mortgage giants’ government conservatorship irks investors, who assert the arrangement deprives them of dividends.
2016-11-14.lead_paragraph: The presidential campaign that just ended was notable for a lack of debate about housing — in particular the uneven state of the United States mortgage market nine years since the start of the financial crisis.
2016-11-14.headline_main: Fannie and Freddie’s Status Continues to Provoke Criticisms

2016-11-14.abstract: After years adapting to the Affordable Care Act, health insurers now face uncertainty about what will come in the Trump administration.
2016-11-14.snippet: After years adapting to the Affordable Care Act, health insurers now face uncertainty about what will come in the Trump administration.
2016-11-14.lead_paragraph: The health care industry was unprepared for the presidential victory of Donald J. Trump, and executives at insurance companies and hospital systems are now uncertain what their business is going to look like in the years ahead. A Trump administration, coupled with a Republican Congress, is likely to lead to a reversal of many of the policies put into place by President Obama, and could mean a repeal of his signature health care law.
2016-11-14.headline_main: Health Care Issues Loom in Politics, Payments and Quality

2016-11-14.abstract: He stars in that conspiracy thriller, beginning Tuesday on the USA Network. It is adapted from the 2007 Mark Wahlberg movie and the Stephen Hunter novel “Point of Impact.”
2016-11-14.snippet: He stars in that conspiracy thriller, beginning Tuesday on the USA Network. It is adapted from the 2007 Mark Wahlberg movie and the Stephen Hunter novel “Point of Impact.”
2016-11-14.lead_paragraph: Ryan Phillippe was so committed to his new show, “Shooter,” that he was willing to take a flying leap — off a fourth-floor balcony. The actor performed his own stunts in this conspiracy thriller, including a terrifying plunge, in the premiere, from an apartment down onto a car.
2016-11-14.headline_main: Ryan Phillippe Talks Guns, Stunts and ‘Shooter’

2016-11-14.abstract: As the financial world faces dismal returns and criticism over high fees, managers are turning to machines to make decisions once left to humans.
2016-11-14.snippet: As the financial world faces dismal returns and criticism over high fees, managers are turning to machines to make decisions once left to humans.
2016-11-14.lead_paragraph: Every five minutes a satellite captures images of China’s biggest cities from space. Thousands of miles away in California, a computer looks at the shadows of the buildings in the images and draws a conclusion: China’s real estate boom is slowing.
2016-11-14.headline_main: The Next Generation of Hedge Fund Stars: Data-Crunching Computers

2016-11-14.abstract: As shown in a study of mountain river systems out West, the bottom, where most of the water is found, is crucial in sustaining a diversity of life.
2016-11-14.snippet: As shown in a study of mountain river systems out West, the bottom, where most of the water is found, is crucial in sustaining a diversity of life.
2016-11-14.lead_paragraph: MISSOULA, Mont. — They are beautiful, glistening icons of the West, filled with life and history. But there is far more to mountain rivers, scientists are learning, than the water churning between their banks.
2016-11-14.headline_main: An Ecosystem’s Lifeblood, Flowing Through Gravel

2016-11-14.abstract: The start-up world has moved away from easily definable consumer or corporate products and services, and Spark Capital has followed.
2016-11-14.snippet: The start-up world has moved away from easily definable consumer or corporate products and services, and Spark Capital has followed.
2016-11-14.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Betting on an automated driving start-up in 2015 may not have been the most intuitive gamble at a time when Google and Uber had already declared that self-driving vehicles were among their top research priorities.
2016-11-14.headline_main: Venture Capital Firm Navigates Uncharted Course to Success

2016-11-14.abstract: Ms. Mattila, 56, used to perform the title part in Janacek’s “Jenufa.” Now she portrays that character’s stepmother. “I love both roles,” she said.
2016-11-14.snippet: Ms. Mattila, 56, used to perform the title part in Janacek’s “Jenufa.” Now she portrays that character’s stepmother. “I love both roles,” she said.
2016-11-14.lead_paragraph: Opera does not give its singers many chances to grow up. Unlike stage or film actresses, star sopranos don’t necessarily move from playing girls, to women, to mothers, to grandmothers over the course of a career — and certainly not within a single work.
2016-11-14.headline_main: Same Opera, Different Role: Karita Mattila Returns to the Met

2016-11-14.abstract: Other financial regulators are expected to follow suit, giving the Trump administration an opening to shift the government’s approach to policing the industry.
2016-11-14.snippet: Other financial regulators are expected to follow suit, giving the Trump administration an opening to shift the government’s approach to policing the industry.
2016-11-14.lead_paragraph: Wall Street regulators began an exodus from Washington on Monday as Mary Jo White, the chairwoman of the Securities and Exchange Commission, announced plans to leave the agency.
2016-11-14.headline_main: Mary Jo White to Step Down as S.E.C. Chief

2016-11-14.abstract: Congress will try to finish the last of its business, including a spending bill to keep the government open, before the Trump administration comes in.
2016-11-14.snippet: Congress will try to finish the last of its business, including a spending bill to keep the government open, before the Trump administration comes in.
2016-11-14.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Congress returns this week to finish the last of its business before a new year and era begin in Washington. Ebullient Republicans are eager to put some remaining legislation behind them and to try to fund the government through the rest of the year. Here are some areas to watch.
2016-11-14.headline_main: Iran, Spending, Defense: Areas to Watch as Congress Reconvenes

2016-11-14.abstract: With girlfriends acting as ironic courtside commentators, Andy Bragen’s play examines a highly charged pastime for two men entering middle age.
2016-11-14.snippet: With girlfriends acting as ironic courtside commentators, Andy Bragen’s play examines a highly charged pastime for two men entering middle age.
2016-11-14.lead_paragraph: At a pivotal moment of a heated tennis match between Brian and Russ, obsessive rivals whose entire season of amateur competition has been building toward this day, an obscenity-spiked command erupts from Brian’s mouth. “Don’t you _______ say a word,” he barks, all aggression and rage. Instantly and irreparably, the men’s relationship implodes.
2016-11-14.headline_main: Review: A Tennis Rivalry That Just Might Sabotage a Friendship

2016-11-14.abstract: We asked readers — without any context — to caption a photo that ran in The New York Times. Here’s how they responded.
2016-11-14.snippet: We asked readers — without any context — to caption a photo that ran in The New York Times. Here’s how they responded.
2016-11-14.lead_paragraph: Times Insider shares insights into how we work at The New York Times. Occasionally we have some fun.
2016-11-14.headline_main: Times Insider Photo Challenge: Caption This!

2016-11-14.abstract: The Russian Defense Ministry blamed a technical failure for the crash of the jet, a MIG-29.
2016-11-14.snippet: The Russian Defense Ministry blamed a technical failure for the crash of the jet, a MIG-29.
2016-11-14.lead_paragraph: MOSCOW — A Russian fighter jet crashed off the Syrian coast on Monday while trying to land on an aging aircraft carrier in the Mediterranean, Russian military officials said.
2016-11-14.headline_main: Russian Jet Crashes Off Syria While Trying to Land on Carrier Kuznetsov

2016-11-14.abstract: Martin Lipton, 85, a founder of Wachtell Lipton Rosen & Katz, discusses his work to promote alternatives to what he calls “short-termism.”
2016-11-14.snippet: Martin Lipton, 85, a founder of Wachtell Lipton Rosen & Katz, discusses his work to promote alternatives to what he calls “short-termism.”
2016-11-14.lead_paragraph: Martin Lipton, a founding partner of the New York law firm Wachtell Lipton Rosen & Katz, specializes in advising major corporations on mergers and acquisitions. Mr. Lipton, 85, has been instrumental in shaping corporate deal making for decades; he is particularly well known for his efforts to bolster management defenses against hostile takeovers.
2016-11-14.headline_main: A Merger Lawyer Sounds Off on the Short-Term Quest for Profits

2016-11-14.abstract: The British designer has crafted a unique collection by sourcing vintage fabrics.
2016-11-14.snippet: The British designer has crafted a unique collection by sourcing vintage fabrics.
2016-11-14.lead_paragraph: The British designer has crafted a unique collection by sourcing vintage fabrics.
2016-11-14.headline_main: John Alexander Skelton’s Fall Collection

2016-11-14.abstract: John Alexander Skelton sources vintage materials from around England and then hand-dyes them before sewing them into men’s garments.
2016-11-14.snippet: John Alexander Skelton sources vintage materials from around England and then hand-dyes them before sewing them into men’s garments.
2016-11-14.lead_paragraph: When it comes to finding inspiration, the designer John Alexander Skelton is more likely to turn to museums and archives than the internet. After all, he got the idea for his MA collection at Central Saint Martins — which earned him the school’s prestigious L’Oreal Prize earlier this year — from the archives of Mass Observation, an extensive anthropological survey in the mid-20th century. “The British Library is an amazing resource,” Skelton says. “I love research because you enter different worlds and it’s so enriching. It’s interesting how intertwined textiles has been with politics and social history.”
2016-11-14.headline_main: Person to Know: The Designer Making One-of-a-Kind Pieces From Sustainable Fabrics

2016-11-14.abstract: A look at the words of Stephen K. Bannon, the new chief White House strategist to President-elect Donald J. Trump.
2016-11-14.snippet: A look at the words of Stephen K. Bannon, the new chief White House strategist to President-elect Donald J. Trump.
2016-11-14.lead_paragraph: The appointment of Stephen K. Bannon as chief White House strategist for President-elect Donald J. Trump has been condemned by civil rights groups, Democrats and some Republicans, because of Mr. Bannon’s record as chairman of Breitbart News, the hard-right news and opinion site.
2016-11-14.headline_main: Stephen Bannon and Breitbart News, in Their Words

2016-11-14.abstract: Prime Minister Modi has banned 500- and 1,000-rupee bills, or about 86 percent of India’s currency, in an effort to combat corruption and tax avoidance.
2016-11-14.snippet: Prime Minister Modi has banned 500- and 1,000-rupee bills, or about 86 percent of India’s currency, in an effort to combat corruption and tax avoidance.
2016-11-14.lead_paragraph: MUMBAI, India — In one of the most audacious experiments in India’s modern history, Prime Minister Narendra Modi banned the two largest bills — of 500 rupees, or about $7.50, and 1,000 rupees — which account for about 86 percent of the currency in a country where 78 percent of financial transactions are done in cash.
2016-11-14.headline_main: How Narendra Modi of India Plans to Wipe Out ‘Black Money’

2016-11-14.abstract: The leaders discussed trade and combating terrorism, with the Russian president saying he hoped for “noninterference in the other’s internal affairs.”
2016-11-14.snippet: The leaders discussed trade and combating terrorism, with the Russian president saying he hoped for “noninterference in the other’s internal affairs.”
2016-11-14.lead_paragraph: MOSCOW — President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia and President-elect Donald J. Trump spoke by telephone for the first time on Monday, agreeing to review what both consider the poor state of relations between the two countries, according to a statement from the Kremlin.
2016-11-14.headline_main: Putin and Trump Talk on Phone and Agree to Improve Ties, Kremlin Says

2016-11-14.abstract: Donald Trump make a controversial appointment; Hillary Clinton blames the F.B.I. director for her loss.
2016-11-14.snippet: Donald Trump make a controversial appointment; Hillary Clinton blames the F.B.I. director for her loss.
2016-11-14.lead_paragraph: To the Editor:
2016-11-14.headline_main: Shock Waves a Week After the Vote

2016-11-14.abstract: President-elect Trump has indicated he will look for a quick exit from America’s commitment to reduce greenhouse gas emissions.
2016-11-14.snippet: President-elect Trump has indicated he will look for a quick exit from America’s commitment to reduce greenhouse gas emissions.
2016-11-14.lead_paragraph: Of all the climate policies the Trump administration has promised to undo, auto emissions standards could be the most consequential.
2016-11-14.headline_main: Climate Protection Advocates Fear a Rollback of Emissions Standards

2016-11-14.abstract: A jury convicted Justin Ross Harris on eight counts, including malice murder, more than two years after his 22-month-old son died in a hot car.
2016-11-14.snippet: A jury convicted Justin Ross Harris on eight counts, including malice murder, more than two years after his 22-month-old son died in a hot car.
2016-11-14.lead_paragraph: ATLANTA — With local television programming interrupted and a camera trained on the defendant’s emotionless face, an Atlanta-area father was convicted of murder on Monday for causing the death of his young son by deliberately leaving him in a hot car more than two years ago.
2016-11-14.headline_main: Georgia Father Is Convicted of Murder in Toddler’s Death in Hot Car

2016-11-14.abstract: Here’s what you need to know at the end of the day.
2016-11-14.snippet: Here’s what you need to know at the end of the day.
2016-11-14.lead_paragraph: (Want to get this briefing by email? Here’s the sign-up.)
2016-11-14.headline_main: Trump, Obama, Gwen Ifill: Your Monday Evening Briefing

2016-11-14.abstract: Trump listened to the media’s drumbeat of problems without remedies and turned it into a winning narrative of doom that only he could fix.
2016-11-14.snippet: Trump listened to the media’s drumbeat of problems without remedies and turned it into a winning narrative of doom that only he could fix.
2016-11-14.lead_paragraph: The election of Donald J. Trump has led to considerable soul searching in the news business, as journalists confront the role we played in his triumph. Much has been written about the billions of dollars of free media coverage Trump received, journalists’ lapses in challenging his outrageous falsehoods, and our clumsy grappling with how to treat his unconventional candidacy.
2016-11-14.headline_main: When Reportage Turns to Cynicism

2016-11-14.abstract: General Manager Sandy Alderson has made clear that the Mets remain serious about re-signing Cespedes, who becomes one of baseball’s most attractive free agents.
2016-11-14.snippet: General Manager Sandy Alderson has made clear that the Mets remain serious about re-signing Cespedes, who becomes one of baseball’s most attractive free agents.
2016-11-14.lead_paragraph: Second baseman Neil Walker informed the Mets just before a 5 p.m. deadline on Monday that he would accept a $17.2 million qualifying offer for 2017, a decision that keeps one of the team’s two most important free agents in Queens.
2016-11-14.headline_main: Neil Walker Accepts Mets’ Qualifying Offer; Yoenis Cespedes Rejects It

2016-11-15.abstract: An ABC series based on Marvel’s characters will debut next year on Imax screens, before a re-edited version heads to TV.
2016-11-15.snippet: An ABC series based on Marvel’s characters will debut next year on Imax screens, before a re-edited version heads to TV.
2016-11-15.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES — One of Marvel Entertainment’s most sprawling superhero mythologies, the Inhumans, is headed to the small screen in a major way.
2016-11-15.headline_main: Marvel’s ‘Inhumans’ TV Series Will Arrive via Imax Theaters

2016-11-15.abstract: Transportation officials said construction delays at new stations on the Upper East Side could postpone the long-awaited opening in December of the new line.
2016-11-15.snippet: Transportation officials said construction delays at new stations on the Upper East Side could postpone the long-awaited opening in December of the new line.
2016-11-15.lead_paragraph: The Metropolitan Transportation Authority’s race to open the Second Avenue subway by the end of the year will require an “unprecedented” push by workers, officials said on Monday.
2016-11-15.headline_main: ‘Unprecedented’ Work Required to Open 2nd Avenue Subway by Year’s End, Officials Say

2016-11-15.abstract: By keeping only the most popular parts, Donald Trump would leave patients worse off than they were before the law was passed.
2016-11-15.snippet: By keeping only the most popular parts, Donald Trump would leave patients worse off than they were before the law was passed.
2016-11-15.lead_paragraph: Donald J. Trump made headlines on Friday by saying he would like to keep two components of the Affordable Care Act: allowing young people to stay on their parents’ insurance until age 26, and continuing the ban on the exclusion of pre-existing conditions by insurers.
2016-11-15.headline_main: What Could Be Worse Than Repealing All of Obamacare?

2016-11-15.abstract: Sovereign wealth funds and hedge funds, as well as retirees’ accounts, restructure portfolios to profit from what they expect will be a free-spending administration.
2016-11-15.snippet: Sovereign wealth funds and hedge funds, as well as retirees’ accounts, restructure portfolios to profit from what they expect will be a free-spending administration.
2016-11-15.lead_paragraph: Global investors have rendered their verdict on Donald J. Trump as president: Sell government bonds and pile into stocks that will benefit the most from a resurgent United States economy.
2016-11-15.headline_main: Ahead of Trump Presidency, Global Investors Sell Bonds and Grab Stocks

2016-11-15.abstract: Mr. Farage was the first foreign politician to meet with President-elect Donald J. Trump, and on Monday, a photograph of the two inside Trump Tower dominated front pages in Britain.
2016-11-15.snippet: Mr. Farage was the first foreign politician to meet with President-elect Donald J. Trump, and on Monday, a photograph of the two inside Trump Tower dominated front pages in Britain.
2016-11-15.lead_paragraph: LONDON — Britain has long been anxious about its “special relationship” with the United States, but after some choice remarks about Donald J. Trump by members of the governing Conservative Party during the presidential campaign, the relationship needs a bit of nurturing. And who better to tend to that, in his own mind at least, than Nigel Farage, the beer-loving commodities-trader-turned-populist-leader of the U.K. Independence Party.
2016-11-15.headline_main: U.K.’s Bridge to Trump? Nigel Farage, Who Pushed ‘Brexit,’ Posits Himself

2016-11-15.abstract: Adena T. Friedman, whose promotion comes at a time of consolidation of market operators, will replace Robert Greifeld on Jan. 1.
2016-11-15.snippet: Adena T. Friedman, whose promotion comes at a time of consolidation of market operators, will replace Robert Greifeld on Jan. 1.
2016-11-15.lead_paragraph: Nasdaq on Monday named Adena T. Friedman its new chief executive, in the first changeover at the stock market operator in nearly 14 years.
2016-11-15.headline_main: Nasdaq Names a New Chief Executive: Adena Friedman

2016-11-15.abstract: A report signed by scholars and former officials asked the president-elect to use the deal, which he has called a disaster, to further ease tensions with Iran.
2016-11-15.snippet: A report signed by scholars and former officials asked the president-elect to use the deal, which he has called a disaster, to further ease tensions with Iran.
2016-11-15.lead_paragraph: Seventy-six national security experts urged President-elect Donald J. Trump on Monday to reverse his hostility to the nuclear agreement signed with Iran last year and to use it as a tool to ease other tensions with the country.
2016-11-15.headline_main: 76 Experts Urge Donald Trump to Keep Iran Deal

2016-11-15.abstract: Rightist politicians see Mr. Trump’s victory as a chance to reverse course on contentious policies like building new settlements and accords with the Palestinians.
2016-11-15.snippet: Rightist politicians see Mr. Trump’s victory as a chance to reverse course on contentious policies like building new settlements and accords with the Palestinians.
2016-11-15.lead_paragraph: JERUSALEM — Emboldened by the Republican sweep of last week’s American elections, right-wing members of the Israeli government have called anew for the abandonment of a two-state solution to the conflict with the Palestinians.
2016-11-15.headline_main: Israel’s Right, Cheering Donald Trump’s Win, Renews Calls to Abandon 2-State Solution

2016-11-15.abstract: With Dallas’s Dirk Nowitzki on the sideline with an injury, Porzingis scored 24 points and grabbed 11 rebounds as the Knicks dispatched the Mavericks.
2016-11-15.snippet: With Dallas’s Dirk Nowitzki on the sideline with an injury, Porzingis scored 24 points and grabbed 11 rebounds as the Knicks dispatched the Mavericks.
2016-11-15.lead_paragraph: In the off-season, as the budding star Kristaps Porzingis prepared for his second season with the Knicks, his new coach, Jeff Hornacek, called his Dallas Mavericks counterpart. He wanted to arrange a meeting between Porzingis and Dirk Nowitzki.
2016-11-15.headline_main: With His Idol Looking On, Kristaps Porzingis Shines in a Knicks Win

2016-11-15.abstract: Engineers say the sheer weight of so-called love locks — padlocks placed on the bridge by lovers to signify their bond — could damage the structure.
2016-11-15.snippet: Engineers say the sheer weight of so-called love locks — padlocks placed on the bridge by lovers to signify their bond — could damage the structure.
2016-11-15.lead_paragraph: To some they are emblems of delight, reminders in steel of unbreakable connections. To others they are barnacles encrusting a beloved landmark. They are the so-called love locks, padlocks placed on the Brooklyn Bridge by lovers to signify their bond.
2016-11-15.headline_main: Dear John: Brooklyn Bridge Discourages Token of Love, With a Smile

2016-11-15.abstract: Strong ratings for Sunday’s Patriots-Seahawks and Cowboys-Steelers games provide hope in an N.F.L. season that has seen prime-time viewership plummet.
2016-11-15.snippet: Strong ratings for Sunday’s Patriots-Seahawks and Cowboys-Steelers games provide hope in an N.F.L. season that has seen prime-time viewership plummet.
2016-11-15.lead_paragraph: NBC Sports will take over the “Thursday Night Football” franchise this week at a suddenly promising point in an N.F.L. season that has seen viewership plummet by double-digit percentages in prime-time games.
2016-11-15.headline_main: NBC Takes Over Thursday Night Football Amid Promising Signs in TV Ratings

2016-11-15.abstract: After criticism that they might have allowed fake news to influence the 2016 election, the companies are banning such sites from using their advertising services.
2016-11-15.snippet: After criticism that they might have allowed fake news to influence the 2016 election, the companies are banning such sites from using their advertising services.
2016-11-15.lead_paragraph: Over the last week, two of the world’s biggest internet companies have faced mounting criticism over how fake news on their sites may have influenced the presidential election’s outcome.
2016-11-15.headline_main: Google and Facebook Take Aim at Fake News Sites

2016-11-15.abstract: A report expanded on findings by experts who have noted an alarming rise in some types of hate crimes tied to the vitriol of the presidential race and recent terrorist attacks.
2016-11-15.snippet: A report expanded on findings by experts who have noted an alarming rise in some types of hate crimes tied to the vitriol of the presidential race and recent terrorist attacks.
2016-11-15.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The F.B.I. reported Monday that attacks against American Muslims surged last year, driving an overall increase in hate crime against all groups.
2016-11-15.headline_main: U.S. Hate Crimes Surge 6%, Fueled by Attacks on Muslims

2016-11-15.abstract: As a black woman in journalism, she had spent her entire career proving people wrong.
2016-11-15.snippet: As a black woman in journalism, she had spent her entire career proving people wrong.
2016-11-15.lead_paragraph: Those of us who worked even briefly with the journalist Gwen Ifill, who died on Monday at the age of 61, can attest to her deeply held sense of fairness, the preternatural grace she showed under pressure and the way she kept her composure in the face of both personal and professional slights that would have left many of us breathing fire and brimstone.
2016-11-15.headline_main: The Grace of Gwen Ifill

2016-11-15.abstract: After marathon negotiations, the Colombian government and the FARC struck a new deal that serves as a road map to officially end five decades of war.
2016-11-15.snippet: After marathon negotiations, the Colombian government and the FARC struck a new deal that serves as a road map to officially end five decades of war.
2016-11-15.lead_paragraph: Six weeks after Colombian voters narrowly rejected a peace agreement between the government and the country’s largest guerrilla group in a plebiscite vote, President Juan Manuel Santos over the weekend unveiled a revised accord that is a testament to what can be achieved through dialogue and compromise, even in a deeply polarized society.
2016-11-15.headline_main: Colombia’s Revised Peace Accord

2016-11-15.abstract: Mayor Bill de Blasio received a significant boost with the endorsements of the Uniformed Sanitationmen’s Association and the Retail, Wholesale and Department Store Union. Neither union initially backed him in 2013.
2016-11-15.snippet: Mayor Bill de Blasio received a significant boost with the endorsements of the Uniformed Sanitationmen’s Association and the Retail, Wholesale and Department Store Union. Neither union initially backed him in 2013.
2016-11-15.lead_paragraph: In recent weeks, Mayor Bill de Blasio, a Democrat, has shifted into re-election mode, holding campaign events and fund-raisers, using separate Twitter accounts for political talk and mayoral messages.
2016-11-15.headline_main: Mayor de Blasio, Seeking Re-election, Secures Backing of 2 Unions

2016-11-15.abstract: Quotation of the day for Tuesday, November 15, 2016.
2016-11-15.snippet: Quotation of the day for Tuesday, November 15, 2016.
2016-11-15.lead_paragraph: “I’m personally offended that you think I would manage a campaign where that would be one of the going philosophies.”
2016-11-15.headline_main: Quotation of the Day

2016-11-15.abstract: Wood, an emerging star, and Altidore, a veteran, stood out for their complementary efforts in the Americans’ loss to Mexico in a World Cup qualifier on Friday.
2016-11-15.snippet: Wood, an emerging star, and Altidore, a veteran, stood out for their complementary efforts in the Americans’ loss to Mexico in a World Cup qualifier on Friday.
2016-11-15.lead_paragraph: SAN JOSE, Costa Rica — With about 15 minutes remaining in the United States’ game against Mexico on Friday night, Jozy Altidore settled under a looping pass at the top of the penalty area and, without even needing to look, chested the ball right into the path of Bobby Wood, who turned and whipped a blistering shot that the Mexican goalkeeper beat away.
2016-11-15.headline_main: Bobby Wood and Jozy Altidore Step Forward as U.S. Team Is Set Back

2016-11-15.abstract: By placing the number that high, the president-elect raised questions about which immigrants he planned to target and how he could achieve removals at that scale.
2016-11-15.snippet: By placing the number that high, the president-elect raised questions about which immigrants he planned to target and how he could achieve removals at that scale.
2016-11-15.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President-elect Donald J. Trump’s promise to deport two million to three million immigrants who have committed crimes suggested that he would dramatically step up removals of both people in the United States illegally and those with legal status. If carried out, the plan potentially would require raids by a vastly larger federal immigration force to hunt down these immigrants and send them out of the country.
2016-11-15.headline_main: What Donald Trump’s Vow to Deport Up to 3 Million Immigrants Would Mean

2016-11-15.abstract: The conflicts are in many ways as complex as his business empire, adding a heightened degree of difficulty for Mr. Trump to separate his official duties from his private business affairs.
2016-11-15.snippet: The conflicts are in many ways as complex as his business empire, adding a heightened degree of difficulty for Mr. Trump to separate his official duties from his private business affairs.
2016-11-15.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Just a few blocks down Pennsylvania Avenue from the White House sits the Trump International Hotel, one of the newest luxury additions to President-elect Donald J. Trump’s real estate empire, and perhaps the most visible symbol of the ethical quandary he now confronts.

2016-11-15.lead_paragraph: Billy Miller, a rock ’n’ roll archivist and collector whose record label, Norton, gave new life to forgotten rockabilly artists and garage bands of yesteryear, died on Sunday at his home in Brooklyn. He was 62.

She was 82.

Fulmer wrapped three fingers around the seams and started making his way up the Mets’ farm system, but it was not the changeup carrying him.

2016-11-15.snippet: Dave Malloy’s pop opera is both the most innovative and the best new musical to open on Broadway since the hit musical about one founding father.
2016-11-15.lead_paragraph: The Imperial Theater, where the rapturous musical “Natasha, Pierre & the Great Comet of 1812” blazed opened on Monday night, has never looked more imperial — or felt more intimate. Who would have guessed that Dave Malloy’s gorgeous pop opera, adapted from a slice of Tolstoy’s “War and Peace,” would land on Broadway with all its signal virtues intact, and in some ways heightened?

2016-11-15.abstract: Keeping the pre-existing conditions piece while removing others might seem like a political win for Donald Trump, but it would result in a broken system.
2016-11-15.snippet: Keeping the pre-existing conditions piece while removing others might seem like a political win for Donald Trump, but it would result in a broken system.
2016-11-15.lead_paragraph: Before Obamacare, it could be hard to buy your own insurance if you’d already had a health problem like cancer. An insurance company might have decided not to sell any insurance to someone like you. It might have agreed to cover you, but not cover cancer care. Or it might have offered you a comprehensive policy, but at some incredibly high price that you could never have paid.
2016-11-15.headline_main: Why Keeping Only the Popular Parts of Obamacare Won’t Work

2016-11-15.abstract: There are two kinds of issues: those worthy of passionate, ideological debate, and those that must unite everyone who believes in democratic values.
2016-11-15.snippet: There are two kinds of issues: those worthy of passionate, ideological debate, and those that must unite everyone who believes in democratic values.
2016-11-15.lead_paragraph: The most fragile part of the country right now is our democratic values. Yes, we face other serious problems — the physical condition of our planet, above all. But the fate of those other problems will be decided in the months and years to come. The condition of our democracy is acute.
2016-11-15.headline_main: Protect Democracy First

Trump’s supporters were probably heartened in September, when, according to an article shared nearly a million times on Facebook, the candidate received an endorsement from Pope Francis. 2016-11-15.snippet: The Museum of Modern Art has enlisted scholars and artists to take a deeper look at Sander’s ambitious effort to catalog the German people.
2016-11-15.lead_paragraph: When August Sander conceived of the structure of his ambitious portrait series, “People of the Twentieth Century,” his goal was to document the German people in a way that rejected the era’s social divisions. Starting in the mid-1920s and through the rise of Nazism, he became keenly aware that the notion of cataloging a people sometimes took on different meanings.

2016-11-15.abstract: Highway deaths have surged in the last two years, and experts put much of the blame on in-car use of smartphones and dashboard apps.
2016-11-15.snippet: Highway deaths have surged in the last two years, and experts put much of the blame on in-car use of smartphones and dashboard apps.
2016-11-15.lead_paragraph: The messaging app Snapchat allows motorists to post photos that record the speed of the vehicle. The navigation app Waze rewards drivers with points when they report traffic jams and accidents. Even the game Pokémon Go has drivers searching for virtual creatures on the nation’s highways.
2016-11-15.headline_main: Biggest Spike in Traffic Deaths in 50 Years? Blame Apps

2016-11-15.abstract: The compulsion to engage the Charleston area’s complex history as a slave-trading center was, for the writer, a visceral thing, akin to the urge to revisit a crime scene.
2016-11-15.snippet: The compulsion to engage the Charleston area’s complex history as a slave-trading center was, for the writer, a visceral thing, akin to the urge to revisit a crime scene.
2016-11-15.lead_paragraph: In the spring of 1862, cloaked in the predawn darkness of Charleston Harbor, 23-year-old Robert Smalls stood aboard the C.S.S. Planter, a Confederate transfer and gunboat, and plotted his escape.
2016-11-15.headline_main: In Charleston, Coming to Terms With the Past

2016-11-15.abstract: Investors have restructured their portfolios, anticipating a free-spending administration.
2016-11-15.snippet: Investors have restructured their portfolios, anticipating a free-spending administration.

2016-11-15.abstract: The Hawaiian demigod is extra large in Disney’s new animated film. His creators explain their departure from previous depictions.
2016-11-15.snippet: The Hawaiian demigod is extra large in Disney’s new animated film. His creators explain their departure from previous depictions.
2016-11-15.lead_paragraph: Nobody’s saying Maui, that most rascally of Polynesian demigods, isn’t strong. He once beat the Sun into submission with a jawbone and yanked the Hawaiian Islands out from the bottom of the ocean. So yes, Maui’s strong.
2016-11-15.headline_main: How (and Why) Maui Got So Big in ‘Moana’

2016-11-15.abstract: Even without a wall, his border-bashing could backfire on the United States.
2016-11-15.snippet: Even without a wall, his border-bashing could backfire on the United States.
2016-11-15.lead_paragraph: MEXICO CITY — On Nov. 8, this mountain capital was soaked by a ferocious off-season thunderstorm, the type of tempest that can lead to jokes about the Aztec rain god Tlaloc being angry. At the same time, over the Rio Grande, a political storm raged worthy of the deity’s fury: The United States elected a president who promised to build a border wall and make Mexico pay for it, deport millions of immigrants and rewrite or rip up a trade deal that Mexico depends on for almost a third of its income. Within hours, an economic storm also seemed to be brewing, with the peso losing value at the fastest rate since the “tequila crisis” of 1994.
2016-11-15.headline_main: Mexico Awaits Trump’s Next Move

So Booker would rub the sleep from his eyes and then go about the unpleasant business of becoming a better basketball player.
2016-11-15.headline_main: Suns’ Devin Booker Has a Knowledgeable Workout Guru: His Father

2016-11-15.abstract: A retrospective in Doha traces the Iraqi artist Dia al-Azzawi’s semi-abstract visions.
2016-11-15.snippet: A retrospective in Doha traces the Iraqi artist Dia al-Azzawi’s semi-abstract visions.
2016-11-15.lead_paragraph: LONDON — Dia al-Azzawi was working at the Iraqi Antiquities Department in Baghdad in the early 1970s when he was assigned to install a new museum building in the northern city of Mosul. The artist and museum administrator spent a year and a half there, scrupulously overseeing the display of antiquities from the nearby archaeological sites of Hatra, Nimrud and Nineveh.

2016-11-15.abstract: Unfulfilled promises, wiretapping and a disregard for Europe have disgruntled Germans.
2016-11-15.snippet: Unfulfilled promises, wiretapping and a disregard for Europe have disgruntled Germans.
2016-11-15.lead_paragraph: BERLIN — When Barack Obama visited here as a senator in 2008, he was greeted by a crowd of 200,000 as a man in the image of John F. Kennedy, who in 1963 assured Berliners  that he was one of them. After eight years of George W. Bush, Mr. Obama seemed to promise not just a course correction, but a new enlightened era in American global leadership. The decision to award him the Nobel Peace Prize at the start of his presidency reflects the Continent’s initial high hopes that he would prove a more “European” president.
2016-11-15.headline_main: How Germany Soured on Obama

2016-11-15.abstract: The uncertain start to what is normally a rapid and meticulously planned transfer of power could have big implications for the Trump administration.
2016-11-15.snippet: The uncertain start to what is normally a rapid and meticulously planned transfer of power could have big implications for the Trump administration.
2016-11-15.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President-elect Donald J. Trump’s transition was in disarray on Tuesday, marked by firings, infighting and revelations that American allies were blindly dialing in to Trump Tower to try to reach the soon-to-be-leader of the free world.
2016-11-15.headline_main: Firings and Discord Put Trump Transition Team in a State of Disarray

Trump’s secretary of state, on Tuesday defended his lucrative 15 years in the private sector as a credential for the job.

2016-11-15.lead_paragraph: The harvest had just begun when agents from the Immigration and Naturalization Service stormed across the onion fields of Vidalia, Ga., in 1998, sweeping up 21 immigrants who were trudging behind tractors without legal authorization to work in the United States, pulling onions out of the ground for 75 cents per 50-pound bag.

2016-11-15.abstract: From the archives of The International Herald Tribune: The Mexican general Francisco Gonzales refused to free three Americans suspected of spying, in November 1916.
2016-11-15.snippet: From the archives of The International Herald Tribune: The Mexican general Francisco Gonzales refused to free three Americans suspected of spying, in November 1916.

The Carranzista leader persists in his refusal in spite of direct demands made by the United States Government.
2016-11-15.headline_main: 1916: Mexican General Refuses to Free U.S. “Spies”

2016-11-15.abstract: For decades, young reporters and news assistants at The Times have begun their careers on the Neediest Cases beat.
2016-11-15.snippet: For decades, young reporters and news assistants at The Times have begun their careers on the Neediest Cases beat.
2016-11-15.lead_paragraph: Nearly a quarter-century ago, as a junior reporter in our newsroom, I received one of the most significant assignments of my career: writing stories about the many people helped by The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund.
2016-11-15.headline_main: A Reporter’s Lesson: Giving a Voice to the Ignored

2016-11-15.abstract: Gregory Manson, 43, knows the importance of having a roof over his head after bouncing around shelters and transitional living facilities in the Bronx, Manhattan and Brooklyn.
2016-11-15.snippet: Gregory Manson, 43, knows the importance of having a roof over his head after bouncing around shelters and transitional living facilities in the Bronx, Manhattan and Brooklyn.
2016-11-15.lead_paragraph: Gregory Manson has moved so many times that he struggles to remember all of the dates, the neighborhoods and the family members he has stayed with. There was his stepmother in Canarsie, Brooklyn, a sister in Jamaica, Queens, and his grandmother’s apartment in the Farragut Houses in Brooklyn. It is all blended and blurred.
2016-11-15.headline_main: After a Lifetime of Instability, Hoping for a Place to Touch Down

2016-11-15.abstract: A new state grant program is aimed at creating urban settings to support entrepreneurs and attract younger workers.
2016-11-15.snippet: A new state grant program is aimed at creating urban settings to support entrepreneurs and attract younger workers.
2016-11-15.lead_paragraph: HARTFORD — After Lelaneia Dubay developed an intolerance for the gluten and chemical additives in many alcoholic beverages, she went looking for a way to salvage her cocktail hour. Already skilled at making cranberry liqueur, which she bottled and gave as gifts at Christmas, she came up with a formula for a lavender liqueur, using sprigs from her garden. When she shared it with friends at a holiday party, their response was emphatic: Get this to market.
2016-11-15.headline_main: Hartford Kicks Open Its Doors to Innovators

2016-11-15.abstract: After taking a total of seven 3-point attempts in his first six N.B.A. seasons, the Nets center has hoisted up 38 this season, in only eight games.

2016-11-15.lead_paragraph: People magazine has named Dwayne Johnson, a.k.a. The Rock, its “Sexiest Man Alive” for 2016, ushering him into an elite group of physically appealing men that over the years has included George Clooney, Matt Damon and David Beckham.
2016-11-15.headline_main: Dwayne Johnson, a.k.a. the Rock, Is People’s Sexiest Man Alive

2016-11-15.abstract: A study of so-called PCSK9 inhibitors showed they can reduce the size of plaques in arteries that may cause heart attacks, a signal that they will show benefit in reducing heart attack risk.
2016-11-15.snippet: A study of so-called PCSK9 inhibitors showed they can reduce the size of plaques in arteries that may cause heart attacks, a signal that they will show benefit in reducing heart attack risk.
2016-11-15.lead_paragraph: If there is one thing decades of studies with tens of thousands of heart disease patients have revealed, it is that lowering cholesterol can reduce the risk of heart attacks and deaths. Now, with new drugs on the market that can plunge cholesterol levels lower than ever thought possible, researchers are eagerly waiting for an answer to the next question: Is there a limit to the benefits in high-risk patients? After a certain point, do benefits level off or even reverse?
2016-11-15.headline_main: Study Shows Promise for Expensive Cholesterol Drugs, but They Are Still Hard to Obtain

2016-11-15.abstract: A report in the British media whose origins were not revealed said 30,000 additional civil servants would be needed to negotiate departure from the E.U.
2016-11-15.snippet: A report in the British media whose origins were not revealed said 30,000 additional civil servants would be needed to negotiate departure from the E.U.
2016-11-15.lead_paragraph: LONDON — The government of Britain could need six more months to settle on a plan for negotiating the country’s exit from the European Union and an extra 30,000 civil servants to deal with the complexities of the task, according to a memo of uncertain parentage leaked to The Times of London on Tuesday.
2016-11-15.headline_main: Leaked ‘Brexit’ Memo Says U.K. Is Unsure How to Proceed

2016-11-15.abstract: Saratoga Springs boasts a growing number of visitors — and now, a chic place for them to stay.
2016-11-15.snippet: Saratoga Springs boasts a growing number of visitors — and now, a chic place for them to stay.
2016-11-15.lead_paragraph: Much attention has been given in recent years to the small-town charms of New York’s Hudson Valley, where city folks have been escaping in droves on the weekends. But just a little farther north (about an hour from the town of Hudson itself), Saratoga Springs is starting to get a second glance by urbanites looking for something different. Known primarily for its famous racetrack (home to the Travers Stakes — one of the biggest Thoroughbred horse races in the country), the town also has a surprisingly rich cultural calendar, with a performing arts center that hosts several opera, ballet and symphonic acts throughout the year; and a spectacular collection of perfectly preserved Victorian, Federal and neo-Classical buildings that line its streets.
2016-11-15.headline_main: At an Old Racetrack, a New Place to Get Away

2016-11-15.abstract: The social network’s well-documented difficulty with users’ bad behavior may well be its biggest concern. But at least its executives admit it is a problem.
2016-11-15.snippet: The social network’s well-documented difficulty with users’ bad behavior may well be its biggest concern. But at least its executives admit it is a problem.
2016-11-15.lead_paragraph: It has been said before but it bears repeating: Twitter’s biggest problem is Twitter.

There was a shared fear that we were moving in the wrong direction, that the values of our community were being trampled by dark, hostile forces.

Bannon, a hard-right nationalist, to a top position.

2016-11-15.abstract: A pop-up sets down roots in the East Village, and other restaurant news.
2016-11-15.snippet: A pop-up sets down roots in the East Village, and other restaurant news.
2016-11-15.lead_paragraph: WAGAMAMA It’s easy to understand why Asian restaurant groups that have come to New York — like Sugarfish from Los Angeles, Ootoya from Tokyo and now Wagamama from London — do not want to be called chains. These places are well designed, with interiors handsomely finished in fine materials. Wagamama, which started in 1992 and has 150 locations worldwide, has opened a two-story space in the NoMad area that seats more than 200, mostly at counters and communal tables. Some seats face the kitchen, though with a no-reservations policy, snaring one may be a challenge. The food, made fresh, is basically Asian, highlighting ramen but also offering soba noodle dishes, donburi rice bowls and curries, which the executive chef of the group, Steve Mangleshot, thinks will have special appeal for New Yorkers. This is the only location where spirits are poured and brunch will be served: 210 Fifth Avenue (26th Street), 212-920-6233, wagamama.us.
2016-11-15.headline_main: Wagamama, Serving Asian-Influenced Dishes, Opens in NoMad

2016-11-15.abstract: We used to imagine women would naturally vote together. Then we imagined they could be persuaded to. It has yet to happen.

2016-11-15.lead_paragraph: When Victoria Woodhull ran for president of the United States, she couldn’t even vote for herself. “If the women can be allowed to vote,” The New York Herald claimed when Woodhull announced her bid in 1870, “Mrs. Woodhull may rely on rolling up the heaviest majority ever polled in this or any other nation.” After all, the paper said, “women always take the part of each other.” The Herald called for passage of a women’s suffrage amendment, and then “victory for Victoria in 1872.”

2016-11-15.abstract: A new exhibition combines works by Willem de Kooning and Zao Wou-Ki.
2016-11-15.snippet: A new exhibition combines works by Willem de Kooning and Zao Wou-Ki.
2016-11-15.lead_paragraph: To coincide with the expansion of her Madison Avenue gallery next month, Dominique Lévy is mounting an exhibition of side-by-side works by Willem de Kooning and Zao Wou-Ki (currently the subject of a solo show at the Asia Society). The two very different expressive painters were both restless experimenters. Frustrated with the formal limitations of the Chinese academy, Zao left for Paris in 1948, while de Kooning, born in the Netherlands and also classically trained, arrived in New York in 1927. The artists found their signature styles around the same time: de Kooning’s infamous “Woman” canvases, exhibited in 1953, broke his association with Abstract Expressionism, and his aggressive dismantling of the female body still unsettles. A year later, Zao changed brushes and technique to create his signature chaotic landscapes. His swirling “4-6-62” has the feel of a tornado, or an atom bomb. Lévy describes the show as “a combat between two giants.’’
2016-11-15.headline_main: Two Men and a Show

2016-11-15.abstract: Tuesday was Election Day in Beijing, but despite urging voters to “treasure democratic rights,” the government bullied and detained activists and candidates.

2016-11-15.abstract: By situating the action in 1940s occupied France, Richard Eyre’s production denies Manon the possibility of rising to a secure perch in the 18th-century demimonde.
2016-11-15.snippet: By situating the action in 1940s occupied France, Richard Eyre’s production denies Manon the possibility of rising to a secure perch in the 18th-century demimonde.
2016-11-15.lead_paragraph: Vocally the revival of Puccini’s “Manon Lescaut,” which opened at the Metropolitan Opera on Monday, is ravishing. It’s almost enough to make sense of Richard Eyre’s problematic production of this already dramatically inconsistent work.
2016-11-15.headline_main: ‘Manon Lescaut’ at the Met Opera: A Courtesan in Need of Context

2016-11-15.abstract: The confidential filing by Snap Inc. might allow the social network company to hold an offering as soon as March.
2016-11-15.snippet: The confidential filing by Snap Inc. might allow the social network company to hold an offering as soon as March.
2016-11-15.lead_paragraph: The clock has started for one of the most eagerly awaited market debuts of 2017: that of Snapchat, the popular messaging service.

2016-11-15.abstract: The restaurant in Williamsburg, Brooklyn, receives two stars, while the three-star restaurant rankings remain unchanged.
2016-11-15.snippet: The restaurant in Williamsburg, Brooklyn, receives two stars, while the three-star restaurant rankings remain unchanged.
2016-11-15.lead_paragraph: Michelin released its 2017 restaurant rankings for New York on Tuesday — several days earlier than planned, because the guidebooks were made available early. There are no changes in its coveted three-star rankings, which remain at six: Chef’s Table at Brooklyn Fare, Eleven Madison Park, Jean-Georges, Le Bernardin, Masa and Per Se.
2016-11-15.headline_main: Aska Wins a Spot in the 2017 New York Michelin Guide

2016-11-15.abstract: Welcome to Neary’s, a safe space for Republicans and Trump voters in a heavily Democratic city. In 2017, the bar will celebrate 50 years in New York.
2016-11-15.snippet: Welcome to Neary’s, a safe space for Republicans and Trump voters in a heavily Democratic city. In 2017, the bar will celebrate 50 years in New York.
2016-11-15.lead_paragraph: The wall on the left side of Neary’s, a green-canopied Irish restaurant and bar on East 57th Street that will celebrate its 50th anniversary next year, is covered with framed photos of politicians considered liberal: Hillary and Bill Clinton, Ted Kennedy, Chris Dodd, Hugh Carey and Michael Bloomberg. Rudy Giuliani, perhaps surprisingly, is up there, too.
2016-11-15.headline_main: Where Everybody Knows Your Name and Accepts Your Politics

2016-11-15.abstract: In this BBC America series, a conspiracy plot focuses on police and judicial mistreatment of black men. Questions pile up, but few are satisfactorily answered.
2016-11-15.snippet: In this BBC America series, a conspiracy plot focuses on police and judicial mistreatment of black men. Questions pile up, but few are satisfactorily answered.
2016-11-15.lead_paragraph: The somewhat specialized category of six-episode British mini-series involving government cabals, police investigations, cynical journalists and a pervasive fog of conspiracy has produced some great television, including “Edge of Darkness” in 1985 and “State of Play” in 2003.
2016-11-15.headline_main: Review: A Defense Lawyer With Hidden Motives in ‘Undercover’

2016-11-15.abstract: Jean Rogers went from cleaning up Superfund sites to founding an organization focused on what companies report on environmental and social issues.
2016-11-15.snippet: Jean Rogers went from cleaning up Superfund sites to founding an organization focused on what companies report on environmental and social issues.
2016-11-15.lead_paragraph: Jean Rogers cut her teeth as an environmental engineer. Early in her career, she worked to clean up Superfund sites, donning hazmat suits to take samples of soil and groundwater polluted by industrial activity.
2016-11-15.headline_main: Investors Want More Firms to Be More Open. This Nonprofit Is Trying to Make It Happen.

2016-11-15.abstract: James Stourton’s biography of this historian and museum director is a window onto a figure whose sensibilities helped to define life, art and civilization in 20th-century Britain.

2016-11-15.abstract: Market forces, not environmental regulations, have doomed coal.
2016-11-15.snippet: Market forces, not environmental regulations, have doomed coal.
2016-11-15.lead_paragraph: Austin, Tex. — Donald J. Trump made many important campaign promises on his way to victory. But saving coal is one promise he won’t be able to keep.
2016-11-15.headline_main: The Coal Industry Isn’t Coming Back

2016-11-15.abstract: As financial pressure increases, ensembles are going beyond merely making music to offer more educational programs and community engagement initiatives.
2016-11-15.snippet: As financial pressure increases, ensembles are going beyond merely making music to offer more educational programs and community engagement initiatives.
2016-11-15.lead_paragraph: PITTSBURGH — There is a stark reality increasingly facing American orchestras: They are now charities, relying more, on average, on philanthropy than on the ticket sales that used to buttress them.
2016-11-15.headline_main: It’s Official: Many Orchestras Are Now Charities

2016-11-15.abstract: Mr. Trump has threatened to roll back President Obama’s sweeping détente, but some analysts say the president-elect’s instincts as a real estate mogul and hotel developer would ultimately prevail.
2016-11-15.snippet: Mr. Trump has threatened to roll back President Obama’s sweeping détente, but some analysts say the president-elect’s instincts as a real estate mogul and hotel developer would ultimately prevail.

2016-11-15.snippet: Recent commercial real estate transactions in New York City.
2016-11-15.lead_paragraph: $4.9 MILLION
2016-11-15.headline_main: Recent Commercial Real Estate Transactions

2016-11-15.abstract: One of the essential 1990s hip-hop groups is back with its first album in 18 years, an often stunning work that interweaves social and political truth-telling.
2016-11-15.snippet: One of the essential 1990s hip-hop groups is back with its first album in 18 years, an often stunning work that interweaves social and political truth-telling.
2016-11-15.lead_paragraph: In the music business, when you disappear for a long stretch of time, you abandon your right to grouse about how things have changed in your absence. Nostalgia is a cheap crutch and a lame weapon. When the whole world is changing, though, disappearing and then re-emerging in different circumstances can be more deeply destabilizing. The things you held dear might be missing, or under attack. Adjusting is a full-time job.
2016-11-15.headline_main: A Tribe Called Quest Returns to a Changed World With Joy and Grief

2016-11-15.abstract: The EB-5 program was intended to reward people for putting money into depressed areas of the United States, in exchange for residency.
2016-11-15.snippet: The EB-5 program was intended to reward people for putting money into depressed areas of the United States, in exchange for residency.
2016-11-15.lead_paragraph: A federal program meant to encourage investment in the United States from wealthy foreigners is increasingly supporting large luxury real estate projects, not the development in the rural and downtrodden districts that some say were the original targets of the program.
2016-11-15.headline_main: U.S. Foreign Investor Program Funding More Luxury Projects

2016-11-15.abstract: Mr. Liang, who has a coming Composer Portrait concert at the Miller Theater, transformed his composing process after research involving high-resolution scans of Chinese paintings.
2016-11-15.snippet: Mr. Liang, who has a coming Composer Portrait concert at the Miller Theater, transformed his composing process after research involving high-resolution scans of Chinese paintings.
2016-11-15.lead_paragraph: On Sunday afternoon, the composer Lei Liang looked on silently as the ensemble Loadbang made its second pass through his “Lakescape V.” For seven years a commission from the busy Mr. Liang had been on a wish list kept by the group, an unusual quartet consisting of trumpet, trombone, bass clarinet and baritone voice. It became a fixed point on the calendar nearly three years ago, when a concert of Mr. Liang’s music was scheduled for Thursday, part of the Miller Theater’s Composer Portrait series.
2016-11-15.headline_main: For Composer Lei Liang, Technology Brings a Different Transcendence

2016-11-15.abstract: In “Thank You for Coming: Play,” at the Brooklyn Academy of Music, her dancers are delving into the social experience of storytelling.
2016-11-15.snippet: In “Thank You for Coming: Play,” at the Brooklyn Academy of Music, her dancers are delving into the social experience of storytelling.
2016-11-15.lead_paragraph: In a studio at the Brooklyn Academy of Music on a recent afternoon, a few dancers stood around chatting, as if catching up before rehearsal. Yet the conversation, upon closer listening, sounded warped, like a script chopped up and scrambled. Gestures, words and facial expressions didn’t quite match up, tricking the mind into seeking a clear, coherent message that never arrived.
2016-11-15.headline_main: Faye Driscoll’s Tingling Force Field With the Dance Audience

2016-11-15.abstract: Two scholars said a sketchbook of 65 drawings is an authentic work by Vincent van Gogh, but the Van Gogh Museum in Amsterdam disagreed.
2016-11-15.snippet: Two scholars said a sketchbook of 65 drawings is an authentic work by Vincent van Gogh, but the Van Gogh Museum in Amsterdam disagreed.
2016-11-15.lead_paragraph: Two scholars said on Tuesday that they believe that an old sketchbook containing 65 drawings is an authentic work by Vincent van Gogh, and was created by that Post-Impressionist in Arles, France, where he made many of his famous and beloved paintings.
2016-11-15.headline_main: Sketchbook Attributed to van Gogh Pits Scholars Against a Museum

2016-11-15.abstract: Claims to the name by makers of computers, cosmetics and leather goods highlight the difficulties that big names face when dealing with Chinese trademark laws.

2016-11-15.abstract: Here’s what you need to know at the end of the day.

2016-11-15.snippet: Turkey is one of several countries that have issued warnings against visiting the United States, for reasons that range from zika to recent protests.
2016-11-15.lead_paragraph: Following the election last week of Donald J. Trump as the next president of the United States, the Turkish government thinks that the United States isn’t the safest travel destination for its citizens: The Turkish Ministry of Foreign Affairs posted a travel warning Saturday on its website, citing the protests that erupted in several cities immediately after the election including New York, Miami, Los Angeles and Seattle.
2016-11-15.headline_main: Turkish Travel Warning Cautions Citizens About Travel to U.S.

2016-11-15.abstract: The right has been waiting a long time for its chance to upend Washington. Now, its faithful want to be sure the new president does not go soft.

2016-11-16.abstract: A little-used law may be used by the Trump administration to strike down regulations passed since this spring under President Obama.

2016-11-16.lead_paragraph: Dozens of major regulations passed recently by the Obama administration — including far-reaching changes on health care, consumer protections and environmental safety — could be undone with the stroke of a pen by Donald J. Trump and the Republican-controlled Congress starting in January, thanks to a little-used law that dates back to 1996.

2016-11-16.abstract: Some diplomats at the global warming summit meeting called for retaliation to compel American compliance with the Paris accord approved a year ago.

Trump, who has called climate change a hoax and vowed to withdraw the United States from the Paris climate change accord, worrying that Mr. Trump’s presidency could cripple a decade of climate diplomacy.

2016-11-16.lead_paragraph: VANCOUVER, British Columbia — Donald J. Trump’s positions on climate change amount to a declaration of war on young people like me. But millennials have a stronger position in this fight than it may first appear.

2016-11-16.abstract: Mr. Trump, whose team is being advised by advocates of privatized health care for veterans, is considering Representative Jeff Miller to lead the department.
2016-11-16.snippet: Mr. Trump, whose team is being advised by advocates of privatized health care for veterans, is considering Representative Jeff Miller to lead the department.
2016-11-16.lead_paragraph: On the campaign trail, Donald J. Trump savaged the Department of Veterans Affairs, calling it a “disaster” and “the most corrupt agency in the United States.” He vowed to fire many workers at the department in an effort to fix a health care system fraught with delays.

2016-11-16.abstract: After a brunch in Carroll Gardens disappoints, a trip to a nearby ice cream place gets the day back on track.

2016-11-16.abstract: With poignant singing by Romina Basso, Jeffrey Thompson and others, the cast and musicians help the tale and the puppets come alive at the White Light Festival.
2016-11-16.snippet: With poignant singing by Romina Basso, Jeffrey Thompson and others, the cast and musicians help the tale and the puppets come alive at the White Light Festival.
2016-11-16.lead_paragraph: The most wrenching moment in Monteverdi’s opera “Il Ritorno d’Ulisse” (“The Return of Ulysses”), based on Homer, comes when we first meet Penelope, Ulysses’ wife. She has been waiting for what feels like an eternity for her husband to return from the Trojan War; she is unsure if he is even still alive.
2016-11-16.headline_main: Review: Puppets Are the Stars in ‘Il Ritorno d’Ulisse’

2016-11-16.abstract: The successful language translation company may end up being sold because the owners seem to be acting like spoiled children, wreaking havoc on it.
2016-11-16.snippet: The successful language translation company may end up being sold because the owners seem to be acting like spoiled children, wreaking havoc on it.
2016-11-16.lead_paragraph: A Delaware court decision to require the sale of TransPerfect, the big, profitable language translation company, has employees howling. They fear their employer will be pushed into the hands of a private equity buyer who would cut jobs. But the real fault lies with the owners who seem to be acting like spoiled children, wreaking havoc on the company they founded.
2016-11-16.headline_main: TransPerfect Is Threatened by Owners’ Petulance

2016-11-16.abstract: The legislation, which would continue sanctions for 10 years, needs Senate approval and President Obama’s signature before the end of the year.
2016-11-16.snippet: The legislation, which would continue sanctions for 10 years, needs Senate approval and President Obama’s signature before the end of the year.
2016-11-16.lead_paragraph: The House of Representatives voted overwhelmingly on Tuesday for legislation to extend American sanctions on Iran for 10 years, a move that proponents called critical economic leverage to ensure Iranian compliance with an international nuclear agreement.
2016-11-16.headline_main: House Votes to Extend Iran Sanctions in Bid to Ensure Nuclear Compliance

2016-11-16.abstract: The former New York mayor lacks substantive diplomatic experience and has demonstrated poor judgment throughout his career.
2016-11-16.snippet: The former New York mayor lacks substantive diplomatic experience and has demonstrated poor judgment throughout his career.
2016-11-16.lead_paragraph: World leaders watching America make a shift under Donald Trump fall into two broad camps: those who hope that the United States will muddle through the next four years, an inexperienced president notwithstanding, and those who are eager to see Washington’s international standing and influence unravel.

2016-11-16.abstract: The New York State inspector general cited financial mismanagement and poor oversight in its first formal review of the university system.
2016-11-16.snippet: The New York State inspector general cited financial mismanagement and poor oversight in its first formal review of the university system.
2016-11-16.lead_paragraph: Shoddy oversight and ineffective management at the City University of New York have created a system “ripe for abuse” that has potentially siphoned money away from needy students and crucial campus projects, according to a report released on Tuesday by the New York State inspector general.
2016-11-16.headline_main: Lapses by CUNY Officials Made System ‘Ripe for Abuse,’ Report Says

2016-11-16.abstract: While discussing her new book, the Fox News anchor describes her initial run-in with Donald J. Trump as “prescient” and warns fellow journalists to remain vigilant while covering the Trump White House.
2016-11-16.snippet: While discussing her new book, the Fox News anchor describes her initial run-in with Donald J. Trump as “prescient” and warns fellow journalists to remain vigilant while covering the Trump White House.
2016-11-16.lead_paragraph: The Fox News anchor Megyn Kelly has spent the better part of the last year living in the main gladiator pit of 2016, becoming as much a target for Donald J. Trump as any of his opponents and emerging as a pivotal figure in the forced resignation of the Fox News Channel chairman Roger Ailes, whom she accused of sexual harassment.
2016-11-16.headline_main: Megyn Kelly’s Cautionary Tale of Crossing Donald Trump

2016-11-16.abstract: The de Blasio administration should instead be promoting transparency by supporting the public’s right to know about officers’ misconduct.
2016-11-16.snippet: The de Blasio administration should instead be promoting transparency by supporting the public’s right to know about officers’ misconduct.
2016-11-16.lead_paragraph: Mayor Bill de Blasio, who promised an open government, has been far from transparent when it comes to the conduct of police officers. Last year, his administration appealed a well-reasoned state court decision that ordered it to release summaries of misconduct findings against the officer who used a choke hold in the 2014 arrest of Eric Garner. More recently, under a narrow reading of state law, it shut down access to Police Department records containing routine personnel information that had been open to the news media for decades.
2016-11-16.headline_main: New York City Helps to Keep Police Records Secret

2016-11-16.abstract: In their annual conference, Catholic bishops elected new leaders and said they are preparing to defend immigrants and refugees against a wave of anger.
2016-11-16.snippet: In their annual conference, Catholic bishops elected new leaders and said they are preparing to defend immigrants and refugees against a wave of anger.
2016-11-16.lead_paragraph: Two nights after Donald J. Trump won the presidential election, Archbishop José H. Gomez convened an interfaith prayer service at the Roman Catholic cathedral in Los Angeles and gave an emotional homily vowing not to abandon children and parents who are living in fear that Mr. Trump will follow through on his promise to deport millions of immigrants.
2016-11-16.headline_main: Catholic Bishops Challenge Donald Trump on Immigration

2016-11-16.abstract: A longtime reporter and editor who was at the scene as planes hit the World Trade Center on 9/11.
2016-11-16.snippet: A longtime reporter and editor who was at the scene as planes hit the World Trade Center on 9/11.
2016-11-16.lead_paragraph: Dick Oliver, an award-winning reporter and editor for The Daily News who became familiar to New York television audiences as a longtime correspondent for the local morning show “Good Day New York,” died on Nov. 11 in Manhattan. He was 77.

2016-11-16.lead_paragraph: The Times asked 15 American families to talk about the dishes on their Thanksgiving tables that speak best to their heritage and traditions, and to who we are. These are their stories.

2016-11-16.snippet: With Alabama safely No. 1, the Buckeyes jumped ahead of Michigan (No. 3) and Clemson (No. 4) but face a tough road to the Big Ten championship game.
2016-11-16.lead_paragraph: Following a weekend in which three of the top four teams lost, the expected shake-up in the College Football Playoff rankings was made official Tuesday night. After No. 1 Alabama (10-0), the sole undefeated major-conference team, Nos. 2 through 4, representing the teams that would complete the playoff bracket if the season ended Tuesday, were Ohio State (9-1), Michigan (9-1) and Clemson (9-1).
2016-11-16.headline_main: College Football Playoff Rankings: Ohio State, at No. 2, Is in a Tough Spot

2016-11-16.abstract: This semidocumentary play at the Public Theater, from the spoken-word collective Universes, may be the most frightening and exciting piece of theater now up.
2016-11-16.snippet: This semidocumentary play at the Public Theater, from the spoken-word collective Universes, may be the most frightening and exciting piece of theater now up.
2016-11-16.lead_paragraph: There were shouts and moans and finger snaps at a weekend performance of “Party People” at the Public Theater. Tears and laughter joined together; so did sympathy and rage. Commissioned by the Oregon Shakespeare Festival for its “American Revolutions” cycle, developed by the director Liesl Tommy and written by the spoken-word collective Universes, this semidocumentary work is a disjointed exploration of two 1960s radical groups, the Black Panther Party and the Young Lords Party. In the current political climate, it may be the most frightening and exciting piece of theater now up.
2016-11-16.headline_main: Review: ‘Party People,’ a Nostalgic Look at 1960s Radicalism

2016-11-16.abstract: The Istrian truffle is premium grade and its culture is free of the snobbery, intrigue and high prices found in Italy’s Piedmont or France’s Perigord.
2016-11-16.snippet: The Istrian truffle is premium grade and its culture is free of the snobbery, intrigue and high prices found in Italy’s Piedmont or France’s Perigord.
2016-11-16.lead_paragraph: “Go Nero!” Nikola Tarandek, a truffle hunter, urged on his black Labrador, who scratched furiously at the moist soil of Motovun Forest in Croatia. We were in the hinterlands of Istria, a diamond-shaped peninsula that juts into the Adriatic Sea, exploring one of the richest grounds for premium white truffles — long overshadowed in fame but not quality by the truffle mecca of Alba in the Piedmont region of Italy. Nero had caught the scent at the roots of an oak, sending up clumps of dirt as Mr. Tarandek twisted a spade into the black earth.
2016-11-16.headline_main: Truffles in Paradise. (And It’s Not Italy.)

2016-11-16.lead_paragraph: Even before he won the presidency, Donald J. Trump had a strong claim to being the most ideologically disruptive presidential nominee of modern times. From the Bush family to Paul Ryan, the Iraq war to entitlement reform, Trump arrayed himself against the personalities and policies of the Republican Party, and his campaign took a wrecking ball to many of his adopted party’s orthodoxies, proposing a vision of right-wing politics far more mercantilist, nationalist and statist than anything we’ve seen from the post-Reagan, post-Goldwater G.O.P.

2016-11-16.snippet: Will the moral values that schools and parents have instilled in young people erode during a Trump presidency?
2016-11-16.lead_paragraph: Kids who are in religious or ethnic minorities, or are gay or disabled, are more likely to be bullied in school than other kids. Their point of difference can be a point of vulnerability. In the last decade, schools have put more energy into preventing bullying, to the benefit of these kids and others (girls, too, are more frequent targets). And they’ve often had the authority of the courts, state legislatures and the federal Department of Education behind them.
2016-11-16.headline_main: Bullying in the Age of Trump

2016-11-16.abstract: Christopher Rea, a literary historian, discusses the flowering of comedy, farce and satire in early 20th-century China, and the parallels to be found today.
2016-11-16.snippet: Christopher Rea, a literary historian, discusses the flowering of comedy, farce and satire in early 20th-century China, and the parallels to be found today.
2016-11-16.lead_paragraph: Christopher Rea is a literary and cultural historian at the University of British Columbia. A 39-year-old native of Berkeley, Calif., he has written on major figures in modern Chinese literature, including Qian Zhongshu and Yang Jiang. His new work, “The Age of Irreverence: A New History of Laughter in China,” shows how the early 20th century inspired a flowering of comedy, farce, cursing and satire. In it, one finds interesting parallels to today, especially in how people stick it to authority.
2016-11-16.headline_main: Finding a Rich Vein of Humor in China’s Past

2016-11-16.abstract: The magazine’s Ethicist columnist on what a child owes an aging parent, who is entitled to read a found letter and more.
2016-11-16.snippet: The magazine’s Ethicist columnist on what a child owes an aging parent, who is entitled to read a found letter and more.
2016-11-16.lead_paragraph: I recently graduated from college — the first person in my family to do so — and am trying to make a life for myself in New York. My father passed away several months ago, and my mother, who is in her 70s, is incapable of financial independence. She has never been financially responsible, and now the burden has fallen on my shoulders, because she has no family and I’m an only child. In my view, she lives way beyond her means; each time I suggest that she cut out a few expenses (fewer trips to the beauty parlor, shopping at a discount market), she breaks down and often lashes out at me. I fear that if I continue to support her, I’ll never be able to save enough money for my own future.
2016-11-16.headline_main: Am I Obliged to Support My Elderly Mother?
