2016-11-16.abstract: Often associated with murk and evil spirits, bogs are actually quite vibrant — a whole ecosystem laid bare.
2016-11-16.snippet: Often associated with murk and evil spirits, bogs are actually quite vibrant — a whole ecosystem laid bare.
2016-11-16.lead_paragraph: Bogs, never the most cherished of landscapes, got a particularly bad rap when I was growing up in the 1980s. There were the fantasy films, of course — perhaps you remember the “Bog of Eternal Stench” from “Labyrinth,” one of many obstacles standing between a young Jennifer Connelly and David Bowie’s Goblin King. But my youthful preconceptions were perhaps shaped more by Boglins, a series of grotesque rubbery puppets released by Mattel. Mine was named Dwork, a slime-green monstrosity with hooded eyes, and for years thereafter it remained my physical reference point for bogs, a land type whose very name, with its double plosive, became a byword in my mind for murk and monsters.
2016-11-16.headline_main: Letter of Recommendation: Bogs

2016-11-16.abstract: It isn’t the low scoring or the quality of play.
2016-11-16.snippet: It isn’t the low scoring or the quality of play.
2016-11-16.lead_paragraph: In the moments after Villanova’s Kris Jenkins hit a game-winning shot to beat North Carolina in the final of last season’s N.C.A.A. tournament, I was lying on my couch with my phone held a few inches from my face. The Crying Jordan meme was all over my social-media feeds, and although I had drifted from my Tar Heels-obsessed childhood, I felt unusually bummed out. Two powerhouse programs with huge followings had just played a game that featured a furious comeback in the final minutes; a magic game-tying shot by Marcus Paige, North Carolina’s senior guard; and, of course, Jenkins’s buzzer beater. After the game, Paige choked up at the news conference and Carolina’s fan base let out a long sigh for a player it had cheered on for four years. The game felt as if it had been scripted to hit all the nerve endings of what makes us care about college sports, and if the quality of the actual play was not up to par, no one but the most hardened sports wonk would have noticed.
2016-11-16.headline_main: What’s the Matter With College Basketball?

2016-11-16.abstract: The Paris-based artist Julio Le Parc is one of Latin America’s foremost proponents of Kinetic art. Now, his work is finding a new audience in the United States.
2016-11-16.snippet: The Paris-based artist Julio Le Parc is one of Latin America’s foremost proponents of Kinetic art. Now, his work is finding a new audience in the United States.
2016-11-16.lead_paragraph: PARIS — The suburban Paris home studio of the Argentine artist Julio Le Parc, widely considered a pioneer of Op Art and Kinetic Art, is a circus of hands-on — sometimes anarchic — delights. In one of a series of rooms surrounding an overgrown courtyard, the artist’s motorized “contorsions” come to life when a switch is flipped, and their rotating arms and reflective metal ribbons refract light into patterns on the wall. Nearby, mirrored sculptures from his “Déplacements” series produce disorienting optical illusions as a viewer moves around them, while the projected-light installations in yet another room create disco-ball effects of shifting color.
2016-11-16.headline_main: Julio Le Parc and Art That Won’t Stand Still

2016-11-16.abstract: Three new studies involving more than a million men and women strongly suggest that regular exercise makes us resistant to despair.
2016-11-16.snippet: Three new studies involving more than a million men and women strongly suggest that regular exercise makes us resistant to despair.
2016-11-16.lead_paragraph: Exercise may be an effective treatment for depression and might even help prevent us from becoming depressed in the first place, according to three timely new studies. The studies pool outcomes from past research involving more than a million men and women and, taken together, strongly suggest that regular exercise alters our bodies and brains in ways that make us resistant to despair.
2016-11-16.headline_main: How Exercise Might Keep Depression at Bay

2016-11-16.abstract: The award-winning architect Francis Kéré continues to focus on West Africa, where he has designed schools, medical centers and cultural spaces.
2016-11-16.snippet: The award-winning architect Francis Kéré continues to focus on West Africa, where he has designed schools, medical centers and cultural spaces.
2016-11-16.lead_paragraph: The architect Francis Kéré was born in a poor village in Burkina Faso where there was no school, no electricity and no access to clean drinking water. His father, the village chief, decided that his son should be the first in the family to learn how to read and write, so he sent him at age 7 to live with an uncle in a distant city, where he sat with 150 other students in an unventilated classroom in 110-degree heat. During his free time, like many of his peers, Mr. Kéré had to work, spending hours fixing crudely built homes, which were in a perpetual state of disrepair. “In my heart, I felt even then that I wanted to build things better one day, so that kids like me would be free to learn,” he said.
2016-11-16.headline_main: In Burkina Faso, Rebuilding With a Local Touch

2016-11-16.snippet: Prime Minister Hasina must rigorously investigate her own party, the Awami League.
2016-11-16.lead_paragraph: Over almost two years, radical Islamists have carried out a string of brutal attacks in Bangladesh, killing scores of bloggers, foreigners and members of religious minorities. A Hindu tailor was killed in April, and a Hindu priest was hacked to death in July. A terrorist attack in Dhaka in July left 22 people dead. Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina and her governing Awami League party have accused the Islamist opposition of fomenting this terrorism. In this context, the news that Awami League politicians may be implicated in recent attacks on Hindu homes and temples is profoundly disturbing.
2016-11-16.headline_main: Attacks on Hindus in Bangladesh

2016-11-16.abstract: Following her residency at the New York performing arts school, Fabienne Verdier paints sound and breath using vast suspended brushes.
2016-11-16.snippet: Following her residency at the New York performing arts school, Fabienne Verdier paints sound and breath using vast suspended brushes.
2016-11-16.lead_paragraph: As the first artist in residence at Juilliard, the French artist Fabienne Verdier spent a semester during 2014 in a temporary “laboratory” in New York. Working alongside jazz ensembles, classical pianists and singers, she explored ways in which sound might be given form through paint and oil stick. The work, she admits, was difficult. “I realized there that to enter into an encounter with others we must leave oneself behind,” Verdier says from her house in Le Vexin, to the north of Paris. “But where danger lies, there too grows the chance for salvation,” she continues, quoting Hölderlin.
2016-11-16.headline_main: One French Painter’s Unlikely Techniques, Developed at Juilliard

2016-11-16.abstract: There’s a certain gravity in Mitski’s indie-rock songs, whether stubbornly trudging ballads or distortion-laced punk.
2016-11-16.snippet: There’s a certain gravity in Mitski’s indie-rock songs, whether stubbornly trudging ballads or distortion-laced punk.
2016-11-16.lead_paragraph: There’s a certain gravity in Mitski’s indie-rock songs, whether they’re stubbornly trudging ballads or distortion-laced punk. Part of it is that Mitski Miyawaki is her band’s bass player and singer onstage (as well as its songwriter and multi-instrumentalist in the studio); her bass lines shadow her own voice from below, adding a constant undertow to her graceful, long-breathed melodies. And part of it is that in her songs, weighty emotional burdens are being exposed, confronted and borne, somberly and patiently. “One morning this sadness will fossilize,” she croons in a song on “Puberty 2,” her latest album, “And I will forget how to cry.” (Monday, Nov. 21, at Webster Hall in Manhattan; Tuesday at Market Hotel in Brooklyn.)
2016-11-16.headline_main: Mitski’s Emotional Undertow

2016-11-16.snippet: This new comedy was devised with millennials in mind. It stars Alia Shawkat.
2016-11-16.lead_paragraph: With its Brooklyn vibe and whiff of self-absorption, “Search Party” was devised with millennials in mind, down to the way it’s meant to be binged: two episodes for five nights running, starting Monday, Nov. 21, at 11 p.m. on TBS.
2016-11-16.headline_main: In ‘Search Party,’ on TBS, the Real Quest Is for the Self

2016-11-16.abstract: Professional choreographers work with students, and both sides benefit.
2016-11-16.snippet: Professional choreographers work with students, and both sides benefit.
2016-11-16.lead_paragraph: When professional choreographers work with students, both sides benefit: Students are exposed to new ways of moving (and possible future employers), while artists can try out ideas on large, curious groups. The Juilliard Dance Division’s winter concert, “New Dances,” facilitates that kind of exchange, and the Guggenheim Museum presents a sneak peek of this year’s offerings — by John Heginbotham, Katarzyna Skarpetowska, Pam Tanowitz and Matthew Neenan, each working with a different class — on Sunday, Nov. 20, as part of its Works & Process series.
2016-11-16.headline_main: Juilliard’s ‘New Dances’ at the Guggenheim

2016-11-16.abstract: The Dewberry is a midcentury masterpiece (and a great place to enjoy a highball).
2016-11-16.snippet: The Dewberry is a midcentury masterpiece (and a great place to enjoy a highball).
2016-11-16.lead_paragraph: Workstead, a rising design firm, makes its South Carolina debut with the Dewberry, a 155-room hotel built in the shell of the 1964 L. Mendel Rivers Federal Building overlooking Charleston’s Marion Square. “We wanted to explore the idea of Southern Modernism,” says co-founder Robert Highsmith. Taking cues from Milan’s Villa Necchi Campiglio, Havana’s Hotel Nacional, and Slim Aarons, they mixed midcentury Danish antiques with nods to the Lowcountry, such as oak salvaged from a tobacco barn in Georgia.
2016-11-16.headline_main: Sweet Southern Hospitality in a New Charleston Hotel

2016-11-16.abstract: The new-music ensemble Counter)Induction devotes an evening to the work of one guy named Moe: Eric Moe.
2016-11-16.snippet: The new-music ensemble Counter)Induction devotes an evening to the work of one guy named Moe: Eric Moe.
2016-11-16.lead_paragraph: Dramatic instinct and poetic sensibility are the hallmarks of Eric Moe’s music; his compositional voice is always distinct, whether in works of dreamy reticence or rhythmic irascibility. On Sunday, Nov. 20, the trailblazing new-music ensemble Counter)Induction dedicates an evening to Mr. Moe that is also an advertisement for the kind of composer-performer symbiosis that has proved so fertile across the New York scene. Half of the program, presented at National Sawdust, is given over to works by Mr. Moe, including a conversation for acoustic viola and electronics, “What Instruments We Have Agree,” an elegy on the death of the composer Lee Hyla, and the New York premiere of “Welcome to Phase Space,” enigmatically described as representing an eight-dimensional universe.
2016-11-16.headline_main: A Feast of One Composer’s Dreamy Reticence and Rhythmic Irascibility

2016-11-16.abstract: An exhibition of his collages, works discovered after his death, is opening at the Museum of Modern Art.
2016-11-16.snippet: An exhibition of his collages, works discovered after his death, is opening at the Museum of Modern Art.
2016-11-16.lead_paragraph: The name of the minimalist painter and theorist Josef Albers has never been on the list of form-minded photographers of the 20th century — a list that would include greats like Edward Weston, Paul Strand, Imogen Cunningham and Laszlo Moholy-Nagy. But the exclusion of Albers, who died in 1976, was a matter of his own choice. His extensive work with a camera, which began in the late 1920s during his days at the Bauhaus and continued throughout his career, was discovered only after his death.
2016-11-16.headline_main: Real, and Unreal: Photography by Josef Albers at MoMA

2016-11-16.abstract: A new show of work by Robert Longo pairs his recent, politically inspired drawings with slow-motion versions of the Russian master’s films.
2016-11-16.snippet: A new show of work by Robert Longo pairs his recent, politically inspired drawings with slow-motion versions of the Russian master’s films.
2016-11-16.lead_paragraph: At 63, Robert Longo has become an increasingly topical artist. Often lumped in with the three other male commercial behemoths of his generation — Eric Fischl, David Salle and Julian Schnabel, or “The Four Brushmen of the Apocalypse,” as Lynn Hirschberg called them in a cheeky 1987 Esquire story — Longo has, in the last two years, refashioned his art in a more blatantly political image. He created a modern classic with his diptych, “Untitled (Ferguson Police, August 13, 2014),” a photorealist depiction of Ferguson, Mo. police officers in riot gear, partly shrouded in a cloud of tear gas, the golden arches of a McDonald’s restaurant visible in the background. (He’d follow this thread further in 2016 with a drawing of the Baltimore police during the riots over the death of Freddie Gray.) His “Untitled (Football Players, Rams, Hands Up),” 2016, featured the St. Louis football team’s receivers entering the stadium for a game and making the “hands up, don’t shoot” gesture that has become a familiar symbol in Black Lives Matter protests. Another charcoal drawing focuses on a close-up of a bullet hole in the window of the Charlie Hebdo offices in Paris.
2016-11-16.headline_main: Bringing Together Eisenstein and Black Lives Matter, in Art

2016-11-16.abstract: Bar Fortuna is on second floor of Casa Apicii, a quieter Italian restaurant that replaced the Lion.
2016-11-16.snippet: Bar Fortuna is on second floor of Casa Apicii, a quieter Italian restaurant that replaced the Lion.
2016-11-16.lead_paragraph: Earlier this decade, there were few downtown restaurants hotter than the Lion, a celebrity-packed canteen run by John DeLucie in a Greenwich Village townhouse. But the restaurant got sold and the crowd moved on. In July, a quieter restaurant, Casa Apicii, took over in the space, and a second-floor chamber was turned into an intimate cocktail annex called Bar Fortuna with just 20 seats.
2016-11-16.headline_main: An Italian Bar Fit for Romance in Greenwich Village

2016-11-16.lead_paragraph: “The Illinois Parables,” Deborah Stratman’s hourlong essay film, arrives at just the right moment. A meditation on history and landscape, it has the power both to soothe complicated feelings about America and to inflame them. Alongside pastoral images of natural beauty — Indian burial mounds; deciduous forests; fields of corn and soybeans seen from the air — is a chronicle of violence, dispossession and disaster, stretching from before the European settlement of the continent to the political turmoil of the 1960s.

2016-11-16.abstract: This book by David Oshinsky, subtitled “Three Centuries of Medicine and Mayhem at America’s Most Storied Hospital,” traces a New York institution’s resilience.
2016-11-16.snippet: This book by David Oshinsky, subtitled “Three Centuries of Medicine and Mayhem at America’s Most Storied Hospital,” traces a New York institution’s resilience.
2016-11-16.lead_paragraph: Fairly or not, Bellevue is a gothic symbol of darkness and defeat: the destination for those who’ve been crushed and ground to a paste by New York City, or at least seem to have internalized its ghost population of demons and dybbuks. Bellevue is where Mark David Chapman was taken after shooting John Lennon. It is where William Burroughs was taken after deliberately snipping off part of  his left pinkie with poultry shears. It is where Norman Mailer was taken after stabbing his second wife, supposedly because she’d told him he’d never be as good as Dostoyevsky.
2016-11-16.headline_main: Review: ‘Bellevue’ Celebrates a Hospital Not Crazy, but Compassionate

2016-11-16.abstract: With its first studio album in eight years, Metallica is reclaiming the attack of its music while jettisoning the image of a band as young, fast and out of control.
2016-11-16.snippet: With its first studio album in eight years, Metallica is reclaiming the attack of its music while jettisoning the image of a band as young, fast and out of control.
2016-11-16.lead_paragraph: A packed, sweaty, ready-to-mosh crowd greeted Metallica in September at Webster Hall in Manhattan — a rare chance to see the band in a club rather than an arena — for a set including two songs from “Hardwired … to Self-Destruct,” the band’s first studio album in eight years.
2016-11-16.headline_main: Metallica, Still Thrashing but Comfortably Adult

2016-11-16.abstract: What some people did this past week, from interfaith vigils to “weaving therapy” to group meditation sessions, once the votes were counted.
2016-11-16.snippet: What some people did this past week, from interfaith vigils to “weaving therapy” to group meditation sessions, once the votes were counted.
2016-11-16.lead_paragraph: They were a cheerful, if slightly dazed, group last Thursday evening at Voz, a store on Elizabeth Street that sells ethical fashion made by indigenous people — one man and seven women gathered around a garment rack and cinched to its uprights with lengths of wool. They wore back strap looms, which look sort of like belts, and they were being led in a postelection “weaving therapy” workshop by Cynthia Alberto, a master weaver and textile designer. Weaving, she explained, has long been used as occupational therapy. Its rhythms are meditative and soothing, and the tradition of a weaving circle foments community and creativity.
2016-11-16.headline_main: Can Yoga Help Chase the Postelection Blues?

2016-11-16.abstract: “The Weight of These Wings” is a double album by this country star, her first record since her divorce from Blake Shelton.
2016-11-16.snippet: “The Weight of These Wings” is a double album by this country star, her first record since her divorce from Blake Shelton.
2016-11-16.lead_paragraph: Yes, “The Weight of These Wings” is Miranda Lambert’s first album since divorcing her fellow country star Blake Shelton last year. And yes, it is filled with songs about romantic skepticism and ones about how the first steps you take after an old love breaks are tentative and fragile. And yes, it is a double album, the sort of gesture intended to connote seriousness of artistic and spiritual purpose, as well as suggesting that the font of feelings serving as inspiration is a roaring waterfall that cannot easily be contained.
2016-11-16.headline_main: Review: Miranda Lambert Sings of What Comes After the Heartbreak

2016-11-16.abstract: Accompanying Accademia Bizantina on an all-Bach program at Zankel Hall, the violinist Viktoria Mullova was detached. But that didn’t make for a bad concert.
2016-11-16.snippet: Accompanying Accademia Bizantina on an all-Bach program at Zankel Hall, the violinist Viktoria Mullova was detached. But that didn’t make for a bad concert.
2016-11-16.lead_paragraph: “Pizza is like sex,” Woody Allen may actually have said once. “When it’s bad it’s still pretty good.”
2016-11-16.headline_main: Review: A Perfectly Acceptable Slice of Bach

2016-11-16.abstract: Representative Jeb Hensarling, chairman of the Financial Services Committee, said he would work on a “2.0 version” of financial reform legislation to attract Senate Democrats.
2016-11-16.snippet: Representative Jeb Hensarling, chairman of the Financial Services Committee, said he would work on a “2.0 version” of financial reform legislation to attract Senate Democrats.
2016-11-16.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — A prominent Republican lawmaker on Wednesday laid out his agenda for restructuring the financial system in the next Congress, including his plan to roll back major portions of the Dodd-Frank Act.
2016-11-16.headline_main: House Foe of Dodd-Frank Says Overhaul Will Face Test in Senate

2016-11-16.abstract: The New York Public Library’s renovation plan once called for a $1 billion overhaul, but a $200 million redesign of Mid-Manhattan was approved instead.
2016-11-16.snippet: The New York Public Library’s renovation plan once called for a $1 billion overhaul, but a $200 million redesign of Mid-Manhattan was approved instead.
2016-11-16.lead_paragraph: In many ways, the New York Public Library’s renovation plan has been a step-by-step retreat from the ambitious and controversial $1 billion overhaul — with a design by the starchitect Norman Foster — that once called for moving the circulating library at the Mid-Manhattan branch into the main Fifth Avenue flagship.
2016-11-16.headline_main: For the Mid-Manhattan Library, a Redesign for the Future

2016-11-16.abstract: It’s rare for a young artist to play Stern Auditorium solo, but Carnegie is giving the pianist Behzod Abduraimov the nod.
2016-11-16.snippet: It’s rare for a young artist to play Stern Auditorium solo, but Carnegie is giving the pianist Behzod Abduraimov the nod.
2016-11-16.lead_paragraph: Carnegie Hall’s main stage, Stern Auditorium, is generally not a place where young artists get their solo-recital sea legs. With its cream-colored walls accented with gilt, its 2,800 seats upholstered in red velvet, it is perhaps the most prestigious performance space in the world, the province of established stars like Lang Lang, Evgeny Kissin and Mitsuko Uchida.
2016-11-16.headline_main: Just 26, and Playing the Big House (Carnegie Hall)

2016-11-16.abstract: Mr. Cohen, who was known for working slowly, had picked up the pace considerably in recent years. His manager said he died in his sleep after a fall.
2016-11-16.snippet: Mr. Cohen, who was known for working slowly, had picked up the pace considerably in recent years. His manager said he died in his sleep after a fall.
2016-11-16.lead_paragraph: When Leonard Cohen’s family announced last week that he had died at  82, it gave no cause. Although the poet and songwriter had been open about his failing health in recent months, fans knew little other than what The New Yorker reported in its weekly radio show, that Mr. Cohen had been battling cancer.
2016-11-16.headline_main: For Leonard Cohen, the End Came With a Fall in the Night

2016-11-16.abstract: Here’s what you need to know at the end of the day.
2016-11-16.snippet: Here’s what you need to know at the end of the day.
2016-11-16.lead_paragraph: (Want to get this briefing by email? Here’s the sign-up.)
2016-11-16.headline_main: Trump, Syria, Schumer: Your Wednesday Evening Briefing

2016-11-16.abstract: Mr. Jones, who has a radio program and has claimed that the Sandy Hook school shooting was a hoax, said Mr. Trump had thanked him for “fighting so hard for Americans.”
2016-11-16.snippet: Mr. Jones, who has a radio program and has claimed that the Sandy Hook school shooting was a hoax, said Mr. Trump had thanked him for “fighting so hard for Americans.”
2016-11-16.lead_paragraph: When Donald J. Trump emerged from the haze of his surprise victory in the presidential election, one of his first calls was apparently to an early supporter, a controversial radio host and conspiracy theorist with a large following.
2016-11-16.headline_main: Alex Jones, Host and Conspiracy Theorist, Says Donald Trump Called to Thank Him

2016-11-16.abstract: Holiday pop-ups galore and sample sales at Rick Owens and Charlotte Olympia.
2016-11-16.snippet: Holiday pop-ups galore and sample sales at Rick Owens and Charlotte Olympia.
2016-11-16.lead_paragraph: Baby, it’s getting cold outside! On Thursday, Moncler and Canada Goose will open United States flagships where you’ll find the Moncler Gamme Bleu designer Thom Browne’s unisex capsule of puffer jackets (starting at $2,500) and knits (starting at $400) with a stars-and-stripes motif and a Canada Goose x Opening Ceremony silk parka ($1,795). Moncler is at 650 Madison Avenue; Canada Goose is at 101 Wooster Street.
2016-11-16.headline_main: Openings All Over Town: Coach, Moncler, Canada Goose and More

2016-11-16.abstract: American authorities said they have not ruled out terrorism as a motive for the killing of three American soldiers at an air base in Jordan this month.
2016-11-16.snippet: American authorities said they have not ruled out terrorism as a motive for the killing of three American soldiers at an air base in Jordan this month.
2016-11-16.lead_paragraph: JERUSALEM — American officials said Wednesday that they were investigating the killing of three United States soldiers at a Jordanian air base this month as a possible terrorist attack and dismissed suggestions that the three had done anything to provoke the shooting.
2016-11-16.headline_main: U.S. Investigates Deaths of 3 Soldiers in Jordan as Possible Terrorism

2016-11-16.abstract: Patients who go to hospitals covered by their medical plans often receive a bill from a doctor who was not in the insurer’s network, a study finds.
2016-11-16.snippet: Patients who go to hospitals covered by their medical plans often receive a bill from a doctor who was not in the insurer’s network, a study finds.
2016-11-16.lead_paragraph: Doug Moore was out of town at a Florida conference on information technology in October 2015 when he was struck with terrible abdominal pain. He tried to go to an urgent care center and called several local doctors. No one could see him. So he headed to the nearest emergency room. On the way, he called his insurance company to make sure the visit would be covered.
2016-11-16.headline_main: Surprise! Insurance Paid the E.R. but Not the Doctor

2016-11-16.abstract: Unless Mr. Trump divests his businesses, there will be no way to know if his actions in office are for the public good or for his own financial gain.
2016-11-16.snippet: Unless Mr. Trump divests his businesses, there will be no way to know if his actions in office are for the public good or for his own financial gain.
2016-11-16.lead_paragraph: Donald Trump refused to release his income tax returns during the campaign and now seems determined to lug every piece of financial baggage connected to his hotels, golf courses and other businesses into the White House. Unless he takes the sorts of common-sense steps past presidents have relied on to preserve the public trust, Americans will never know for certain if his actions in office are for the public good or his family’s private gain.
2016-11-16.headline_main: Donald Trump’s Tangled Web

2016-11-16.abstract: Renaud Laplanche has filed papers in several states to create Credify, a lending marketplace.
2016-11-16.snippet: Renaud Laplanche has filed papers in several states to create Credify, a lending marketplace.
2016-11-16.lead_paragraph: Just months after being forced out as the chief executive of the Lending Club, Renaud Laplanche is starting a new venture to lend money online.
2016-11-16.headline_main: Former Lending Club Chief Is Creating a New Lending Site

2016-11-16.abstract: Facebook promises to increase use of outside measurement services for ads and to expand use of metrics services, among other measures.
2016-11-16.snippet: Facebook promises to increase use of outside measurement services for ads and to expand use of metrics services, among other measures.
2016-11-16.lead_paragraph: Facebook is moving to restore confidence among advertisers and publishers that it is accurately measuring how often and how long users see videos, news articles, ads and corporate messages on its social network.
2016-11-16.headline_main: Facebook Acts to Restore Trust After Overstating Video Views

2016-11-16.abstract: There were no significant differences between the physical therapy and the self-treatment groups at one, three or six months after an ankle injury.
2016-11-16.snippet: There were no significant differences between the physical therapy and the self-treatment groups at one, three or six months after an ankle injury.
2016-11-16.lead_paragraph: Physical therapy for a sprained ankle may be no more effective than self-treatment at home, a randomized trial reports.
2016-11-16.headline_main: For a Sprained Ankle, Physical Therapy No Better Than Self Care

2016-11-16.abstract: The 21 recipients of the award, the nation’s highest civilian honor, also include Frank Gehry, Vin Scully, Tom Hanks and Bill and Melinda Gates.
2016-11-16.snippet: The 21 recipients of the award, the nation’s highest civilian honor, also include Frank Gehry, Vin Scully, Tom Hanks and Bill and Melinda Gates.
2016-11-16.lead_paragraph: President Obama named the recipients of the 2016 Presidential Medal of Freedom on Wednesday, a list that includes cultural, athletic and philanthropic luminaries like Kareem Abdul-Jabbar, Ellen DeGeneres, Tom Hanks and Bill and Melinda Gates. It is the last time Mr. Obama will award the nation’s highest civilian honor.
2016-11-16.headline_main: Ellen DeGeneres and Kareem Abdul-Jabbar Among 2016 Presidential Medal of Freedom Recipients

2016-11-16.abstract: National League voters overwhelmingly chose Scherzer. Porcello won the American League award despite receiving fewer first-place votes than Justin Verlander.
2016-11-16.snippet: National League voters overwhelmingly chose Scherzer. Porcello won the American League award despite receiving fewer first-place votes than Justin Verlander.
2016-11-16.lead_paragraph: If you thought the Electoral College was confusing, consider the 2016 American League Cy Young Award vote. After five routine elections, for the rookies of the year, the managers of the year and the National League Cy Young Award, things got really, really weird Wednesday night.
2016-11-16.headline_main: Cy Young Awards: Max Scherzer in N.L. and Rick Porcello in a Twist

2016-11-17.abstract: The slickly-produced videos, broadcast on Iranian state television, include suspects confessing to crimes that happened after they had been incarcerated.
2016-11-17.snippet: The slickly-produced videos, broadcast on Iranian state television, include suspects confessing to crimes that happened after they had been incarcerated.
2016-11-17.lead_paragraph: When Iran conducted a mass hanging in August of Sunni prisoners accused of attacks in its restive western Kurdish region, the executions were widely criticized as an egregious human rights violation. But death-penalty opponents also were appalled at what came next.
2016-11-17.headline_main: Rights Groups Assail Iran Over Videos of Condemned Prisoners

2016-11-17.abstract: With business acumen and political ties, he pushed the food products company to the front of American industry.
2016-11-17.snippet: With business acumen and political ties, he pushed the food products company to the front of American industry.
2016-11-17.lead_paragraph: Dwayne O. Andreas, an executive whose mastery of the global grain trade and the levers of political power turned the Archer Daniels Midland Company into a farm products giant and pushed it to the front ranks of American industry, died on Wednesday in Decatur, Ill. He was 98.
2016-11-17.headline_main: Dwayne O. Andreas, Who Turned Archer Daniels Midland Into Food Giant, Dies at 98

2016-11-17.abstract: The wistful “Daddy’s Hands” won two Grammy nominations, and Ms. Dunn’s song “Maybe I Mean Yes” provoked a national conversation about date rape.
2016-11-17.snippet: The wistful “Daddy’s Hands” won two Grammy nominations, and Ms. Dunn’s song “Maybe I Mean Yes” provoked a national conversation about date rape.
2016-11-17.lead_paragraph: Holly Dunn, a country singer who wrote the hit “Daddy’s Hands” as a Father’s Day gift for her preacher father and whose song “Maybe I Mean Yes” provoked a national conversation about date rape, died on Monday in Albuquerque. She was 59.
2016-11-17.headline_main: Holly Dunn, 59, Country Singer-Songwriter, Dies; ‘Daddy’s Hands’ Was a Hit

2016-11-17.abstract: Clips of Pedro Hernandez’s interviews with the authorities in 2012 have been played in his retrial in the 6-year-old’s 1979 disappearance in Manhattan.
2016-11-17.snippet: Clips of Pedro Hernandez’s interviews with the authorities in 2012 have been played in his retrial in the 6-year-old’s 1979 disappearance in Manhattan.
2016-11-17.lead_paragraph: Hours after he was taken to a small interview room, surrounded by detectives, Pedro Hernandez started to sob. The investigators had sought him out for a decades-old case, the disappearance of Etan Patz, a 6-year-old who vanished as he walked to his school bus stop in Manhattan.
2016-11-17.headline_main: Stoic in Court, Patz Suspect Is Heard in Harrowing Confession

2016-11-17.abstract: This year, for the first time, the Fafsa was made available on Oct. 1 — three months earlier than usual — for the next academic year.
2016-11-17.snippet: This year, for the first time, the Fafsa was made available on Oct. 1 — three months earlier than usual — for the next academic year.
2016-11-17.lead_paragraph: High school students appear to be responding well to recent changes in the federal student financial aid application process, an early analysis shows.
2016-11-17.headline_main: How Students Are Responding to the Changes in Federal Financial Aid

2016-11-17.abstract: A sociologist with a knack for market research, she contributed to the “Please don’t squeeze the Charmin” toilet paper ad.

2016-11-17.lead_paragraph: In the 1950s, women in the advertising industry often struggled to advance, much less get their work noticed.

2016-11-17.abstract: An idiosyncratic figure whose roller-coaster career included stockbroker, singer, investment adviser, publisher and television host.
2016-11-17.snippet: An idiosyncratic figure whose roller-coaster career included stockbroker, singer, investment adviser, publisher and television host.
2016-11-17.lead_paragraph: Howard Ruff, an idiosyncratic economist, best-selling author and political conservative best known for being bullish on gold and silver and gloomy about the economy, died on Nov. 12 in Lehi, Utah. He was 85.

2016-11-17.abstract: Mr. Eskin performed with the ensemble for more than half a century.
2016-11-17.snippet: Mr. Eskin performed with the ensemble for more than half a century.
2016-11-17.lead_paragraph: Jules Eskin, the principal cellist of the Boston Symphony Orchestra for more than half a century and among the longest-serving orchestral musicians in the United States, died on Tuesday at his home in Brookline, Mass. He was 85.
2016-11-17.headline_main: Jules Eskin, Cellist With Boston Symphony Orchestra, Dies at 85

2016-11-17.abstract: He left a job as an accountant when he saw a future in creating a frozen food company that was named for his mother and used her recipe.
2016-11-17.snippet: He left a job as an accountant when he saw a future in creating a frozen food company that was named for his mother and used her recipe.

2016-11-17.abstract: But optimism had no effect on death rates one way or the other, Finnish researchers found.
2016-11-17.snippet: But optimism had no effect on death rates one way or the other, Finnish researchers found.
2016-11-17.lead_paragraph: A pessimistic attitude increases the risk for death from heart disease, a new study reports, while an optimistic outlook may have no effect at all.
2016-11-17.headline_main: Pessimism May Be Bad for Your Heart

2016-11-17.abstract: The bank will roll out its first advertising campaign aimed at getting individuals to replace higher-cost credit card debt with a lower-cost personal loan.
2016-11-17.snippet: The bank will roll out its first advertising campaign aimed at getting individuals to replace higher-cost credit card debt with a lower-cost personal loan.

2016-11-17.headline_main: Goldman Sachs, Bank to the Elite, Makes Pitch to the Masses

2016-11-17.abstract: The foreign minister announced a plan to help Mexicans get accurate information and avoid scams related to deportation policies in a Trump administration.
2016-11-17.snippet: The foreign minister announced a plan to help Mexicans get accurate information and avoid scams related to deportation policies in a Trump administration.
2016-11-17.lead_paragraph: MEXICO CITY — Mexico’s Ministry of Foreign Affairs, apparently responding to promises by President-elect Donald J. Trump to step up deportations, announced a plan on Wednesday to provide more protection and support for Mexican immigrants in the United States and urged the Mexican population to “stay calm.”
2016-11-17.headline_main: ‘Stay Calm,’ Mexican Officials Tell Fearful Immigrants in U.S.

2016-11-17.abstract: Humanitarian agencies warned of growing violations of international law — particularly what they called a pattern of deliberate attacks on hospitals.
2016-11-17.snippet: Humanitarian agencies warned of growing violations of international law — particularly what they called a pattern of deliberate attacks on hospitals.
2016-11-17.lead_paragraph: BEIRUT, Lebanon — Eight hospitals bombed in the past week, five of them within the last 48 hours. Food stores running out of supplies. Scores of people killed in a single day.
2016-11-17.headline_main: Life Is Turned ‘Upside Down’ as Jets Pound Rebel-Held Syrian Cities

2016-11-17.abstract: Though there is no evidence that voting was disrupted, cybersecurity experts debated whether the warning was a success, and whether Russia had paid enough of a price.
2016-11-17.snippet: Though there is no evidence that voting was disrupted, cybersecurity experts debated whether the warning was a success, and whether Russia had paid enough of a price.

Putin of Russia has received two starkly different messages about hacking into American computer networks from the current and future presidents of the United States: Don’t you dare, and don’t worry, we’re not even sure it was you.
2016-11-17.headline_main: White House Confirms Pre-Election Warning to Russia Over Hacking

2016-11-17.abstract: The songwriter, who hesitated before even acknowledging his prize, said that “pre-existing commitments” would prevent him from picking up his award for literature.
2016-11-17.snippet: The songwriter, who hesitated before even acknowledging his prize, said that “pre-existing commitments” would prevent him from picking up his award for literature.

2016-11-17.headline_main: Minneapolis Fed Chief Proposes Eliminating ‘Too Big to Fail’ Banks

2016-11-17.abstract: Close, whose Bruins were the preseason favorite to take the Pacific-12 title, knew Wooden, a legendary men’s coach, for 15 years and has taken ideas like his Pyramid of Success to heart.
2016-11-17.snippet: Close, whose Bruins were the preseason favorite to take the Pacific-12 title, knew Wooden, a legendary men’s coach, for 15 years and has taken ideas like his Pyramid of Success to heart.
2016-11-17.lead_paragraph: Every day on her way to the practice floor at Pauley Pavilion, U.C.L.A.’s women’s basketball coach, Cori Close, makes a point of walking past the 10 banners for the national championships the Bruins’ men’s team won under John Wooden.
2016-11-17.headline_main: U.C.L.A. Women’s Coach Cori Close Follows John Wooden’s Example

2016-11-17.abstract: Reporters who thought the Obama administration was closed may be up against something much more opaque.
2016-11-17.snippet: Reporters who thought the Obama administration was closed may be up against something much more opaque.
2016-11-17.lead_paragraph: To understand how President-elect Donald J. Trump’s spontaneous meal this week at the “21” Club, the Manhattan nightspot, could turn into a flash point on the future of American journalism, it’s best to start with what the news media already knows about its future charge.
2016-11-17.headline_main: Ritual of Ever-Present Coverage May Not Pass Muster With Trump

2016-11-17.abstract: Thomas Gallagher, the engineer of the New Jersey Transit train that slammed into the station, killing one and injuring more than 100, believed the diagnosis might explain what happened.
2016-11-17.snippet: Thomas Gallagher, the engineer of the New Jersey Transit train that slammed into the station, killing one and injuring more than 100, believed the diagnosis might explain what happened.
2016-11-17.lead_paragraph: The engineer of a New Jersey Transit train that crashed into Hoboken Terminal in September had an undiagnosed sleep disorder, his lawyer said on Wednesday.
2016-11-17.headline_main: Engineer in Hoboken Train Crash Had Undiagnosed Sleep Disorder, Lawyer Says

2016-11-17.abstract: By late 1968, Mr. Laird believed that diplomacy was the only way to end the war, and later pressed the Nixon White House to wind down troop involvement.
2016-11-17.snippet: By late 1968, Mr. Laird believed that diplomacy was the only way to end the war, and later pressed the Nixon White House to wind down troop involvement.
2016-11-17.lead_paragraph: Melvin R. Laird, who as President Richard M. Nixon’s first secretary of defense quietly challenged the administration’s hawkish military policies during the war in Vietnam, prompting deep suspicion — and even spying — between the White House and the Pentagon, died on Wednesday in Fort Myers, Fla. He was 94.
2016-11-17.headline_main: Melvin Laird, Defense Secretary Who Challenged Vietnam Policy, Dies at 94

2016-11-17.abstract: Federal authorities are expected to announce a roughly $264 million settlement with the bank over charges that it hired children of Chinese leaders in exchange for deals.
2016-11-17.snippet: Federal authorities are expected to announce a roughly $264 million settlement with the bank over charges that it hired children of Chinese leaders in exchange for deals.
2016-11-17.lead_paragraph: After more than three years of digging into JPMorgan Chase’s hiring practices in China, federal authorities have determined that the bank hired the children of Chinese leaders as part of a quid pro quo to win business in the booming nation, clearing the way for a costly punishment.
2016-11-17.headline_main: JPMorgan Is Said to Settle Bribery Case Over Hiring in China

2016-11-17.abstract: The Q Brothers have concocted another mash-up of rap and Shakespeare. And the laughter grows, right along with the stack of corpses.
2016-11-17.snippet: The Q Brothers have concocted another mash-up of rap and Shakespeare. And the laughter grows, right along with the stack of corpses.
2016-11-17.lead_paragraph: Last time I checked, there were not a lot of laughs in Shakespeare’s tragedy about a Moorish general beset by the green-eyed monster. Yet giggles abound in “Othello: The Remix,” a clever and exuberantly performed hip-hop version of the play that opened on Wednesday at the Westside Theater.
2016-11-17.headline_main: Review: ‘Othello’ Goes Hip-Hop. There’s Humor, Too.

2016-11-17.abstract: With its new coach, Luke Walton, emphasizing teamwork and passing, the team is off to a 7-5 start in its first season without the retired Kobe Bryant.
2016-11-17.snippet: With its new coach, Luke Walton, emphasizing teamwork and passing, the team is off to a 7-5 start in its first season without the retired Kobe Bryant.
2016-11-17.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES — Jordan Clarkson, a third-year guard with the Los Angeles Lakers, was explaining the virtues of good ball movement this week when he was asked about last season, when the Lakers were not known for their good ball movement. The Lakers were known for many things, like their horrible record, but ball movement was not one of them.
2016-11-17.headline_main: The Ball Is Moving, and the Lakers Are Rolling

2016-11-17.abstract: Accusations of racial comments doomed the 1986 court nomination of Mr. Sessions, an Alabama senator under consideration for attorney general or defense secretary.
2016-11-17.snippet: Accusations of racial comments doomed the 1986 court nomination of Mr. Sessions, an Alabama senator under consideration for attorney general or defense secretary.
2016-11-17.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — In 1981, a Justice Department prosecutor from Washington stopped by to see Jeff Sessions, the United States attorney in Mobile, Ala., at the time. The prosecutor, J. Gerald Hebert, said he had heard a shocking story: A federal judge had called a prominent white lawyer “a disgrace to his race” for representing black clients.
2016-11-17.headline_main: Specter of Race Shadows Jeff Sessions, Potential Trump Nominee for Cabinet

2016-11-17.abstract: The 1891 canvas sold at Christie’s on Wednesday night.
2016-11-17.snippet: The 1891 canvas sold at Christie’s on Wednesday night.
2016-11-17.lead_paragraph: After a 14-minute battle involving five bidders — four on the phone and one in the room — a new auction high was set for the French Impressionist Claude Monet on Wednesday evening when the artist’s radiant 1891 canvas “Meule,” or “Grainstack,” fetched $81.4 million with fees at Christie’s in Manhattan.

2016-11-17.abstract: After days of reports that Donald J. Trump had requested a top-secret security clearance for his son-in-law, people close to him said that was not the case, but the law would not stop him.

2016-11-17.lead_paragraph: As its initial installments this season have made plain, Fox’s hit show “Empire” has been losing a two-front war. And in terms of plot, can it keep the soap suds bubbling by simply pitting the members of the Lyon family against each other — and against Lucious, in particular — again and again?

2016-11-17.abstract: After he went blind, John Hull used sound to rediscover a rich sensory universe.
2016-11-17.snippet: After he went blind, John Hull used sound to rediscover a rich sensory universe.
2016-11-17.lead_paragraph: “What is the world of sound?” So begins a diary entry from April 1984, recorded on audiocassette, about the nature of acoustic experience. The voice on the tape is that of the writer and theologian John Hull, who at the time of the recording had been totally blind for almost two years. After losing his sight in his mid-40s, Dr. Hull, a newlywed with a young family, had decided that blindness would destroy him if he didn’t learn to understand it. For three years he recorded his experiences of sight loss, documenting “a world beyond sight.”
2016-11-17.headline_main: Notes on Blindness: Acoustic Space

2016-11-17.abstract: Losing my sight in my 80s has been like entering a new country.
2016-11-17.snippet: Losing my sight in my 80s has been like entering a new country.
2016-11-17.lead_paragraph: Blindness is enveloping. It’s beyond belief to step outside and see so little, just a milky haze. Indoors, a smothering dark. It means that you can’t shed a mood of loneliness with a brisk walk down the street because you might trip, fall and break something. Nor will you see a passing friend, the sight of whom could be as cheery as an actual conversation. Sights, like sounds, randomly evoke a surge of memories ordinarily inaccessible that lighten and brighten the day. “Who are you?” I may already have asked 10 people who have spoken to me. Their body language as well as their smiles are lost to me. Human nature is striped with ambiguities, and you need to see them, but like a prisoner, I am hooded.
2016-11-17.headline_main: Feeling My Way Into Blindness

2016-11-17.abstract: The cartoonist and MacArthur fellow on DC vs. Marvel, feeling like an outsider and what he’s going to do with all that “genius” grant money.
2016-11-17.snippet: The cartoonist and MacArthur fellow on DC vs. Marvel, feeling like an outsider and what he’s going to do with all that “genius” grant money.
2016-11-17.lead_paragraph: What got you into collecting — and then creating — comics? The first comic book I ever read was DC Comics Presents No. 57, and it had Superman and the Atomic Knights in it. Pretty soon after, I started making my own comics. Nowadays any kid can make anything — movies or music, but back then, it seemed like there was such a low bar of entry into this way of telling stories.

2016-11-17.abstract: When times are tough, nerves can be soothed by aligot.
2016-11-17.snippet: When times are tough, nerves can be soothed by aligot.
2016-11-17.lead_paragraph: In times of great stress, or of flickering, low-level dread, I find that canceling all my plans and staying in to make mashed potatoes generally helps. This year, there were quite a few opportunities to do so. Election-related anxiety gnawed at me for months, lighting up old networks of pain in my shoulders and back. Mold bloomed around the mysterious wet patch that appeared in my bedroom ceiling. I started a thrilling, but terrifying, new job. And as the holidays neared, I worried about my grandmother, almost 80, living alone. Still, I let about half her calls go to voice mail each week, and hated myself for it.
2016-11-17.headline_main: Cheesy Mashed Potatoes for the Soul

2016-11-17.abstract: How can a wife be cruel to her husband? It’s entirely up to a judge’s discretion to decide whether to support claims of cruelty and approve divorces.
2016-11-17.snippet: How can a wife be cruel to her husband? It’s entirely up to a judge’s discretion to decide whether to support claims of cruelty and approve divorces.
2016-11-17.lead_paragraph: India’s family law was written to discourage divorce, and in that sense it has succeeded brilliantly: The last census, in 2011, showed that the number of Indians who described themselves as separated was nearly three times the number who were divorced.
2016-11-17.headline_main: Divorce, India Style: It’s All Up to the Judge

2016-11-17.abstract: Eddie Redmayne stars as a visitor to the city with a very stuffed magic suitcase in “Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them.”
2016-11-17.snippet: Eddie Redmayne stars as a visitor to the city with a very stuffed magic suitcase in “Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them.”
2016-11-17.lead_paragraph: “Is anyone safe?” That alarmed question nearly shrieks off a newspaper in “Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them,” rattling the story almost before it’s begun. A big, splashy footnote to J. K. Rowling’s Harry Potter screen series, it opens a new subdivision in the wizardry world that she created, even as it turns back the clock. Unlike Harry’s reality, which unfolds in a present that looks like ours but with dragons, “Fantastic Beasts” takes place in a 1926 New York, where dark forces cut swaths of destruction alongside chugging Model T’s. Ms. Rowling is just getting revved up, but her time frame suggests her sights are on another world catastrophe.
2016-11-17.headline_main: Review: ‘Fantastic Beasts’ Unleashes J.K. Rowling’s Magic on Old New York

2016-11-17.lead_paragraph: Auli’i Cravalho, a native Hawaiian, is the voice of the heroine in Walt Disney Animation Studios’ “Moana,” which opens Nov. 23. The comedy adventure, which also stars Dwayne Johnson, features a daring teenager on a seafaring mission to save her people. The story is inspired in part by the oral histories of Oceania. Ms. Cravalho, a high school sophomore who turns 16 on Nov. 22, grew up singing and dancing for family and friends. Born in Kohala on the island of Hawaii, she lives with her mother in Mililani, on the island of Oahu.

2016-11-17.lead_paragraph: Two months ago, Charles Granatell’s house in Wyckoff, N.J., was filled with testosterone-fueled camaraderie. His best friend from college, Mike Canfora, was getting married. Mr. Canfora flew in from Seattle, others drove in from Massachusetts and Manhattan, and some lived nearby. Eight of the 10 groomsmen were there. A big-screen TV loudly projected the Giants N.F.L. game. Paper plates containing sandwiches, pasta, salad and steak, food that had been catered, were strewn about. Wine and beer were consumed.
2016-11-17.headline_main: A New Reason to Party: Custom Suiting for the Suitor and His Pals

2016-11-17.lead_paragraph: Is it possible to break Thanksgiving? And if so, could last week’s chaotically divisive election have actually broken it? A story in The Times on Wednesday explores how the war between the presidential candidates might also lead to war at family dinner. Do you take the year off? Do you put a moratorium on politics at the table? You could. Or you could let Sam Sifton show you how to make a gravy so good it heals all divides.

2016-11-17.lead_paragraph: LONDON — If you’re going to direct a play suffused with music, how appropriate to come up with a production that really sings. That is just one of the achievements of the new London production of “Amadeus,” which restores Peter Shaffer’s drama to the Olivier stage at the National Theater, where it was first seen in 1979.
2016-11-17.headline_main: Review: Salieri’s Anguish Continues in a New ‘Amadeus’ in London

2016-11-17.abstract: “Simplicius Simplicissimus,” a little-known work by Karl Hartmann, has a belated British premiere.
2016-11-17.snippet: “Simplicius Simplicissimus,” a little-known work by Karl Hartmann, has a belated British premiere.
2016-11-17.lead_paragraph: LONDON — Unless you happened to be Aryan and write music deemed to promote Nazi ideals, Germany in the 1930s was no place for composers. It certainly wasn’t for Karl Amadeus Hartmann, whose opera “Simplicius Simplicissimus” was begun just after Hitler came to power, had no chance of performance in the Third Reich and, despite occasional postwar productions, languished at the margins of the repertoire. Hence its very belated British premiere last week at Sadler’s Wells, in a staging by the young director Polly Graham, designed by Nate Gibson, and conducted by the new-music specialist Timothy Redmond.
2016-11-17.headline_main: Review: An Anti-Nazi Protest in the Guise of Opera

2016-11-17.headline_main: Intensified by Climate Change, ‘King Tides’ Change Ways of Life in Florida

2016-11-17.abstract: A Parisian cool kid, Antoinette Poisson launches a series of new collaborations.
2016-11-17.snippet: A Parisian cool kid, Antoinette Poisson launches a series of new collaborations.
2016-11-17.lead_paragraph: Antoinette Poisson, the Parisian purveyor of spectacular handmade wallpaper, got its start when conservationists Julie Stordiau, Vincent Farelly and Jean-Baptiste Martin were renovating an 18th-century house in Auvergne and stumbled upon domino papers, or poster-size swatches that can be pieced together on the wall. With the goal of bringing back this largely forgotten process, the three friends opened for business in 2012, in a bare-bones studio in Paris’s 11th Arrondissement.
2016-11-17.headline_main: From Wallpaper to Printed Journals and Candles

2016-11-17.abstract: Britain pardons men it once imprisoned for gay acts — and highlights the injustice of its detention policy for migrants today.
2016-11-17.snippet: Britain pardons men it once imprisoned for gay acts — and highlights the injustice of its detention policy for migrants today.
2016-11-17.lead_paragraph: LONDON — Just days after the British government announced posthumous pardons for men convicted of homosexual acts, I sat in the chapel of Reading Prison, where Oscar Wilde was incarcerated from 1895 to 1897. I was listening to the stage and screen actor Maxine Peake read from “De Profundis,” the 50,000-word letter Wilde wrote from his cell to his lover, Lord Alfred “Bosie” Douglas.
2016-11-17.headline_main: Oscar Wilde, a Refugee of His Time

2016-11-17.abstract: “Dragging the terrible thing into the light can strip it of its potency.”
2016-11-17.snippet: “Dragging the terrible thing into the light can strip it of its potency.”
2016-11-17.lead_paragraph: I was 19 and had fallen in love. He was a grad student who lived in a long, narrow apartment with a room devoted solely to books. I didn’t live there with him, but my toothbrush did. I lived in a dorm a 10-minute drive away, but he and I hardly spent a night apart. When I’d finished my work for the day, he’d pick me up at the back gate of my dorm. I always ran to his car, because it was cold and because walking would not get me to him fast enough. This was first love, the real thing, the full symphony.
2016-11-17.headline_main: Zoe Kazan on Overcoming an Eating Disorder

2016-11-17.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — An automated army of pro-Donald J. Trump chatbots overwhelmed similar programs supporting Hillary Clinton five to one in the days leading up to the presidential election, according to a report published Thursday by researchers at Oxford University.
2016-11-17.headline_main: Automated Pro-Trump Bots Overwhelmed Pro-Clinton Messages, Researchers Say

2016-11-17.abstract: The right public works projects can send a message of inclusion and pride. If Donald Trump is ready to take a cue from F.D.R., here are some places to start.
2016-11-17.snippet: The right public works projects can send a message of inclusion and pride. If Donald Trump is ready to take a cue from F.D.R., here are some places to start.
2016-11-17.lead_paragraph: Here’s how President-elect Trump could unify a bitterly divided America, provide well-paying jobs to many of the millions of disaffected workers who voted for him, and lift the economy, stock market and tax rolls.
2016-11-17.headline_main: Trump-Size Idea for a New President: Build Something Inspiring

2016-11-17.abstract: Immerse yourself in a 360-degree experience directed by Luca Guadagnino, best viewed on a smartphone with a Google Cardboard or a Daydream View.
2016-11-17.snippet: Immerse yourself in a 360-degree experience directed by Luca Guadagnino, best viewed on a smartphone with a Google Cardboard or a Daydream View.
2016-11-17.lead_paragraph: Download the NYT VR app to be transported into one day in the life of a New York-based contemporary artist.
2016-11-17.headline_main: The Creators: Rob Pruitt

2016-11-17.abstract: Judges must stop relying solely on flawed police arrest reports when determining bail.
2016-11-17.snippet: Judges must stop relying solely on flawed police arrest reports when determining bail.
2016-11-17.lead_paragraph: BALTIMORE — Increased scrutiny of this city’s justice system has now expanded to include its sky-high bail amounts. Those accused of a crime may spend months in jail because they were assessed bail far beyond their means, even though nearly 45 percent of all misdemeanor and 30 percent of all felony cases here are ultimately dismissed.
2016-11-17.headline_main: Bail Reform Begins with the Bench

2016-11-17.abstract: There are few people better qualified to remind us of what democracy really looks like than John Lewis, the Georgia congressman, civil rights icon and author of a graphic memoir called “March.”
2016-11-17.snippet: There are few people better qualified to remind us of what democracy really looks like than John Lewis, the Georgia congressman, civil rights icon and author of a graphic memoir called “March.”
2016-11-17.lead_paragraph: MARCH TRILOGYBy John Lewis, Andrew Aydin and Nate PowellIllustrated. 560 pp. Top Shelf Productions. $49.99.
2016-11-17.headline_main: John Lewis’s National Book Award-Winning Graphic Memoir on the Civil Rights Movement

2016-11-17.abstract: Merging civilian and military trauma care would benefit doctors and patients alike.
2016-11-17.snippet: Merging civilian and military trauma care would benefit doctors and patients alike.
2016-11-17.lead_paragraph: Like anyone living in Boston in the spring of 2013, I remember where I was when I heard that bombs had gone off at the Boston Marathon finish line on Patriots’ Day, April 15. Three people, including an 8-year-old boy, were killed instantly. More than 260 were injured, many critically — bodies crushed, limbs shattered, arteries severed.
2016-11-17.headline_main: Lessons From the Battlefield

2016-11-17.abstract: From the archives of The International Herald Tribune: General Falkenhayn pressed his offensive in Transylvania, but the Romanians resisted, in November 1916.
2016-11-17.snippet: From the archives of The International Herald Tribune: General Falkenhayn pressed his offensive in Transylvania, but the Romanians resisted, in November 1916.
2016-11-17.lead_paragraph: Although General Falkenhayn is pressing his offensive in Transylvania and has gained a few local successes in some of the frontier passes, there is every reason to believe that the Roumanian military situation is steadily improving.
2016-11-17.headline_main: 1916: Romanian Troops Resist Offensive

2016-11-17.abstract: Gary Tanner, the former Valeant executive, entered into a secret relationship with Philidor’s chief executive, Andrew Davenport, federal authorities said.
2016-11-17.snippet: Gary Tanner, the former Valeant executive, entered into a secret relationship with Philidor’s chief executive, Andrew Davenport, federal authorities said.
2016-11-17.lead_paragraph: A secret relationship had made the two men rich: one, the head of a mail-order pharmacy, the other, an executive at a major pharmaceutical company who had promised to funnel millions of dollars to his partner in exchange for receiving millions of his own.
2016-11-17.headline_main: Former Drug Industry Executives Charged in Kickback Scheme

2016-11-17.abstract: California Craft meets Japanese Minimalism in the house that the sculptor built.

2016-11-17.abstract: The late craftsman J.B. Blunk built his Marin County cabin by hand: a holistic expression of an artistic life.
2016-11-17.snippet: The late craftsman J.B. Blunk built his Marin County cabin by hand: a holistic expression of an artistic life.
2016-11-17.lead_paragraph: IN THE SLEEPY Marin County town of Inverness, on a remote wooded ridge that overlooks the wide blue sweep of the Tomales Bay, sits a modest, low-slung redwood cabin that the late multidisciplinary artist-craftsman J.B. Blunk built entirely by hand.
2016-11-17.headline_main: A Little House in the Big Woods

2016-11-17.abstract: A prominent supporter cited World War II-era internment camps as a “precedent” for an immigrant registry suggested by a member of Mr. Trump’s transition team.
2016-11-17.snippet: A prominent supporter cited World War II-era internment camps as a “precedent” for an immigrant registry suggested by a member of Mr. Trump’s transition team.
2016-11-17.lead_paragraph: A prominent supporter of Donald J. Trump drew concern and condemnation from advocates for Muslims’ rights on Wednesday after he cited World War II-era Japanese-American internment camps as a “precedent” for an immigrant registry suggested by a member of the president-elect’s transition team.
2016-11-17.headline_main: Trump Camp’s Talk of Registry and Japanese Internment Raises Muslims’ Fears

2016-11-17.abstract: Alexandra Hirsch and Brady Donnelly did not go looking for bells and whistles. But having seen them, they were all in.
2016-11-17.snippet: Alexandra Hirsch and Brady Donnelly did not go looking for bells and whistles. But having seen them, they were all in.
2016-11-17.lead_paragraph: Three years ago, Alexandra Hirsch moved to Greenpoint, Brooklyn, taking in a friend as a roommate. The sunny two-bedroom was nicely redone inside. “It was stereotypically perfect Brooklyn,” she said.
2016-11-17.headline_main: A Gowanus Rental Charms With Amenities

2016-11-17.abstract: The case centers on JPMorgan’s hiring practices in China, where it is accused of hiring the children of Chinese leaders to win business there.
2016-11-17.snippet: The case centers on JPMorgan’s hiring practices in China, where it is accused of hiring the children of Chinese leaders to win business there.
2016-11-17.lead_paragraph: Vying for lucrative deals in China, JPMorgan Chase deployed all the usual wining-and-dining tactics that big banks use to woo clients. JPMorgan, federal authorities now say, also had ways of sweetening the deal that crossed a legal line.
2016-11-17.headline_main: JPMorgan Chase to Pay $264 Million to Settle Foreign Bribery Case

2016-11-17.abstract: Hollywood’s Mr. Nice Guy is honored, with speeches by Steve Martin and Emma Watson, among others.
2016-11-17.snippet: Hollywood’s Mr. Nice Guy is honored, with speeches by Steve Martin and Emma Watson, among others.
2016-11-17.lead_paragraph: The monochromatic labyrinth that is the Museum of Modern Art isn’t particularly known to give visitors the warm fuzzies, but on Tuesday night, the space echoed with resounding positivity.
2016-11-17.headline_main: A Salute to Tom Hanks at the MoMA Film Benefit

2016-11-17.abstract: Spurred by rising demand for the fruit, farmers in the Mexican state that hosts the annual butterfly migration are replacing a vital forest habitat with orchards.
2016-11-17.snippet: Spurred by rising demand for the fruit, farmers in the Mexican state that hosts the annual butterfly migration are replacing a vital forest habitat with orchards.
2016-11-17.lead_paragraph: APÚTZIO DE JUÁREZ, Mexico — The green volcanic hills that tower above Apútzio de Juárez have begun to fill with swarms of monarch butterflies,  which return each year for the winter stretch of their celebrated — and imperiled — migration.
2016-11-17.headline_main: Avocados Imperil Monarch Butterflies’ Winter Home in Mexico

2016-11-17.abstract: Leaders in the country’s capital may be terrified, but on the Russian border people hope Donald J. Trump can lower tensions between Washington and Moscow.
2016-11-17.snippet: Leaders in the country’s capital may be terrified, but on the Russian border people hope Donald J. Trump can lower tensions between Washington and Moscow.
2016-11-17.lead_paragraph: NARVA, Estonia — Barely a few hundred yards inside NATO’s jittery eastern border with Russia, a high school teacher asked students in his social studies class this week to address a topic of paramount importance for their future: the election of Donald J. Trump as the next president of the United States.
2016-11-17.headline_main: In Estonia, Caution but Surprising Cheers for Trump’s Victory

2016-11-17.abstract: Some actors are pursuing audiences where they believe they are staying.
2016-11-17.snippet: Some actors are pursuing audiences where they believe they are staying.
2016-11-17.lead_paragraph: The fashionable notion that television is better than ever and that cinema or film is battling in vain to maintain relevance is, depending on where you sit, either a potent truth or a spectacularly tedious kernel of received nonwisdom. The fact that popular streaming video services are now investing hefty sums in the creation of content in formats that fit comfortably into commonly accepted notions of TV (varied series in half-hour and full-hour episodes) and motion pictures (self-contained features averaging two hours) puts a new spin on the debate.
2016-11-17.headline_main: Actors Flock to Netflix to Satisfy Their Most Loyal Fans

2016-11-17.lead_paragraph: THURSDAY, NOVEMBER 17, 2016 — The New York Times is happy to announce the launch of The New York Times Crossword app for Android users, available for download in the Google Play Store.
2016-11-17.headline_main: The New York Times Launches the Android App for Crosswords

2016-11-17.abstract: Olivia Wendel’s first six pieces were adapted from her own black and white paintings — and launch today.
2016-11-17.snippet: Olivia Wendel’s first six pieces were adapted from her own black and white paintings — and launch today.
2016-11-17.lead_paragraph: Last week, the designer Olivia Wendel yanked open the door to the Bushwick, Brooklyn, building where she lives and works, and smoothed her white blouse, printed with muddy-looking flowers — a gift from her sisters. “They always find what end up being my favorite things, and this vintage top is one of them,” Wendel, 29, says later, ensconced on her couch across from her debut collection of scarves. “Very early on in my designing process, I would think specifically of Lilly and Zoë, and what I could get them to wear.”
2016-11-17.headline_main: Painterly Scarves That Celebrate the Female Form

2016-11-17.abstract: “A.H.S.” has always been polarizing, and critics are divided on whether the episode brought “Roanoke” to a satisfying end.
2016-11-17.snippet: “A.H.S.” has always been polarizing, and critics are divided on whether the episode brought “Roanoke” to a satisfying end.
2016-11-17.lead_paragraph: “American Horror Story” creator Ryan Murphy wasn’t kidding when he casually mentioned, weeks before the premiere of Season 6, that the seasons in his anthology horror series are all connected. Wednesday night’s finale not only culminated the show’s meta-commentary on celebrity, violence and television, it also served as the final piece tying together all six of its seasons. “A.H.S.” has always been a polarizing series, and critics are divided on whether the high-concept episode brought “Roanoke” to a satisfying end.
2016-11-17.headline_main: What You Should Read About the ‘American Horror Story: Roanoke’ Finale

2016-11-17.abstract: The Cadenza does not offer the indulgences of German cars, but it looks rich at a nonrich price, staring at about $33,000.
2016-11-17.snippet: The Cadenza does not offer the indulgences of German cars, but it looks rich at a nonrich price, staring at about $33,000.
2016-11-17.lead_paragraph: We make deliberate choices when buying things. Shopping for a wallet recently, I briefly considered a devastatingly gorgeous Burberry billfold. However, the outlay would have left me with little money to put into it. Oh, the irony. I opted for something similar but far more affordable.
2016-11-17.headline_main: Video Review: Kia Cadenza Offers Budget-Minded Pampering

2016-11-17.abstract: Bills quarterback Tyrod Taylor has a favorable matchup in the Bengals; playing receiver DeAndre Hopkins is worth the risk.
2016-11-17.snippet: Bills quarterback Tyrod Taylor has a favorable matchup in the Bengals; playing receiver DeAndre Hopkins is worth the risk.
2016-11-17.lead_paragraph: The Sablich brothers have provided award-winning fantasy football advice for The New York Times since 2010. See their weekly player rankings and visit 5thDownFantasy.com for more fantasy analysis. You can also ask them questions through their Twitter account, @5thdownfantasy.
2016-11-17.headline_main: Fantasy Football: Players to Start in Week 11

2016-11-17.abstract: The film, written and directed by Kenneth Lonergan and starring Casey Affleck, finds a man quietly dealing with tragedies.
2016-11-17.snippet: The film, written and directed by Kenneth Lonergan and starring Casey Affleck, finds a man quietly dealing with tragedies.
2016-11-17.lead_paragraph: In each of the three movies Kenneth Lonergan has directed, characters move through their everyday lives under the shadow of death. The brother and sister played by Mark Ruffalo and Laura Linney in “You Can Count on Me” (2000) had, when they were children, lost their parents in a car crash, a trauma that rippled unspoken beneath their mundane adult interactions. The coming-of-age of Lisa Cohen, the New York teenager (Anna Paquin) at the center of “Margaret” (2011), was complicated by a fatal bus accident and colored by the aftermath of the Sept. 11 terrorist attacks.
2016-11-17.headline_main: Review: ‘Manchester by the Sea’ and the Tides of Grief

2016-11-17.abstract: Federal prosecutors, the S.E.C. and the Federal Reserve accused JPMorgan Chase of a vast foreign bribery scheme in China that may have spread to a number of Wall Street banks.
2016-11-17.snippet: Federal prosecutors, the S.E.C. and the Federal Reserve accused JPMorgan Chase of a vast foreign bribery scheme in China that may have spread to a number of Wall Street banks.

2016-11-17.snippet: Home videos and other clips can be copied off the tablet and recorded onto a disc for watching on a standard DVD player.
2016-11-17.lead_paragraph: Q. When I retired from teaching, the school made a lovely tribute movie on an iPad. I would love a copy of the movie as a keepsake, but no one can figure out how to make a DVD for me. Can you help?
2016-11-17.headline_main: Turn an iPad-Made Movie Into a DVD

2016-11-17.abstract: The reality series, among the most popular on cable television, will end after its 11th season in April, the family announced.

2016-11-17.headline_main: ‘Duck Dynasty’ to End Its Run on A&E in 2017

2016-11-17.abstract: For nearly a decade, more women runners have been crossing the finish line than men. Here we address the big and small challenges of running while female. Grab the sports bra, lace up your sneakers and let’s hit the road.

2016-11-17.abstract: The hunt for great tamales ends at this small restaurant in Sunset Park, Brooklyn.
2016-11-17.snippet: The hunt for great tamales ends at this small restaurant in Sunset Park, Brooklyn.
2016-11-17.lead_paragraph: The hunt for great tamales ends at this small restaurant in Sunset Park, Brooklyn.
2016-11-17.headline_main: Alimentos Saludables

2016-11-17.abstract: Pulled out of their corn husks, the tamales at this tiny restaurant in Sunset Park, Brooklyn, almost seem to breathe.
2016-11-17.snippet: Pulled out of their corn husks, the tamales at this tiny restaurant in Sunset Park, Brooklyn, almost seem to breathe.
2016-11-17.lead_paragraph: In pursuit of tamales, I have lurked outside Roman Catholic churches after Spanish Mass and chased down ladies pushing blue coolers in shopping carts along the street. Even a run-of-the-mill tamale can be a glorious thing, the musty-sweet essence of corn fortified by lard and chicken broth, the sheath of corn husks impressing some lost scent of summer.
2016-11-17.headline_main: Tamales, for Many Meals and Courses, at Alimentos Saludables

2016-11-17.abstract: It’s been a tough week for Mark Zuckerberg’s company. First it was fake news complaints; now it’s acknowledging bad user metrics. Neither is good.
2016-11-17.snippet: It’s been a tough week for Mark Zuckerberg’s company. First it was fake news complaints; now it’s acknowledging bad user metrics. Neither is good.

2016-11-17.headline_main: Daily Report: Facebook Does Some Explaining on Metrics

2016-11-17.abstract: Ms. Streisand, who vowed to leave the country if Donald Trump won the election, will be there in April; Alejandro G. Iñárritu is also on the lineup.
2016-11-17.snippet: Ms. Streisand, who vowed to leave the country if Donald Trump won the election, will be there in April; Alejandro G. Iñárritu is also on the lineup.
2016-11-17.lead_paragraph: Barbra Streisand counts among the luminaries who vowed to leave the United States if Donald J. Trump won the presidential election. But next April, at the very least, she will be in New York, interviewed onstage at the Tribeca Film Festival.
2016-11-17.headline_main: Barbra Streisand’s Not Leaving Yet; Set to Appear at Tribeca Talks

2016-11-17.abstract: Al Qaeda’s Syria affiliate has rebranded, claiming it’s not a threat. And a cleric accused of being in the group’s inner circle insists he’s “independent.”
2016-11-17.snippet: Al Qaeda’s Syria affiliate has rebranded, claiming it’s not a threat. And a cleric accused of being in the group’s inner circle insists he’s “independent.”
2016-11-17.lead_paragraph: American officials accuse him of being part of the “inner leadership circle” of Al Qaeda’s Syrian affiliate, most widely known as the Nusra Front, and of raising as much as $5 million for the terrorist group while signing up thousands of fighters.
2016-11-17.headline_main: Protest of U.S. Terror Listing Offers a Glimpse at Qaeda Strategy

2016-11-17.abstract: A new feature allows you to use the simulator backward, to see who will finish last and secure the No. 1 draft pick.
2016-11-17.snippet: A new feature allows you to use the simulator backward, to see who will finish last and secure the No. 1 draft pick.
2016-11-17.lead_paragraph: How can my team make the N.F.L. playoffs? It’s a simple question, but answering it can be devilishly complicated. At this point in the season, when teams have six or seven games remaining, the playoff picture is delightfully foggy.
2016-11-17.headline_main: The New York Times N.F.L. Playoff Simulator (3rd Annual)
