2016-11-19.abstract: John Ricco, the team’s assistant general manager since 2004, has moved up the ranks by advising executives on navigating baseball’s rules and contracts.
2016-11-19.snippet: John Ricco, the team’s assistant general manager since 2004, has moved up the ranks by advising executives on navigating baseball’s rules and contracts.
2016-11-19.lead_paragraph: Two days before the start of last year’s winter meetings, Major League Baseball’s annual convention, the Mets announced that General Manager Sandy Alderson could not attend the event in Nashville because he was dealing with a treatable form of cancer.
2016-11-19.headline_main: The Mets Middleman Who’s Always on Call

2016-11-19.abstract: Mary Lou Guizzo and Jeff Chen make it a fun puzzle solve.
2016-11-19.snippet: Mary Lou Guizzo and Jeff Chen make it a fun puzzle solve.
2016-11-19.lead_paragraph: SATURDAY PUZZLE — Most people who solve The New York Times Crossword at all know that the hardest day of the week is the Saturday puzzle. Thursday crosswords usually have a trick, but the clues are not necessarily ramped up like those in a Saturday puzzle. Friday’s are the other themeless day of the week, but there is a bit of grace built in to make it ultimately solvable.
2016-11-19.headline_main: Hardly a Piece of Cake

2016-11-19.abstract: Once again, President-elect Trump has chosen a top official with a history of racism and bigotry.
2016-11-19.snippet: Once again, President-elect Trump has chosen a top official with a history of racism and bigotry.
2016-11-19.lead_paragraph: In 1986, President Ronald Reagan nominated Jeff Sessions, then a United States attorney from Alabama, to be a federal judge. The Republican-controlled Senate rejected Mr. Sessions out of concern, based on devastating testimony by former colleagues, that he was a racist.
2016-11-19.headline_main: Jeff Sessions as Attorney General: An Insult to Justice

2016-11-19.abstract: They were arrested a year ago in Haiti and charged with conspiring to transport more than 1,700 pounds of cocaine to the United States.
2016-11-19.snippet: They were arrested a year ago in Haiti and charged with conspiring to transport more than 1,700 pounds of cocaine to the United States.
2016-11-19.lead_paragraph: Two nephews of Venezuela’s first lady were convicted in Manhattan on Friday of conspiring to transport cocaine to the United States.
2016-11-19.headline_main: 2 Nephews of Venezuela’s First Lady Convicted on Drug Charges in U.S. Court

2016-11-19.abstract: The president-elect didn’t go far when he left Trump Tower to dine with his family on Tuesday: to the “21” Club, a stop on the see-and-be-seen circuit that has helped define his New York for decades.
2016-11-19.snippet: The president-elect didn’t go far when he left Trump Tower to dine with his family on Tuesday: to the “21” Club, a stop on the see-and-be-seen circuit that has helped define his New York for decades.
2016-11-19.lead_paragraph: When he ventured out of Trump Tower for a meal with his family on Tuesday, President-elect Donald J. Trump went to the “21” Club, a former speakeasy on West 52nd Street where cast-iron lawn jockeys line the balcony above the front door. It is all of four blocks from Trump Tower.
2016-11-19.headline_main: Donald Trump’s New York: The City of the ‘Bonfire of the Vanities’ Set

2016-11-19.abstract: The New York City Education Department recently told a group of parents and educators that it did not think their district was ready for a desegregation plan.
2016-11-19.snippet: The New York City Education Department recently told a group of parents and educators that it did not think their district was ready for a desegregation plan.
2016-11-19.lead_paragraph: While the New York City Education Department has been trying to persuade parents on the Upper West Side to accept a rezoning plan aimed, in part, at diversifying the neighborhood’s schools, it has told a group of Lower Manhattan parents that they must hold off on their desegregation plan.
2016-11-19.headline_main: In Lower Manhattan, a Move to Integrate Some Schools Is Delayed

2016-11-19.abstract: Ms. Jones recorded and performed at an unrelenting pace, and a documentary film chronicled her battle with pancreatic cancer.
2016-11-19.snippet: Ms. Jones recorded and performed at an unrelenting pace, and a documentary film chronicled her battle with pancreatic cancer.
2016-11-19.lead_paragraph: Sharon Jones, the soul singer and powerful voice of the band the Dap-Kings, died on Friday of pancreatic cancer that had been in remission but returned last year. She was 60.
2016-11-19.headline_main: Sharon Jones, Powerful Voice of Soul With the Dap-Kings, Dies at 60

2016-11-19.abstract: He is likely to encourage President-elect Donald Trump’s worst impulses and fuel his suspicion of Muslims.
2016-11-19.snippet: He is likely to encourage President-elect Donald Trump’s worst impulses and fuel his suspicion of Muslims.
2016-11-19.lead_paragraph: Of all the disturbing scenes in the presidential campaign, the Republican Convention speech by retired Lt. Gen. Michael Flynn stood out. During a fiery address in which he lamented the decline of American exceptionalism and lambasted the Democratic nominee, Hillary Clinton, General  Flynn joined the crowd in chants of “lock her up!” Smiling slyly, he shouted: “Yeah, that’s right, lock her up!”
2016-11-19.headline_main: Michael Flynn: An Alarming Pick for National Security Adviser

2016-11-19.abstract: For an inside track on the new administration, ask a golfer.
2016-11-19.snippet: For an inside track on the new administration, ask a golfer.
2016-11-19.lead_paragraph: Today, Donald Trump as diplomat. We’re not talking about the big stuff, like his ominous national security appointments — I know you’ve had a hard week. Let’s take it easy and just look at his phone calls with heads of state.
2016-11-19.headline_main: Oh, No! Donald Trump’s Calling

2016-11-19.abstract: We give the country cheap energy. We get poisoned water in return.
2016-11-19.snippet: We give the country cheap energy. We get poisoned water in return.
2016-11-19.lead_paragraph: CULLOWHEE, N.C. — In a year dominated by political frenzy, the water crisis in Flint, Mich., was one of the few stories to grab the headlines away from the presidential race. Pallets of bottled water were donated. Celebrities ran fund-raisers. Congressmen grilled the mayor and the governor, demanding to know how they could let their citizens drink poisoned water. A handwritten warning posted above a drinking fountain became a national disgrace.
2016-11-19.headline_main: Appalachia’s Sacrifice

2016-11-19.abstract: The polls were off and so were my predictions. What can we do about it?
2016-11-19.snippet: The polls were off and so were my predictions. What can we do about it?
2016-11-19.lead_paragraph: LAST weekend I ate a cricket on national television. Based on my statistical analysis of presidential polls, I made a bet that if Donald J. Trump won  more than 240 Electoral College votes, I would chow down. Like millions of voters in both parties, I was surprised by the outcome. As a consolation, I’d like to learn what went wrong — and to figure out how pollsters might do better when they puzzle over our polarized electorate.
2016-11-19.headline_main: Why I Had to Eat a Bug on CNN

2016-11-19.abstract: A group of foreign reformers was not able to change things, but the issue of officials getting rich at the public’s expense is still front and center.
2016-11-19.snippet: A group of foreign reformers was not able to change things, but the issue of officials getting rich at the public’s expense is still front and center.
2016-11-19.lead_paragraph: The whole saga of Mikheil Saakashvili, the former president of Georgia, showing up in Ukraine as the corruption-fighting governor of Odessa has been a curious one, as was his resignation last week with a loud flurry of attacks  on the resistance of the country’s leadership to reform. He also announced that he was forming a new Ukrainian political party. Setting aside Mr. Saakashvili’s political ambitions, the episode once again cast light on the tenacity of Ukraine’s culture of corruption.
2016-11-19.headline_main: Ukraine’s Imported Corruption Busters

2016-11-19.abstract: Dr. West, a provocative scholar whose searing critiques of President Obama earned him the enmity of many Democrats, left Harvard in 2002.
2016-11-19.snippet: Dr. West, a provocative scholar whose searing critiques of President Obama earned him the enmity of many Democrats, left Harvard in 2002.
2016-11-19.lead_paragraph: CAMBRIDGE, Mass. — Cornel West, the fiery African-American scholar who broke with Harvard University 14 years ago and whose searing critiques of President Obama earned him the enmity of many on the left, has been invited back to the university to teach.
2016-11-19.headline_main: Cornel West Will Return to Teach at Harvard

2016-11-19.abstract: It’s true that the Supreme Court’s infamous 1944 Japanese internment decision hasn’t been overturned. But that’s not what matters.
2016-11-19.snippet: It’s true that the Supreme Court’s infamous 1944 Japanese internment decision hasn’t been overturned. But that’s not what matters.
2016-11-19.lead_paragraph: The Supreme Court’s infamous 1944 Japanese internment decision, Korematsu v. United States, has never been overturned. But does that mean, as some of Donald J. Trump’s associates have recently implied, that it is still good law, a precedent that could be cited in support of a national registry for Muslim immigrants or other morally repugnant classification schemes?
2016-11-19.headline_main: Why Korematsu Is Not a Precedent

2016-11-19.abstract: Mike Pence attended the musical Friday, and an actor delivered a statement to the vice president-elect, drawing a sharp rebuke from Donald Trump.
2016-11-19.snippet: Mike Pence attended the musical Friday, and an actor delivered a statement to the vice president-elect, drawing a sharp rebuke from Donald Trump.
2016-11-19.lead_paragraph: “Hamilton,” the hit Broadway musical about colonial rebels shaping the future of an unformed country, took an even more political turn at the end of its performance on Friday night.
2016-11-19.headline_main: ‘Hamilton’ Had Some Unscripted Lines for Pence. Trump Wasn’t Happy.

2016-11-19.abstract: “Race” traces the footsteps of the runner Jesse Owens to his performance at the Berlin Olympics. And Kristen Wiig hosts “S.N.L.” for the second time.
2016-11-19.snippet: “Race” traces the footsteps of the runner Jesse Owens to his performance at the Berlin Olympics. And Kristen Wiig hosts “S.N.L.” for the second time.
2016-11-19.lead_paragraph: “Race” traces the footsteps of the Olympic runner Jesse Owens. Kristen Wiig hosts “S.N.L.” for the second time. And Sally Hawkins giggles her way through “Happy-Go-Lucky,” part of a tribute to the director Mike Leigh.
2016-11-19.headline_main: What’s on TV Saturday: ‘Race,’ and Kristen Wiig hosts ‘S.N.L.’

2016-11-19.abstract: On Friday night, Mike Pence attended the Broadway musical in New York. After the performance, the actor Brandon Victor Dixon delivered a message to the vice president-elect.
2016-11-19.snippet: On Friday night, Mike Pence attended the Broadway musical in New York. After the performance, the actor Brandon Victor Dixon delivered a message to the vice president-elect.
2016-11-19.lead_paragraph: On Friday night, Mike Pence attended the Broadway musical in New York. After the performance, the actor Brandon Victor Dixon delivered a message to the vice president-elect.

2016-11-19.abstract: Now you’re really going to see what a rigged election looks like.
2016-11-19.snippet: Now you’re really going to see what a rigged election looks like.
2016-11-19.lead_paragraph: In June 2013, the Supreme Court ruled in Shelby County v. Holder that states with a long history of racial discrimination no longer needed to approve any proposed changes to their voting procedures with the federal government, as had long been required under the Voting Rights Act. That meant this year’s presidential election was the first in 50 years without the full protections of the act.
2016-11-19.headline_main: Voting Rights in the Age of Trump

2016-11-19.abstract: Republicans who were part of the opposition to Donald J. Trump have begun to ponder the future of a conservative movement they thought they understood better.
2016-11-19.snippet: Republicans who were part of the opposition to Donald J. Trump have begun to ponder the future of a conservative movement they thought they understood better.
2016-11-19.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — If they squint hard enough, they can see hope in the form of an ambitious piece of legislation like a big tax cut. Then there is the fact that Hillary Clinton will not be president. And Mike Pence, the faithfully conservative vice president-elect, is there to keep watch.
2016-11-19.headline_main: ‘Never Trump’ Stalwarts Try to Focus on Policy, Not the Man

2016-11-19.abstract: The Chinese buyer of Aixtron is asking President Obama to rule directly after a U.S. advisory panel recommended he block the deal.
2016-11-19.snippet: The Chinese buyer of Aixtron is asking President Obama to rule directly after a U.S. advisory panel recommended he block the deal.
2016-11-19.lead_paragraph: HONG KONG — A Chinese company is setting up a rare and potentially tone-setting showdown with the American government over its deal to buy a high-tech firm that the United States says could impact national security.
2016-11-19.headline_main: Showdown Looms as U.S. Questions Chinese Deal for German Chip Designer

2016-11-19.abstract: In a Facebook post Friday, Mr. Zuckerberg said the company was considering third-party verification, better automated detection and simpler ways to flag suspicious content.
2016-11-19.snippet: In a Facebook post Friday, Mr. Zuckerberg said the company was considering third-party verification, better automated detection and simpler ways to flag suspicious content.
2016-11-19.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — After more than a week of accusations that the spread of fake news on Facebook may have affected the outcome of the presidential election, Mark Zuckerberg published a detailed post Friday night describing ways the company was considering dealing with the problem.
2016-11-19.headline_main: Facebook Considering Ways to Combat Fake News, Mark Zuckerberg Says

2016-11-19.abstract: Our Top 10 Comments of the Week: Readers debate the mechanics of the Trump transition, women’s gestures of political solidarity and athlete activism.
2016-11-19.snippet: Our Top 10 Comments of the Week: Readers debate the mechanics of the Trump transition, women’s gestures of political solidarity and athlete activism.

2016-11-19.headline_main: ‘This Election Changed My Mind About America’

2016-11-19.abstract: Explore Doug Aitken’s underwater sculptures, accessible only to scuba divers off the coast of Catalina Island in California.

2016-11-19.abstract: The neighborhood is where monumental, white-stone Washington intersects with a quirky village.
2016-11-19.snippet: The neighborhood is where monumental, white-stone Washington intersects with a quirky village.
2016-11-19.lead_paragraph: The neighborhood is where monumental, white-stone Washington intersects with a quirky village.
2016-11-19.headline_main: Living in the Capitol Hill Historic District, Washington, D.C.

2016-11-19.abstract: Neighboring Congress and the Supreme Court, the historic district is where monumental, white-stone Washington intersects with a quirky, lush village.
2016-11-19.snippet: Neighboring Congress and the Supreme Court, the historic district is where monumental, white-stone Washington intersects with a quirky, lush village.
2016-11-19.lead_paragraph: For Meaghan Hannan Davant, Capitol Hill is not the throbbing, recently convulsed heart of political power in Washington, D.C., but an unpretentious small town. “People don’t wear makeup,” said Ms. Davant, a 39-year-old lawyer, who has been living in the Capitol Hill Historic District since 2006. “They wear yoga pants and drive Honda Odysseys. We do walk down the streets and see the newscasters and senators, but they’re in their sweatpants, just like us.”
2016-11-19.headline_main: Capitol Hill Historic District, Washington, D.C.: Surprisingly Homey

2016-11-19.abstract: Vaccines usually take a decade or more to develop, but researchers say a Zika vaccine could be available as early as 2018, thanks in part to experimental DNA technology.
2016-11-19.snippet: Vaccines usually take a decade or more to develop, but researchers say a Zika vaccine could be available as early as 2018, thanks in part to experimental DNA technology.
2016-11-19.lead_paragraph: MADISON, Wis. — The Zika virus thrives in tropical climates. But it is also growing in this cold-weather city — up a flight of stairs, past a flier for lunchtime yoga and behind a locked door. That is where scientists working in a lab for Takeda, the Japanese drug company, inspect and test vials of the virus.
2016-11-19.headline_main: The Race for a Zika Vaccine

2016-11-19.abstract: The internationally celebrated video artist has created a work meant to be experienced underwater: three mirror-lined pavilions off the California coast, submerged in depths of 10 to 40 feet.
2016-11-19.snippet: The internationally celebrated video artist has created a work meant to be experienced underwater: three mirror-lined pavilions off the California coast, submerged in depths of 10 to 40 feet.
2016-11-19.lead_paragraph: OFF THE COAST OF CATALINA ISLAND — At first, the fish avoided the intruder. A couple of beefy sheepshead hid in the kelp near the shore. The electric orange Garibaldi swam in the other direction. A small school of blacksmith darted away.
2016-11-19.headline_main: Move Over, Neptune. Doug Aitken Has Another Big Idea.

2016-11-19.abstract: “Hair,” a study by the photographer Émilie Régnier, chronicles popular looks, influenced by Beyoncé and Rihanna, in the hair salons of Abidjan.
2016-11-19.snippet: “Hair,” a study by the photographer Émilie Régnier, chronicles popular looks, influenced by Beyoncé and Rihanna, in the hair salons of Abidjan.
2016-11-19.lead_paragraph: “Hair,” a study by the photographer Émilie Régnier, chronicles the various styles, some of them influenced by Beyoncé and Rihanna, in the city of Abidjan, Ivory Coast. Ms. Régnier made her portraits in the manner of the photographs she saw in the look books available to customers of the local hair salons.
2016-11-19.headline_main: Ivory Coast Style

2016-11-19.abstract: How parents fight back against their kids’ obsession with smartphones and social media.
2016-11-19.snippet: How parents fight back against their kids’ obsession with smartphones and social media.
2016-11-19.lead_paragraph: In the Broadway classic “The Music Man,” set in 1912, the con artist Harold Hill shows up in River City, Iowa, and attempts to persuade the otherwise contented townspeople that their youth are slipping into degradation. He singles out a billiard parlor, “the devil’s playground,” as the root.
2016-11-19.headline_main: When Tech Is a Problem Child

2016-11-19.abstract: Climate change has already complicated elite ski racing for several years as reduced snow has forced the cancellation or relocation of some events.
2016-11-19.snippet: Climate change has already complicated elite ski racing for several years as reduced snow has forced the cancellation or relocation of some events.
2016-11-19.lead_paragraph: KILLINGTON, Vt. — For the last 25 years, the World Cup of skiing has spurned the Eastern United States, favoring instead the West and its more bountiful snow.
2016-11-19.headline_main: In Vermont’s Bid to Lure Pro Skiers, a Warm Welcome Is Unwanted

2016-11-19.snippet: Two approaches to collecting clothes are now on view in Michigan and at the Met.
2016-11-19.lead_paragraph: DEARBORN, MICH. — Three days into November, before the election cleaved the nation into Swiss cheese, red and blue were commingling in perfect harmony … on a silk gauze gown from 1856.
2016-11-19.headline_main: America’s Great Divide — About How to Archive Its Fashion

2016-11-19.abstract: The designer-director and the film presenter find common bonds over old movies, childhood influences and the perfectly buttoned suit.
2016-11-19.snippet: The designer-director and the film presenter find common bonds over old movies, childhood influences and the perfectly buttoned suit.
2016-11-19.lead_paragraph: WEST HOLLYWOOD, Calif. — Tom Ford was on the job as Ben Mankiewicz took a last look at himself before the photographer got to work. “Hair looks good; stubble looks good,” Mr. Ford said. “But you need to button your jacket on camera. Every time I watch you on TCM, your jacket is undone.”
2016-11-19.headline_main: Tom Ford, Ben Mankiewicz and a Fashion-Film Vortex

2016-11-19.abstract: The photographer Émilie Régnier chronicles popular looks, influenced by Beyoncé and Rihanna, in the hair salons of Abidjan, Ivory Coast.

2016-11-19.abstract: Want to get away for a bit? Here’s what to do to get the most out of a multiweek getaway.
2016-11-19.snippet: Want to get away for a bit? Here’s what to do to get the most out of a multiweek getaway.
2016-11-19.lead_paragraph: Having two or three weeks off for your next vacation is undoubtedly a luxury, but, depending on how you plan, the trip could be time well spent or wasted, according to Sam McClure, the owner of Small World Travel in Austin, Tex., who specializes in creating customized extended itineraries.
2016-11-19.headline_main: How to Plan an Extended Vacation

2016-11-19.abstract: Several organizers of the demonstration in Kuala Lumpur were arrested on the eve of the rally, in what rights advocates called an attempt to suppress turnout.
2016-11-19.snippet: Several organizers of the demonstration in Kuala Lumpur were arrested on the eve of the rally, in what rights advocates called an attempt to suppress turnout.
2016-11-19.lead_paragraph: Tens of thousands of people took to the streets of Kuala Lumpur, the capital of Malaysia, on Saturday to call for the resignation of Prime Minister Najib Razak, who is accused of taking $1 billion from a government investment fund.
2016-11-19.headline_main: Tens of Thousands of Protesters Call for Najib Razak, Malaysian Leader, to Resign

2016-11-19.abstract: A place to discuss the “A Little Variety” suite of puzzles.
2016-11-19.snippet: A place to discuss the “A Little Variety” suite of puzzles.
2016-11-19.lead_paragraph: VARIETY PUZZLES — This week’s puzzles include:
2016-11-19.headline_main: A Little Variety

2016-11-19.abstract: Life continues amid crumbling buildings and rubble in towns like Norcia, in Umbria. Since Aug. 24, the broader area has endured 28,500 earthquakes and aftershocks.
2016-11-19.snippet: Life continues amid crumbling buildings and rubble in towns like Norcia, in Umbria. Since Aug. 24, the broader area has endured 28,500 earthquakes and aftershocks.
2016-11-19.lead_paragraph: NORCIA, Italy — Over centuries, residents of this Umbrian city and its environs have grown accustomed to the ragged tempo of earthquakes in the mountainous region. Resilience is a point of local pride. But the quake that struck on Oct. 30, the strongest to hit Italy in 36 years, was drastically different. As Mayor Nicola Alemanno of Norcia put it, some quakes are “cataclysms that generate catastrophes.”
2016-11-19.headline_main: Italy’s Zone of Endless Shaking

2016-11-19.abstract: Sounds like investment, smells like ripoff.
2016-11-19.snippet: Sounds like investment, smells like ripoff.
2016-11-19.lead_paragraph: Trumpists are touting the idea of a big infrastructure build, and some Democrats are making conciliatory noises about working with the new regime on that front. But remember who you’re dealing with: if you invest anything with this guy, be it money or reputation, you are at great risk of being scammed. So, what do we know about the Trump infrastructure plan, such as it is?
2016-11-19.headline_main: Infrastructure Build or Privatization Scam?

2016-11-19.abstract: Facebook and Twitter faced fallout from the ways they had been used during the election, and Snapchat’s parent released video-recording glasses.
2016-11-19.snippet: Facebook and Twitter faced fallout from the ways they had been used during the election, and Snapchat’s parent released video-recording glasses.
2016-11-19.lead_paragraph: Each Saturday, Farhad Manjoo and Mike Isaac, technology reporters at The New York Times, review the week’s news, offering analysis and maybe a joke or two about the most important developments in the tech industry.
2016-11-19.headline_main: Farhad’s and Mike’s Week in Tech: Fake News, Trolls and Other Spectacles

2016-11-19.abstract: On climate change, refugees, Iran and the Cuba embargo, Donald J. Trump and his loyalists have positions at odds with the United Nations.
2016-11-19.snippet: On climate change, refugees, Iran and the Cuba embargo, Donald J. Trump and his loyalists have positions at odds with the United Nations.
2016-11-19.lead_paragraph: UNITED NATIONS — In the genteel, carpeted halls of the United Nations headquarters, a 20-minute walk from Trump Tower, diplomats from the world over are holding their breath about the American president-elect.
2016-11-19.headline_main: Donald Trump and the U.N.: Signs of Clashing Views on Many Issues

2016-11-19.abstract: New vigilance was propelled in part by concern that followers of an ultraconservative branch of Islam are trying to recruit among the many Muslims who arrived a year ago.
2016-11-19.snippet: New vigilance was propelled in part by concern that followers of an ultraconservative branch of Islam are trying to recruit among the many Muslims who arrived a year ago.
2016-11-19.lead_paragraph: HILDESHEIM, Germany — For years, the authorities in Germany have warily monitored the swelling ranks of Salafists, followers of an ultraconservative branch of Islam who are known for aggressive proselytizing and their sympathies for the Islamic State.
2016-11-19.headline_main: Germany Cracks Down on Salafists to Shield Refugees

2016-11-19.abstract: You might not like the idea of keeping the tub, but if you lose it, you will probably be in the minority.
2016-11-19.snippet: You might not like the idea of keeping the tub, but if you lose it, you will probably be in the minority.
2016-11-19.lead_paragraph: Q. My husband and I live in a 1,000-square-foot Junior 4  in the Riverdale section of the Bronx. We have one bathroom and are considering replacing the shower-and-tub combination with just a shower, because we almost never take baths. Without a tub, the bathroom would feel more open, but would removing it affect our resale value? And is this something we should worry about even if we do not plan to sell for many years?
2016-11-19.headline_main: Will Removing a Tub Affect Apartment Value?

2016-11-19.abstract: Europe’s right-wing populists are celebrating Donald J. Trump as a natural ally, but memories of Russian domination during the Soviet era remain raw in Poland.
2016-11-19.snippet: Europe’s right-wing populists are celebrating Donald J. Trump as a natural ally, but memories of Russian domination during the Soviet era remain raw in Poland.
2016-11-19.lead_paragraph: WARSAW — Europe’s right-wing populists have scrambled to outdo one another in celebrating Donald J. Trump as an American president who shares many of their nationalistic, anti-immigrant attitudes. Less thrilled are the hard-liners in Poland. And the problem is Vladimir V. Putin.
2016-11-19.headline_main: Enthusiasm for Trump in Poland Is Tempered by Distrust of Putin

2016-11-19.abstract: Ankara has paid attention to General Flynn’s full-throated support for Recep Tayyip Erdogan’s government, and its desire to extradite Fethullah Gulen.
2016-11-19.snippet: Ankara has paid attention to General Flynn’s full-throated support for Recep Tayyip Erdogan’s government, and its desire to extradite Fethullah Gulen.
2016-11-19.lead_paragraph: ISTANBUL — Lt. Gen. Michael T. Flynn, the designated national security adviser for the incoming Trump administration, once wrote on Twitter that it was “rational” to fear Muslims, but that does not seem likely to cause him any grief with Turkey’s government, even though it is led by a religiously conservative Muslim, Recep Tayyip Erdogan.
2016-11-19.headline_main: Turkey Cheered by Words of Michael Flynn, Trump’s Security Adviser

2016-11-19.abstract: The president-elect promised jobs, but market forces, automation and pollution concerns may block coal’s comeback.
2016-11-19.snippet: The president-elect promised jobs, but market forces, automation and pollution concerns may block coal’s comeback.
2016-11-19.lead_paragraph: Donald J. Trump made coal a centerpiece of his campaign, holding rousing rallies with miners in hard hats, who he said had been neglected under eight years of the Obama administration. The strategy paid off, helping him score crucial wins in Pennsylvania and Ohio.
2016-11-19.headline_main: A Bleak Outlook for Trump’s Promises to Coal Miners

2016-11-19.abstract: Squeezed by bad loans, Italian lenders are starving a weak economy of capital, which may keep the rest of Europe from regaining its economic vigor.
2016-11-19.snippet: Squeezed by bad loans, Italian lenders are starving a weak economy of capital, which may keep the rest of Europe from regaining its economic vigor.
2016-11-19.lead_paragraph: MILAN — Victor Massiah has grown weary of talk that the Italian banking system is so threadbare and stuffed with terrible loans that it threatens Europe with another financial crisis.
2016-11-19.headline_main: Italy’s Banks Are in a Slow-Motion Crisis. And Europe May Pay.

2016-11-19.abstract: Despite federal, state and city programs created to help rebuild damaged homes, the Rodriguez family and Elena Trama of Brooklyn
2016-11-19.snippet: Despite federal, state and city programs created to help rebuild damaged homes, the Rodriguez family and Elena Trama of Brooklyn
2016-11-19.lead_paragraph: Although Hurricane Sandy hit New York on Oct. 29, 2012, the nightmare that came with it has lasted four years for the Rodriguez family. They, like tens of thousands of others in New York and New Jersey, lost their homes in the disaster.
2016-11-19.headline_main: 4 Years After Hurricane Sandy, 2 Households Still Wait to Go Home

2016-11-19.abstract: Dylan Ratigan, the outspoken former talk show host, helped found a company that turns shipping containers into hydroponic farms and solar power stations.
2016-11-19.snippet: Dylan Ratigan, the outspoken former talk show host, helped found a company that turns shipping containers into hydroponic farms and solar power stations.
2016-11-19.lead_paragraph: When Dylan Ratigan was last on daily television, he was often in a bit of a rage. After two highly publicized rants about unseemly ties between corporations and politicians on MSNBC, he left his show in 2012.
2016-11-19.headline_main: MSNBC Host Left TV Battles Behind to Fight Poverty Instead

2016-11-19.abstract: Countries around the Asia-Pacific rim are shifting allegiances as a China-led trade deal excluding the United States gains momentum.
2016-11-19.snippet: Countries around the Asia-Pacific rim are shifting allegiances as a China-led trade deal excluding the United States gains momentum.
2016-11-19.lead_paragraph: LIMA, Peru — A toxic political war over money, jobs and globalization killed the vast and complex trade deal that was supposed to be a signature legacy of President Obama. But the deal, between the United States and 11 Asian and Pacific nations, was never just about trade.
2016-11-19.headline_main: China’s Influence Grows in Ashes of Trans-Pacific Trade Pact

2016-11-19.abstract: The history of the two nations’ rivalry, including the Sunni-Shiite sectarianism both sides have cultivated, points to a future of civil wars, scholars warn.
2016-11-19.snippet: The history of the two nations’ rivalry, including the Sunni-Shiite sectarianism both sides have cultivated, points to a future of civil wars, scholars warn.
2016-11-19.lead_paragraph: Behind much of the Middle East’s chaos — the wars in Syria and Yemen, the political upheaval in Iraq and Lebanon and Bahrain — there is another conflict.
2016-11-19.headline_main: How the Iranian-Saudi Proxy Struggle Tore Apart the Middle East

2016-11-19.abstract: Our increasing addiction to the constant stimulus of updates, likes and posts is damaging our ability to concentrate deeply and focus on work that matters.
2016-11-19.snippet: Our increasing addiction to the constant stimulus of updates, likes and posts is damaging our ability to concentrate deeply and focus on work that matters.
2016-11-19.lead_paragraph: I’m a millennial computer scientist who also writes books and runs a blog. Demographically speaking I should be a heavy social media user, but that is not the case. I’ve never had a social media account.
2016-11-19.headline_main: Quit Social Media. Your Career May Depend on It.

2016-11-19.abstract: As Donald J. Trump goes about his routine — schmoozing, tweeting, rewarding loyalty, fomenting infighting — it doesn’t appear the gravity of the presidency is changing him.
2016-11-19.snippet: As Donald J. Trump goes about his routine — schmoozing, tweeting, rewarding loyalty, fomenting infighting — it doesn’t appear the gravity of the presidency is changing him.
2016-11-19.lead_paragraph: Donald J. Trump sits high in Trump Tower in New York, spending hours on the phone with friends, television personalities and donors to ask if they know people to recommend for his cabinet.
2016-11-19.headline_main: High in Tower, Trump Reads, Tweets and Plans

2016-11-19.abstract: A childhood ambition, driven by the cartoon “Captain Planet and the Planeteers,” is realized for an operations manager at the Captain Planet Foundation.
2016-11-19.snippet: A childhood ambition, driven by the cartoon “Captain Planet and the Planeteers,” is realized for an operations manager at the Captain Planet Foundation.
2016-11-19.lead_paragraph: Ain Chiké, 34, is an operations manager at the Captain Planet Foundation in Atlanta.
2016-11-19.headline_main: An Urban Gardener Who Grew Up to Be a Planeteer

2016-11-19.abstract: Since Donald J. Trump’s victory, stock futures, bonds and some stock sectors have reversed themselves, and investors can expect more uncertainty.
2016-11-19.snippet: Since Donald J. Trump’s victory, stock futures, bonds and some stock sectors have reversed themselves, and investors can expect more uncertainty.
2016-11-19.lead_paragraph: The markets are always fickle, but since the presidential election, the tastes of traders in stocks, bonds and commodities have conspicuously changed.
2016-11-19.headline_main: It’s Not Just the White House. Change Is in the Air on Wall St., Too

2016-11-19.abstract: President-elect Donald J. Trump on Saturday moved to mend fences with rivals, meeting with Mitt Romney to discuss naming him secretary of state.
2016-11-19.snippet: President-elect Donald J. Trump on Saturday moved to mend fences with rivals, meeting with Mitt Romney to discuss naming him secretary of state.
2016-11-19.lead_paragraph: BEDMINSTER, N.J. — President-elect Donald J. Trump on Saturday moved to mend fences with political rivals after a divisive campaign, meeting with Mitt Romney, who had scathingly criticized him during the race as “a phony” and “a fraud,” to discuss naming him as secretary of state.
2016-11-19.headline_main: Trump Meets With Romney as He Starts to Look Outside His Inner Circle

2016-11-19.abstract: A nonprofit that disputes huge bills from a supplier of printer toner is whipsawed between two companies, one of which is not even supposed to exist.
2016-11-19.snippet: A nonprofit that disputes huge bills from a supplier of printer toner is whipsawed between two companies, one of which is not even supposed to exist.
2016-11-19.lead_paragraph: The Haggler loves a great consumer mystery. Like, why are hotel thermostats so varied and confounding? Do we really need smart refrigerators? And here’s one that recently flitted across the Haggler’s mind: When Taco Bell conceived its Cheesy Core Burrito — basically, a cheese burrito stuffed inside a beef burrito — did it ever consider cramming the whole concoction into yet another, even bigger burrito and calling it the Triple Dare?
2016-11-19.headline_main: A $28,000 Mystery: Will the Real Toner Supplier Please Stand Up?

2016-11-19.abstract: The collective bargaining agreement that has helped Major League Baseball to revenues of more than $9 billion will most likely receive only minor tweaks.
2016-11-19.snippet: The collective bargaining agreement that has helped Major League Baseball to revenues of more than $9 billion will most likely receive only minor tweaks.
2016-11-19.lead_paragraph: The most significant change in baseball in the last two decades is labor peace between the owners and the players. That is saying something, given how much has changed in the way the game is run and played. But without cooperation, changes never happen. Without labor peace, there is no sport.
2016-11-19.headline_main: M.L.B.’s Prosperity Comes With Labor Peace, and Only Quiet Complaints

2016-11-19.abstract: In the chaos that often seems to surround President-elect Trump, his son-in-law injects optimism and reinforces Mr. Trump’s world views and instincts.
2016-11-19.snippet: In the chaos that often seems to surround President-elect Trump, his son-in-law injects optimism and reinforces Mr. Trump’s world views and instincts.
2016-11-19.lead_paragraph: It was the low point for a campaign that had been in steady decline for weeks.
2016-11-19.headline_main: The In-Law in the Trump Inner Circle: Jared Kushner’s Steadying Hand

2016-11-19.abstract: Readers comment on “Can Trump Save Their Jobs?” (Nov. 13).
2016-11-19.snippet: Readers comment on “Can Trump Save Their Jobs?” (Nov. 13).
2016-11-19.lead_paragraph: “Can Trump Save Their Jobs?” by Nelson D. Schwartz (Nov. 13), looked at workers at a Carrier plant in Indianapolis that will soon close, with production moving to Mexico. Some of the workers interviewed spoke of their support for Donald J. Trump.
2016-11-19.headline_main: Carrier Workers for Trump

2016-11-19.abstract: Returning to a vacation spot, and taking family along to help celebrate a proposal of marriage.
2016-11-19.snippet: Returning to a vacation spot, and taking family along to help celebrate a proposal of marriage.
2016-11-19.lead_paragraph: Julie Appleton Zuckerman, the daughter of Betsy Appleton and Dr. Eric J. Zuckerman of Bloomfield Hills, Mich., was married Nov. 19 to Ryan Paul Gessin, the son of Faye Gessin and Corey Gessin of Orangeburg, N.Y. Rabbi Daniel Pernick officiated at the Yale Club of New York.
2016-11-19.headline_main: Julie Zuckerman and Ryan Gessin: On Nantucket Sand, Love Finds Its Footing

2016-11-19.abstract: Odd tactics can be interpreted as a lack of effort, depending on the observer. “It’s a difficult one to police,” Andy Murray said.
2016-11-19.snippet: Odd tactics can be interpreted as a lack of effort, depending on the observer. “It’s a difficult one to police,” Andy Murray said.
2016-11-19.lead_paragraph: LONDON — During a tennis season pockmarked by match-fixing reports, high-profile doping busts, sexist comments by tournament directors and superstars sidelined by injuries, tanking would seem to be low on the list of priorities.
2016-11-19.headline_main: Men’s Tennis Wants to Crack Down on Tanking. But What, Exactly, Is Tanking?

2016-11-19.abstract: Representative Danny K. Davis’s grandson, Jovan Wilson, was killed after two people forced their way into the teenager’s home, the police said.
2016-11-19.snippet: Representative Danny K. Davis’s grandson, Jovan Wilson, was killed after two people forced their way into the teenager’s home, the police said.
2016-11-19.lead_paragraph: CHICAGO — A teenage grandson of Representative Danny K. Davis was killed on Friday night after two people forced their way inside a home and argued with the teenager before one of them pulled a gun and fired, the police said. The fight may have been over a pair of shoes.
2016-11-19.headline_main: Grandson of Lawmaker Danny Davis Is Fatally Shot in Chicago

2016-11-19.abstract: Have you or a family member received a diagnosis of autism spectrum disorder and attended college? If so, we would like to learn more about your experiences.
2016-11-19.snippet: Have you or a family member received a diagnosis of autism spectrum disorder and attended college? If so, we would like to learn more about your experiences.
2016-11-19.lead_paragraph: Have you or a family member received a diagnosis of autism spectrum disorder and attended college? If so, we would like to learn more about your experiences.
2016-11-19.headline_main: Share Your Story about Being a College Student with Autism

2016-11-19.abstract: The first generation of students with an autism diagnosis is fanning out to schools across the country. They face a complex array of academic and social challenges.
2016-11-19.snippet: The first generation of students with an autism diagnosis is fanning out to schools across the country. They face a complex array of academic and social challenges.
2016-11-19.lead_paragraph: BOWLING GREEN, Ky. — Crosby J. Gardner has never had a girlfriend. Now 20 and living for the first time in a dorm here at Western Kentucky University, he has designed a fast-track experiment to find her.
2016-11-19.headline_main: Along the Autism Spectrum, a Path Through Campus Life

2016-11-19.abstract: Will Shortz encourages us to build something fun.
2016-11-19.snippet: Will Shortz encourages us to build something fun.
2016-11-19.lead_paragraph: VARIETY PUZZLE — My sincere apologies to Will Shortz; I am recovering from surgery this week and accidentally skipped writing up the Variety post.
2016-11-19.headline_main: Variety: Building Blocks

2016-11-19.abstract: Laine, a rookie, has 12 goals in his first 18 games and the Jets are playing with an easygoing attitude that befits their youth.
2016-11-19.snippet: Laine, a rookie, has 12 goals in his first 18 games and the Jets are playing with an easygoing attitude that befits their youth.
2016-11-19.lead_paragraph: PHILADELPHIA — Patrik Laine encountered a grand total of one boo when he stepped onto the ice Thursday for the first shift of his first game against the Philadelphia Flyers. The city’s rugged fans know hockey well enough to spot a powerful adversary worthy of their badgering. But Laine, the Winnipeg Jets’ 18-year-old right wing, got a reprieve.
2016-11-19.headline_main: Off to Flying Start, Patrik Laine Lifts Spirits in Winnipeg

2016-11-19.abstract: Johnson will be seeking his record-tying seventh series championship Sunday, as Nascar faces a number of issues, including finding a new title sponsor.
2016-11-19.snippet: Johnson will be seeking his record-tying seventh series championship Sunday, as Nascar faces a number of issues, including finding a new title sponsor.
2016-11-19.lead_paragraph: HOMESTEAD, Fla. — The Nascar season heads into its finale this weekend, with history on the line for Jimmie Johnson, who can tie Richard Petty and Dale Earnhardt Sr. with his seventh series championship.
2016-11-19.headline_main: Jimmie Johnson Goes for History as a Nascar Season Full of Uncertainty Concludes

2016-11-19.abstract: Like many other schools around the country since the election, West High has become a microcosm of the United States, roiled by divisions and mistrust.
2016-11-19.snippet: Like many other schools around the country since the election, West High has become a microcosm of the United States, roiled by divisions and mistrust.
2016-11-19.lead_paragraph: IOWA CITY — The air felt leaden in the hallways at West High School on the morning after Election Day. The usual clatter from the building’s 2,000 students was muffled. At lunchtime, Lujayn Hamad was in the cafeteria when she said a boy she barely knew roughly bumped into her and swore at her.
2016-11-19.headline_main: At Iowa High School, Election Results Kindle Tensions and Protests

2016-11-19.abstract: Too many smart, experienced Republicans are being stiffed in favor of men with reputations for hate.
2016-11-19.snippet: Too many smart, experienced Republicans are being stiffed in favor of men with reputations for hate.
2016-11-19.lead_paragraph: Early signs of what the Trump administration may look like: A man associated with white supremacy and misogyny will be White House chief strategist; a man rejected for a judgeship because of alleged racism will be attorney general; and an Islamophobe who has taken money from Moscow will be national security adviser.
2016-11-19.headline_main: Trump Embarrasses Himself and Our Country

2016-11-19.abstract: A weekly comic strip featured in the Sunday Review.
2016-11-19.snippet: A weekly comic strip featured in the Sunday Review.
2016-11-19.lead_paragraph: A weekly comic strip featured in the Sunday Review.
2016-11-19.headline_main: The Strip

2016-11-19.abstract: Identity politics failed the Democrats this time, but its influence won’t be easily dislodged.
2016-11-19.snippet: Identity politics failed the Democrats this time, but its influence won’t be easily dislodged.
2016-11-19.lead_paragraph: THE 2016 campaign was a crisis for conservatism; its aftermath is a crisis for liberalism. The right, delivered unexpectedly to power, is taking a breather from introspection as it waits to see what Trumpism means in practice. The left, delivered unexpectedly to impotence, has no choice but to start arguing about how it lost its way.
2016-11-19.headline_main: The Crisis for Liberalism

2016-11-19.abstract: Technology exploded in 2007. But if you blinked, you missed it.
2016-11-19.snippet: Technology exploded in 2007. But if you blinked, you missed it.
2016-11-19.lead_paragraph: BRITAIN’S vote to withdraw from the European Union followed by Donald Trump’s election in America constitute a single giant political event — one that makes 2016 a vintage year in history that will long be studied. Big political events have big causes. For the last three years I’ve been working on a book about what’s been happening beneath the surface — in the plumbing and wiring of the world — that’s roiling politics in so many places. My answer begins with a question: What the hell happened in and around 2007?
2016-11-19.headline_main: Dancing in a Hurricane

2016-11-19.abstract: What will you do when they start rounding us up?
2016-11-19.snippet: What will you do when they start rounding us up?
2016-11-19.lead_paragraph: On election night, while I was making my way through a crowd gathered outside the Fox News headquarters in Midtown Manhattan, a white man wearing a Mets cap patted my back and said through the noise: “Get ready to be deported.” Rattled, I made it inside the green room and waited to go on the air.
2016-11-19.headline_main: Undocumented in Trump’s America

2016-11-19.abstract: Hoaxes are not just bouncing around among conspiracy theorists; candidates and elected officials are sharing them, too.
2016-11-19.snippet: Hoaxes are not just bouncing around among conspiracy theorists; candidates and elected officials are sharing them, too.
2016-11-19.lead_paragraph: This year, the adage that “falsehood flies and the truth comes limping after it” doesn’t begin to describe the problem. That idea assumes that the truth eventually catches up. There’s not much evidence of this happening for the millions of people taken in by the fake news stories — like Pope Francis endorsing Donald Trump or Mr. Trump pulling ahead of Hillary Clinton in the popular vote — that have spread on social media sites.
2016-11-19.headline_main: Facebook and the Digital Virus Called Fake News

2016-11-19.abstract: Its music and words are often reflections on past glories.
2016-11-19.snippet: Its music and words are often reflections on past glories.
2016-11-19.lead_paragraph: This has been a bad year for music legends. First David Bowie, Glenn Frey and Maurice White. Then Prince and George Martin.
2016-11-19.headline_main: Is Rock ’n’ Roll Dead, or Just Old?

2016-11-19.abstract: The president has vowed to refrain from criticism during the transition, but has made it clear that he will not remain silent if Mr. Trump undoes his legacy.
2016-11-19.snippet: The president has vowed to refrain from criticism during the transition, but has made it clear that he will not remain silent if Mr. Trump undoes his legacy.
2016-11-19.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Obama is rethinking his plans to withdraw from the political arena after he leaves office next year, hinting to friends and supporters that he wants to add his voice to the shellshocked Democratic activists and elected officials who are now angrily vowing to oppose Donald J. Trump’s presidency.
2016-11-19.headline_main: Obama May Jump Into Fray as Democrats Counter Trump

2016-11-19.abstract: Ms. Jones was a frontwoman with indomitable energy and fast feet.
2016-11-19.snippet: Ms. Jones was a frontwoman with indomitable energy and fast feet.
2016-11-19.lead_paragraph: Sharon Jones, a powerhouse soul singer with a gritty voice, fast feet and indomitable energy, died Friday of pancreatic cancer. She was 60.
2016-11-19.headline_main: Sharon Jones, Powerhouse Soul Singer, Dies at 60

2016-11-19.abstract: What will The_Donald do when the Donald is no longer running?
2016-11-19.snippet: What will The_Donald do when the Donald is no longer running?
2016-11-19.lead_paragraph: On the morning of Nov. 9, a moderator who goes by the handle OhSnapYouGotServed posted on a Reddit topic page called The_Donald: “How does it feel, centipedes? The God Emperor said that we would get tired of winning. Are you tired of winning yet? Feel vindicated, centipedes. It’s over and there is nothing they can do about it. We are the future.”
2016-11-19.headline_main: Reddit and the God Emperor of the Internet

2016-11-19.abstract: The Blackfeet tribe prevails in a long struggle to protect land at the heart of its creation story.
2016-11-19.snippet: The Blackfeet tribe prevails in a long struggle to protect land at the heart of its creation story.
2016-11-19.lead_paragraph: A ceremony all too familiar to American Indian tribes — the signing of still another agreement with federal officials — took place Wednesday in the Blackfeet country of Montana. But this time, instead of winding up on the losing end, the tribe enjoyed a welcome reversal of fortune in its long struggle to protect its sacred grounds. With Blackfeet leaders in ceremonial headdress, Interior Secretary Sally Jewell canceled 15 energy exploration leases in the Badger-Two Medicine Area along the majestic Rocky Mountain Front, halting the feared desecration of lands at the heart of the tribe’s creation story.
2016-11-19.headline_main: Keeping the Drillers From Sacred Grounds

2016-11-19.abstract: Keen intelligence and groveling submission do not go hand in hand.
2016-11-19.snippet: Keen intelligence and groveling submission do not go hand in hand.
2016-11-19.lead_paragraph: The mathematician Norbert Wiener founded the science of cybernetics in 1948 with a warning that has become a cornerstone of futurist writing. The computer age was still in its infancy when he cautioned that intelligent machines could wreak havoc on civilization — and perhaps even snuff it out — if we failed to handle them with humility and care.
2016-11-19.headline_main: ‘Westworld’ and the Moral Dilemma of Cyborgs

2016-11-19.abstract: We should all get free therapy. We could call it reparations.
2016-11-19.snippet: We should all get free therapy. We could call it reparations.
2016-11-19.lead_paragraph: I wish I could point to the moment when I first understood I was a thing to be hated. The first “I’m just not attracted to black girls.” The first “Do you work here?”
2016-11-19.headline_main: How to Stay Sane While Black

2016-11-19.abstract: His major reforms are on the chopping block. But there is hope that some may be saved.
2016-11-19.snippet: His major reforms are on the chopping block. But there is hope that some may be saved.
2016-11-19.lead_paragraph: Three days after the election, I gathered with a group of historians at Princeton for a conference about Barack Obama’s presidency. The mood among the scholars, who had just written papers about the underappreciated accomplishments of the Obama administration, was bleak. We were discussing how quickly his programs would be dismantled, now that Republicans controlled the White House and Congress. Donald J. Trump’s stunning election appeared to many to be a direct repudiation of the essential meaning of 2008, when the country elected its first African-American president.
2016-11-19.headline_main: The Wreckage of Obama’s Legacy

2016-11-19.abstract: The new leader of the Senate’s Democratic minority sees a delicate balance between working with the new president and guarding against a trampling of values.
2016-11-19.snippet: The new leader of the Senate’s Democratic minority sees a delicate balance between working with the new president and guarding against a trampling of values.
2016-11-19.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Senator Chuck Schumer of New York wasn’t planning on being leader of the Senate minority — and by extension the Democratic opposition — as the Trump era dawns in the nation’s capital.
2016-11-19.headline_main: In a Trump Era, Schumer Declares, Democrats Are ‘the Barrier’

2016-11-19.abstract: Science is being used as an instrument of deception on issues like global warming.
2016-11-19.snippet: Science is being used as an instrument of deception on issues like global warming.
2016-11-19.lead_paragraph: Stanford, Calif. — THE good news got pretty much drowned out this month: Yes, 2016 is on track to become the hottest year on record, but thankfully also the third year in a row to see relatively flat growth in global greenhouse gas emissions. With global economic growth on the order of 3 percent a year, we may well have turned a corner toward a sustainable climate economy.
2016-11-19.headline_main: Climate Change in Trump’s Age of Ignorance

2016-11-19.abstract: Even as he ran against President Obama’s record, Donald J. Trump endorsed some big government ideas. Will his own party try to thwart him?
2016-11-19.snippet: Even as he ran against President Obama’s record, Donald J. Trump endorsed some big government ideas. Will his own party try to thwart him?
2016-11-19.lead_paragraph: The demolition job is finished, and now a new Republican Party is arising from the rubble, its ultimate shape unclear. President-elect Donald J. Trump, the most conspicuous builder on the scene, is the undisputed leader of his party. But he also remains an outsider, as Republicans who opposed him said all the way to election night. The mounting tensions of the transition have done little to change this.
2016-11-19.headline_main: Donald Trump’s Art of the New Deal?

2016-11-19.abstract: The reputation of the monarchy is zealously guarded in a castle tower.
2016-11-19.snippet: The reputation of the monarchy is zealously guarded in a castle tower.
2016-11-19.lead_paragraph: SYDNEY, Australia — To work in the Royal Archives at Windsor Castle in England is one of the most delicious prizes for a researcher. Climbing the steps to the Round Tower, where you can read centuries-old correspondence between monarchs and their ministers, untie ribbons binding intimate family records and feel the parchment crackling in your fingers, is viscerally thrilling.
2016-11-19.headline_main: Victoria’s Secrets: What the Royal Archives Didn’t Want You to Know About England’s Queen

2016-11-19.abstract: What you do online can help elect a president.
2016-11-19.snippet: What you do online can help elect a president.
2016-11-19.lead_paragraph: Do you panic easily? Do you often feel blue? Do you have a sharp tongue? Do you get chores done right away? Do you believe in the importance of art?
2016-11-19.headline_main: Cambridge Analytica and the Secret Agenda of a Facebook Quiz

2016-11-19.abstract: His vice-presidential bid over, the Virginia senator sees himself as part of “the only emergency brake” on the Trump train. He doesn’t miss the entourage.
2016-11-19.snippet: His vice-presidential bid over, the Virginia senator sees himself as part of “the only emergency brake” on the Trump train. He doesn’t miss the entourage.
2016-11-19.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Senator Tim Kaine’s second-floor office is much as he left it, with a minifridge full of Virginia-made hummus and an iPod playlist heavy on bluegrass and classic rock. The trademark harmonicas have been holstered, at least for now, his audience shrinking from a spellbound national electorate to a spirited weekday gathering of the Virginia Chamber of Commerce.
2016-11-19.headline_main: Tim Kaine Readily Moves Out of Spotlight: ‘This Is More Me’

2016-11-19.abstract: Did The Times paint the presidential campaign with too broad a brush? Many readers, liberal and conservative, believe that it did.
2016-11-19.snippet: Did The Times paint the presidential campaign with too broad a brush? Many readers, liberal and conservative, believe that it did.
2016-11-19.lead_paragraph: THERE is a group of 10 friends in Charlotte, N.C., all women, all in their 50s, all white. They’re college educated with successful careers, and they have a message for The New York Times: Come visit us.
2016-11-19.headline_main: One Thing Voters Agree On: Better Campaign Coverage Was Needed

2016-11-19.abstract: Immigrants protected under President Obama’s DACA program worry about losing the progress they have made and being forced back underground or even deported.
2016-11-19.snippet: Immigrants protected under President Obama’s DACA program worry about losing the progress they have made and being forced back underground or even deported.
2016-11-19.lead_paragraph: Brought to the United States from Venezuela as a toddler, Carlos Roa was among the first young undocumented immigrants to be protected from deportation under a program President Obama set up in 2012 by executive action.
2016-11-19.headline_main: Immigrants Who Came to U.S. as Children Fear Deportation Under Trump

2016-11-19.abstract: Readers dissect what went wrong, and offer ideas about how the party can recover.
2016-11-19.snippet: Readers dissect what went wrong, and offer ideas about how the party can recover.
2016-11-19.lead_paragraph: Readers dissect what went wrong, and offer ideas about how the party can recover.
2016-11-19.headline_main: Why the Democrats Lost

2016-11-19.abstract: Top officials have urged the president to remove Adm. Michael S. Rogers, citing concern over his efforts to combat the Islamic State and guard secrets.
2016-11-19.snippet: Top officials have urged the president to remove Adm. Michael S. Rogers, citing concern over his efforts to combat the Islamic State and guard secrets.
2016-11-19.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Obama is considering removing Adm. Michael S. Rogers from his posts as leader of the National Security Agency and United States Cyber Command after top officials expressed frustration over the speed at which Admiral Rogers had moved to combat the Islamic State and over the agency’s repeated loss of closely guarded secrets, administration and intelligence officials said Saturday.
2016-11-19.headline_main: Obama Is Considering Removing N.S.A. Leader

2016-11-19.abstract: Donald Trump took to Twitter to demand an apology from the cast of “Hamilton,” which directly addressed Vice President-elect Mike Pence after a performance on Friday.
2016-11-19.snippet: Donald Trump took to Twitter to demand an apology from the cast of “Hamilton,” which directly addressed Vice President-elect Mike Pence after a performance on Friday.
2016-11-19.lead_paragraph: A surprising confrontation erupted on Saturday between President-elect Donald J. Trump and the cast and creators of the Broadway hit “Hamilton,” setting off furious debate over American principles like free speech, respect and the ability to challenge authority in the Trump era.
2016-11-19.headline_main: ‘Hamilton’ Cast’s Appeal to Pence Ignites Showdown With Trump

2016-11-19.abstract: Ms. Tovar, known as the “Sweetheart of Mexico,” also performed in silent films and Westerns and helped to promote Mexican cinema.
2016-11-19.snippet: Ms. Tovar, known as the “Sweetheart of Mexico,” also performed in silent films and Westerns and helped to promote Mexican cinema.
2016-11-19.lead_paragraph: Lupita Tovar, a Mexican-born actress who began her career in silent films and starred as an alluring heroine in the Spanish-language version of the 1931 horror classic “Dracula,” died on Nov. 12 at her home in Los Angeles. She was 106.
2016-11-19.headline_main: Lupita Tovar, Star of Spanish-Language ‘Dracula,’ Dies at 106

2016-11-19.abstract: Ed Sessa crosses the right people.
2016-11-19.snippet: Ed Sessa crosses the right people.
2016-11-19.lead_paragraph: SUNDAY PUZZLE — In a crossword puzzle, a crossed reference refers to a pair of clues that are tied together in some way, either because each of the entries is part of a common phrase, or because one entry describes the other.

She was 12 at the time. Her father, who had been conscripted into the Soviet Army, was forced to stay behind.

2016-11-20.abstract: After playing only three songs, the rapper cut short his “Saint Pablo” show in Sacramento following a 17-minute monologue.
2016-11-20.snippet: After playing only three songs, the rapper cut short his “Saint Pablo” show in Sacramento following a 17-minute monologue.
2016-11-20.lead_paragraph: Kanye West likened himself to Donald J. Trump at a concert on Saturday in California before tumbling into a 17-minute, free-associative speech addressing radio programmers, MTV, his friends and collaborators Jay Z and Beyoncé, Hillary Clinton, Mark Zuckerberg and more.
2016-11-20.headline_main: Kanye West Calls Out Beyoncé and Praises Trump in Onstage Tirade

2016-11-20.abstract: The J.K. Rowling-scripted fantasy is a boon for the studio, whose last three big-budget efforts drew cool reactions from critics.
2016-11-20.snippet: The J.K. Rowling-scripted fantasy is a boon for the studio, whose last three big-budget efforts drew cool reactions from critics.
2016-11-20.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES — Warner Bros. and J. K. Rowling pulled off an exceptionally difficult magic trick over the weekend. Not only did they bring the “Harry Potter” film franchise back to life, they also did it without Harry Potter.
2016-11-20.headline_main: ‘Fantastic Beasts’ Is a Hit for Warner Bros.

2016-11-20.abstract: Murray, who took over the top spot from Djokovic two weeks ago, took advantage of Djokovic’s 30 unforced errors to capture his first ATP World Tour Finals title.
2016-11-20.snippet: Murray, who took over the top spot from Djokovic two weeks ago, took advantage of Djokovic’s 30 unforced errors to capture his first ATP World Tour Finals title.
2016-11-20.lead_paragraph: LONDON — As Andy Murray closed in this fall on Novak Djokovic’s run of more than two years at No. 1 and then overtook him this month, one thing was missing: a punctuating win over Djokovic, his toughest and longest rival.
2016-11-20.headline_main: Andy Murray Beats Error-Prone Novak Djokovic to Retain No. 1 Ranking

2016-11-20.abstract: The following tax-exempt fixed-income issues are scheduled for pricing this week.
2016-11-20.snippet: The following tax-exempt fixed-income issues are scheduled for pricing this week.
2016-11-20.lead_paragraph: The Treasury’s schedule of financing this week includes Monday’s regular weekly auction of new three- and six-month bills and an auction of four-week bills on Tuesday.
2016-11-20.headline_main: Treasury Auctions Set for the Week of Nov. 21

2016-11-20.abstract: The new American foreign policy seems to be to tell allies they “should go and love yourself.”
2016-11-20.snippet: The new American foreign policy seems to be to tell allies they “should go and love yourself.”
2016-11-20.lead_paragraph: Sofia, Bulgaria — It seems no matter what happens with American politics, the 19th-century French thinker Alexis de Tocqueville has something to say about it. In his classic “Democracy in America,” he suggested that democratic politics was in need of drama; as an election nears, “intrigues become more active, agitation more lively and more widespread. The entire nation falls into a feverish state.” But, once the election has passed, “everything becomes calm, and the river, one moment overflowed, returns peacefully to its bed.”
2016-11-20.headline_main: Donald Trump and the Bieber Doctrine

2016-11-20.abstract: The Giants looked lifeless on offense, defense and special teams early on but still won their fifth straight and improved to 7-3 as Collins made a game-sealing interception.
2016-11-20.snippet: The Giants looked lifeless on offense, defense and special teams early on but still won their fifth straight and improved to 7-3 as Collins made a game-sealing interception.
2016-11-20.lead_paragraph: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J. — A year ago, Landon Collins would stand at the back of the Giants’ secondary looking confused and fretful. A rookie safety, he was the Giants’ last line of defense and the last person the team could rely on. His head was swimming, even drowning, in the details of a playbook full of mystifying schemes and signals.
2016-11-20.headline_main: Landon Collins’s Development Keeps the Giants on the Rise

2016-11-20.abstract: The tech giant’s rapid growth in Austin provides a window into the vast constellation of jobs at the company and their economic impact.
2016-11-20.snippet: The tech giant’s rapid growth in Austin provides a window into the vast constellation of jobs at the company and their economic impact.
2016-11-20.lead_paragraph: The tech giant’s rapid growth in Austin provides a window into the vast constellation of jobs at the company and their economic impact.
2016-11-20.headline_main: A Look at Apple’s Sprawling New Campus in Texas

2016-11-20.abstract: The tech giant probably won’t bring all production to the United States, as Donald Trump has suggested, but it provides diverse opportunities for thousands of Americans, along with a ladder to climb.
2016-11-20.snippet: The tech giant probably won’t bring all production to the United States, as Donald Trump has suggested, but it provides diverse opportunities for thousands of Americans, along with a ladder to climb.
2016-11-20.lead_paragraph: AUSTIN, Tex. — During the presidential campaign, President-elect Donald J. Trump complained that America had lost too many manufacturing jobs and promised to force big companies like Apple to bring that work home. “I’m going to get Apple to start making their computers and their iPhones on our land, not in China,” he said.
2016-11-20.headline_main: How Apple Empowers, and Employs, the American Working Class

2016-11-20.abstract: If conductors can be divided into those who excel at Brahms’s First and Third symphonies and those who do best with the Second and Fourth, Andris Nelsons is the former.
2016-11-20.snippet: If conductors can be divided into those who excel at Brahms’s First and Third symphonies and those who do best with the Second and Fourth, Andris Nelsons is the former.
2016-11-20.lead_paragraph: BOSTON — The British critic Richard Osborne once wrote that, when it comes to Brahms’s symphonies, there are First and Third conductors, and Second and Fourth conductors. The scheme is loose and doesn’t apply to everyone, particularly not to visionaries or stoics, but it captures the difficulties in maintaining consistency across the cycle. Musicians who excel in the personal, odd-numbered statements are often challenged, relatively speaking, by the formalistic, even-numbered works.
2016-11-20.headline_main: Review: Brahms at the Boston Smphony, With Hélène Grimaud

2016-11-20.abstract: A cure for millennial malaise? Maybe, at least for the sleuths who pursue this mystery, and the humor it exudes.
2016-11-20.snippet: A cure for millennial malaise? Maybe, at least for the sleuths who pursue this mystery, and the humor it exudes.
2016-11-20.lead_paragraph: In a television season full of nonconformist new comedies, TBS’s “Search Party,” beginning Monday, is one of the odder ducks.
2016-11-20.headline_main: Review: ‘Search Party’ Turns Up Clueless Sleuths of Brooklyn

2016-11-20.abstract: Beijing’s unilateral move to block two politicians from taking their seats in the Legislature is seen as an attempt to silence democratic voices.

2016-11-20.lead_paragraph: Beijing’s unilateral move to block two politicians from taking their seats in the Hong Kong Legislature is seen as an attempt to silence democratic voices.

2016-11-20.abstract: An HBO film about the 2013 terror attack during the Boston race has its feel-good moments, but it’s really about physical and emotional pain.
2016-11-20.snippet: An HBO film about the 2013 terror attack during the Boston race has its feel-good moments, but it’s really about physical and emotional pain.
2016-11-20.lead_paragraph: Survivor documentaries are common, and many come with a triumph-over-adversity element that might make viewers tingle at the resilience of the human spirit. “Marathon: The Patriots Day Bombing,” airing Monday night on HBO, is no exception.
2016-11-20.headline_main: Review: ‘Marathon: The Patriots Day Bombing’ Focuses on the Struggle to Recover

2016-11-20.abstract: The former Paris Opera Ballet star dancer will assume that role at the Stanislavsky and Nemirovich-Danchenko Moscow Music Theater on Jan. 1.
2016-11-20.snippet: The former Paris Opera Ballet star dancer will assume that role at the Stanislavsky and Nemirovich-Danchenko Moscow Music Theater on Jan. 1.
2016-11-20.lead_paragraph: Laurent Hilaire, a former Paris Opera Ballet star dancer, who has been a contender for the artistic director job at both that company and La Scala Ballet, finally has a company to call his own. The Stanislavsky and Nemirovich-Danchenko Moscow Music Theater announced on Sunday that Mr. Hilaire would become artistic director of its 120-member ballet company on Jan. 1.
2016-11-20.headline_main: Laurent Hilaire Named Artistic Director of Stanislavsky Ballet

2016-11-20.abstract: The apparel company co-founder has amassed more than 20,000 paintings by artists from 120 countries through his “Imago Mundi” project, with postcard-sized works now showing in China.
2016-11-20.snippet: The apparel company co-founder has amassed more than 20,000 paintings by artists from 120 countries through his “Imago Mundi” project, with postcard-sized works now showing in China.
2016-11-20.lead_paragraph: BEIJING — More than 30 years ago, the United Colors of Benetton released a series of provocative advertisements about race and multiculturalism. But in recent years, Luciano Benetton, 81, the co-founder of that Italian apparel company, has sought a different medium through which to promote his feel-good, internationalist ideals: art.
2016-11-20.headline_main: Luciano Benetton Presents Art Collection in China

2016-11-20.abstract: In this book, “Achieving Our Country,” Mr. Rorty predicted an electoral shift that would leave an opening for a Trump-like figure to emerge as a savior.
2016-11-20.snippet: In this book, “Achieving Our Country,” Mr. Rorty predicted an electoral shift that would leave an opening for a Trump-like figure to emerge as a savior.
2016-11-20.lead_paragraph: Three days after the presidential election, an astute law professor tweeted a picture of three paragraphs, very slightly condensed, from Richard Rorty’s “Achieving Our Country,” published in 1998. It was retweeted thousands of times, generating a run on the book — its ranking soared on Amazon and by day’s end it was no longer available. (Harvard University Press is reprinting the book for the first time since 2010, a spokeswoman for the publisher said.)
2016-11-20.headline_main: Richard Rorty’s 1998 Book Suggested Election 2016 Was Coming

2016-11-20.abstract: This deft revival of a Mike Leigh play, set at a drunken suburban soiree, lays bare the disappointment behind seemingly self-satisfied guests.
2016-11-20.snippet: This deft revival of a Mike Leigh play, set at a drunken suburban soiree, lays bare the disappointment behind seemingly self-satisfied guests.
2016-11-20.lead_paragraph: “Abigail’s Party” may be the most uncomfortable comedy in New York right now, and I’d sit through it again in a second. Here, humor and unpleasantness are intertwined, and that leads to laughs — many, many laughs — that are part gleeful and part appalled.
2016-11-20.headline_main: Review: Innocuous Remarks Double as Cutting Commentary in ‘Abigail’s Party’

2016-11-20.abstract: This film about a ruthless lobbyist and gun control might be a box-office gamble after the victory of Donald J. Trump.
2016-11-20.snippet: This film about a ruthless lobbyist and gun control might be a box-office gamble after the victory of Donald J. Trump.
2016-11-20.lead_paragraph: In the new political drama “Miss Sloane,” Jessica Chastain’s titular lobbyist explains how to win in Washington. You have to play your last trump card, she says, right after your opponents play their last trump card.
2016-11-20.headline_main: Jessica Chastain’s ‘Miss Sloane’ Echoes Campaign Rhetoric

2016-11-20.abstract: This 46-year-old troupe, directed by Eduardo Vilaro, continued its November tradition in a festive show with excellent dancing.
2016-11-20.snippet: This 46-year-old troupe, directed by Eduardo Vilaro, continued its November tradition in a festive show with excellent dancing.
2016-11-20.lead_paragraph: Eduardo Vilaro, the artistic director of Ballet Hispanico, looked out from the Apollo Theater stage and told the excited crowd, “This is home.” Since 2011, his company has appeared at that Harlem theater annually around this time of year, and these performances have offered the best expression of how Mr. Vilaro, at the helm since 2009, has been maintaining and transforming this 46-year-old troupe. The show on Friday evening continued that tradition. While not quite living up to the claims of reinvention and originality in the printed program, it was a festive affair with excellent dancing.
2016-11-20.headline_main: Review: Ballet Hispanico Adds Style and Bounce to an Apollo Homecoming

2016-11-20.abstract: Even John Lieb is back.
2016-11-20.snippet: Even John Lieb is back.
2016-11-20.lead_paragraph: MONDAY PUZZLE — John Lieb is back, and his Monday puzzle has a theme element that cannot be reproduced in the online versions or the apps. If you are a print solver, however, you will see a bonus theme feature, which I discuss below. If not, this is still a very smooth and enjoyable Monday solve.
2016-11-20.headline_main: How an Extreme Underdog Wins
