2016-11-20.abstract: Companies like G.E. are working with podcast networks to produce original series — a kind of twist on “native ads” that are crafted to resemble editorial content.
2016-11-20.snippet: Companies like G.E. are working with podcast networks to produce original series — a kind of twist on “native ads” that are crafted to resemble editorial content.
2016-11-20.lead_paragraph: FOR a brand seeking to reach the podcast-listening public, there is one thing better than sponsoring a hit series: creating your own. General Electric pulled it off last year with its quaintly named GE Podcast Theater. Its eight-part science-fiction thriller “The Message,” produced with the Panoply podcasting network, hit No. 1 on the iTunes podcast chart and had nearly five million downloads.
2016-11-20.headline_main: Forget Filling Ad Breaks; Some Marketers Make the Podcasts

2016-11-20.abstract: The computer giant says it’s ready to start planning a prototype quantum computer, a superpowerful device that relies on subatomic particles instead of transistors.
2016-11-20.snippet: The computer giant says it’s ready to start planning a prototype quantum computer, a superpowerful device that relies on subatomic particles instead of transistors.
2016-11-20.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Microsoft is putting its considerable financial and engineering muscle into the experimental field of quantum computing as it works to build a machine that could tackle problems beyond the reach of today’s digital computers.
2016-11-20.headline_main: Microsoft Spends Big to Build a Computer Out of Science Fiction

2016-11-21.abstract: A music producer and arranger who founded Cherry Lane Music Publishing, Mr. Okun also worked with Peter, Paul and Mary, Plácido Domingo and Harry Belafonte.
2016-11-21.snippet: A music producer and arranger who founded Cherry Lane Music Publishing, Mr. Okun also worked with Peter, Paul and Mary, Plácido Domingo and Harry Belafonte.
2016-11-21.lead_paragraph: Milt Okun, a producer and arranger who helped turn acts as diverse as Peter, Paul and Mary, John Denver and Plácido Domingo into pop sensations, and who founded Cherry Lane Music Publishing, one of the world’s largest independent music publishers, died on Nov. 15 at his home in Beverly Hills, Calif. He was 92.
2016-11-21.headline_main: Milt Okun, Who Turned John Denver Into a Pop Star, Dies at 92

2016-11-21.abstract: After getting demolished by the Penguins in the first round of last season’s playoffs, the Rangers followed their lead by getting younger and faster.
2016-11-21.snippet: After getting demolished by the Penguins in the first round of last season’s playoffs, the Rangers followed their lead by getting younger and faster.
2016-11-21.lead_paragraph: Sidney Crosby had three weary Islanders right where he wanted them early in overtime on Friday at Barclays Center.
2016-11-21.headline_main: The Penguins’ Steady Ascent Shows the Way for the Rest of the N.H.L.

2016-11-21.abstract: Klinsmann, whose tenure as the men’s national team coach could end this week, says calls for his firing are “disrespectful.”
2016-11-21.snippet: Klinsmann, whose tenure as the men’s national team coach could end this week, says calls for his firing are “disrespectful.”
2016-11-21.lead_paragraph: Jurgen Klinsmann, whose status as coach of the United States men’s national team is under intense scrutiny, said Sunday night that he was “very comfortable” with his position and that he believed those calling for him to be fired were “being disrespectful” and “ignoring the facts” about his tenure as the team’s leader.
2016-11-21.headline_main: As U.S. Soccer Weighs Jurgen Klinsmann’s Future, He Says, ‘I’m Not Afraid’

2016-11-21.abstract: Legal experts say Donald Trump’s election could change how vigorously the federal government handles two giant deals and others in the industry.
2016-11-21.snippet: Legal experts say Donald Trump’s election could change how vigorously the federal government handles two giant deals and others in the industry.
2016-11-21.lead_paragraph: The proposed health insurance mega-merger between Anthem and Cigna heads to court on Monday, as the companies face off against a Justice Department seeking to block their $48 billion deal. It will be followed in just a few weeks by the trial for another proposed insurance mega-merger, between Aetna and Humana.
2016-11-21.headline_main: The Future of Health Care Mergers Under Trump

2016-11-21.abstract: Many analysts point to Donald J. Trump’s remarks that the United States should stop backing rebels in Syria, whose president is an ally of Iran’s.
2016-11-21.snippet: Many analysts point to Donald J. Trump’s remarks that the United States should stop backing rebels in Syria, whose president is an ally of Iran’s.
2016-11-21.lead_paragraph: TEHRAN — At first blush, the election of Donald J. Trump would seem to be bad news for Iran. But there is a chance that on balance, things could work out surprisingly well for the clerics.
2016-11-21.headline_main: Trump, Though Critical of Nuclear Deal, Could Offer Opportunities for Iran

2016-11-21.abstract: The Center Party had long been shut out of power because it had brokered a pact with Vladimir Putin’s party. A change in its leadership changed all that.
2016-11-21.snippet: The Center Party had long been shut out of power because it had brokered a pact with Vladimir Putin’s party. A change in its leadership changed all that.
2016-11-21.lead_paragraph: TALLINN, Estonia — Juri Ratas, the new leader of a party whose strongest support comes from the country’s ethnic Russians, has been named the next prime minister of Estonia.
2016-11-21.headline_main: Estonia’s New Premier Comes From Party With Links to Russia

2016-11-21.abstract: The Knicks aired their grievances in a team meeting on Saturday and then put together the kind of defensive performance that had been a rarity for them.
2016-11-21.snippet: The Knicks aired their grievances in a team meeting on Saturday and then put together the kind of defensive performance that had been a rarity for them.
2016-11-21.lead_paragraph: The Knicks came together Saturday for a team meeting, which offered them an opportunity to air their grievances. Although they had played only 12 games, their patchy start had left them in need of introspection.
2016-11-21.headline_main: Knicks Patch Things Up, Then Fix Some Problems Against the Hawks

2016-11-21.abstract: Mr. Fillon, a tradition-minded former prime minister, won the first round among the Republicans, advancing to face Alain Juppé and knocking out former President Nicolas Sarkozy.
2016-11-21.snippet: Mr. Fillon, a tradition-minded former prime minister, won the first round among the Republicans, advancing to face Alain Juppé and knocking out former President Nicolas Sarkozy.
2016-11-21.lead_paragraph: PARIS — A taciturn, tradition-minded former prime minister, François Fillon, emerged as the surprise front-runner in the first round of presidential primary voting among center-right candidates in France on Sunday, advancing to the second round next week against another former prime minister, Alain Juppé, who came in second.
2016-11-21.headline_main: Nicolas Sarkozy Is Out as François Fillon Takes Surprise Lead in French Primary

2016-11-21.abstract: Ward, 32, staged a come-from-behind victory against Sergey Kovalev in a light-heavyweight title bout that may position him as the sport’s next big star.
2016-11-21.snippet: Ward, 32, staged a come-from-behind victory against Sergey Kovalev in a light-heavyweight title bout that may position him as the sport’s next big star.
2016-11-21.lead_paragraph: LAS VEGAS — The lights were back on at T-Mobile Arena. The ring ropes had been taken down, cables for the vast broadcast apparatus had been disconnected, and almost all of the crowd, announced at more than 13,000, had cleared out.
2016-11-21.headline_main: Perseverance Pays Off for Andre Ward, an Old Hand and a New Champion

2016-11-21.abstract: The president of the World Anti-Doping Agency said he was eager to restore Russia to good standing, but athletes remain elusive to the authorities.
2016-11-21.snippet: The president of the World Anti-Doping Agency said he was eager to restore Russia to good standing, but athletes remain elusive to the authorities.
2016-11-21.lead_paragraph: GLASGOW — Russian athletes, under intense scrutiny after revelations of widespread doping, remain elusive to antidoping authorities, failing to provide updates on their whereabouts and training inside military areas that are inaccessible to drug-testing officials, according to the global watchdog for sports doping.
2016-11-21.headline_main: How to Avoid Drug Testing in Russia: Radio Silence and Secure Perimeters

2016-11-21.abstract: As the mainstream news media work to separate fact from fiction, Facebook — which has gobbled up much of the online ad market — must do its part.
2016-11-21.snippet: As the mainstream news media work to separate fact from fiction, Facebook — which has gobbled up much of the online ad market — must do its part.
2016-11-21.lead_paragraph: Friday night, the Facebook co-founder Mark Zuckerberg went on his vast social network to convince an expanding chorus of critics — including the departing president of the United States — that he honest-to-goodness wants to combat the “fake news” that is running wild across his site and others, and turning our politics into a paranoiac fantasy come to life.
2016-11-21.headline_main: Mark Zuckerberg and Facebook Must Defend the Truth

2016-11-21.abstract: As Democrats pick through the wreckage of the campaign, one lesson is clear: The election was notable as much for the people who did not show up, as for those who did.
2016-11-21.snippet: As Democrats pick through the wreckage of the campaign, one lesson is clear: The election was notable as much for the people who did not show up, as for those who did.
2016-11-21.lead_paragraph: MILWAUKEE — Four barbers and a firefighter were pondering their future under a Trump presidency at the Upper Cutz barbershop last week.
2016-11-21.headline_main: Many in Milwaukee Neighborhood Didn’t Vote — and Don’t Regret It

2016-11-21.abstract: The host, Stephen J. Dubner, and panelists consider a Depression-era menu, a nutty fact about the Iran nuclear deal, a surprisingly versatile musical instrument and more.
2016-11-21.snippet: The host, Stephen J. Dubner, and panelists consider a Depression-era menu, a nutty fact about the Iran nuclear deal, a surprisingly versatile musical instrument and more.
2016-11-21.lead_paragraph: In 1933, in the midst of the Great Depression, President Franklin Delano Roosevelt sat down to a meal that cost less than 8 cents. The first lady, Eleanor Roosevelt, wanted to provide an example for hungry Americans, to demonstrate how a family could survive on a pittance. It was a carefully chosen combination of calories and nutrients. The meal marked the start of the first government program that distributed food to the hungry.
2016-11-21.headline_main: What You Didn’t Know About Things That Go In Your Mouth

2016-11-21.abstract: The Knicks’ president, back in the public cross hairs, has not hesitated to expound on other teams’ issues even as he and his players have stumbled.
2016-11-21.snippet: The Knicks’ president, back in the public cross hairs, has not hesitated to expound on other teams’ issues even as he and his players have stumbled.
2016-11-21.lead_paragraph: Like the guy behind you in a theater, chattering away during a movie, Phil Jackson seems to have lost the ability to hear himself.
2016-11-21.headline_main: Phil Jackson Perches Atop the Knicks, and a Soapbox

2016-11-21.abstract: They will remain in New York for at least another six months after the inauguration, transition officials said, out of concern for uprooting him in the middle of the school year.
2016-11-21.snippet: They will remain in New York for at least another six months after the inauguration, transition officials said, out of concern for uprooting him in the middle of the school year.
2016-11-21.lead_paragraph: President-elect Donald J. Trump’s wife, Melania, and their 10-year-old son, Barron, will not immediately move to the White House after Mr. Trump takes office in January, out of concern for uprooting Barron in the middle of the school year, transition officials said on Sunday.
2016-11-21.headline_main: Melania and Barron Trump Won’t Immediately Move to White House

2016-11-21.abstract: Johnson went from last place to first in the Ford EcoBoost 400 and joined Richard Petty and Dale Earnhardt as the only seven-time series champions.
2016-11-21.snippet: Johnson went from last place to first in the Ford EcoBoost 400 and joined Richard Petty and Dale Earnhardt as the only seven-time series champions.
2016-11-21.lead_paragraph: HOMESTEAD, Fla. — Jimmie Johnson pulled off an improbable last-place-to-first-place drive in Sunday’s Nascar Sprint Cup season finale at Homestead-Miami Speedway to claim a record-tying seventh series championship.

2016-11-21.abstract: An exhibition sheds light on materials and designs used in Algeria, Morocco and Tunisia.
2016-11-21.snippet: An exhibition sheds light on materials and designs used in Algeria, Morocco and Tunisia.
2016-11-21.lead_paragraph: PARIS — A couple visiting Morocco in the 1970s gave in to the temptation of the Marrakesh bazaar and bought a silver brooch, never dreaming that the purchase would lead to many more over the years in other North African souks or from dealers in Paris. Now, the collection of the Swiss couple, Jean-François and Malou Bouvier, is being shown for the first time at “Wearable Treasures: Jewelry and Accessories,” an exhibition through Jan. 8 at the Institute of the Arab World in Paris. The museum’s director, Eric Delpont, spoke recently about the exhibition curated by Djamila Chakour. This interview has been condensed and edited.

The pearls are real, and important gems, Ayesha Al Khoori, 25, said — but the stones, she added with a smile, “don’t have to be real, because no one cares about these.”

2016-11-21.abstract: For one sequence, the show offers a taste of the delicious (and fun) entertainment that might have been.
2016-11-21.snippet: For one sequence, the show offers a taste of the delicious (and fun) entertainment that might have been.
2016-11-21.lead_paragraph: With the few fragments of brain we have left this deep into the first season of “Westworld,” let us try once again to remember the source of Jonathan Nolan and Lisa Joy’s series, the starting point of the maze in which we currently find ourselves. Because for as much as Michael Crichton tried to suggest the dangers of technology and the hubris of resurrecting a world lost to history, his original “Westworld” was also a diverting piece of genre entertainment. Mr. Crichton always wanted to advance big, alarmist ideas — about viral plagues, about Japanese business tactics, about the true nature of sexual harassment — but his instinct for pleasing his audience is why he had a career as a best-selling author, rather than another penniless purveyor of hard sci-fi.
2016-11-21.headline_main: ‘Westworld’ Season 1, Episode 8: Maeve Plays God

2016-11-21.abstract: Step inside the Police Department of Flint, Mich., to see how officers in this struggling city confront budget cuts and public distrust.
2016-11-21.snippet: Step inside the Police Department of Flint, Mich., to see how officers in this struggling city confront budget cuts and public distrust.
2016-11-21.lead_paragraph: As filmmakers, we’ve always been interested in exploring different mediums to combine intimate, character-driven stories with a strong sense of place. We employed this approach while making our first feature documentary, “T-Rex,” about the two-time Olympic gold medal boxer Claressa Shields, who is a native of the once thriving, now struggling, city of Flint, Mich. After spending four years in the city and getting to know its residents, we felt there was more that needed to be told about the challenges Flint is confronting. So last fall, we began production on an episodic documentary series about an institution at the core of the city, the Flint Police Department.
2016-11-21.headline_main: Policing Flint

2016-11-21.abstract: With Donald Trump headed to the White House, my future as a working community college student is uncertain.
2016-11-21.snippet: With Donald Trump headed to the White House, my future as a working community college student is uncertain.
2016-11-21.lead_paragraph: PORTAGE, Ind. — I was working the night of the election — helping ship merchandise to convenience stores around Indiana — so I kept up on the news by texting a friend. “Should I worry?” I asked around 10 p.m. Not yet, he said. An hour later, the response had changed: “Pressing the worry button now.” I got off work at midnight, and listened to the radio as I drove home. It was by then Nov. 9, and the election was coming to an end. But it didn’t hit me until I saw my mom.
2016-11-21.headline_main: A Dreamer’s Deportation Nightmare

There is no way to ease the concerns of those leaders about America’s retreat from the 12-nation Trans-Pacific Partnership trade pact, a casualty of anti-globalization fervor, American politics and, in particular, the objections of President-elect Donald Trump, who has called it a “disaster.”

2016-11-21.abstract: White Americans are starting, once again, to see themselves as a distinct identity group — and to wield power as one.
2016-11-21.snippet: White Americans are starting, once again, to see themselves as a distinct identity group — and to wield power as one.
2016-11-21.lead_paragraph: Three years ago, I read “Adventures of Huckleberry Finn” to my daughter. She smiled as she heard about Huck’s mischief, his jokes, his dress-up games, but it was his relationship with the runaway slave Jim that intrigued her most. Huck and Jim travel together as Jim seeks his freedom; at times, Huck wrestles with his decision to help. In the end, Tom Sawyer concocts an elaborate scheme for Jim’s release.
2016-11-21.headline_main: The Identity Politics of Whiteness

2016-11-21.abstract: The media personality on learning from his mistakes and why Donald Trump could be one of the most dangerous presidents to ever come into the Oval Office.
2016-11-21.snippet: The media personality on learning from his mistakes and why Donald Trump could be one of the most dangerous presidents to ever come into the Oval Office.
2016-11-21.lead_paragraph: You’ve recently been talking a lot about wanting to warn liberals, based on your experience, now that Donald Trump is president-elect. I don’t imagine that many liberals listen to your show, but here you are on the back page of The New York Times Magazine. Here is your liberal audience. What do you want to say to them? Please be better than I was. Please learn from my mistakes. Let’s just take it from 2000: George W. Bush was called an idiot, among other things. It got so bad that Republicans and conservatives just stopped listening to the media, because we made everything about jingoism. And so what happened? The pendulum swung back so far the other way that the next guy who was elected president offered hope and change, but all a lot of people saw was that he, for a while, wasn’t wearing a flag pin. They stopped listening to people on the left. Now we’re here in crazy town. What we need now is for reasonable people to sit down with each other and say: O.K., your guy wasn’t the end of the world. My guy wasn’t the end of the world. How can we talk to each other?
2016-11-21.headline_main: Glenn Beck Is Sorry About All That

2016-11-21.abstract: In his new film, “Silence,” he returns to a subject that has animated his entire life’s work and that also sparked his career’s greatest controversy: the nature of faith.

2016-11-21.abstract: As Trump’s new chief of staff, the lifelong G.O.P. loyalist will have to guide an outsider president and his band of radicals through a city they’ve pledged to upend.
2016-11-21.snippet: As Trump’s new chief of staff, the lifelong G.O.P. loyalist will have to guide an outsider president and his band of radicals through a city they’ve pledged to upend.
2016-11-21.lead_paragraph: Ten days removed from the still-fresh shock of Donald Trump’s election, around lunchtime on a Friday, I navigated the jagged lines of steel barriers, police officers and Secret Service battalions with big dogs and big guns surrounding Trump Tower. The glass-and-marble shopping mall, tourist trap and TV set had been transformed into the unlikely plotting ground for the nation’s immediate future. It was anybody’s guess what was taking shape inside the gilded bunkers. Clots of media people, passers-by and protesters crowded the lobby and nearby streets for the occasional clue, or at least glimpses of Marla Maples and Prime Minister Shinzo Abe of Japan. Kellyanne Conway posed for a selfie with a few lucky cops.
2016-11-21.headline_main: Reince Priebus, Normalizer in Chief

2016-11-21.abstract: The stream of job candidates visiting the president-elect continued as transition officials began turning their focus to their economic and domestic policy teams.
2016-11-21.snippet: The stream of job candidates visiting the president-elect continued as transition officials began turning their focus to their economic and domestic policy teams.
2016-11-21.lead_paragraph: With Thanksgiving approaching, the transition team is putting the last touches on President-elect Donald J. Trump’s national security leadership even as Mr. Trump pivots to his domestic and economic policy cabinet posts. One visitor to Trump Tower on Monday is of note: a Democrat, Representative Tulsi Gabbard of Hawaii. Another, Secretary of State Kris Kobach of Kansas, let the world see part of his plans for the Department of Homeland Security.
2016-11-21.headline_main: A List of Priorities From Trump, and Kris Kobach Tips His Hand

2016-11-21.abstract: Self-proclaimed white nationalists have embraced Donald J. Trump’s victory. Are they the same as white supremacists? Not exactly.
2016-11-21.snippet: Self-proclaimed white nationalists have embraced Donald J. Trump’s victory. Are they the same as white supremacists? Not exactly.
2016-11-21.lead_paragraph: A question has been posed in a puzzled whisper in many of the nation’s living rooms and newsrooms ever since Donald J. Trump’s triumph in this month’s presidential election: What, exactly, is white nationalism?
2016-11-21.headline_main: ‘White Nationalism,’ Explained

2016-11-21.abstract: A Santa Rosa medical marijuana company says it came out into the open and tried to follow the rules — only to be raided by local and federal police officers.
2016-11-21.snippet: A Santa Rosa medical marijuana company says it came out into the open and tried to follow the rules — only to be raided by local and federal police officers.
2016-11-21.lead_paragraph: SANTA ROSA, Calif. — California’s multibillion-dollar marijuana industry, by far the nation’s largest, is crawling out from the underbrush after voters opted to legalize cannabis in this month’s election. In Sonoma County alone, an estimated 9,000 marijuana cultivation businesses are operating in a provisional gray market, with few specific regulations, and are now looking to follow the path of the wine industry, which emerged from its own prohibition eight decades ago and rose to the global prominence it enjoys today.
2016-11-21.headline_main: Medical Marijuana Is Legal in California. Except When It’s Not.

2016-11-21.abstract: One museum reopens with a new look — and a free exhibition.
2016-11-21.snippet: One museum reopens with a new look — and a free exhibition.
2016-11-21.lead_paragraph: It’s been a busy year for London’s design world. Fall marked the city’s inaugural Design Biennale, and now the Design Museum is entering an ambitious era in its new home on Kensington High Street, on the edge of Holland Park. The interior of the former Commonwealth Institute building, reimagined by John Pawson, will triple the museum’s exhibition space. Despite the soaring, vast scope of the space (crowned with a dramatic paraboloid roof), Pawson aimed to create a welcoming environment. “I used lots of warm wood and made sure there were benches and seating areas to encourage people to stay for a while.”
2016-11-21.headline_main: London’s New Design Destination

2016-11-21.abstract: When a child who has decided to go vegan won’t eat just a sliver of Grandma’s famous pie, feelings can be hurt.
2016-11-21.snippet: When a child who has decided to go vegan won’t eat just a sliver of Grandma’s famous pie, feelings can be hurt.
2016-11-21.lead_paragraph: Lisa Yates has a 13-year-old who cannot eat nuts and an 18-year-old who will not eat gluten. When the family hops on a train on Thursday to visit relatives for Thanksgiving, Ms. Yates will be carrying nut-free chocolate, gluten-free banana bread and two containers of stuffing – a nut-free version and a gluten-free version.
2016-11-21.headline_main: Special Diets Can Heighten Tensions at the Holiday Dinner Table

2016-11-21.abstract: Melissa Ferrer, 33, loses her hair in clumps from the stress of caring for her children, all of whom have spent portions of their childhoods in New York City’s shelter system.
2016-11-21.snippet: Melissa Ferrer, 33, loses her hair in clumps from the stress of caring for her children, all of whom have spent portions of their childhoods in New York City’s shelter system.
2016-11-21.lead_paragraph: Though Melissa Ferrer moved into her new home in July, she has refused to paint her sons’ bedroom walls blue. She does not dare get too comfortable, a symptom of her years of homelessness.

2016-11-21.abstract: From the archives of the International Herald Tribune: A report from the French front in November 1916 summarizes the situation during the Battle of the Somme, as the Germans are beaten back.
2016-11-21.snippet: From the archives of the International Herald Tribune: A report from the French front in November 1916 summarizes the situation during the Battle of the Somme, as the Germans are beaten back.
2016-11-21.lead_paragraph: Following the official report issued yesterday of the military situation on the French front: November 13 to November 17: In the course of the past week the Germans made a powerful attempt to counteract our successes north and south of the Somme. The enemy’s attack opened the 15th, in the morning, on the Ablaincourt-Chaulnes Wood front, end in the afternoon was extended on the north bank from Lesboeufs to Bouchavesnes.
2016-11-21.headline_main: 1916: A Series of German Defeats

2016-11-21.abstract: Despite fears that dementia rates were going to explode as the population grows older, a large study of Americans has found the opposite.
2016-11-21.snippet: Despite fears that dementia rates were going to explode as the population grows older, a large study of Americans has found the opposite.
2016-11-21.lead_paragraph: Despite fears that dementia rates were going to explode as the population grows older and fatter, and has more diabetes and high blood pressure, a large nationally representative survey has found the reverse. Dementia is actually on the wane. And when people do get dementia, they get it at older and older ages.
2016-11-21.headline_main: U.S. Dementia Rates Are Dropping Even as Population Ages

2016-11-21.snippet: Solid scientific evidence on most vitamins, minerals and herbs is lacking.
2016-11-21.lead_paragraph: Hardly a day goes by that people don’t tell me that one or more dietary supplement has cured or prevented an ailment of theirs or suggest that I try one to treat a problem of my own. And I am not immune to wishful thinking that an over-the-counter vitamin, mineral or herb may help to keep me healthy or relieve some distress without having to see a doctor.

2016-11-21.lead_paragraph: Do you remember playing pretend when you were little? Maybe you were a superhero, a dinosaur or a princess. It’s normal when you’re little, and it’s usually harmless. Most children know the difference between pretending to be a superhero and jumping off the roof thinking they can fly.

2016-11-21.lead_paragraph: When Robert Eidelberg’s journalism class at John Bowne High School in Flushing, Queens, convened in September, 1972, our first assignment was to write an obituary about ourselves. We were all about 15 years old, without much life experience (I was months from my first paying job at a supermarket), so the task was to invent our futures.

2016-11-21.abstract: People used to flock to the Araguari River to catch the Pororoca, which once brought waves over five feet high, but surfers last rode it in 2013.
2016-11-21.snippet: People used to flock to the Araguari River to catch the Pororoca, which once brought waves over five feet high, but surfers last rode it in 2013.

2016-11-21.abstract: The lingering use of Catalan in Alghero, Italy, is a reminder of how Mediterranean cultures have blended for centuries. But the language is fading there today.
2016-11-21.snippet: The lingering use of Catalan in Alghero, Italy, is a reminder of how Mediterranean cultures have blended for centuries. But the language is fading there today.
2016-11-21.lead_paragraph: ALGHERO, Italy — The first Catalans reached Sardinia in the 14th century, when troops sailed from the eastern coast of what is now Spain as part of an expansion into the Mediterranean.

2016-11-21.abstract: Irish by birth and upbringing but a longtime resident of Britain, Mr. Trevor focused his mournful, darkly funny short stories and novels on “the sadness of fate.”
2016-11-21.snippet: Irish by birth and upbringing but a longtime resident of Britain, Mr. Trevor focused his mournful, darkly funny short stories and novels on “the sadness of fate.”
2016-11-21.lead_paragraph: William Trevor, whose mournful, sometimes darkly funny short stories and novels about the small struggles of unremarkable people placed him in the company of masters like V. S. Pritchett, W. Somerset Maugham and Chekhov, died on Sunday in Somerset, England. He was 88.
2016-11-21.headline_main: William Trevor, Writer Who Evoked the Struggles of Ordinary Life, Is Dead at 88

2016-11-21.abstract: His sculpture “Bouquet of Tulips” will be permanently installed next year in the plaza in front of the Museum of Modern Art and the Palais de Tokyo.

2016-11-21.abstract: Apple makes one product domestically: the Mac Pro, in Austin, Tex. But in addition to the manufacturing jobs that it has created, Apple employs 6,000 at its own Austin campus.
2016-11-21.snippet: Apple makes one product domestically: the Mac Pro, in Austin, Tex. But in addition to the manufacturing jobs that it has created, Apple employs 6,000 at its own Austin campus.
2016-11-21.lead_paragraph: President-elect Donald J. Trump said during the campaign that he would push companies to bring manufacturing jobs back to the United States. He named one tech company in particular — Apple — which is the world’s largest public company and makes many of its gadgets overseas.
2016-11-21.headline_main: Daily Report: At Apple, U.S. Jobs That Go Beyond Manufacturing

2016-11-21.abstract: Excerpts from three of his short stories.
2016-11-21.snippet: Excerpts from three of his short stories.
2016-11-21.lead_paragraph: “Each character is somebody that I know very well — as well as I know myself,” William Trevor once said. Here are excerpts from three of his short stories, originally published by the Bodley Head in Britain and Viking in the United States.
2016-11-21.headline_main: ‘Hot and Unhappy in Unwise Shoes’: A William Trevor Sampler

2016-11-21.abstract: A collection of images from across our country that helps create a more nuanced portrait of the increasingly diverse American experience.
2016-11-21.snippet: A collection of images from across our country that helps create a more nuanced portrait of the increasingly diverse American experience.
2016-11-21.lead_paragraph: A collection of images from across our country that helps create a more nuanced portrait of the increasingly diverse American experience.
2016-11-21.headline_main: #HereIsMyAmerica: Your Perspective

2016-11-21.abstract: Officials retesting urine samples have found scores of violations from the 2008 and 2012 Games, and medals are being stripped from dozens of athletes.
2016-11-21.snippet: Officials retesting urine samples have found scores of violations from the 2008 and 2012 Games, and medals are being stripped from dozens of athletes.
2016-11-21.lead_paragraph: After disclosures of an extensive, state-run doping program in Russia, sports officials have been retesting urine samples from the 2008 and 2012 Summer Olympics, in Beijing and London. Their findings have resulted in a top-to-bottom rewriting of Olympics history.
2016-11-21.headline_main: Olympics History Rewritten: New Doping Tests Topple the Podium

2016-11-21.abstract: The women of the island’s Cookbook Club warm the off-season by sharing dishes and opinions.
2016-11-21.snippet: The women of the island’s Cookbook Club warm the off-season by sharing dishes and opinions.
2016-11-21.lead_paragraph: WEST TISBURY, Mass. — The November meeting of the Martha’s Vineyard Cookbook Club offered saffron-infused gin cocktails, a table of food, a tray of something called “strong ginger cookies” — and a few strong opinions.
2016-11-21.headline_main: Cooking Up Conversation as Martha’s Vineyard Quiets Down

2016-11-21.abstract: Citigroup, Bank of America and Wells Fargo each moved up a notch in the annual risk rankings of banks deemed to be globally important.
2016-11-21.snippet: Citigroup, Bank of America and Wells Fargo each moved up a notch in the annual risk rankings of banks deemed to be globally important.
2016-11-21.lead_paragraph: LONDON — Three of America’s biggest banks potentially pose a greater risk to the global financial system than they did last year if they were to fail, global regulators said on Monday.
2016-11-21.headline_main: Three Big American Banks Pose Greater Systemic Risk, Regulator Says

2016-11-21.abstract: We're not saying you can't talk about politics on Thanksgiving. But here are some conversation starters about science and medicine for your dinner table.
2016-11-21.snippet: We're not saying you can't talk about politics on Thanksgiving. But here are some conversation starters about science and medicine for your dinner table.
2016-11-21.lead_paragraph: Look, we’re not saying you can’t talk about politics at the Thanksgiving dinner table. But it’s been quite a November so far, following a seemingly never-ending campaign, and the anxiety in the air is thicker than your mom’s gravy. Some people are sitting out Thanksgiving with their loved ones altogether. Others are preparing themselves for acts of civil disagreement.
2016-11-21.headline_main: This Thanksgiving, Be Thankful for Science

2016-11-21.abstract: In his final news conference on his last foreign trip as president, he argued for a foreign policy in which America continues to take on major global problems.
2016-11-21.snippet: In his final news conference on his last foreign trip as president, he argued for a foreign policy in which America continues to take on major global problems.
2016-11-21.lead_paragraph: LIMA, Peru — President-elect Donald J. Trump, with his “America First” campaign slogan, sees an America that has for years been taken for granted by weaker nations and is too quick to intervene in intractable conflicts far away.
2016-11-21.headline_main: As Obama’s Tour Ends, He Says U.S. Involvement Abroad Must Not

2016-11-21.abstract: In this production, the audience will join the performers in eating a turn-of-the-century feast.
2016-11-21.snippet: In this production, the audience will join the performers in eating a turn-of-the-century feast.
2016-11-21.lead_paragraph: The centerpiece of “The Dead,” a novella by James Joyce, is a family dinner in 1904 to celebrate the Epiphany. At the Irish Repertory Theater’s staged adaptation, “The Dead, 1904,” presented with Dot Dot Productions, the audience joins in the meal. They mingle with the performers, including Kate Burton and Boyd Gaines, and are then seated for a multicourse feast during the performance. On the menu are beef tenderloin with fig sauce, honey-glazed ham, potatoes, bread pudding and drinks. It takes place at the American Irish Historical Society, a Victorian townhouse, and the meal is catered by Great Performances: “The Dead, 1904” by the Irish Repertory Theater, through Jan. 7 at  991 Fifth Avenue (East 80th Street); $300 including dinner, $500 for premium seating ($1,000 after Dec. 7), 212-727-2737, irishrep.org.
2016-11-21.headline_main: Dinner and James Joyce in New Adaptation of ‘The Dead’

2016-11-21.abstract: The rap group’s first record in nearly two decades opens with 135,000 album-equivalent units.
2016-11-21.snippet: The rap group’s first record in nearly two decades opens with 135,000 album-equivalent units.
2016-11-21.lead_paragraph: A Tribe Called Quest’s comeback came at just the right time: Released the Friday after the election, the emotional and political “We Got It From Here … Thank You 4 Your Service” (Epic), the first album from the storied hip-hop group in nearly two decades, has topped the Billboard chart.
2016-11-21.headline_main: A Tribe Called Quest’s Comeback Album Debuts at No. 1

2016-11-21.abstract: The latest outpost of Marco Canora’s bone broth chain offers flavor customization and frozen broths for home use.
2016-11-21.snippet: The latest outpost of Marco Canora’s bone broth chain offers flavor customization and frozen broths for home use.
2016-11-21.lead_paragraph: No doubt about it, Marco Canora really started something when he opened his first Brodo takeout window at Hearth, his East Village restaurant. That was two years ago, and now bone broth, spruced up with the Brodo label, is everywhere. Mr. Canora has expanded with a kiosk in Bryant Park, and he’s just opened a shop in the West Village where some basic broths are mixed and sometimes frothed with freshly milled herbs, Asian condiments, bone marrow, seaweed, butter and even cocoa. There are 11 preset seasoning combinations, $6 to $11, though customers can devise their own. Tom Yum, a combo with chicken broth, coconut milk, curry and chile oil, is becoming a favorite. The shop also sells basic broths, frozen, for home use: Brodo, 496 Hudson Street (Christopher Street), 212-366-0600, brodo.com.
2016-11-21.headline_main: Broths to Restore and Revive at Brodo

2016-11-21.abstract: The case appears to be a straightforward tale of avarice, but the Justice Department may have a difficult time proving the charges.
2016-11-21.snippet: The case appears to be a straightforward tale of avarice, but the Justice Department may have a difficult time proving the charges.
2016-11-21.lead_paragraph: Valeant Pharmaceuticals International is a onetime Wall Street darling that has become a punching bag for how pharmaceutical firms drove up drug prices and engaged in questionable sales practices, in the process losing 90 percent of its market value. The first case to emerge from multiple federal and state investigations of its conduct, however, portrays it as a victim, not a perpetrator.
2016-11-21.headline_main: Kickback Case Questions Whether Valeant Was Victim or Participant

2016-11-21.abstract: Here’s what you need to know to start your day.
2016-11-21.snippet: Here’s what you need to know to start your day.
2016-11-21.lead_paragraph: Good morning.
2016-11-21.headline_main: Pope Francis, Trump, Japan: Your Tuesday Briefing

2016-11-21.abstract: As the leaves change color, one side gets the gloriously bright reds, yellows and oranges. The other? Not so much.
2016-11-21.snippet: As the leaves change color, one side gets the gloriously bright reds, yellows and oranges. The other? Not so much.
2016-11-21.lead_paragraph: Q. As the autumn leaves change color, why is the top of a leaf the most colorful, sometimes bright red, while the underside is comparatively drab?
2016-11-21.headline_main: Explaining the Other Side of Autumn Leaves

2016-11-21.abstract: A look at stockbrokers with career black marks; claims payouts by auto insurers; and charges of discrimination in a senior community.
2016-11-21.snippet: A look at stockbrokers with career black marks; claims payouts by auto insurers; and charges of discrimination in a senior community.
2016-11-21.lead_paragraph: I love a good mystery, but it’s rare that we get to solve one in the world of personal finance.
2016-11-21.headline_main: Your Money Weekly: Solving the Mystery of the Stockbrokers

2016-11-21.lead_paragraph: These bars are themed for sleeper hits and cult favorites.
2016-11-21.headline_main: Cinematic Watering Holes

2016-11-21.abstract: Décor and drinks that evoke films from “The Shining” to “Anchorman.”
2016-11-21.snippet: Décor and drinks that evoke films from “The Shining” to “Anchorman.”
2016-11-21.lead_paragraph: The Overlook Lodge, a bar in the Pleasant Ridge neighborhood of Cincinnati, looks cozy enough at first, with wooden rafters and a fireplace big enough to sit inside.
2016-11-21.headline_main: These Bars Want to Be in the Movies

2016-11-21.abstract: Coloring books for grown-ups, with drawings inspired by travel and Champagne wishes, aim to capture the imaginations of tourists.
2016-11-21.snippet: Coloring books for grown-ups, with drawings inspired by travel and Champagne wishes, aim to capture the imaginations of tourists.
2016-11-21.lead_paragraph: Forget coffee in the lobby and chocolates at turndown. Coloring books for grown-ups — where the illustrations are inspired by travel, fashion and Champagne wishes — are among the latest amenities being offered at hotels around the world.
2016-11-21.headline_main: Travel Coloring Books for Grown-Ups

2016-11-21.abstract: Laurent Tourondel’s Dough to Go kit will make one margherita pie in a home oven.
2016-11-21.snippet: Laurent Tourondel’s Dough to Go kit will make one margherita pie in a home oven.
2016-11-21.lead_paragraph: The chef Laurent Tourondel, who makes pizza in the wood-fueled ovens of L’Amico, is sharing the recipe with home cooks. With this kit you can nearly replicate the classic 12-inch pizza margherita from his Chelsea restaurant in a gas or electric oven. The dough is a breeze to handle, and =buffalo mozzarella, basil a tomato sauce with personality are included. Add a drizzle of good olive oil, chile flakes and whatever else you like on your pie with ingredients from your larder: Dough to Go, $14 for pickup only, L’Amico, 849 Avenue of the Americas (West 30th Street), 212-201-4065, lamico.nyc.
2016-11-21.headline_main: A Kit to Make Restaurant Pizza at Home

2016-11-21.abstract: Mounting criticism and recent defeats in World Cup qualifying, including a 4-0 thrashing at Costa Rica last week, led U.S. Soccer to change course.
2016-11-21.snippet: Mounting criticism and recent defeats in World Cup qualifying, including a 4-0 thrashing at Costa Rica last week, led U.S. Soccer to change course.
2016-11-21.lead_paragraph: On Thursday, Jurgen Klinsmann, the coach of the United States national men’s soccer team, dined with President Obama, Chancellor Angela Merkel of Germany, a number of Nobel laureates and a couple of astronauts at a gala in Berlin. The sausages were “excellent,” he said.
2016-11-21.headline_main: Jurgen Klinsmann Fired as U.S. Soccer Coach

2016-11-21.abstract: Ancolie serves breakfast fare, layered salads and desserts in returnable glass jars.
2016-11-21.snippet: Ancolie serves breakfast fare, layered salads and desserts in returnable glass jars.
2016-11-21.lead_paragraph: Food served in jars is not new, but Chloe Vichot, who fled finance for food and studied at culinary schools in New York along the way, has opened a shop dedicated exclusively to it. Ms. Vichot prepares and sells breakfast fare, bright lunch salads, soups, stews and desserts in glass jars, $5 to $14. Her specially made wide-mouth containers are more convenient than the usual Mason jars that some restaurants use to serve pâtés, desserts or even cocktails. The idea is to cut down on trash, and customers get a $1 discount for each jar they return (there is no jar deposit). The salads, in compact layers, are generous 22-ounce portions: Ancolie, 58 West Eighth Street (Avenue of the Americas), 646-524-5929, ancolie.co.
2016-11-21.headline_main: Breakfast, Lunch and Dessert in Jars

2016-11-21.abstract: How he fought to preserve Alabama’s long history of separate and unequal education.
2016-11-21.snippet: How he fought to preserve Alabama’s long history of separate and unequal education.
2016-11-21.lead_paragraph: In 1986, the Republican-dominated Senate Judiciary Committee torpedoed Ronald Reagan’s nomination of Jeff Sessions to the federal bench. As sworn testimony there revealed, Mr. Sessions, then the United States attorney for the Southern District of Alabama, had referred to the N.A.A.C.P. and the Southern Christian Leadership Conference (founded by the Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr.) as “un-American” and “Communist inspired.” He had joked that he thought the Ku Klux Klan was “O.K.” until he discovered some of its members smoked pot, and had accused a white attorney who supported voting rights of being a race traitor.
2016-11-21.headline_main: Jeff Sessions’ Other Civil Rights Problem

2016-11-21.abstract: Cured features the writers Betty Fussell, Jessica B. Harris, William Woys Weaver and Fuchsia Dunlop.
2016-11-21.snippet: Cured features the writers Betty Fussell, Jessica B. Harris, William Woys Weaver and Fuchsia Dunlop.
2016-11-21.lead_paragraph: Cured, a periodical about preserving food, is definitely a niche publication. An impressive roster of writers, including Betty Fussell, Jessica B. Harris, William Woys Weaver and Fuchsia Dunlop, covers a wealth of topics under the editorial direction of Darra Goldstein, an author and a founder of Gastronomica. Learn about a Swedish tradition of fermenting fish that dates back 9,000 years; making persimmon vinegar; the allure of stinky Chinese food; pickles in the Nishiki Market in Kyoto, Japan; and zur, a fermented Polish rye soup. As Ms. Goldstein put it, preserving is as important a development for humankind as cooking, a means of “hedging our bets against hunger.” The magazine is published by Zero Point Zero, the company that produces “The Mind of a Chef” and Anthony Bourdain’s “Parts Unknown”: Cured, $20 at some food shops, bookstores nationwide and from curedmagazine.com.
2016-11-21.headline_main: A New Magazine Focuses on Food Preservation

2016-11-21.abstract: The president-elect has sent mixed signals on education policy, but here is an overview of what schools and universities might expect from his administration.
2016-11-21.snippet: The president-elect has sent mixed signals on education policy, but here is an overview of what schools and universities might expect from his administration.
2016-11-21.lead_paragraph: When it comes to predicting how President-elect Donald J. Trump’s administration will affect America’s schools and universities, education experts say they are struggling to read the tea leaves.
2016-11-21.headline_main: Where Donald Trump Stands on School Choice, Student Debt and Common Core

2016-11-21.abstract: Bomb Coffee will donate a portion of its sales this month to help treat veterans with PTSD.
2016-11-21.snippet: Bomb Coffee will donate a portion of its sales this month to help treat veterans with PTSD.
2016-11-21.lead_paragraph: Detonate this new full-bodied coffee in your mug in the morning, and you’ll be fueled for the day. Bomb Coffee was founded by four friends, two of them veterans, and through the end of November, 22 percent of all sales will go to the treatment of post-traumatic stress disorder and suicide prevention among veterans. The coffee, which they claim is high in caffeine, is grown in India and roasted in Rockford, Ill. The original is balanced, and the bourbon-infused variety has more complexity with a hint of booze: Bomb Coffee, whole bean or ground, $17.99 a pound or $19.99 a pound for bourbon-infused, $15.99 for 12 Keurig pods, bombcoffee.com.
2016-11-21.headline_main: Fully Buzzed, This Coffee Helps Veterans

2016-11-21.abstract: A federal judge declined to dismiss the copyright claims in a lawsuit that challenges the validity of the song’s copyright.
2016-11-21.snippet: A federal judge declined to dismiss the copyright claims in a lawsuit that challenges the validity of the song’s copyright.
2016-11-21.lead_paragraph: “We Shall Overcome” may be headed for a trial.
2016-11-21.headline_main: ‘We Shall Overcome’ Copyright Case Moves Closer to Trial

2016-11-21.abstract: A by-no-means exhaustive list of items we like.
2016-11-21.snippet: A by-no-means exhaustive list of items we like.
2016-11-21.lead_paragraph: These pendants from Catherine Weitzman caught my eye among the endless pieces of jewelry and clothing I see every day in market appointments. The flowers within them are collected during trips around the world in places like the Canary Islands, Sri Lanka and Japan. And at Weitzman’s studio in Hawaii, the dried blooms are then protected in glass, sealed with either gold vermeil or recycled silver, and strung onto necklace chains — all one of a kind. $100-$205, available at catherineweitzman.com — ANGELA KOH
2016-11-21.headline_main: Four Women’s Things T Editors Are Really Into Right Now

2016-11-21.abstract: The former mayor of New York remains in the running for a post in Donald Trump’s cabinet. This documentary on Amazon chronicles Giuliani’s controversial ascent.
2016-11-21.snippet: The former mayor of New York remains in the running for a post in Donald Trump’s cabinet. This documentary on Amazon chronicles Giuliani’s controversial ascent.
2016-11-21.lead_paragraph: For those who didn’t live in New York City under the two-term mayor Rudolph W. Giuliani, you might know him only as one of the heroes of 9/11. The man who held together a shattered metropolis. America’s Mayor. After a long stint out of the spotlight, Giuliani was back in the public eye on the campaign trail for Donald J. Trump. And now he’s one of President-elect Trump’s many candidates for a cabinet position.
2016-11-21.headline_main: Watch This 2006 Documentary About Rudy Giuliani

2016-11-21.abstract: The canyon is about the size of Montana and twice as deep as the Grand Canyon, and the planet’s cooling may have led to its formation.
2016-11-21.snippet: The canyon is about the size of Montana and twice as deep as the Grand Canyon, and the planet’s cooling may have led to its formation.
2016-11-21.lead_paragraph: A colossal canyon on Mercury may provide evidence that the tiny planet is shrinking.
2016-11-21.headline_main: Mercury Is Shrinking, a ‘Great Valley’ Shows

2016-11-21.abstract: A painstaking effort is turning the vessel into an interactive exhibit at the National WWII Museum in New Orleans.
2016-11-21.snippet: A painstaking effort is turning the vessel into an interactive exhibit at the National WWII Museum in New Orleans.
2016-11-21.lead_paragraph: NEW ORLEANS — There was one hairy moment during PT 305’s slow-motion jaunt through downtown here on Saturday morning.
2016-11-21.headline_main: New Victory for World War II PT Boat: Restored and Museum-Ready

2016-11-21.abstract: The ballet’s “Trois Grandes Fugues” offers pieces by Anne Teresa de Keersmaeker, Maguy Marin and Lucinda Childs, with three renditions of Beethoven’s “Grosse Fuge.”
2016-11-21.snippet: The ballet’s “Trois Grandes Fugues” offers pieces by Anne Teresa de Keersmaeker, Maguy Marin and Lucinda Childs, with three renditions of Beethoven’s “Grosse Fuge.”
2016-11-21.lead_paragraph: LYON, France — Three dances. Three major choreographers. Three renditions of Beethoven’s “Grosse Fuge.” That’s the simple yet audacious idea behind the Lyon Opera Ballet’s “Trois Grandes Fugues,” which offers two pieces, by Anne Teresa de Keersmaeker and Maguy Marin, already in its repertory, and a new work by the American choreographer Lucinda Childs.
2016-11-21.headline_main: Review: Lyon Opera Ballet Showcases Beethoven and Female Choreographers

2016-11-21.abstract: The Food and Drug Administration has ordered a so-called black box warning on the package regarding the potentially painful side effects for women.
2016-11-21.snippet: The Food and Drug Administration has ordered a so-called black box warning on the package regarding the potentially painful side effects for women.
2016-11-21.lead_paragraph: Kim Myers used to compete in rodeo-style barrel horse races, but after being sterilized with an implantable device called Essure, the pain was so intense that she had to stop.
2016-11-21.headline_main: Bayer’s Essure Contraceptive Implant, Now With a Warning

2016-11-21.abstract: Shares of Sunoco Logistics Partners and Energy Transfer Partners fell nearly 10 percent early Monday, before recovering some of their losses.
2016-11-21.snippet: Shares of Sunoco Logistics Partners and Energy Transfer Partners fell nearly 10 percent early Monday, before recovering some of their losses.
2016-11-21.lead_paragraph: Energy Transfer investors are in another tangle. The pipeline partnership Sunoco Logistics Partners wants to buy Energy Transfer Partners for $21 billion, based on Friday’s closing prices. Energy Transfer Partners’ parent, Energy Transfer Equity, tied itself in knots trying to buy rival pipeline operator Williams Companies last year, before walking away on a technicality. The sour reaction to the latest deal suggests E.T.P. may also be headed for trouble.
2016-11-21.headline_main: Market Reaction to Deal May Bode Ill for Energy Transfer Partners

2016-11-21.abstract: The story of how Cristiano Ronaldo made it to Sporting Lisbon is a case study in how to recruit and develop players.
2016-11-21.snippet: The story of how Cristiano Ronaldo made it to Sporting Lisbon is a case study in how to recruit and develop players.
2016-11-21.lead_paragraph: LISBON — The way they tell the story at Sporting Lisbon, they did not even have to watch Cristiano Ronaldo play to know he was special. Seeing him with a ball at his feet, the quiet, skinny 12-year-old’s every effortless touch proof of his masterly control, was enough.
2016-11-21.headline_main: ‘Made in Sporting’: Lisbon Club’s Youth Academy Sets It Apart

2016-11-21.abstract: Scenes from the iconic party of the 1960s, held at the Plaza hotel.
2016-11-21.snippet: Scenes from the iconic party of the 1960s, held at the Plaza hotel.
2016-11-21.lead_paragraph: Scenes from the iconic party of the 1960s, held at the Plaza hotel.
2016-11-21.headline_main: Truman Capote’s Black and White Ball

2016-11-21.abstract: The guests wore black tie and couture dresses. But with its unlikely mix of attendees, the Black and White Ball helped to break down the old order.
2016-11-21.snippet: The guests wore black tie and couture dresses. But with its unlikely mix of attendees, the Black and White Ball helped to break down the old order.
2016-11-21.lead_paragraph: What if you gave a party and everybody came? That is precisely what occurred on the drizzly night of Nov. 28, 1966, when 540 of Truman Capote’s nearest and dearest turned out for what the writer insisted on calling his “little masked ball for Kay Graham and all of my friends.”
2016-11-21.headline_main: 50 Years Ago, Truman Capote Hosted the Best Party Ever

2016-11-21.abstract: Fears of a nuclear accident were raised as a cooling system in a reactor near the site of the 2011 disaster shut down, but it was restored without incident.
2016-11-21.snippet: Fears of a nuclear accident were raised as a cooling system in a reactor near the site of the 2011 disaster shut down, but it was restored without incident.
2016-11-21.lead_paragraph: TOKYO — A powerful earthquake triggered a tsunami off the coast of Japan early Tuesday, near where three nuclear reactors melted down at a plant in Fukushima after a quake and tsunami in 2011.
2016-11-21.headline_main: Earthquake Off Fukushima, Japan, Triggers Tsunami

2016-11-21.abstract: The portfolio of this pianist and composer has expanded to include collaborations with visual artists, choreographers and filmmakers.
2016-11-21.snippet: The portfolio of this pianist and composer has expanded to include collaborations with visual artists, choreographers and filmmakers.
2016-11-21.lead_paragraph: A decade ago, when Jason Moran released “Artist in Residence,” it might have been possible to see that album as an outlier. Made up of selections from several large commissioned works — with a percussive cameo by the performance artist Joan Jonas, and a spoken-word sample of the conceptual artist Adrian Piper — it framed Mr. Moran as not only a pianist and composer but also a fluent traveler in the realm of contemporary art.
2016-11-21.headline_main: Jason Moran, From the Venice Biennale to the Village Vanguard

2016-11-22.lead_paragraph: Myanmar has long persecuted the country’s Rohingya Muslim minority, denying it basic rights to citizenship, to marry, to worship and to an education. After violence unleashed in 2012 by Buddhist extremists drove tens of thousands of Rohingya out of their homes, many risked their lives to escape in smugglers’ boats; more than 100,000 others are living in squalid internment camps. Now, a counterinsurgency operation by Myanmar’s military is again forcing thousands of Rohingya to abandon their villages.

2016-11-22.lead_paragraph: One hundred years ago today, Jack London died in Sonoma County, Calif., at the age of 40. He was famous for novels, like the “The Call of the Wild,” which were based on his adventures, trekking through the Klondike or sailing the South Pacific. 2016-11-22.lead_paragraph: Our granddaughter is in kindergarten at a highly ranked elementary school: Test scores average in the top 1 percent of the schools in the state. Only 1.2 percent of the students are on a free or low-cost lunch. A sheet is passed out to parents of all students in the school from the parents’ organization at the beginning of the school year. Last year they pressured parents to donate $600 per year per student enrolled. This year the amount has been raised to $1,000. The parents’ organization keeps the books and clearly knows which parents have paid in full and which have not.
2016-11-22.headline_main: Should Parents Be Expected to Donate to a Public School?

2016-11-22.abstract: We’ve heard about its power to help us empathize with others. But what if, instead, it’s just cocooning us with our friends?
2016-11-22.snippet: We’ve heard about its power to help us empathize with others. But what if, instead, it’s just cocooning us with our friends?
2016-11-22.lead_paragraph: Maybe I shouldn’t have been surprised that Donald Trump could be elected president, but I was. I live in Brooklyn and work in Manhattan, two of the most liberal places in the country. But even online, I wasn’t seeing many signs of support for him. How did that blindness occur? Social media is my portal into the rest of the world — my periscope into the communities next to my community, into how the rest of the world thinks and feels. And it completely failed me.
2016-11-22.headline_main: Is Social Media Disconnecting Us From the Big Picture?

2016-11-22.abstract: It’s difficult to define but easy to enjoy.
2016-11-22.snippet: It’s difficult to define but easy to enjoy.
2016-11-22.lead_paragraph: Don’t be bitter, we’re told. But in American cocktail culture — especially its most rarefied, la-di-da precincts — bitterness has become a signifier of sophistication and discernment. A decade ago, bar patrons who wished to make it clear that they weren’t into the sweet stuff might have requested something on the dry side or the sour side. Now they’re as likely to want it bitter.
2016-11-22.headline_main: Amaro for Everyone

2016-11-22.abstract: A small group of superrich Americans — the president-elect among them — has laid the groundwork for an unprecedented legal assault on the media. Can they succeed?
2016-11-22.snippet: A small group of superrich Americans — the president-elect among them — has laid the groundwork for an unprecedented legal assault on the media. Can they succeed?
2016-11-22.lead_paragraph: In 2005, Tim O’Brien, then a financial reporter at The New York Times, published the book “TrumpNation: The Art of Being the Donald.” O'Brien talked to sources with an up-close view of Donald J. Trump’s finances, who concluded that the real-estate developer’s net worth was $150 million to $250 million, rather than the $2 billion to $5 billion Trump had variously claimed. Trump, who had courted O’Brien by taking him for rides in his Ferrari and private jet, sued O’Brien for libel in New Jersey in 2006. Trump called O’Brien a “wack job” on the “Today” show — while, O’Brien says, continuing to curry favor with him privately. O’Brien’s publisher, Warner Books, was also named in the suit and hired top lawyers who put Trump through an unsparing two-day deposition. Asked about his finances, Trump was caught lying or exaggerating 30 times. “He thought he’d get a friendly judge, and we would roll over,” says O’Brien, who is now the executive editor of Bloomberg View. “We didn’t.” The case went through four judges and was dismissed in 2009.
2016-11-22.headline_main: Billionaires vs. the Press in the Era of Trump

2016-11-22.abstract: The Zika scare in Latin America has prompted a recent surge in awareness and monitoring of the virus in Asia.
2016-11-22.snippet: The Zika scare in Latin America has prompted a recent surge in awareness and monitoring of the virus in Asia.
2016-11-22.lead_paragraph: The Zika virus caught the world’s attention last year after experts noticed that a small percentage of women carrying the virus in Latin America were giving birth to children with microcephaly, a defect that causes malformed heads and severely stunts brain development. The virus is now endemic there, and scientists fear that caseloads may spike again during the hot, wet months of the Southern Hemisphere’s summer, which begins in December.
2016-11-22.headline_main: Zika Looms in Asia, Tempered by a Fuller View of Its Dangers

2016-11-22.abstract: There may be a way to counter what alcohol does to your neurons: Go for a run.
2016-11-22.snippet: There may be a way to counter what alcohol does to your neurons: Go for a run.
2016-11-22.lead_paragraph: The holiday season is a good time for a reminder that alcohol can do bad things to the brain. Studies on animals suggest that it reduces the number of neurons in the hippocampus, the brain’s memory center, and weakens mitochondria there. Because mitochondria help produce energy within cells, their impairment can damage or kill brain cells. But two new animal studies offer some succor: Aerobic exercise, it turns out, may meliorate some of the impacts of heavy drinking on the brain.
2016-11-22.headline_main: Jogging the Brain

2016-11-22.abstract: Critics of President Park Geun-hye denounced the cooperation with Korea’s former colonizer, with the main opposition party calling her a “traitorous president.”
2016-11-22.snippet: Critics of President Park Geun-hye denounced the cooperation with Korea’s former colonizer, with the main opposition party calling her a “traitorous president.”
2016-11-22.lead_paragraph: SEOUL, South Korea — President Park Geun-hye on Tuesday approved a military intelligence-sharing pact with Japan aimed at countering the North Korean threat, a move that angered South Korean opposition parties, which want to impeach Ms. Park over a corruption scandal.
2016-11-22.headline_main: South Korean Leader, Amid Scandal, Approves Intelligence Pact With Japan

2016-11-22.abstract: A stained glass screen created for the headquarters of the Stasi has an asking price of $21.4 million.
2016-11-22.snippet: A stained glass screen created for the headquarters of the Stasi has an asking price of $21.4 million.
2016-11-22.lead_paragraph: An art historian in Germany has unearthed a three-ton, 65-foot-wide stained glass mural that was created in the early 1980s for the headquarters of the East German secret police, or Stasi, and had been forgotten in a shipping container for 24 years. It will go on sale at a temporary exhibition space in Miami to coincide with the Art Basel Miami Beach contemporary art fair next week, with a price tag of $21.4 million — which some historians said was out of line with its value.
2016-11-22.headline_main: Art for East Germany’s Secret Police Is for Sale in Miami

2016-11-22.abstract: The Mexican government has no reason to cooperate with a hostile administration in Washington.
2016-11-22.snippet: The Mexican government has no reason to cooperate with a hostile administration in Washington.
2016-11-22.lead_paragraph: This year, for the first time since Ronald Reagan assailed the Soviet Union in 1980, an American presidential candidate actively campaigned against another country’s national interests. By threatening to deport all undocumented immigrants, about half of whom are Mexican; to build a wall on the Mexican border; and to rip up the North American Free Trade Agreement, which is far more important for Mexico than for the United States, Donald J. Trump made Mexico one of the central issues of the campaign.
2016-11-22.headline_main: Mexico Doesn’t Have to Appease Trump. It Can Fight Back.

2016-11-22.abstract: Educated younger people in the less densely populated parts of the nation tend to move to the big coastal cities, because that’s where the jobs are.
2016-11-22.snippet: Educated younger people in the less densely populated parts of the nation tend to move to the big coastal cities, because that’s where the jobs are.
2016-11-22.lead_paragraph: This year’s election has forced Americans to take notice of class divisions between workers. And while these divisions may at first ring of lazy stereotypes — the rural Rust Belt worker without a college degree and the coastal urban college-educated worker — they’re rooted in a real dynamic. Many of the most skilled workers — young people with college degrees — are leaving struggling regions of America for cities, specifically for cities in Southern and coastal states.
2016-11-22.headline_main: The States That College Graduates Are Most Likely to Leave

2016-11-22.abstract: To celebrate a century and a half in business, the suddenly-cool-again heritage brand Grenson enlisted the famously unsparing photographer to capture its essence.
2016-11-22.snippet: To celebrate a century and a half in business, the suddenly-cool-again heritage brand Grenson enlisted the famously unsparing photographer to capture its essence.
2016-11-22.lead_paragraph: Long the preserve of fusty country gents, the venerable British footwear brand Grenson has enjoyed a renaissance in the hands of the designer Tim Little; its sturdy handmade shoes and boots are now prized by footwear fetishists from Hackney to Tokyo. This year, the label is celebrating its 150th birthday — in understated British fashion. It has re-editioned eight styles from the last century, including an awkward-looking orthopedic Oxford from the 1930s named the “Grenson Joy Step” and a 1940s infantryman’s boot.
2016-11-22.headline_main: A 150-Year-Old British Footwear Factory, Through the Lens of Martin Parr

2016-11-22.abstract: Michael Anastassiades shares personal images — and his passions and inspirations — with T.
2016-11-22.snippet: Michael Anastassiades shares personal images — and his passions and inspirations — with T.
2016-11-22.lead_paragraph: Michael Anastassiades’s lighting and furniture are the very picture of minimalism, but the designer dislikes the limited nature of the word. “I like to start broadly with my research and take information away,” says the London-based Cypriot. “It’s a distillation process.” His uncompromising aesthetic — a blend of clever functionality and spare organic beauty — has earned the 49-year-old a loyal following. His Calder-inspired mobiles and spheres are sold in such design meccas as the Future Perfect and Ralph Pucci, and he has collaborated with FlOS and the Parisian fashion boutique Colette.
2016-11-22.headline_main: The Great Big World of a Minimalist Lighting Designer

Trump said on Tuesday that he had no intention of pressing for an investigation into Hillary Clinton’s use of a private email server or the financial operations of her family’s foundation, dropping the “lock her up” pledge that became a rallying cry for his campaign for the White House.

2016-11-22.snippet: It’s possible that there will be only minimal disruptions to world economies, and better deals for American companies. Or not.
2016-11-22.lead_paragraph: Donald J. Trump, through decades in public life, has been consistent on one core policy idea: that the United States has gotten a raw deal from its major trading partners in the agreements that bind their economies. Renegotiating those terms will surely be a top priority for his administration.
2016-11-22.headline_main: What Will Trump Trade Policy Actually Look Like? Three Possibilities

2016-11-22.abstract: Researchers could make inferences about people from the chemicals they left on their phones, but there could be problems with using them in criminal investigations and court cases.
2016-11-22.snippet: Researchers could make inferences about people from the chemicals they left on their phones, but there could be problems with using them in criminal investigations and court cases.
2016-11-22.lead_paragraph: Your phone is pretty much a high-tech bucket of germs. Thousands of microscopic bugs crawl around on its surface. Remnants of dirty, old skin cells smudge its cover. Tiny hairs stick inside its buttons. And your hands have smeared hundreds of chemicals across its surface. The foundation on your face, the antidepressants you take, the shampoo in your shower and even the hard-core mosquito repellent you applied down in Panama four months ago: All of these things leave traces on your hands and phone. That’s why scientists say they can use your phone to learn a lot about your lifestyle.
2016-11-22.headline_main: Your Phone Carries Chemical Clues About You, but There Are Limits to Using Them

2016-11-22.snippet: Defying expectations, Oakland is 8-2 after beating the Texans on Monday night in Mexico City.
2016-11-22.lead_paragraph: Oakland Raiders fans got a dose of hope last season when, under a dynamic new coach, Jack Del Rio, their long-moribund team finished at 7-9, a sharp improvement after 4-12, 4-12 and 3-13 seasons. Still, it was their 13th straight year without a trip to the N.F.L. playoffs.
2016-11-22.headline_main: In Turnaround, Raiders Close In on Winning Season, Maybe More

2016-11-22.abstract: From a plug-in espresso machine to an organizer for toys and gadgets, accessories to make your trip go smoother.
2016-11-22.snippet: From a plug-in espresso machine to an organizer for toys and gadgets, accessories to make your trip go smoother.
2016-11-22.lead_paragraph: While talk of Thanksgiving travel often centers around the cost and tribulations of flying, during the holiday weekend more Americans actually hit the road.  AAA estimated that nearly 90 percent of Thanksgiving travelers will go by automobile this year, with about 48.7 million people driving 50 miles or more from home. That’s up nearly 2 percent over 2015, and the most Thanksgiving travelers since 2007. So why not make the journey more enjoyable? After all, you could spend hours sitting in traffic. Or maybe dinner at your cousin’s house wasn’t as tasty, er, filling, as you had hoped. Everyone knows to bring along the usual accessories, like phone chargers and tablet mounts. But certain extras can help shift a ho-hum road trip into the next gear. Below, a guide.
2016-11-22.headline_main: How to Upgrade Your Thanksgiving Road Trip

2016-11-22.lead_paragraph: In the early days of Thai cuisine in the United States, when pad Thai and spring rolls were exotic treats, Americans fell hard for the interlocking tastes of lime, fish sauce, chiles and herbs. Over the years, that love has grown lukewarm. Many of the restaurants weren’t very good to begin with, and watered-down, sloppy Americanized versions of dishes from central Thailand were the only Thai food many Americans knew.

2016-11-22.lead_paragraph: Few filmmakers are linked to a borough the way that Spike Lee is to Brooklyn. So when Mr. Lee, the 59-year-old director, announced that he was having an open casting call for a coming Netflix series based on “She’s Gotta Have It” last month, Brooklynites of all stripes turned out. The line of actors and performers at the Masonic Temple was so long that it wrapped around an entire block in Fort Greene. Despite the wait, the crowd was in good spirits and, naturally, smartly dressed.
2016-11-22.headline_main: What 10 Actors Wore to a Spike Lee Casting Call in Brooklyn

2016-11-22.abstract: Sushi Kaiseki takes up residence in David Bouley’s Brushstroke, and other restaurant news.
2016-11-22.snippet: Sushi Kaiseki takes up residence in David Bouley’s Brushstroke, and other restaurant news.
2016-11-22.lead_paragraph: GUN HILL TAVERN There’s a burger at this South Bronx newcomer to be sure, but with a menu that also features shrimp po’ boys, vegetable quesadillas and a pulled-pork Cuban sandwich, it’s not your everyday neighborhood spot. “We’re serving more upscale pub food so we might attract a wider market,” said Dave Lopez, an owner, along with Adam Gherardi, the manager. Mr. Lopez is also a partner in Gun Hill Brewing Company, in the north Bronx, near Gun Hill Road. The tavern will serve its own beers, with names pulled from history, given that there was a Revolutionary War battle at Gun Hill. (One of the beers, Rise Up Rye, is poured at the Richard Rodgers Theater, where “Hamilton” is playing.) Everything in a glass is from New York State, including other beers, wines, ciders and spirits. The tavern pours a kind of refined Puerto Rican moonshine called Pitorro from Port Morris Distillery next door, also a partner in the tavern. Other whiskeys include some made in-house and used to flavor homemade ice cream: 780 East 133rd Street (Willow Avenue), Port Morris, Bronx, 718-585-3192, gunhillbrewing.com.
2016-11-22.headline_main: Gun Hill Tavern Opens in the Bronx

2016-11-22.abstract: A study published Tuesday found that some babies who did not have unusually small heads when they were born still presented microcephaly months later.
2016-11-22.snippet: A study published Tuesday found that some babies who did not have unusually small heads when they were born still presented microcephaly months later.
2016-11-22.lead_paragraph: It is the news that doctors and families in the heart of Zika territory had feared: Some babies not born with the unusually small heads that are the most severe hallmark of brain damage as a result of the virus have developed the condition, called microcephaly, as they have grown older.
2016-11-22.headline_main: Microcephaly Found in Babies of Zika-Infected Mothers Months After Birth

2016-11-22.snippet: This sequel addresses two unnecessary questions: What if bad Santa weren’t so bad? And what if he had an estranged and equally foul mother?
2016-11-22.lead_paragraph: In the hall of fame of ill-tempered comic characters, between wax works of W. C. Fields and Larry David, there ought to be a monument to Billy Bob Thornton’s work as Willie, the alcoholic safecracker of “Bad Santa.” As much as Terry Zwigoff’s 2003 film relied on the spectacle of Mr. Thornton soiling himself in a Santa suit or saying unspeakable things to children, the performance was a master class in timing and sly reaction shots. Only Mr. Thornton could have played the role.

2016-11-22.lead_paragraph: Moana is the daughter of a chief and will someday inherit her father’s position, but she’s furious when Maui, a tattooed, muscle-bound demigod, calls her a princess. Moana (MWAH-nah) is not only part of a dynastic line but also a girl off on an adventure in the company of a cute animal sidekick (a dimwitted chicken named Heihei). So not just any princess, in other words: a Disney princess. She may be on a quest to save her island and restore ecological balance to the planet, but Moana (voiced by Auli’i Cravalho) is also upholding a brand.
2016-11-22.headline_main: Review: ‘Moana,’ Brave Princess on a Voyage With a Chicken

2016-11-22.abstract: Doctors not only monitored torture by C.I.A. operatives, they helped design it. They should not lose their ethical moorings again.
2016-11-22.snippet: Doctors not only monitored torture by C.I.A. operatives, they helped design it. They should not lose their ethical moorings again.
2016-11-22.lead_paragraph: President-elect Donald J. Trump on Tuesday expressed reservations about the use of torture. But he did not disavow the practice, or his promise to bring it back. And if he does, C.I.A. doctors may be America’s last defense against a return to savagery. But they’ll need to break sharply with what they did the last time around.

2016-11-22.abstract: This film takes comic aim at Hollywood absurdity and at Hughes, the eccentric mogul.
2016-11-22.snippet: This film takes comic aim at Hollywood absurdity and at Hughes, the eccentric mogul.
2016-11-22.lead_paragraph: It may be hyperbolic to describe Warren Beatty’s Howard Hughes movie, “Rules Don’t Apply,” as a screwball “Citizen Kane.” But that’s what it feels like. From another perspective, this serio-comic portrait of Hughes, the aeronautics mogul, movie producer and marathon womanizer, might also be a satirical cartoon that emphasizes his similarities to Donald J. Trump. Why else would Mr. Beatty name a fictional aspiring singer and actress who comes into Hughes’s orbit Marla Mabrey?
2016-11-22.headline_main: Review: ‘Rules Don’t Apply’ Features Warren Beatty as Howard Hughes

2016-11-22.abstract: The 2015 tax filing of Donald J. Trump's foundation offers new details about the president-elect’s charitable giving, which became the subject of intense scrutiny during his presidential campaign. On the filing, the charity checked “yes” to answer a question about whether its resources had been directed or used to benefit a “disqualified person” — meaning one of the organization’s central people.

One result of that spike, Gulati said, is “that pressure has increased on anyone involved in the game.”

Great art will come out of this, people told me. Times like this make for great art.

2016-11-23.abstract: Attending the theater before 1850 or so in the United States was far more akin to attending a football game today than to attending contemporary theater.
2016-11-23.snippet: Attending the theater before 1850 or so in the United States was far more akin to attending a football game today than to attending contemporary theater.
2016-11-23.lead_paragraph: In 1832, during a performance of “Richard III” at the Bowery Theater in Manhattan, 300 boisterous audience members joined the cast onstage to participate in the final sword fight and the slaying of the tyrannical King Richard. According to a newspaper account, “the audience mingled with the soldiers and raced across the stage” and during the last duel “made a ring around the combatants to see fair play, and kept them at it for nearly a quarter of an hour.” In today’s theater, where audience members are admonished to unwrap their candy in advance to avoid making a sound, such a scene is hard to fathom; in the 19th-century theater, it was of a piece (although on the rowdy side of the spectrum) with standard audience behavior.
2016-11-23.headline_main: Long Before ‘Hamilton’ Brouhaha, Theater Was Anything but Polite
