2016-11-23.abstract: President Obama could step in to protect everyone’s safety and pressure the sheriff’s officers to stand down in North Dakota.
2016-11-23.snippet: President Obama could step in to protect everyone’s safety and pressure the sheriff’s officers to stand down in North Dakota.
2016-11-23.lead_paragraph: When injustice aligns with cruelty, and heavy weaponry is involved, the results can be shameful and bloody. Witness what happened on Sunday in North Dakota, when law enforcement officers escalated their tactics against unarmed American Indians and allies who have waged months of protests against the Dakota Access oil pipeline.
2016-11-23.headline_main: Power Imbalance at the Pipeline Protest

2016-11-23.abstract: In a saner time, in a country whose politics were less poisoned, there would be no talk of punishing young immigrants.
2016-11-23.snippet: In a saner time, in a country whose politics were less poisoned, there would be no talk of punishing young immigrants.
2016-11-23.lead_paragraph: In a saner time, in a country whose politics were less poisoned, there would be no talk of punishing young immigrants like Sofia De La Vega, Luis Roberto Ursua Briceno and Anayancy Ramos. No one would be threatening to derail their ambitions, stifle their educations, throttle their dreams.
2016-11-23.headline_main: America Has Room for the Dreamers

2016-11-23.abstract: I made the choice to sacrifice social acceptability for the freedom to be myself.
2016-11-23.snippet: I made the choice to sacrifice social acceptability for the freedom to be myself.
2016-11-23.lead_paragraph: When I was 17, my father took me to a juvenile treatment clinic to see if doctors could figure out what was wrong with me. I entered a room. I sat on a chair. I waited for a long while. There was a video camera trained on me. Then I heard voices, the voices of doctors behind a two-way mirror. It was like being in a police interrogation room in the movies.
2016-11-23.headline_main: My Life With Tourette’s Syndrome

2016-11-23.abstract: Reports of domestic workers falling to their deaths this year have added urgency to a long-running debate about the city’s reliance on low-cost migrant labor.
2016-11-23.snippet: Reports of domestic workers falling to their deaths this year have added urgency to a long-running debate about the city’s reliance on low-cost migrant labor.
2016-11-23.lead_paragraph: HONG KONG — Whenever the windows of her employer’s 35th-floor apartment looked dirty, Win Win Warsiating would lean halfway out of the high-rise building to clean them. Sometimes she would glance down at the ground far below and be seized with anxiety, she said. But she never complained.
2016-11-23.headline_main: After Window-Washing Deaths, a Debate Over Migrants’ Rights in Hong Kong

2016-11-23.abstract: Even as she fought cancer, the singer Sharon Jones lived for the stage as a powerful, soulful presence. From legendary theaters to sweltering Midwest venues, she gave it her best.
2016-11-23.snippet: Even as she fought cancer, the singer Sharon Jones lived for the stage as a powerful, soulful presence. From legendary theaters to sweltering Midwest venues, she gave it her best.
2016-11-23.lead_paragraph: Jacob Blickenstaff has been photographing Sharon Jones and the Dap-Kings since 2009. He started out documenting shows, then recording sessions, and was eventually asked by Gabe Roth, a co-founder of Daptone Records, to shoot his first album cover for the label, “I Learned the Hard Way,” depicting Miss Jones and the group in back of their studio in Bushwick, Brooklyn. Since then, Mr. Blickenstaff has worked with the label on several other album projects. After Ms. Jones’s death last week, Mr. Blickenstaff reflected on his years with the band.
2016-11-23.headline_main: Miss Sharon Jones, a Queen Among Dap-Kings

2016-11-23.abstract: Beijing’s distinct and colorful dialect is heard less and less as migration, development and language standardization programs reshape the city.
2016-11-23.snippet: Beijing’s distinct and colorful dialect is heard less and less as migration, development and language standardization programs reshape the city.
2016-11-23.lead_paragraph: BEIJING — To the untutored ear, the Beijing dialect can sound like someone talking with a mouthful of marbles, inspiring numerous parodies and viral videos. Its colorful vocabulary and distinctive pronunciation have inspired traditional performance arts such as cross-talk, a form of comic dialogue, and “kuaibanr,’’ storytelling accompanied by bamboo clappers.
2016-11-23.headline_main: The Disappearing Dialect at the Heart of China’s Capital

2016-11-23.headline_main: With Philip Hammond’s Plan, U.K. Shelves Austerity

2016-11-23.abstract: Stabilize the board before standing. Then pop up light as a cat.
2016-11-23.snippet: Stabilize the board before standing. Then pop up light as a cat.
2016-11-23.lead_paragraph: “One of the biggest mistakes beginners make,” says Carol Philips, founder of the North Shore Surf Girls surf school and a pioneer of big-wave body boarding for women, “is that they equate catching a wave with standing up.” Philips says it’s more important to focus on stabilizing the board with your hands, lying prone on your stomach and then standing up. But, she says, beginners should not try to do all three of those things at the same time.
2016-11-23.headline_main: How to Catch a Wave

2016-11-23.abstract: A republic of doting parents and proud siblings, supportive neighbors and sentimental alumni.
2016-11-23.snippet: A republic of doting parents and proud siblings, supportive neighbors and sentimental alumni.
2016-11-23.lead_paragraph: Kenny Byrd broke one tackle, then another, and soon he had nothing in front of him but end zone. The crowd roared with delight; the marching band lifted its horns and belted out a celebratory rendition of “Shut Up and Dance.” Cowbells clanged. Behind me, the superintendent of schools celebrated next to a local Republican candidate for the State Legislature. In front of me, a Latino family embraced before turning around to offer me high-fives. I obliged them. Though I hadn’t lived in Hot Springs, Ark., for more than 20 years, this was my alma mater.
2016-11-23.headline_main: Letter of Recommendation: High-School-Football Games

2016-11-23.abstract: Marriage is a journey you must walk together. Make sure you’re not wearing the same weirdo shoes.
2016-11-23.snippet: Marriage is a journey you must walk together. Make sure you’re not wearing the same weirdo shoes.
2016-11-23.lead_paragraph: Ryan writes: I often wear checkered Vans slip-ons while running errands, and my wife decided to get the exact same pair. I do not want to wear the same shoes in public. Please order that she cannot copy me.
2016-11-23.headline_main: Judge John Hodgman on Copying Checkered Vans

2016-11-23.abstract: Advertisers say featuring models with Down syndrome helps them to communicate their values and connect with customers who value inclusiveness.
2016-11-23.snippet: Advertisers say featuring models with Down syndrome helps them to communicate their values and connect with customers who value inclusiveness.
2016-11-23.lead_paragraph: IN a new commercial for the Fisher-Price Little People Sit ‘n Stand Skyway, Lili Boglarka Havasi claps and smiles as the cars zoom down the plastic raceway. It’s a typical holiday toy ad except for one fact: Lili has Down syndrome.
2016-11-23.headline_main: In Toy Ads and on the Catwalk, Models With Down Syndrome

2016-11-23.abstract: A 14-year-old dying girl’s last wish is fulfilled.
2016-11-23.snippet: A 14-year-old dying girl’s last wish is fulfilled.
2016-11-23.lead_paragraph: The saying goes that two things in life are certain: death and taxes. One of those, however, might be not so certain after all. Cryogenics is the scientific process by which a dead body is frozen in the hopes it will one day be thawed, bringing the person back to life. So far, the reversal process has happened only in movies, but that doesn’t stop some people from wanting the option.
2016-11-23.headline_main: Would You Like to Be Cryogenically Preserved (Frozen!) Upon Your Death?

2016-11-23.abstract: A confrontation with a wild black bear.
2016-11-23.snippet: A confrontation with a wild black bear.
2016-11-23.lead_paragraph: It happened so fast: One moment I was running trails, the next I was staring a black-bear sow in the face, so close I could smell it, wild and pungent and alarming, and I knew it could smell me, too, my fear.
2016-11-23.headline_main: Running Into Danger on an Alaskan Trail

2016-11-23.abstract: Selected by Matthew Zapruder.
2016-11-23.snippet: Selected by Matthew Zapruder.
2016-11-23.lead_paragraph: Aristotle wrote that poets are those who have “an eye for resemblances,” unexpected likenesses that only by means of the poem reveal themselves to us as true. This poet sees such an unexpected resemblance between medical forms and the scalp of an “unreal child,” presumably a desired one, and through that resemblance, he is able to conjure the mixture of feelings a person might have in this awkward, hopeful, itself quite unreal-seeming situation. Selected by Matthew Zapruder.
2016-11-23.headline_main: In Vitro

2016-11-23.abstract: Residents of eastern Aleppo describe the terror that rises in them every time they see a plane cross the sky.
2016-11-23.snippet: Residents of eastern Aleppo describe the terror that rises in them every time they see a plane cross the sky.
2016-11-23.lead_paragraph: Residents of eastern Aleppo have been living for more than five years under skies heavily trafficked by Syrian and now also Russian warplanes. Activists and citizens in the besieged rebel-held areas of the city have posted videos online of bombs being dropped, and have described in WhatsApp voice messages the fear that grips them every time they see an aircraft cross the sky.
2016-11-23.headline_main: Searching the Sky for Bombs in Aleppo

2016-11-23.snippet: Beatrice, the second wife (and second cousin) of the King of Bohemia, and her baby are believed to be the first mother and child to survive a cesarean section, new research has found.
2016-11-23.lead_paragraph: Births by cesarean section are so common these days that it is easy to forget what they were like before the advent of modern medicine: desperate gambits to save a baby by sacrificing the mother.

2016-11-23.abstract: Make sure it has just your essentials (most people carry too many credit cards), and take the time to back up your personal documents.
2016-11-23.snippet: Make sure it has just your essentials (most people carry too many credit cards), and take the time to back up your personal documents.
2016-11-23.lead_paragraph: Losing your wallet or having it stolen is a nuisance anytime, but when you’re on vacation, it can ruin the hope of a good trip, according to Chris McGoey, a security consultant who has traveled to more than 110 countries. “People carry critical personal information like credit cards and a driver’s license in their wallet, and a lost or stolen one is a bigger headache and harder to recover from when you’re traveling,” he said.
2016-11-23.headline_main: Taking Your Wallet on Vacation? Here’s How to Keep It Safe

2016-11-23.abstract: The writer, a self-confessed travel snob traveling with her husband and toddler, wondered what quality you could get in a packaged trip.
2016-11-23.snippet: The writer, a self-confessed travel snob traveling with her husband and toddler, wondered what quality you could get in a packaged trip.
2016-11-23.lead_paragraph: Maybe it’s because I hadn’t been to Hawaii since I was a child, when everything seemed big. But even from 10,000 feet, the Big Island was surprisingly, strikingly large. Its volcanic peaks had vast slopes, each divided into color-coded microclimates of green and tan, and each punctuated with charcoal-hued tributaries of recently cooled lava.
2016-11-23.headline_main: Looking for a Bargain Vacation? Don’t Rule Out Hawaii

2016-11-23.abstract: With a week left in the regular season plus conference championships, plenty could change. But here’s a look at categories of contenders.

2016-11-23.headline_main: Who’s Likely to Make the College Football Playoff (Besides Alabama)

2016-11-23.abstract: A new energy has taken hold in Catskill on the heels of the Catskill Mill, a project by the Etsy founder Rob Kalin and a partner that includes spaces for craftspeople.
2016-11-23.snippet: A new energy has taken hold in Catskill on the heels of the Catskill Mill, a project by the Etsy founder Rob Kalin and a partner that includes spaces for craftspeople.
2016-11-23.lead_paragraph: Inside the New York Restaurant in Catskill, N.Y., on a recent Sunday afternoon, a jazz band whiled away the hours as the place filled up. Fresh into town, a friend and I marveled at unusual dishes like “cauliflower wings” and brussels sprout chips, and at the sense that we’d stumbled into the clubhouse for local creatives. I’d last visited Catskill a couple of years before, and here was my first indication that since then, a new energy had taken hold in this small town of 4,000 set in the Hudson Valley, where Catskill Creek meets the Hudson River.
2016-11-23.headline_main: In the Hudson Valley, a New Mecca for Artisans

2016-11-23.abstract: Donald Trump and Hillary Clinton focused on attacks on character, and the data on their campaign ads shows it.
2016-11-23.snippet: Donald Trump and Hillary Clinton focused on attacks on character, and the data on their campaign ads shows it.
2016-11-23.lead_paragraph: If you think back to this year’s presidential campaign and recall a lot of articles mentioning Hillary Clinton’s email troubles and Donald J. Trump’s various controversies, you wouldn’t be wrong. If it seems there were fewer articles about jobs, the economy and taxes, that’s because there were. The temptation to blame news organizations for this imbalance is strong, but there is at least some reason to resist it. Critics have long assailed campaign coverage as focused too much on candidate personality, campaign strategy and assessments of who’s winning, instead of on policies and ideas. But this year, the candidates share the blame.
2016-11-23.headline_main: Why This Election Was Not About the Issues

2016-11-23.abstract: David Webb originally sketched the striking cuff in 1971.
2016-11-23.snippet: David Webb originally sketched the striking cuff in 1971.
2016-11-23.lead_paragraph: David Webb helped define the audacious edge of mid-20th-century jewelry design. In an atelier above the glamorous Manhattan shop he opened in 1948, the genteel Southerner fashioned extravagant bejeweled creations — often in the shape of exotic animals — that were coveted by Elizabeth Taylor, Lana Turner and Barbra Streisand. Diana Vreeland often wore Webb’s zebra bangle with ruby eyes. Thanks to the 40,000 sketches left behind after his death in 1975, his iconic designs have continued to live on — including this recently reissued modernist gold and black enamel cuff. Designed by Webb in 1971, it juxtaposes opaque and translucent gems in a bold geometric composition of carved coral and diamonds surrounding a massive 58-carat Brazilian citrine.
2016-11-23.headline_main: A Bracelet Reissued Over 40 Years After a Designer’s Death

2016-11-23.abstract: The Netflix series ends its first season with two especially juicy episodes.
2016-11-23.snippet: The Netflix series ends its first season with two especially juicy episodes.
2016-11-23.lead_paragraph: As we have seen, the struggle to become the head of state of the American republic can be ugly and brutal. One of the upsides of being a constitutional monarchy is that there’s no such struggle. No one elects the British head of state — no one but God. The monarch’s role is to be (or, at least, to appear) immutable. Queen Elizabeth II wields a delicate, unsought sovereignty that can never be eschewed (except by abdication or death) and is rarely exercised. She must evolve with change and sometimes nudge it — but never, ever demand it.
2016-11-23.headline_main: Tina Brown on the Final Two Episodes of ‘The Crown’: Love and Duty

2016-11-23.abstract: Latin America’s ideological pendulum is shifting from left to right, but new leaders are also repeating the errors of their predecessors.
2016-11-23.snippet: Latin America’s ideological pendulum is shifting from left to right, but new leaders are also repeating the errors of their predecessors.
2016-11-23.lead_paragraph: BOGOTÁ, Colombia — In the late 2000s, leftist politicians were leading countries all across Latin America. Today, most are in retreat, challenged by a new crop of would-be leaders promising to fix the problems created by the left. In Argentina, Paraguay and Peru, these challengers have won elections. In Brazil, they took office this year as a result of a presidential impeachment and, as in Chile, gained ground in municipal elections. In Colombia, Mexico and Venezuela, they are regaining electoral strength.
2016-11-23.headline_main: The Curse of Hypercorrection in Latin America

2016-11-23.abstract: From the archives of The International Herald Tribune: Lawmakers in the French Parliament disagree on a labor law limiting the daily hours of female workers in November 1891.
2016-11-23.snippet: From the archives of The International Herald Tribune: Lawmakers in the French Parliament disagree on a labor law limiting the daily hours of female workers in November 1891.
2016-11-23.lead_paragraph: There is a prospect of a conflict between the two French Chambers in respect to the new law for regulating labor. The Bill as it left the Chamber provided that ten hours per day should be the maximum for youths under eighteen, boys, girls, and women of all ages. When the law reached the Senate there was an animated discussion of the portion of the clause relating to women; and eventually, on the motion of M. Berenger, the words “and women” were struck out by 109 votes to 99.
2016-11-23.headline_main: 1891: A 10-Hour Day for Women in France

2016-11-23.abstract: Damien Chazelle’s film infuses Hollywood movies with a vision and energy that have been sorely missing.
2016-11-23.snippet: Damien Chazelle’s film infuses Hollywood movies with a vision and energy that have been sorely missing.
2016-11-23.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES — The first time I watched Damien Chazelle’s musical, “La La Land,” I thought a lot about how it worked, about its form, his craft and how the lickable candy-colored costumes bring to mind both M&M’s and Jacques Demy. I thought about how Mr. Chazelle and his stars, Emma Stone and Ryan Gosling, fit into the history of the film musical. When I went to see “La La Land” again, I was in a terrible state, and this time I just fell into it, gratefully. I surrendered. Afterward, I realized that this must have been what it was like to watch Fred Astaire and Ginger Rogers during the Great Depression.
2016-11-23.headline_main: ‘La La Land’ Makes Musicals Matter Again

2016-11-23.abstract: MoMA will unveil “A Revolutionary Impulse: The Rise of the Russian Avant-Garde,” a culling of nearly 270 works from its extensive holdings.
2016-11-23.snippet: MoMA will unveil “A Revolutionary Impulse: The Rise of the Russian Avant-Garde,” a culling of nearly 270 works from its extensive holdings.
2016-11-23.lead_paragraph: The Museum of Modern Art is getting a head start celebrating the centennial of the Russian Revolution of 1917. On Saturday, Dec. 3, it will unveil “A Revolutionary Impulse: The Rise of the Russian Avant-Garde,” a culling of nearly 270 works from its extensive holdings. Everything on view was made between 1912, when European modernism was especially influential among a talented cadre of Russian artists, and 1934, when the Soviet government clamped down on avant-garde activities. The show will put on view nearly all of the museum’s Russian paintings and sculptures from these years, tracing the absorption of Cubism and Futurism and the rise of Suprematism and Constructivism. There will also be films and film posters, photographs, illustrated books, prints, drawings, utilitarian objects and magazines, including a complete run of 22 issues of Novyi Lef, or New Left, magazine, recently acquired, which reflect the design and photographic genius of Aleksandr Rodchenko. (Through March 12; moma.org.)
2016-11-23.headline_main: Looking Back on a Revolution: Russian Art at MoMA

2016-11-23.abstract: A symbol of America’s ailing infrastructure, Lock No. 52 on the Ohio River is responsible for a shipping bottleneck that hobbles commerce far and wide.
2016-11-23.snippet: A symbol of America’s ailing infrastructure, Lock No. 52 on the Ohio River is responsible for a shipping bottleneck that hobbles commerce far and wide.

Several of the panels that kept the water back were missing, while others were out of true. Weeks of work stretched before him, compounded by the vagaries of the river.

2016-11-23.snippet: Mr. Almodóvar is the subject of a 20-film retrospective at the Museum of Modern Art. Expect delirious sensuality.
2016-11-23.lead_paragraph: If, among Spain’s great directors, Luis Buñuel was the bourgeoisie’s secular critic, and Carlos Saura the symbolist poet of the Franco regime’s twilight, Pedro Almodóvar initially embodied the cultural bacchanal after Franco’s death in 1975. By now, Mr. Almodóvar — the subject of a 20-film retrospective at the Museum of Modern Art from Tuesday, Nov. 29, through Dec. 17 — is an Oscar winner (“All About My Mother” took best foreign film in 2000; “Talk to Her” won for best original screenplay in 2003) and a Spanish national treasure.
2016-11-23.headline_main: Pedro Almodóvar: Oscar Winner and Spanish Treasure

Originally developed from cabaret performances in Canada, it’s about a group of school choir kids who meet their grisly ends when the roller coaster they are riding malfunctions. They assemble in some strange purgatory, where it is revealed that one will be granted the chance to return to life, while the others will head, well, who knows where.

Take Goldie’s, an unpretentious beer-and-shot joint that opened in Greenpoint. It has become an indispensable local hangout, mostly for its reliable marriage of cheap drinks and familiar faces.

2016-11-23.abstract: Now in his third year as president of Youngstown State University, the former coach reflects on his time at Ohio State.
2016-11-23.snippet: Now in his third year as president of Youngstown State University, the former coach reflects on his time at Ohio State.
2016-11-23.lead_paragraph: YOUNGSTOWN, Ohio — Jim Tressel greeted the servers one afternoon last week at an 89-year-old Italian restaurant with wood-panel walls. He sat in a booth and crossed his legs. He still had his familiar correct, salt-and-pepper haircut and the same glasses, worn crookedly. He wore a blazer, a tie, a blue sweater — was it a sweater? He flared open one side of his blazer to reveal that yes, it was a sweater vest he had on under there.
2016-11-23.headline_main: Five Years After Scandal, Jim Tressel Is Still a Buckeye

2016-11-23.abstract: Facebook and Google are under fire for spreading fake news, but given some of the ads it runs, The Times should take a good look at its own house.
2016-11-23.snippet: Facebook and Google are under fire for spreading fake news, but given some of the ads it runs, The Times should take a good look at its own house.
2016-11-23.lead_paragraph: If you are a close observer of The New York Times, as Alison Harvey is, you might have noticed a headline about Megyn Kelly, the Fox News anchor. It suggested that she had died, at age 45, leaving us without “America’s favorite news reporter.”
2016-11-23.headline_main: Condemning ‘Fake News,’ but Running Fake-News Ads

2016-11-23.abstract: Television’s avalanche of holiday fare began a few weeks ago on some outlets, and now it is really picking up.
2016-11-23.snippet: Television’s avalanche of holiday fare began a few weeks ago on some outlets, and now it is really picking up.
2016-11-23.lead_paragraph: If the supposed war on Christmas is still being waged, you’d never know it from the television listings for the next few weeks. Christmas — which conservative critics have complained has been marginalized in our cross-cultural age — is everywhere this season, often right in the titles of specials and made-for-TV movies. And one of the first examples comes Friday night on that most libertine of cable outlets, HBO.
2016-11-23.headline_main: Weathering a Blizzard of Christmas TV Programming

2016-11-23.abstract: No one really pandered to them. Does that mean no one cares?
2016-11-23.snippet: No one really pandered to them. Does that mean no one cares?
2016-11-23.lead_paragraph: One cannot rule out a blizzard in Minnesota after Labor Day, and so when I travel for Thanksgiving or any time in the fall, I am careful to fly into Des Moines instead of Minneapolis, and then drive the 200 miles north to my hometown. I like to drive through Iowa during autumn because it turns back time. When I travel straight north, I traverse latitude, moving toward a place where the thaw arrives later in the spring.
2016-11-23.headline_main: The Farmers We Forgot

2016-11-23.abstract: A market debut early next year could get Snap trading ahead of anticipated stock sales by older ventures including Airbnb, Palantir, Pinterest and Uber.
2016-11-23.snippet: A market debut early next year could get Snap trading ahead of anticipated stock sales by older ventures including Airbnb, Palantir, Pinterest and Uber.
2016-11-23.lead_paragraph: Snap wants to be sure youth is not wasted on the young. The company, which offers an app with disappearing messages and pictures, is preparing an initial public offering at the tender age of five years. That is earlier than most of its technologically minded peers, which tend to mature a little more before going public. Snap’s value, however, may yet have some growing to do.
2016-11-23.headline_main: Snap Moving to I.P.O. Faster Than Its Peers

2016-11-23.abstract: Ms. Haley, the governor of South Carolina, once criticized President-elect Donald J. Trump’s demeanor, but is now his choice for United Nations ambassador.
2016-11-23.snippet: Ms. Haley, the governor of South Carolina, once criticized President-elect Donald J. Trump’s demeanor, but is now his choice for United Nations ambassador.
2016-11-23.lead_paragraph: ATLANTA — Gov. Nikki R. Haley of South Carolina is the daughter of immigrants, favors free markets and global trade, and earned international attention for speaking out against the Confederate battle flag in the aftermath of the 2015 massacre at a black church in Charleston. During Donald J. Trump’s presidential campaign, she sharply criticized his demeanor and warned what it might mean for American diplomacy — even suggesting that his tendency to lash out at critics could cause a world war.
2016-11-23.headline_main: Nikki Haley’s Path: From Daughter of Immigrants to Trump’s Pick for U.N.

2016-11-23.snippet: The New School honors Maria Thereza Alves, whose “Seeds of Change” traces human movement around the globe.
2016-11-23.lead_paragraph: Maria Thereza Alves, an artist who helped found Brazil’s Green Party and whose floating-garden pieces explore human migration through the idea of seeds distributed inadvertently around the world in the holds of cargo ships, has won the Vera List Center Prize for Art and Politics. The prize is given every two years to an artist or group whose work furthers social justice.
2016-11-23.headline_main: Prize for Migration Project That Weaves Art and Politics

2016-11-23.lead_paragraph: At 76, Lucinda Childs finds herself in a position she didn’t imagine she’d be in again: running a dance company. “I sort of thought, well that was interesting, and it was great, and I had the 30 years in SoHo,” she said before a rehearsal in Brooklyn last month. “I’m sort of moving on.”

2016-11-23.abstract: Make it meaningful at shops that are donating to good causes, get a free ride with Uber for shopping on Small Business Saturday, and more.
2016-11-23.snippet: Make it meaningful at shops that are donating to good causes, get a free ride with Uber for shopping on Small Business Saturday, and more.
2016-11-23.lead_paragraph: Here comes the biggest shopping weekend of the year. This Thanksgiving, Apiece Apart aims to make the whole experience more meaningful by recruiting 10 women-led brands to donate 5 percent of total sales — from Black Friday to Cyber Monday — to Planned Parenthood. Support the cause from the comfort of your couch by purchasing a wrap-style blanket coat ($472.50) from the Apiece Apart website, or head to Rachel Comey, Creatures of Comfort and Maryam Nassir Zadeh if you’re out and about in the city. At apieceapart.com. Rachel Comey is at 95 Crosby Street, Creatures of Comfort is at 205 Mulberry Street, Maryam Nassir Zadeh is at 123 Norfolk Street.
2016-11-23.headline_main: Are You Ready for the Biggest Shopping Weekend of the Year?

2016-11-23.headline_main: How to Help if Someone Is Being Harassed

2016-11-23.snippet: This is the third album from Mr. Mars and his first in four years.
2016-11-23.lead_paragraph: The Bruno Mars way-back machine has been one of pop’s most reliable tools in the last few years, and it rarely falls short of complete, uncanny accuracy. His skill for manipulating the past has made him something of an outlier: a retro-minded soul singer, songwriter and producer interested not in strict nostalgia, but in illuminating old styles so they shimmer in a way that’s appealing to a listener not much interested in looking backward.
2016-11-23.headline_main: Review: Bruno Mars Delivers Decades of Funk in ‘24K Magic’

2016-11-23.lead_paragraph: MANILA — Thomas Dooley has bad memories of the 1998 World Cup. He was a player with the United States back then, when the team lost all three of its games in France. After the tournament, FIFA ranked the 32 participants; it put the Americans last.
2016-11-23.headline_main: Soccer in the Philippines Scrambles for a Toehold, With an American Leading the Way

2016-11-23.abstract: Since the election, rates have climbed roughly half a percentage point, adding hundreds, sometimes thousands, of dollars to a buyer’s yearly payments.
2016-11-23.snippet: Since the election, rates have climbed roughly half a percentage point, adding hundreds, sometimes thousands, of dollars to a buyer’s yearly payments.
2016-11-23.lead_paragraph: When Jared Rutledge called his mortgage broker one morning last week after putting in an offer on a home in Glendale, Ariz., just west of Phoenix, he discovered that the 3.8 percent rate he had been quoted a couple of months ago had already gone up to 4.125 percent. That afternoon, it had inched up to 4.25, and by evening, when he finally called back to finalize the deal, it was 4.375 percent.
2016-11-23.headline_main: Mortgage Rates’ Rise Catches Home Buyers — and Lenders — Off Guard

2016-11-23.abstract: Along Fifth Avenue, the luxury stores adjacent to Trump Tower adjust to the none-too-jolly presence of police barricades and bomb-sniffing dogs.
2016-11-23.snippet: Along Fifth Avenue, the luxury stores adjacent to Trump Tower adjust to the none-too-jolly presence of police barricades and bomb-sniffing dogs.
2016-11-23.lead_paragraph: It is the beginning of the holiday shopping season on Fifth Avenue, even if the festive spirit is dampened a bit by the long guns of stationed police officers and the regular presence of bomb-sniffing dogs.
2016-11-23.headline_main: How Fifth Avenue Is Coping

2016-11-23.abstract: A book by Salvatore Settis, an art historian and chairman of the Louvre Museum’s Scientific Council, sounds the alarm about Italy’s fabled metropolis.
2016-11-23.snippet: A book by Salvatore Settis, an art historian and chairman of the Louvre Museum’s Scientific Council, sounds the alarm about Italy’s fabled metropolis.
2016-11-23.lead_paragraph: For centuries, Venice has a been a gorgeous shell — the colorful, fragile remains of its former imperial past. It is a stop on an itinerary, not a final destination. “There is no use pretending that the tourist Venice is not the real Venice,” Mary McCarthy wrote in “Venice Observed,” published in 1956.
2016-11-23.headline_main: Review: ‘If Venice Dies’ Examines a City Sinking, and Not Only Into Water

2016-11-23.abstract: The strike was resolved after its musicians agreed to freeze their defined benefit pensions and management settled for an initial 7.5 percent wage cut.
2016-11-23.snippet: The strike was resolved after its musicians agreed to freeze their defined benefit pensions and management settled for an initial 7.5 percent wage cut.
2016-11-23.lead_paragraph: The Pittsburgh Symphony Orchestra settled a 55-day strike on Wednesday, just in time for Thanksgiving. The strike was resolved after its musicians agreed to freeze their defined benefit pensions and management settled for an initial 7.5 percent wage cut, half of what it had been seeking.
2016-11-23.headline_main: Pittsburgh Symphony Orchestra Strike Is Resolved

2016-11-23.lead_paragraph: If you’re in the retail business in the United States, you probably really care about these two things: millennials and Black Friday.

2016-11-23.abstract: Any effort to promote vouchers from Washington would run up against structural realities.
2016-11-23.snippet: Any effort to promote vouchers from Washington would run up against structural realities.
2016-11-23.lead_paragraph: We’re resurfacing this article after the narrow confirmation of Betsy DeVos as education secretary on Tuesday. As we noted in November, she will be highly constrained in trying to voucherize American K-12 education.
2016-11-23.headline_main: Why Betsy DeVos Won’t Be Able to Privatize U.S. Education

2016-11-23.abstract: The guild is seeking permission in court to sell off a memorabilia collection with an estimated value of more than $1 million; it wants to divide the proceeds with the Met.
2016-11-23.snippet: The guild is seeking permission in court to sell off a memorabilia collection with an estimated value of more than $1 million; it wants to divide the proceeds with the Met.
2016-11-23.lead_paragraph: When opera companies feel the pinch, it can lead to some pretty interesting rummage sales. The Metropolitan Opera Guild is seeking permission in court to sell off a memorabilia collection — with an estimated value of more than $1 million — that includes a gold cigarette holder that belonged to the bass Ezio Pinza; a jeweled baton owned by the composer Richard Wagner; and a silver, ivory and diamond pen that was used by the composer Giacomo Meyerbeer.
2016-11-23.headline_main: Met Opera Guild Moves to Sell Memorabilia to Raise Money

2016-11-23.abstract: The best in picture books, middle grade and young adult fiction and nonfiction, selected by the children’s books editor of The New York Times Book Review.
2016-11-23.snippet: The best in picture books, middle grade and young adult fiction and nonfiction, selected by the children’s books editor of The New York Times Book Review.
2016-11-23.lead_paragraph: The best in picture books, middle grade and young adult fiction and nonfiction, selected by the children’s books editor of The New York Times Book Review.
2016-11-23.headline_main: Notable Children’s Books of 2016

2016-11-23.abstract: A long-debated rule to carry out a neglected provision of the 1968 Fair Housing Act faces an uncertain future.
2016-11-23.snippet: A long-debated rule to carry out a neglected provision of the 1968 Fair Housing Act faces an uncertain future.
2016-11-23.lead_paragraph: President Obama’s civil-rights legacy looked on track, not long ago, to include a major push against America’s deeply entrenched housing segregation. In 2015, his administration rolled out a rule requiring local communities to assess their own patterns of racial and income segregation and make genuine plans to address them.
2016-11-23.headline_main: How Ben Carson Could Undo a Desegregation Effort

2016-11-24.abstract: The move represents a continued march back from standards set in 2009 and complicates the president-elect’s pledge to eliminate influence from special interests.
2016-11-24.snippet: The move represents a continued march back from standards set in 2009 and complicates the president-elect’s pledge to eliminate influence from special interests.
2016-11-24.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President-elect Donald J. Trump will allow corporations and wealthy individuals to make large donations to fund the activities surrounding his inauguration, complicating his promise to eliminate special interests from influencing his government.
2016-11-24.headline_main: Trump to Accept Inauguration Funds From Corporations and Big Donors

2016-11-24.abstract: Officials emphasized that the Fed was planning a slow retreat. And it sounded a cautionary note about the strength of growth in the third quarter.
2016-11-24.snippet: Officials emphasized that the Fed was planning a slow retreat. And it sounded a cautionary note about the strength of growth in the third quarter.
2016-11-24.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — When Federal Reserve officials convened just before the presidential election, they talked like people who were ready to raise interest rates, although they decided to wait a little longer.
2016-11-24.headline_main: Latest Fed Discussion Reflects More Confidence in Raising Rates

2016-11-24.abstract: On the Upper East Side of Manhattan, caregivers tend to newborn orphans around the clock. The orphans happen to be kittens, and the A.S.P.C.A. has saved scores of them from being euthanized in overwhelmed city shelters.
2016-11-24.snippet: On the Upper East Side of Manhattan, caregivers tend to newborn orphans around the clock. The orphans happen to be kittens, and the A.S.P.C.A. has saved scores of them from being euthanized in overwhelmed city shelters.
2016-11-24.lead_paragraph: On the Upper East Side of Manhattan, caregivers tend to newborn orphans around the clock. The orphans happen to be kittens, and the A.S.P.C.A. has saved scores of them from being euthanized in overwhelmed city shelters.
2016-11-24.headline_main: Kitten Nursery Provides A Second Chance

2016-11-24.abstract: Donald J. Trump’s victory may have paralyzed some elite campuses, but students at LaGuardia Community College in Queens remained focused on studies and jobs.
2016-11-24.snippet: Donald J. Trump’s victory may have paralyzed some elite campuses, but students at LaGuardia Community College in Queens remained focused on studies and jobs.
2016-11-24.lead_paragraph: On a blustery afternoon this past week, the Atrium, a gathering place at LaGuardia Community College, arguably the most ethnically diverse college in the most ethnically diverse quarter of the world — western Queens — seemed especially worn. There was little light streaming in from the windows that overlook a small interior courtyard, the only suggestion of greenery amid a drab array of buildings, and an offering of concession foods that did not put you in mind of Alice Waters’s ministrations in the dining halls at Yale.
2016-11-24.headline_main: Trump’s Election? Some Students Are Too Busy to Worry

2016-11-24.abstract: Sworn statements described a scheme to cheat customers, and sales playbooks called for tapping into “the roller coaster of emotions” to get people to sign up.
2016-11-24.snippet: Sworn statements described a scheme to cheat customers, and sales playbooks called for tapping into “the roller coaster of emotions” to get people to sign up.
2016-11-24.lead_paragraph: Donald J. Trump had repeatedly vowed he would not settle the fraud claims facing his defunct for-profit education program, Trump University. But after his election on Nov. 8, the president-elect made a surprising reversal and agreed to pay $25 million to bring the matter to a close — while claiming he would have prevailed at trial.
2016-11-24.headline_main: Would Trump Have Won Trump University Cases? Evidence Says He Faced Hard Fight

2016-11-24.abstract: At a bunkerlike space in Manhattan, workers and volunteers have tended to 3,500 strays and orphans. At the city’s shelters, kitten euthanasias are down by more than 20 percent.
2016-11-24.snippet: At a bunkerlike space in Manhattan, workers and volunteers have tended to 3,500 strays and orphans. At the city’s shelters, kitten euthanasias are down by more than 20 percent.
2016-11-24.lead_paragraph: When you’re a kitten, there’s a lot to learn. In a room lined with cages on the Upper East Side of Manhattan one recent afternoon, Imando was getting a lesson in eating solid food.
2016-11-24.headline_main: Two Rooms, 300 Kittens

2016-11-24.abstract: The community center dedicated to Jewish life offers a gym, a prestigious nursery, a vast array of classes, and is one of New York City’s premier cultural institutions.
2016-11-24.snippet: The community center dedicated to Jewish life offers a gym, a prestigious nursery, a vast array of classes, and is one of New York City’s premier cultural institutions.
2016-11-24.lead_paragraph: Looming above Lexington Avenue, the 92nd Street Y is one of the premier cultural institutions in New York City. It was here that Emma Lazarus taught English to immigrants; here that the Nobel Prize winner Elie Wiesel gave 180 lectures; here that the cellist Yo-Yo Ma made his New York City debut; here that the choreographer Alvin Ailey first presented “Revelations” and that the writer Truman Capote introduced “In Cold Blood.” It is also a great place to swim, throw a clay pot and hear a talk about the women of the Supreme Court.
2016-11-24.headline_main: 142 Years of Sweat, Crafts and Culture at the 92nd Street Y

2016-11-24.abstract: Her supporters have seized on reports by experts suggesting that Michigan, Pennsylvania and Wisconsin should manually review paper ballots.
2016-11-24.snippet: Her supporters have seized on reports by experts suggesting that Michigan, Pennsylvania and Wisconsin should manually review paper ballots.
2016-11-24.lead_paragraph: Hillary Clinton’s lead in the popular vote is growing. She is roughly 30,000 votes behind Donald J. Trump in the key swing states of Michigan and Wisconsin — a combined gap that is narrowing. Her impassioned supporters are now urging her to challenge the results in those two states and Pennsylvania, grasping at the last straws to reverse  Mr. Trump’s decisive majority in the Electoral College.
2016-11-24.headline_main: Hillary Clinton Supporters Call for Vote Recount in Battleground States

2016-11-24.abstract: Federico Rosa, a leading manager of distance runners, had been accused of abetting the doping of Rita Jeptoo of Kenya, once a top marathoner.
2016-11-24.snippet: Federico Rosa, a leading manager of distance runners, had been accused of abetting the doping of Rita Jeptoo of Kenya, once a top marathoner.
2016-11-24.lead_paragraph: As he prepared to board a flight in Kenya for his home in Italy on Wednesday, Federico Rosa, a leading manager of distance runners, said it was one of the happiest days of his life.
2016-11-24.headline_main: Kenya Drops Doping Charges Against a Top Manager

2016-11-24.abstract: Mr. Batiste gets up late, prays, meditates, looks at art, plays piano at his teacher’s home and cooks dinner with his girlfriend.
2016-11-24.snippet: Mr. Batiste gets up late, prays, meditates, looks at art, plays piano at his teacher’s home and cooks dinner with his girlfriend.
2016-11-24.lead_paragraph: Between leading impromptu street parades, performing as the bandleader on “The Late Show With Stephen Colbert” and fulfilling his duties as an artistic director of the National Jazz Museum in Harlem, Jon Batiste is busy enough. But this year, the Louisiana-born musician and composer also released his first holiday album, “Christmas With Jon Batiste,” a mix of original compositions and remixed classics. Mr. Batiste, 29, who lives alone in Midtown Manhattan, said Sundays offered him a “day of freedom and a time when I take a breather from rehearsals and performing.” SHIVANI VORA
2016-11-24.headline_main: How Jon Batiste, Bandleader on ‘Late Show With Stephen Colbert,’ Spends His Sundays

2016-11-24.abstract: President-elect Donald J. Trump said this week that Mr. Kushner, his son-in-law, could play a key, if undefined, role in Middle East peace efforts.
2016-11-24.snippet: President-elect Donald J. Trump said this week that Mr. Kushner, his son-in-law, could play a key, if undefined, role in Middle East peace efforts.
2016-11-24.lead_paragraph: JERUSALEM — He is friends with the mayor and once tried to buy an Israeli insurance company. His parents’ names are emblazoned across a hospital campus, a tribute to generous donors. But to many Israelis and Palestinians, Jared Kushner is a mystery.
2016-11-24.headline_main: Jared Kushner, Cast as Potential Player on Israel, Is Little Known There

2016-11-24.abstract: Noah, who signed a four-year, $72 million deal during the summer, has struggled early on, but his value to the team cannot be weighed on statistics alone.
2016-11-24.snippet: Noah, who signed a four-year, $72 million deal during the summer, has struggled early on, but his value to the team cannot be weighed on statistics alone.
2016-11-24.lead_paragraph: During their last two games, both victories, the Knicks have played some of their most resilient basketball of this still-emerging season. In defeating two possible playoff teams, the Knicks have generally looked cohesive and fluid and, for the most part, defensively stout. Coincidentally, they have done it without Joakim Noah, their marquee off-season signing.
2016-11-24.headline_main: Joakim Noah Is Still Finding His Way With the Knicks

2016-11-24.abstract: Where conditions are right, masses of the plant’s yellow flowers can be found well into late November.
2016-11-24.snippet: Where conditions are right, masses of the plant’s yellow flowers can be found well into late November.
2016-11-24.lead_paragraph: There are still days in late November that manage to slip past 60 degrees. For all of their warmth, the angle of the sun is unmistakable; not as low as it will be as we move toward winter, but well on its way. Shadows stretch for yards by 3 p.m., and by 5, the cold returns and the reprieve from winter is over.
2016-11-24.headline_main: Seaside Goldenrod, a Late Bloomer

2016-11-24.abstract: Mitsuwa Marketplace in Edgewater, less than a mile from Manhattan, offers food like crabstick croquettes, pop culture items and even a corset face band.
2016-11-24.snippet: Mitsuwa Marketplace in Edgewater, less than a mile from Manhattan, offers food like crabstick croquettes, pop culture items and even a corset face band.
2016-11-24.lead_paragraph: Incalculable hours vanish in exploring Mitsuwa Marketplace, a Japanese superstore in Edgewater, N.J. There are aisles of curious condiments, sake and novelties like a corset face band, which belts around the head and purportedly slims it, for $19.99.
2016-11-24.headline_main: Japanese Superstore in New Jersey Offers Exotica, From Katsu to Kitsch

2016-11-24.abstract: Heavier drinking, however, increased the risk of stroke.
2016-11-24.snippet: Heavier drinking, however, increased the risk of stroke.
2016-11-24.lead_paragraph: Having one or two alcoholic drinks a day is associated with a lower risk of stroke, a review of studies has found. But drinking more than that increases the risk.
2016-11-24.headline_main: Moderate Drinking Tied to Lower Stroke Risk

2016-11-24.abstract: In the last two years, federal judges in Texas have chipped away at President Obama’s legacy by striking down or suspending no fewer than five regulations and executive orders.
2016-11-24.snippet: In the last two years, federal judges in Texas have chipped away at President Obama’s legacy by striking down or suspending no fewer than five regulations and executive orders.
2016-11-24.lead_paragraph: President-elect Donald J. Trump promised to undo many of the Obama administration’s most ambitious regulations. But even before he takes office, federal courts in Texas are doing some of the work for him.
2016-11-24.headline_main: Overtime Rule Is but the Latest Obama Initiative to End in Texas Court

2016-11-24.abstract: A security cordon and news trucks descended on the area around the president-elect’s Florida resort, but many residents were blasé about the activity.
2016-11-24.snippet: A security cordon and news trucks descended on the area around the president-elect’s Florida resort, but many residents were blasé about the activity.
2016-11-24.lead_paragraph: PALM BEACH, Fla. — There will be no skinny-dipping this weekend outside the Borislow family’s oceanfront home here: They live across the street from Mar-a-Lago, President-elect Donald J. Trump’s winter resort, and now a Coast Guard patrol boat is parked right outside their window.
2016-11-24.headline_main: All the Clamor? Trump’s Palm Beach Neighbors See an Upside

2016-11-24.abstract: The emails, totaling more than 1,550 pages, reveal a City Hall going over the minutiae of press strategy with public relations firms.
2016-11-24.snippet: The emails, totaling more than 1,550 pages, reveal a City Hall going over the minutiae of press strategy with public relations firms.
2016-11-24.lead_paragraph: After months of wrangling with reporters and in court over the disclosure of emails, the administration of Mayor Bill de Blasio on Wednesday released a third batch of its correspondence with outside advisers that it has designated as “agents of the city.”

2016-11-24.abstract: Abraham Zapruder’s film stands as the most famous bystander documentation of a crime.
2016-11-24.snippet: Abraham Zapruder’s film stands as the most famous bystander documentation of a crime.
2016-11-24.lead_paragraph: Standing in a choice and sunlit spot along the Dallas parade route that day in November 1963, Abraham Zapruder put his Bell & Howell 414PD to his eye and filmed the 26 seconds that shook Americans to their core.
2016-11-24.headline_main: 26 Seconds in 1963

2016-11-24.abstract: Mr. Chase, a jazz trumpeter known as Dooky, ran his family’s Creole restaurant, which also served as a gathering place for civil rights activists.
2016-11-24.snippet: Mr. Chase, a jazz trumpeter known as Dooky, ran his family’s Creole restaurant, which also served as a gathering place for civil rights activists.
2016-11-24.lead_paragraph: Edgar Chase Jr., known as Dooky, who with his wife, the chef Leah Chase, turned his family’s New Orleans restaurant into a showcase for Creole cuisine and a gathering spot for activists during the civil rights era, died on Tuesday in New Orleans. He was 88.
2016-11-24.headline_main: Edgar Chase Jr., Purveyor of Creole Cuisine, Dies at 88

2016-11-24.abstract: A regular customer is momentarily flummoxed when a street vendor refuses a request to pay the next day.

2016-11-24.headline_main: Credit With the Coffee Man

2016-11-24.abstract: The rabbi’s music flavored the religious life of Orthodox Jews and influenced klezmer bands.
2016-11-24.snippet: The rabbi’s music flavored the religious life of Orthodox Jews and influenced klezmer bands.
2016-11-24.lead_paragraph: Rabbi Ben Zion Shenker, regarded as perhaps the leading composer of Hasidic prayer melodies, whose music flavored the religious life of Orthodox Jews and influenced popular klezmer bands, died on Sunday in Brooklyn. He was 91.
2016-11-24.headline_main: Ben Zion Shenker, Rabbi Who Wrote Prayer Melodies, Dies at 91

2016-11-24.abstract: Ms. DeVos, a philanthropist, activist and Republican fund-raiser, has worked to give families vouchers to attend private schools and pressed to expand charter schools.
2016-11-24.snippet: Ms. DeVos, a philanthropist, activist and Republican fund-raiser, has worked to give families vouchers to attend private schools and pressed to expand charter schools.
2016-11-24.lead_paragraph: It is hard to find anyone more passionate about the idea of steering public dollars away from traditional public schools than Betsy DeVos, Donald J. Trump’s pick as the cabinet secretary overseeing the nation’s education system.
2016-11-24.headline_main: Betsy DeVos, Trump’s Education Pick, Has Steered Money From Public Schools

2016-11-24.abstract: Before giving up the home run that would haunt his career, Branca often wondered aloud at his physical blessings.
2016-11-24.snippet: Before giving up the home run that would haunt his career, Branca often wondered aloud at his physical blessings.
2016-11-24.lead_paragraph: In 1902, a seamstress named Katherine Berger married a trolley-car conductor named John Branca and spent half of the next 26 years pregnant, giving birth 17 times. One of her children, Ralph Theodore, grew taller than the others. And he was a teenager, the only Branca to reach 6 feet, when he began to wonder why he alone had been so physically blessed.
2016-11-24.headline_main: ‘Why Me?’ Echoed in Ralph Branca’s World, Even Before a Doomed Pitch

2016-11-24.abstract: With the number of restaurants that call themselves diners and coffee shops dwindling in the city, a devotee wonders how New Yorkers will get along without these antidotes to urban loneliness.
2016-11-24.snippet: With the number of restaurants that call themselves diners and coffee shops dwindling in the city, a devotee wonders how New Yorkers will get along without these antidotes to urban loneliness.
2016-11-24.lead_paragraph: For the past 25 years — since the divorce — I’ve lived a good part of my life in diners. Without them I might be slimmer, but also crazier and more unhappy. Judging by the crowds at the Metro Diner, on 100th Street and Broadway, my current haunt, I suspect that other New Yorkers feel the same way.
2016-11-24.headline_main: More Than Coffee: New York’s Vanishing Diner Culture

2016-11-24.abstract: “I know there are some bad ones in here, but this is the last time I’m doing this, so we’re not leaving any room for leftovers,” he said to some laughter.
2016-11-24.snippet: “I know there are some bad ones in here, but this is the last time I’m doing this, so we’re not leaving any room for leftovers,” he said to some laughter.
2016-11-24.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Obama officially pardoned two turkeys on Wednesday, in an oddly mournful replaying of a White House Thanksgiving ritual that not even his daughters attended.
2016-11-24.headline_main: Obama Lets Bad Puns Fly at Turkey Pardoning Tinged With Sadness

2016-11-24.abstract: Mr. Morgenthau, now 97, saw crime and the city change during his decades as a top prosecutor. As for any mistakes along the way, he says he doesn’t revisit closed chapters.
2016-11-24.snippet: Mr. Morgenthau, now 97, saw crime and the city change during his decades as a top prosecutor. As for any mistakes along the way, he says he doesn’t revisit closed chapters.
2016-11-24.lead_paragraph: In his early years as a prosecutor, Robert M. Morgenthau was once asked about the most effective way to fight organized crime. At the time, Mr. Morgenthau had made a name for himself as a United States attorney by indicting more than 100 Mafia figures.
2016-11-24.headline_main: Robert Morgenthau on His Years as District Attorney: ‘I Don’t Look Back’

2016-11-24.abstract: A letter from a lawyer for Ms. Coico, who resigned amid an investigation, placed blame for her legal troubles on top CUNY administrators.

2016-11-24.snippet: A letter on behalf of the recently departed president of the school blaming top administrators for a scandal she is ensnared in seems to have energized the governor’s ethics campaign.

2016-11-24.headline_main: Cuomo Seizes On City College Scandal to Revive Push to Revamp CUNY

2016-11-24.abstract: The announcement of a sixth death came hours after the chief executive of the school district’s busing contractor offered an emotional apology.
2016-11-24.snippet: The announcement of a sixth death came hours after the chief executive of the school district’s busing contractor offered an emotional apology.
2016-11-24.lead_paragraph: The National Transportation Safety Board said Wednesday that the school bus that crashed on Monday in Chattanooga, Tenn., killing six students, was not traveling along its regular route when it wrecked.

2016-11-24.abstract: A debut by Brian J. MacDonald.
2016-11-24.snippet: A debut by Brian J. MacDonald.
2016-11-24.lead_paragraph: THURSDAY PUZZLE — As we close in on my favorite food holiday of the year, I’d like to take the time to wish Wordplay readers a happy and peaceful Thanksgiving.

2016-11-24.snippet: In 2015, the photographer Tess Mayer sought to document “how farming shapes people” in Delaware County, N.Y.

2016-11-24.abstract: The photographer Tess Mayer, interested in “how farming shapes people,” documented new farmers with urban ties and the deeply rooted farm families in New York’s Southern Tier.
2016-11-24.snippet: The photographer Tess Mayer, interested in “how farming shapes people,” documented new farmers with urban ties and the deeply rooted farm families in New York’s Southern Tier.
2016-11-24.lead_paragraph: Tess Mayer, 21, grew up among farmers’ children in Delaware County, in the Southern Tier region of New York. “I had chickens but nothing beyond that,” she said. She graduated high school early and, eager for cosmopolitan life, moved to New York City to attend New York University. But she went home on breaks, and upon returning to her small town of Bovina, Ms. Mayer recalled, she became interested in “how farming shapes people.”
2016-11-24.headline_main: Crops of Old and New Farmers in Delaware County

2016-11-24.abstract: Two days after the Rangers beat the Stanley Cup champions on their own ice, the Penguins asserted themselves with a stunning second-period flurry.
2016-11-24.snippet: Two days after the Rangers beat the Stanley Cup champions on their own ice, the Penguins asserted themselves with a stunning second-period flurry.
2016-11-24.lead_paragraph: The Rangers have been impressive, particularly at home, for the first six weeks of the season. First place in the Metropolitan Division is theirs, at least for the moment, giving their fans reason to ponder their playoff possibilities in the spring.
2016-11-24.headline_main: Penguins Pay Back the Rangers With a Rout

2016-11-24.abstract: The influential love-her-or-hate-her British art-pop singer releases “Before the Dawn,” a set based on her 2014 London shows.
2016-11-24.snippet: The influential love-her-or-hate-her British art-pop singer releases “Before the Dawn,” a set based on her 2014 London shows.
2016-11-24.lead_paragraph: For three days at Pinewood Studios in London, Kate Bush strapped on a life preserver, plunged into a tank of water and sang to a camera. The first day, she stayed immersed so long that she ended up with mild hypothermia; she hadn’t yet been advised to take breaks. And at least part of the time, she said in a cheery telephone interview earlier this month from her home in England, she was thinking, “My God, what am I doing?”
2016-11-24.headline_main: Kate Bush Is Running Up That Concert Stage for a Giant Live Album

2016-11-24.lead_paragraph: “I think e-commerce has allowed for Black Friday to start whenever Amazon wants it to start.”
2016-11-24.headline_main: Quotation of the Day

2016-11-24.abstract: With more and more civilians caught up in the battle to take Mosul from the Islamic State, some military officials are second-guessing their initial strategy.
2016-11-24.snippet: With more and more civilians caught up in the battle to take Mosul from the Islamic State, some military officials are second-guessing their initial strategy.
2016-11-24.lead_paragraph: MOSUL, Iraq — By the time little Amira, just a year old, reached the field clinic near the front line in Mosul, she was already dead. All her father could do was bundle her up in a golden blanket, carry her to a nearby mosque and bury her.
2016-11-24.headline_main: Iraq Told Civilians to Stay in Mosul. Now They’re Paying With Their Lives.

2016-11-24.headline_main: What’s on TV Thursday: Macy’s Thanksgiving Day Parade and ‘The Simpsons 600 Marathon’

2016-11-24.abstract: The journalist John Pomfret discusses the subject of his new book: the complex history of interactions between the countries, from 1776 to the present.
2016-11-24.snippet: The journalist John Pomfret discusses the subject of his new book: the complex history of interactions between the countries, from 1776 to the present.
2016-11-24.lead_paragraph: For his second book, John Pomfret, a journalist with extensive experience in China, has taken a microscope to an enormous subject: the relationship between the United States and China, from 1776 to the present. With growing stress points in that relationship and the emergence of strongman leaders in both nations, the book, “The Beautiful Country and the Middle Kingdom,” arrives during a precarious inflection point. It is peppered with characters that Mr. Pomfret uses to trace a long historical arc, from Howqua, a Cantonese tycoon, to Herbert Yardley, a prominent American cryptographer, and Henry M. Paulson Jr., the former United States Treasury secretary.
2016-11-24.headline_main: In the History of U.S.-China Relations, a Pattern of Enchantment and Despair

2016-11-24.abstract: Rescuers were searching for survivors after a scaffold collapsed on Thursday inside a cooling tower being built at a coal power plant in Jiangxi Province.
2016-11-24.snippet: Rescuers were searching for survivors after a scaffold collapsed on Thursday inside a cooling tower being built at a coal power plant in Jiangxi Province.
2016-11-24.lead_paragraph: BEIJING — Dozens of workers were crushed to death under an avalanche of scaffolding, cement and steel rods in southeast China on Thursday after a platform in an unfinished tower of a coal power plant collapsed.
2016-11-24.headline_main: Construction Collapse in Southeast China Kills Dozens at Power Plant

2016-11-24.lead_paragraph: America’s first illegal-alien amnesty wasn’t the biggest in our history, but it was the most influential, since we’re still talking about it.

2016-11-24.snippet: I made a mistake, but I have paid for it.
2016-11-24.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — I arrived in the United States on Nov. 12, 1981, when I was 1. My parents had fled the Pol Pot genocide in Cambodia, in which over two million people were murdered. I was born in a refugee camp in Thailand before moving to California, and then Virginia.
2016-11-24.headline_main: Mr. Trump: I Am an Immigrant With a Criminal Record

2016-11-24.snippet: Donald Trump’s support for leaving abortion to the states resonates with a dark period when “separate but equal” was the law of the land.
2016-11-24.lead_paragraph: Half slave and half free. The last time the United States split into two countries, it didn’t work out at all well.
2016-11-24.headline_main: Chasing Abortion Rights Across the State Line

2016-11-24.abstract: The president-elect’s transition has drawn a crowd of job seekers of varying ideological hues and experience levels.
2016-11-24.snippet: The president-elect’s transition has drawn a crowd of job seekers of varying ideological hues and experience levels.
2016-11-24.lead_paragraph: President-elect Donald Trump’s transition has been a circus, to say the least, with a colorful and eclectic crowd of job seekers of varying ideological hues and levels of experience ascending to the 26th floor of Trump Tower to audition for some of the most consequential jobs in the country. The man who spent years saying “you’re fired” is now saying “you’re hired” to all sorts of people, though it’s not at all clear whether his choices result from a carefully thought-out strategy or are being made on the fly.
2016-11-24.headline_main: No Experience, No Problem

2016-11-24.abstract: Did you miss the pope’s Extraordinary Jubilee Year? It’s not too late.
2016-11-24.snippet: Did you miss the pope’s Extraordinary Jubilee Year? It’s not too late.
2016-11-24.lead_paragraph: Growing up in a big Irish Catholic family, I knew the liturgical seasons of the year — Advent, Christmas, Lent, Triduum, Easter and Ordinary Time. But I don’t remember hearing much about Jubilee Years, which occur about every 25 years, let alone about Extraordinary Jubilee Years, which are called out of that cycle to commemorate a special moment in the Roman Catholic Church’s history or highlight an important issue. Since the church began celebrating Jubilee Years in 1300, only a few Extraordinary Jubilees have been called — including the one that ended this week.
2016-11-24.headline_main: This Merciful Year

2016-11-24.abstract: Because Mr. Trump, an outspoken admirer of Mr. Putin, is unlikely to act, it is up to Mr. Obama to hold the Russian president to account.
2016-11-24.snippet: Because Mr. Trump, an outspoken admirer of Mr. Putin, is unlikely to act, it is up to Mr. Obama to hold the Russian president to account.
2016-11-24.lead_paragraph: After the stunning disclosures last month that Russia had tried to interfere with the election by hacking the Democratic National Committee, the Obama administration hinted at some kind of retaliation. So far, however, its only known response has been to publicly identify the Russians as the culprits and warn them against interfering again in America’s democratic processes.
2016-11-24.headline_main: Warning Russia on Hacking Isn’t Enough

2016-11-24.abstract: An era when canned vegetables and lemon gelatin with cranberry-tinted mayonnaise were extolled for their convenience and chic.
2016-11-24.snippet: An era when canned vegetables and lemon gelatin with cranberry-tinted mayonnaise were extolled for their convenience and chic.
2016-11-24.lead_paragraph: Eighty-five years ago this month, President Herbert Hoover followed tradition and proclaimed the final Thursday of November a day of national Thanksgiving, an unenviable task given the circumstances. America was two years into the Great Depression, the unemployment rate was more than 15 percent, and millions more despaired for the future. The president’s rhetorical strategy was to bob and weave, extolling the country’s “abundant harvests” and downgrading the Depression to a “passing adversity.”
2016-11-24.headline_main: ‘Mock Duck’ and Other Depression Thanksgiving Delights

2016-11-24.abstract: Also, when blended families are too big to blend in one house, and revisiting holiday food clashes.
2016-11-24.snippet: Also, when blended families are too big to blend in one house, and revisiting holiday food clashes.
2016-11-24.lead_paragraph: I live in Los Angeles, but I am spending Thanksgiving week with my parents in the heartland. My brother lives near them. Unfortunately, before the election, I threatened to move to Canada if Trump won. Cut to: Trump won, and I have no plans to move. My brother (32 going on 16) has seized on this, asking me (literally) every time he sees me: “So, when will you be moving to Montreal? Or is it Toronto?” This is getting really annoying. So far, I have ignored him. How should I deal with his foolishness — and mine?
2016-11-24.headline_main: Trump Won. Still Moving to Canada?

2016-11-24.snippet: Homeowners are slowly growing wary of buying property in the areas most at risk, setting up a potential economic time bomb in an industry that is struggling to adapt.
2016-11-24.lead_paragraph: MIAMI — Real estate agents looking to sell coastal properties usually focus on one thing: how close the home is to the water’s edge. But buyers are increasingly asking instead how far back it is from the waterline. How many feet above sea level? Is it fortified against storm surges? Does it have emergency power and sump pumps?
2016-11-24.headline_main: Perils of Climate Change Could Swamp Coastal Real Estate

2016-11-24.abstract: Jessica Chastain stars as a win-at-all-costs lobbyist in this Washington-based political thriller.
2016-11-24.snippet: Jessica Chastain stars as a win-at-all-costs lobbyist in this Washington-based political thriller.
2016-11-24.lead_paragraph: Jessica Chastain rules the Washington-based political thriller “Miss Sloane” with such steely authority that you are hard pressed to imagine another actress playing the imperious, largely unsympathetic title character. In the opening moments, Elizabeth Sloane, a formidable Washington lobbyist, legendary for her deviousness and determination to win at all costs, impassively describes her professional modus operandi. “Lobbying,” she declares, gazing straight into a camera, is about “foresight.” It involves anticipating an opponent’s next move and calculating your response ahead of time so that nothing takes you by surprise.
2016-11-24.headline_main: Review: A Chilly ‘Miss Sloane’ Makes a Lecture Out of Lobbying

2016-11-24.abstract: Saroo’s journey begins when he accidentally travels more than 1,000 miles from his home in central India to the streets of Calcutta.
2016-11-24.snippet: Saroo’s journey begins when he accidentally travels more than 1,000 miles from his home in central India to the streets of Calcutta.
2016-11-24.lead_paragraph: The first part of “Lion,” Garth Davis’s unabashedly tear-jerking movie about a remarkable real-world incident, has some of the scary, wondrous feeling of a fairy tale. The audience is invited to imagine a long-ago time — 1986, to be precise — before social media or smartphones or Google. In those days, a person could get lost, which is just what happens to a little boy named Saroo (Sunny Pawar), who accidentally travels more than 1,000 miles from his home in central India to the streets of Calcutta.
2016-11-24.headline_main: Review: ‘Lion’ Brings Tears for a Lost Boy, Wiped Dry by Google

2016-11-24.abstract: Margaret Lyons has four recommendations for your Thanksgiving television viewing.
2016-11-24.snippet: Margaret Lyons has four recommendations for your Thanksgiving television viewing.
2016-11-24.lead_paragraph: It’s Thanksgiving, which means that people need to be able to come and go from the TV area and still follow what’s happening, which is why any reality-contest show will fit the bill. But above all, you seek “The Great British Baking Show.” This is the most earnest and enjoyable of any reality-contest show in living memory, and the skills and passion on display are significant and inspiring. (“Masterclass” episodes, with Paul and Mary, are free to stream on PBS; three seasons are available for members of Thirteen and other participating PBS broadcasters.)
2016-11-24.headline_main: What You Should Watch on Thanksgiving With a Disparate Group, Including Kids

2016-11-24.abstract: Thanksgiving often means a lot of together time. Here are some TV recommendations to please disparate tastes.
2016-11-24.snippet: Thanksgiving often means a lot of together time. Here are some TV recommendations to please disparate tastes.
2016-11-24.lead_paragraph: Thanksgiving not the time to finally watch “The Wire,” or anything too dialogue-rich: People chitchat, someone gets up to stir something — you don’t want to be shushing people or asking everyone to pause stuff while you check on the pies. It’s time for solid shows that still don’t require tremendous brainpower. Go with “Prison Break,” Fox’s big, twisty, drama answer to “Lost” from 2005. Season 1 is a solid action soap, although the show grows exhausting after that. (Netflix)
2016-11-24.headline_main: What You Should Watch on Thanksgiving With a (Child-Free) Group

2016-11-24.abstract: This character in “The Nutcracker” is well known, but hardly understood.
2016-11-24.snippet: This character in “The Nutcracker” is well known, but hardly understood.
2016-11-24.lead_paragraph: Few characters in ballet are more renowned than the Sugar Plum Fairy. People who’ve never been to any ballet, let alone “The Nutcracker,” have heard of her. Yet who is she? And why does she dance? When she enters to dance a grand pas de deux with her cavalier, what’s going on between them? Is he her consort or her squire? Is this supposed to be love? Why is Tchaikovsky’s music for their grand adagio so unsugary, so imposing, so colossal? What choreography can catch its essence?
2016-11-24.headline_main: The Sugar Plum Fairy: An Enigma Wrapped in a Beautiful Dance

2016-11-24.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Climate negotiators convened in Morocco, this month to discuss how to turn the Paris climate accord into action. The accord, signed by almost 200 countries last year, came into force on Nov. 4. Many questions persist about how each country can move toward the zero carbon-energy target that experts say is necessary to avoid destructive climate change. Some parts of the world are better positioned than others to take this test. Latin America is a good example.

2016-11-24.snippet: Is it possible to find grace in the context of a cancer death?

2016-11-24.abstract: From the archives of The International Herald Tribune: A German submarine torpedoes the British hospital ship Britannic off the coast of the Island of Zea in the Aegean Sea, during World War I, in November 1916.
2016-11-24.snippet: From the archives of The International Herald Tribune: A German submarine torpedoes the British hospital ship Britannic off the coast of the Island of Zea in the Aegean Sea, during World War I, in November 1916.
2016-11-24.lead_paragraph: LONDON — Despatches from Athens agree that the British hospital ship Britannic, of 50,000 tons, was torpedoed by a German submarine between eight and nine o’clock on Tuesday morning, a trifle more than two miles off the Island of Zea, while en route for Mudros, the port of Lemnos, in the Aegean Sea, where she was to take on board sick and wounded. She sank about fifty-five minutes after being struck.
2016-11-24.headline_main: 1916: Pirates Sank the Britannic

2016-11-24.abstract: An angler’s daily pursuit of striped bass leads to lessons, and puzzle-solving, about wildlife and nature.
2016-11-24.snippet: An angler’s daily pursuit of striped bass leads to lessons, and puzzle-solving, about wildlife and nature.
2016-11-24.lead_paragraph: BOWDOINHAM, Maine — The striped bass arrived with a bang this spring on Maine’s Kennebec River, a melee of swirling currents, careening gulls and breaking fish. After several years of disappointing action, their annual migration north from the Chesapeake stirred in me an excitement I hadn’t expected.
2016-11-24.headline_main: He Fished Every Morning of Summer. And Was Home by 7 A.M.

The primary topic of conversation: What did they want to do with the players the next day?

2016-11-24.abstract: In less than three minutes, trailers must make the case for a movie and its overall saga.
2016-11-24.snippet: In less than three minutes, trailers must make the case for a movie and its overall saga.
2016-11-24.lead_paragraph: “Rogue One: A Star Wars Story,” set for release Dec. 16, occupies a challenging place in the “Star Wars” universe. Though it’s billed as a stand-alone story, the movie takes place between earlier trilogies of the “Star Wars” saga, managing to be both prequel and sequel in a franchise that already has plenty of them. And past extensions of “Star Wars” haven’t always been well received, even by die-hard fans.
2016-11-24.headline_main: Movie Trailers: ‘Rogue One,’ ‘Fantastic Beasts’ and the Franchise Challenge

2016-11-24.abstract: Freshwater fish like carp have disappeared from tanks at supermarkets in the capital, with little explanation to wary Chinese consumers bruised by food safety scares.
2016-11-24.snippet: Freshwater fish like carp have disappeared from tanks at supermarkets in the capital, with little explanation to wary Chinese consumers bruised by food safety scares.
2016-11-24.lead_paragraph: BEIJING — In supermarkets across the Chinese capital, shoppers have been staring, baffled by empty fish tanks and asking: Where have all the fish gone?
2016-11-24.headline_main: ‘Something Is Wrong’: Fresh Fish Vanish From Beijing Stores, Raising Suspicions

2016-11-24.abstract: Ms. Lupino proves her mettle as an actress in “Road House” (1948) and “On Dangerous Ground” (1952). In other films, she was equally impressive as a director.
2016-11-24.snippet: Ms. Lupino proves her mettle as an actress in “Road House” (1948) and “On Dangerous Ground” (1952). In other films, she was equally impressive as a director.
2016-11-24.lead_paragraph: Of all the actresses associated with film noir, Ida Lupino (1918-1995) seems the most complex. Ms. Lupino could be as sultry and sassy as Lauren Bacall while projecting an aching vulnerability. As world-weary as Gloria Grahame, she never came across as fragile, particularly in her subsequent work as a director.
2016-11-24.headline_main: Ida Lupino, a Woman of Spine on Both Sides of the Lens

2016-11-24.abstract: The pilgrims, who were returning to Iran after a journey to observe Arbaeen, were killed by a truck bomb at a roadside service station.
2016-11-24.snippet: The pilgrims, who were returning to Iran after a journey to observe Arbaeen, were killed by a truck bomb at a roadside service station.
2016-11-24.lead_paragraph: ERBIL, Iraq — At least 80 people, many of them Shiite pilgrims on their way home to Iran, were killed on Thursday when an Islamic State suicide bomber detonated a truck filled with explosives at a roadside service station in southern Iraq, local officials said.
2016-11-24.headline_main: ISIS Bomb Aimed at Shiite Pilgrims in Iraq Kills at Least 80

2016-11-24.abstract: The redesign by the Los Angeles architects Johnston Marklee is expected to be completed by June 2017.
2016-11-24.snippet: The redesign by the Los Angeles architects Johnston Marklee is expected to be completed by June 2017.
2016-11-24.lead_paragraph: While many art museums have pursued big-budget expansions in their bids for larger and more loyal audiences, the Museum of Contemporary Art Chicago is rethinking and reconfiguring its public spaces without altering its basic footprint downtown. This week the museum revealed plans for a $16 million renovation by the Los Angeles architects Johnston Marklee, led by Sharon Johnston and Mark Lee.
2016-11-24.headline_main: Museum of Contemporary Art Chicago Plans $16 Million Renovation
