2016-11-24.abstract: The studio’s new animated movie did better on Wednesday, its first day of release, than Disney’s blockbuster did upon its debut in the same period in 2013.
2016-11-24.snippet: The studio’s new animated movie did better on Wednesday, its first day of release, than Disney’s blockbuster did upon its debut in the same period in 2013.
2016-11-24.lead_paragraph: Disney looks like it is beating itself going into this Thanksgiving weekend. The studio’s latest animated offering, “Moana,” about a defiant Polynesian princess on a heroine’s quest to save her people and restore the planet’s ecological balance, took in $15.6 million at the box office Wednesday, its first full day of release, running ahead of the studio’s smash hit “Frozen,” which drew $15.16 million on Thanksgiving Eve in 2013. While “Moana” is projected to earn more than $80 million over the five-day holiday weekend, that wouldn’t melt “Frozen,” which still holds the Thanksgiving five-day opening record, of $93.6 million. With runaway hits like “Finding Dory” and “Zootopia” under its belt, and “Rogue One: A Star Wars Story” looming, Disney is having a banner year. “Moana” is also holding a 97 percent fresh rating on the review-aggregation site Rotten Tomatoes, a hair behind “Zootopia,” at 98 percent.
2016-11-24.headline_main: Disney’s ‘Moana’ Surpasses ‘Frozen’ in Pre-Thanksgiving Box Office

2016-11-24.abstract: After a previous deal was rejected last month in a referendum, the president signed modified accords that will instead go to Congress, which his governing coalition controls.
2016-11-24.snippet: After a previous deal was rejected last month in a referendum, the president signed modified accords that will instead go to Congress, which his governing coalition controls.

2016-11-24.lead_paragraph: Following up on a campaign promise that appealed directly to his Rust Belt base, President-elect Donald J. Trump said Thursday that he had reached out to the Carrier air conditioner company in Indiana to ask it not to move more than 2,000 factory jobs from Indiana to Mexico.
2016-11-24.headline_main: Trump Cites Progress in Keeping Carrier Air Conditioning Plant in Indiana

2016-11-24.abstract: After choosing national security hard-liners for some of his earliest appointments, the president-elect is turning to ultrawealthy conservatives.
2016-11-24.snippet: After choosing national security hard-liners for some of his earliest appointments, the president-elect is turning to ultrawealthy conservatives.
2016-11-24.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President-elect Donald J. Trump is expected to select as commerce secretary Wilbur Ross, a billionaire investor who became known as the “king of bankruptcy” for buying, restructuring and selling off steel makers and other fading industrial companies, officials on the transition team said on Thursday.
2016-11-24.headline_main: Wilbur Ross, Billionaire Investor, Is Said to Be Trump’s Commerce Pick

2016-11-24.abstract: In “Alton Brown Live: Eat Your Science,” the Food Network personality serves up a menu of challenging fare. Tequila and pumpkin spice liqueur with mouthwash, anyone?
2016-11-24.snippet: In “Alton Brown Live: Eat Your Science,” the Food Network personality serves up a menu of challenging fare. Tequila and pumpkin spice liqueur with mouthwash, anyone?
2016-11-24.lead_paragraph: If Alton Brown, the Food Network celebrity, offers you a cocktail, refuse it. Maybe you are parched. Maybe you are in alcohol withdrawal. Maybe you have thought that clinking glasses with the host of “Good Eats” and “Cutthroat Kitchen” would be a fine thing. Even so, don’t do it. Never forget that this is the man who coined the term “evilicious.”
2016-11-24.headline_main: Review: Alton Brown, a Mad Culinary Scientist in a Broadway Laboratory

2016-11-24.abstract: The documentary, narrated by Keanu Reeves, interviews directors, actors and others to gain insights into Toshiro Mifune’s sword-fighting bravado and stoicism.
2016-11-24.snippet: The documentary, narrated by Keanu Reeves, interviews directors, actors and others to gain insights into Toshiro Mifune’s sword-fighting bravado and stoicism.
2016-11-24.lead_paragraph: “Mifune: The Last Samurai” is a celebration of the originality and influence of the Japanese star Toshiro Mifune (1920-1997), shown as a rare actor capable of the subtlest stoicism and the wildest bravado. It’s a brisk and energetic primer for those who don’t know his movies or are ready to watch them again. And it doubles as a history of the chanbara (sword fighting) genre, providing an opportunity to sample clips from seldom-seen or partially lost silent films.
2016-11-24.headline_main: Review: ‘Mifune: The Last Samurai’ Celebrates a Fearless Actor

2016-11-24.abstract: This British thriller concerns a band of people in combat gear trying to avoid attackers.
2016-11-24.snippet: This British thriller concerns a band of people in combat gear trying to avoid attackers.
2016-11-24.lead_paragraph: “No animals were hurt during the production of this film — only humans,” reads a line toward the end of the closing credits of “Tank 432.” That’s a good hook for an exploitation film, but it deserves a snappier movie than the one it’s attached to. This British thriller is a high-concept tease that slogs its way through a morass of barely differentiated characters and visuals before reaching an unsatisfying conclusion.
2016-11-24.headline_main: Review: In ‘Tank 432,’ on the Run, but Stuck in a Morass

2016-11-24.snippet: Jacques Perrin and Jacques Cluzaud, whose projects include ‘Winged Migration’ and ‘Oceans,’ explore the fate of the forests that once covered Europe.

2016-11-24.abstract: A young boy’s creepy childhood in a picturesque seaside village with an unsettling goings-on.
2016-11-24.snippet: A young boy’s creepy childhood in a picturesque seaside village with an unsettling goings-on.
2016-11-24.lead_paragraph: The opening shots of “Evolution,” the long-awaited new feature from Lucile Hadzihalilovic, show a sumptuous underwater environment. (Her last full-length film, the eerie and provocative “Innocence,” came out in 2004.) The sea is so clear one might be tempted to breathe it in; the colors of the undulating forms of plant and animal life are psychedelic and virtually tactile. A young boy swimming in these waters is startled by the sight of another boy, drowned, a garishly red starfish covering his navel.
2016-11-24.headline_main: Review: ‘Evolution’ Goes to a Magical Place You Wouldn’t Want to Live In

2016-11-24.lead_paragraph: Sophia Wilansky, 21, who grew up in the Bronx, rested in a Minneapolis hospital bed, her father by her side, recovering from surgery to try to save her left hand and arm after an explosion at a pipeline protest in North Dakota this week.

2016-11-24.abstract: This Rachel Lang film is light on narrative, but features a worthy performance by Salomé Richard.
2016-11-24.snippet: This Rachel Lang film is light on narrative, but features a worthy performance by Salomé Richard.
2016-11-24.lead_paragraph: “Despite your ugly clothes and your ugly hair, you’re really cute,” an errant boyfriend, attempting to be charming, says to Ana, the heroine of “Baden Baden.” It’s true that Ana is almost perpetually dressed down, in jean shorts and tank tops, and she keeps her dark hair in a pixie cut that she doesn’t tend to much. But she is more than cute. Played by Salomé Richard, she exudes an energy that some might call coltish.
2016-11-24.headline_main: Review: A Free Spirit Remains Undaunted in ‘Baden Baden’

2016-11-24.abstract: Actresses try to renew their friendship during a weekend visit to Big Sur, Calif., but jealousies and old resentments bubble up.
2016-11-24.snippet: Actresses try to renew their friendship during a weekend visit to Big Sur, Calif., but jealousies and old resentments bubble up.
2016-11-24.lead_paragraph: “Always Shine” opens with a title card quoting the modeling agency founder John Robert Powers as saying that a woman is “the bowl of flowers” at the table of life. It then cuts to the actress Caitlin FitzGerald, in the role of Beth, in medium close-up and terribly upset. Not to worry. Beth is an actor, and here she’s auditioning for what seems to be a cruddy horror movie. Unseen bro-dudes behind the camera tell her that the role requires “extensive nudity” and answer one of her questions with “whatever, sweetheart.”
2016-11-24.headline_main: Review: Two Friends Take a Trip, Heavy Baggage in Tow, in ‘Always Shine’

2016-11-24.lead_paragraph: Porsche is adamant that it doesn’t sell transportation; it’s in the experience business. The automotive industry practically invented the hype machine, but Porsche has turned it into an art. 2016-11-25.abstract: Why are you interested in the things that interest you?
2016-11-25.snippet: Why are you interested in the things that interest you?
2016-11-25.lead_paragraph: Danny Kahneman grew up Jewish in occupied France during World War II. Once in Paris, after curfew, he was nearly captured by an SS officer. His family traveled from town to town through rural France, hiding and hoping people wouldn’t recognize them as Jews. As Michael Lewis writes in his forthcoming book, “The Undoing Project,” Kahneman survived the Holocaust by keeping himself apart.
2016-11-25.headline_main: Does Decision-Making Matter?

2016-11-25.abstract: What does the white working class want?
2016-11-25.snippet: What does the white working class want?
2016-11-25.lead_paragraph: Hillary Clinton won the popular vote by more than two million, and she would probably be president-elect if the director of the F.B.I. hadn’t laid such a heavy thumb on the scales, just days before the election. But it shouldn’t even have been close; what put Donald Trump in striking distance was overwhelming support from whites without college degrees. So what can Democrats do to win back at least some of those voters?
2016-11-25.headline_main: The Populism Perplex

2016-11-25.abstract: I already miss Obama’s wit. Trump can’t take a joke, and neither can he tell one.
2016-11-25.snippet: I already miss Obama’s wit. Trump can’t take a joke, and neither can he tell one.
2016-11-25.lead_paragraph: I miss him already. Miss his steady rationality, his I-got-this mien, the eight years without a hint of personal scandal. And not to be overlooked, I miss the wit of Barack Obama. No president has had a better comic sensibility.
2016-11-25.headline_main: A Farewell to the Comedian in Chief

2016-11-25.abstract: An outdated salary threshold in a law has left many employees without overtime, but a judge has blocked rules that would have fixed the problem.
2016-11-25.snippet: An outdated salary threshold in a law has left many employees without overtime, but a judge has blocked rules that would have fixed the problem.
2016-11-25.lead_paragraph: If all had gone according to plan, as many as 4.2 million additional workers in the United States would have started earning time and a half for overtime, effective Dec. 1. But that plan, developed by the Obama administration’s Labor Department in an exemplary rule-making process over the past two years, was blocked on Tuesday by a federal judge in Texas.
2016-11-25.headline_main: No Extra Pay for Extra Work

2016-11-25.lead_paragraph: In one of the early Democratic presidential debates, the candidates were asked which enemy they were the proudest of making. Tellingly, most offered a political response: Hillary Clinton singled out Republicans; Martin O’Malley, a former Maryland governor, mentioned the National Rifle Association; Senator Bernie Sanders turned his ire on Wall Street; and Lincoln Chafee, a former Rhode Island governor, discussed the coal lobby.

2016-11-25.snippet: The $25 million settlement of the Trump University fraud cases is only the tip of the iceberg.
2016-11-25.lead_paragraph: Donald Trump will take office as president facing a tsunami of litigation over his business practices and personal behavior. He may have settled the fraud suits involving Trump University, but at least 75 other lawsuits are underway against him or his companies, according to USA Today. Its investigation found more than 3,500 lawsuits over the past three decades, ranging from contract disputes to real estate battles to harassment and discrimination claims.
2016-11-25.headline_main: Donald Trump and the Lawsuit Presidency

2016-11-25.snippet: There’s nothing new about the alt-right’s intellectual aspirations.
2016-11-25.lead_paragraph: Tallahassee, Fla. — Richard B. Spencer is one of the main figures of the alt-right movement, a former doctoral student from Duke whose movement supports the creation of “an ethno-state” for white Europeans and “peaceful ethnic cleansing.” The Southern Poverty Law Center describes him as “a suit-and-tie version of the white supremacists of old, a kind of professional racist in khakis”; a recent Los Angeles Times profile ran with a photo of him in sunglasses and a black shirt, looking more like a hipster academic than a Klansman.
2016-11-25.headline_main: White-Collar Supremacy

2016-11-25.abstract: The body of a woman whose mutation keeps her on the brink of starvation may hold the secret to treating obesity.
2016-11-25.snippet: The body of a woman whose mutation keeps her on the brink of starvation may hold the secret to treating obesity.
2016-11-25.lead_paragraph: Abby Solomon suffers from a one-in-a-billion genetic syndrome: After just about an hour without food, she begins to starve. She sleeps in snatches. In her dreams she gorges on French fries. But as soon as she wakes up and nibbles a few bites, she feels full, so she ends up consuming very few calories. At 5 feet 10 inches tall, she weighs 99 pounds.
2016-11-25.headline_main: The Thin Gene

2016-11-25.lead_paragraph: More than a decade ago, when I was growing up in Finland, my model of an attractive woman was Pamela Anderson from “Baywatch.” She was my father’s favorite. Whenever the boys at school asked me who I Googled when my parents weren’t home, I said, “Pamela,” and the name was greeted with a unanimous nodding of heads.

2016-11-25.snippet: Taa, spoken by a few thousand people in Botswana and Namibia, is believed to have the largest sound inventory of any language in the world.
2016-11-25.lead_paragraph: With five distinct kinds of clicks, multiple tones and strident vowels — vocalized with a quick choking sound — the Taa language, spoken by a few thousand people in Botswana and Namibia, is believed by most linguists to have the largest sound inventory of any tongue in the world.

It’s a delightful trap: crunch, then sink. The flavors, too, give and take, pulverized peanuts leavened by ginger, sunny lemon pulled down to earth by cumin with its whiff of broken husks.

2016-11-25.abstract: The author on the word that fills him with dread.
2016-11-25.snippet: The author on the word that fills him with dread.
2016-11-25.lead_paragraph: I was disappointed when the website of Oxford Dictionaries called off its search for the worst word in the English language before I got a chance to have my say. When the survey was halted — the Oxford folks said that too many people were sending in offensive or insulting words — the word “moist” was in the lead. If a sort of yucky association was the criterion for what the survey officially called “your least favorite” word, I would have gone for “membrane” over “moist.” I can think of some pleasant uses for “moist” — a moist chocolate cake springs to mind — but I never encountered a membrane that didn’t make me shudder.
2016-11-25.headline_main: Calvin Trillin on the Scariest Word

2016-11-25.lead_paragraph: The notion of Ramzan Kadyrov, the leader of Chechnya, seeking to remake his image through a Donald Trump-like reality show would be mildly amusing if his rule were not so obscenely brutal and corrupt. “The Team,” in which the losing contestant’s name is scrawled with a gold pen — the equivalent of “You’re fired” — doesn’t even begin to approach reality. 2016-11-25.abstract: It’s a big city, with plenty to do, see, hear and watch. Here’s a sampling of cultural highlights this weekend and over the week ahead.
2016-11-25.snippet: It’s a big city, with plenty to do, see, hear and watch. Here’s a sampling of cultural highlights this weekend and over the week ahead.
2016-11-25.lead_paragraph: The artist Charlotte Moorman (1933-91) was a classically trained cellist who became a catalytic figure in the international avant-garde. As a musician, she collaborated frequently with the video pioneer Nam June Paik. As a charismatic organizer, she produced the Annual Avant Garde Festival of New York from 1963 to 1980 and persuaded city officials to let it happen in such places as Grand Central Terminal and Shea Stadium. A great spirit, she gets her due in this retrospective, which is closed until Tuesday but will continue through Dec. 10. A not-to-be-missed concurrent show, “Charlotte Moorman: Don’t Throw Anything Out,” runs through Dec. 9 at the Fales Library & Special Collections. HOLLAND COTTER
2016-11-25.headline_main: 10 Things to Do Now in NYC

2016-11-25.abstract: A computer science student in a former Soviet republic found there was money to be made in mixing real and made-up stories, as long as they were pro-Trump.
2016-11-25.snippet: A computer science student in a former Soviet republic found there was money to be made in mixing real and made-up stories, as long as they were pro-Trump.
2016-11-25.lead_paragraph: TBILISI, Georgia — Jobless and with graduation looming, a computer science student at the premier university in the nation of Georgia decided early this year that money could be made from America’s voracious appetite for passionately partisan political news. He set up a website, posted gushing stories about Hillary Clinton and waited for ad sales to soar.
2016-11-25.headline_main: Inside a Fake News Sausage Factory: ‘This Is All About Income’

2016-11-25.abstract: “Moana” is a step toward diversifying the world of animated princesses. But it’s still exceedingly rare to see dark-skinned heroines in such films.
2016-11-25.snippet: “Moana” is a step toward diversifying the world of animated princesses. But it’s still exceedingly rare to see dark-skinned heroines in such films.
2016-11-25.lead_paragraph: I’m not part of Disney’s target audience for its latest princess movie, “Moana,” but I don’t care. I’ve been excited about this film since Dwayne Johnson previewed it last year at the D23 Expo for all things Disney. As much as the new Lin-Manuel Miranda music sounds promising, what’s really exciting is the chance to see a Disney princess who doesn’t look like those we have already.
2016-11-25.headline_main: A Latina Disney Movie Princess? The Wait Isn’t Over

2016-11-25.abstract: A federal judge ruled that the trial of Mr. Roof, the avowed white supremacist accused of killing nine black churchgoers in June 2015, can move forward.
2016-11-25.snippet: A federal judge ruled that the trial of Mr. Roof, the avowed white supremacist accused of killing nine black churchgoers in June 2015, can move forward.
2016-11-25.lead_paragraph: Dylann S. Roof, the self-avowed white supremacist who is accused of killing nine black parishioners at a Charleston, S.C., church in June 2015, is competent to stand trial, a federal judge ruled Friday.
2016-11-25.headline_main: Dylann Roof Found Competent for Trial in Charleston Church Killings

2016-11-25.abstract: On Wednesday, the spacecraft that has studied Saturn for a dozen years will commence a series of maneuvers that will graze the planet’s rings.
2016-11-25.snippet: On Wednesday, the spacecraft that has studied Saturn for a dozen years will commence a series of maneuvers that will graze the planet’s rings.
2016-11-25.lead_paragraph: It’s the beginning of a spectacular, almost circuslike end for NASA’s Cassini mission. For 12 years Cassini has been buzzing about Saturn, its rings and its moons. As a result we know that there are methane lakes on Titan and jets of water shooting from Enceladus, and the rings themselves have warps, ripples, hills twists and braids.
2016-11-25.headline_main: How Cassini Will Begin Its Date With Death on Saturn

2016-11-25.lead_paragraph: AUBURN, Ala. — It is the season of non-offensive touchdowns for No. 1 Alabama. The Crimson Tide have scored 12 of the so-called NOTs, those touchdowns by the defense or by special teams. The wish of many Alabama football fans heading into Saturday’s Iron Bowl is to add a particular NOT to the Crimson Tide portfolio: the return for a touchdown of a short Auburn field-goal attempt. It would offer not only 6 points, but also some cathartic payback.
2016-11-25.headline_main: Auburn’s Iron Bowl Hopes Are on Firm Footing

2016-11-25.lead_paragraph: The issues in Gauri Shinde’s sharply observed drama “Dear Zindagi” are suggested in its opening scene: A woman walks with her boyfriend, disgusted with his infidelity, while he pleads for forgiveness, professing his love. A director calls cut, and we realize we are watching actors on a Mumbai movie set. The young cinematographer Kaira (Alia Bhatt) suggests shooting another take, this time with the woman surreptitiously checking out a passing male bicyclist. Her director approves.
2016-11-25.headline_main: Review: In ‘Dear Zindagi,’ a Conflicted Woman in Search of a Truer Life

2016-11-25.abstract: She remains a polarizing figure among gamers, a paradox regarded as either a digital pinup girl or a feminist role model — or sometimes both.
2016-11-25.snippet: She remains a polarizing figure among gamers, a paradox regarded as either a digital pinup girl or a feminist role model — or sometimes both.
2016-11-25.lead_paragraph: Lara Croft set off on her first Tomb Raider adventure in 1996, traveling the globe in search of ancient artifacts amid dark and dusty ruins. She pushed that video game into a multibillion-dollar franchise that included several sequels, two feature films (starring Angelina Jolie), an animated series, apparel and merchandise. Now, the Academy Award-winning Swedish actress Alicia Vikander is set to  portray Lara Croft in a reboot of the series.
2016-11-25.headline_main: Girl Power? For Lara Croft, It’s a Complicated Legacy

2016-11-25.abstract: One is confident, the other defensive. Trump will have to deal with both.
2016-11-25.snippet: One is confident, the other defensive. Trump will have to deal with both.
2016-11-25.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — With a single phone conversation this month, Donald J. Trump and Vladimir V. Putin have started talk of another “reset” in ties between Russia and the United States. A new president, of course, has every reason to seek improved relations. But what could make this “reset” work? Mr. Trump rightly believes there may be opportunities in the relationship. They’re just not the ones he thinks.
2016-11-25.headline_main: The Two Putin Problem

2016-11-26.abstract: The executive chef at the National Museum of the American Indian’s cafe researched oral histories to showcase indigenous food from across the Americas.
2016-11-26.snippet: The executive chef at the National Museum of the American Indian’s cafe researched oral histories to showcase indigenous food from across the Americas.
2016-11-26.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — It took 12 years for the nation’s pre-eminent Native American restaurant to hire its first Native American executive chef. Yet the chef, Freddie Bitsoie, is feeling a more particular pressure.
2016-11-26.headline_main: A Navajo Chef Looks to History in His Homage to Native Cuisine

2016-11-26.lead_paragraph: BEVERLY HILLS, Calif. — Shawn Levy quickly made a name for himself in Hollywood. Maybe too quickly.

2016-11-26.abstract: Donald Trump’s choice for education secretary was an architect of school reforms in Michigan. The results were terrible.
2016-11-26.snippet: Donald Trump’s choice for education secretary was an architect of school reforms in Michigan. The results were terrible.
2016-11-26.lead_paragraph: NEW ORLEANS — President-elect Donald J. Trump’s selection of Betsy DeVos as secretary of education has sent shock waves through the educational establishment. Understandably so, since this is a clear sign that Mr. Trump intends a major national push to direct public funds to private and charter schools. But this is more than just a political or financial loss for traditional public schools. It will also most likely be a loss for students.
2016-11-26.headline_main: Betsy DeVos and the Wrong Way to Fix Schools

2016-11-26.abstract: Mr. Barrows and Mr. Graham met by chance in 1945 and began a professional association that lasted more than 70 years.

2016-11-26.lead_paragraph: Cliff Barrows, a farmer’s son and ordained Baptist minister who for more than 70 years was the musical voice and program manager of the Rev. Billy Graham’s global Christian evangelistic crusades, died on Nov. 15 in Pineville, N.C. He was 93.
2016-11-26.headline_main: Cliff Barrows, Billy Graham’s Longtime Musical Director, Dies at 93

2016-11-26.snippet: Mr. Trump’s business interests will threaten the integrity of the government.
2016-11-26.lead_paragraph: In the short time Donald Trump has been president-elect, he’s already shown that he will freely mix his business affairs with his activities as president. Federal ethics rules are not a deterrent, since they cannot be enforced against him. The situation practically invites foreign governments and businesses to try to influence American policy by currying favor with him through his business empire.
2016-11-26.headline_main: Donald Trump’s Caldron of Conflicts

2016-11-26.abstract: A young woman with cerebral palsy receives furniture for her new bedroom, with help from The Neediest Cases.
2016-11-26.snippet: A young woman with cerebral palsy receives furniture for her new bedroom, with help from The Neediest Cases.
2016-11-26.lead_paragraph: It wasn’t until she was 3 years old that Shatiana Vanterpool received a diagnosis. Unable to walk or talk, she was taken by her mother, Shayntte Johnson, to three different doctors, and finally it was discovered that she had cerebral palsy, which affected her muscle tone and motor skills. She didn’t learn to walk until she was about 5. And doctors said she would never be able to speak.
2016-11-26.headline_main: A Hard Journey Toward Independence

2016-11-26.lead_paragraph: RIVERDALE, N.J. — With a baby strapped to her front, a knapsack on her back and a Donald Duck coffee mug in one hand, Christi Mulder arrived at the Target here, about 30 miles northwest of Manhattan, early Friday morning. She and her sister, Erica Renaud, who brought her 7-week-old son, were on the hunt for holiday gifts for the 11 children they have between them.

Yanukovych, the former president of Ukraine, said Friday that he regrets he did not impose martial law and order troops to disperse the mass protests that toppled his government and forced him into exile in Russia.

2016-11-26.abstract: Anthony scored a season-high 35 points and grabbed 14 rebounds, carrying the Knicks past the Hornets in overtime at Madison Square Garden.
2016-11-26.snippet: Anthony scored a season-high 35 points and grabbed 14 rebounds, carrying the Knicks past the Hornets in overtime at Madison Square Garden.
2016-11-26.lead_paragraph: Carmelo Anthony has been a star in the shadows this season. He remains one of the N.B.A.’s marquee players and the face of the Knicks, but Anthony has been pushed off center stage often enough this month by the emerging Kristaps Porzingis. It has not been an unruly exchange, and Anthony seems to appreciate his new co-star after so many years of toiling away in New York with much acclaim but few wins.

2016-11-26.abstract: Trying to build suspense, the series changed the points system at Abu Dhabi in 2014. No one seemed to like the result.

2016-11-26.lead_paragraph: The 2014 Abu Dhabi Grand Prix was the only race in Formula One history in which the teams and drivers contended for double points. It quickly became apparent that the rule was one of the worst ideas the series ever had, and it was immediately discarded.

2016-11-26.lead_paragraph: At the end of this year’s season, the Mercedes Formula One team has cemented its reputation like no other road car manufacturer before it. It won a third constructors’ and drivers’ title, more than any major road car manufacturer in the series’ history.

2016-11-26.snippet: Liz Mandarano, the owner of the brownstone that was the backdrop for Spike Lee’s film, believes she’s being unfairly targeted. But the city said her building violated the housing code.
2016-11-26.lead_paragraph: The doorbell rang. On the steps of the brownstone in the Bedford-Stuyvesant section of Brooklyn were two police officers, two firefighters and two Buildings Department inspectors. The one who did the talking said to get out immediately, not because there was a gas leak, not because anyone was suspected of selling illegal drugs, but because the brownstone was being used as a bed-and-breakfast.
2016-11-26.headline_main: Owner of a Brooklyn Brownstone From ‘Crooklyn’ Sees Herself Caught in Airbnb Crossfire

2016-11-26.snippet: Huntsman coached at the college level, led United States Olympic teams and fought financial reductions that threatened the very existence of the sport.
2016-11-26.lead_paragraph: Stan Huntsman, who coached outstanding college track and field teams for 39 years, led a dominant United States men’s team at the 1988 Olympics in Seoul, and fought tirelessly against cuts in financial support for the sport, died on Wednesday in Austin, Tex. He was 84.

2016-11-26.snippet: Researchers say they have figured out a piece of the puzzle of why a 2.3 million-gallon spill of molasses from a storage tank in Boston was so deadly, killing 21 people and destroying buildings.
2016-11-26.lead_paragraph: It was January. The place was Boston. And when 2.3 million gallons of molasses burst from a gigantic holding tank in the city’s North End, 21 people were killed and about 150 more were left injured. The wave of syrup — some reports said it was up to 40 feet tall — rushed through the waterfront, destroying buildings, overturning vehicles and pushing a firehouse off its foundation.
2016-11-26.headline_main: Solving a Mystery Behind the Deadly ‘Tsunami of Molasses’ of 1919

2016-11-26.snippet: Five decades after the Loving ruling, intolerance is still sometimes an issue for interracial couples.
2016-11-26.lead_paragraph: When I was a new mother living on the Upper West Side of Manhattan in 2010, I often forgot that my infant son, Harper, didn’t look like me. As I pushed him around the neighborhood, I thought of him as the perfect brown baby, soft-skinned and tulip-lipped, with a full head of black hair, even if it was the opposite of my blond waves and fair skin.
2016-11-26.headline_main: For Interracial Couples, Growing Acceptance, With Some Exceptions

2016-11-26.lead_paragraph: ACCRA, Ghana — Semiratu Zakaru was standing in the hot sun on a crowded noontime street explaining why Ghana’s new ban against certain skin-bleaching creams was unlikely to work, when her friend, Desmond Kwamina Odonkor, walked up and interrupted our conversation, oozing confidence and game.

2016-11-26.abstract: In hearing about Fidel Castro’s death, many older Cubans went into mourning, but younger people were generally indifferent.

2016-11-26.lead_paragraph: HAVANA — At the Salon Rojo, one of Havana’s most popular nightspots, where the reggaeton usually blares into the early hours, the music stopped abruptly.

2016-11-26.headline_main: With One Castro Gone, Questions About What the Other Castro Will Do

Trump’s administration may be viewed as an experiment — an opportunity to discover whether one particular businessman’s perspective and skills will be assets in governing a nation.

2016-11-26.snippet: A North Dakota site has been the location of demonstrations against the construction of a crude oil pipeline.
2016-11-26.lead_paragraph: Citing public safety concerns, federal officials plan to close access to a campsite where demonstrators have protested the construction of a crude oil pipeline near the Standing Rock Sioux Reservation in North Dakota and create a “free speech zone.”
2016-11-26.headline_main: Officials to Close Standing Rock Protest Campsite

2016-11-26.abstract: How do you permanently remove vagrants from a rental building lobby?
2016-11-26.snippet: How do you permanently remove vagrants from a rental building lobby?
2016-11-26.lead_paragraph: Q. Two people who appear to be drug addicts regularly sleep in the lobby of my rental building in East Flatbush, Brooklyn. They sneak in every afternoon behind someone who leaves the door open and stay out of the view of the cameras. The super, who lives nearby, clears them out in the morning. They are generally amiable and accommodating, but when they are high they become agitated and accost me, threatening harm  if I call the police. I am scared to report them, especially because I know they will probably be back the next day. What’s the best way to handle this?
2016-11-26.headline_main: Vagrants in the Building Lobby

2016-11-26.abstract: Being uprooted from her home amid domestic violence did not stop Andie Gratereaux, 12, from crossing things off her to-do list with a mentor’s help.
2016-11-26.snippet: Being uprooted from her home amid domestic violence did not stop Andie Gratereaux, 12, from crossing things off her to-do list with a mentor’s help.
2016-11-26.lead_paragraph: Andie Gratereaux sat under the autumn leaves at DeSalvio Playground in Manhattan a year ago, peeled away the wrapper from a salted caramel cupcake and started to put her life back together.
2016-11-26.headline_main: Chipping Away at a List of Goals, and Bonding Over Cupcakes

2016-11-26.abstract: The Anger Room in Dallas and other businesses that let people break things to release their rage have gained customers, especially during the election season.
2016-11-26.snippet: The Anger Room in Dallas and other businesses that let people break things to release their rage have gained customers, especially during the election season.
2016-11-26.lead_paragraph: When she was a teenager on the South Side of Chicago in the late 1990s, Donna Alexander fantasized about setting up a space where stressed-out people could relieve their tension in a safe, nonviolent way — by smashing mannequins, televisions, furniture and other objects. She was confident in her idea, but she wasn’t sure how to turn it into a business.
2016-11-26.headline_main: Anger Rooms: A Smashing New Way to Relieve Stress

2016-11-26.abstract: In the coming trial of Dylann S. Roof, who is accused of killing nine black churchgoers last year, no issue is more disputed than whether he should face execution.
2016-11-26.snippet: In the coming trial of Dylann S. Roof, who is accused of killing nine black churchgoers last year, no issue is more disputed than whether he should face execution.
2016-11-26.lead_paragraph: CHARLESTON, S.C. — The Rev. Sharon Risher often thinks these days about what she calls her “humanness”: the passing impulse to crave the execution of the white supremacist accused of killing her mother and eight other black churchgoers last year.
2016-11-26.headline_main: U.S. Seeks Death for Charleston Shooting Suspect. Victims’ Families Prefer Mercy.

2016-11-26.abstract: The wealth culture of today, in contrast to the excesses of the 1980s, emphasizes staying under the radar. The election of Mr. Trump could change that.

2016-11-26.abstract: Lt. Gen. Qamar Javed Bajwa was selected to take over the command of Pakistan’s army when Gen. Raheel Sharif retires on Tuesday.

2016-11-26.lead_paragraph: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan — Prime Minister Nawaz Sharif of Pakistan on Saturday chose Lt. Gen. Qamar Javed Bajwa, a military commander with a solid soldierly reputation and a firm belief in civilian supremacy, to lead the country’s powerful army.
2016-11-26.headline_main: Pakistan Names New Military Leader

2016-11-26.snippet: Emily Cox and Henry Rathvon win me over once again.
2016-11-26.lead_paragraph: VARIETY PUZZLE — Today’s acrostic has nothing to do with my beloved Monty Python’s Flying Circus (a shame, in my opinion), but our constructors have lovingly planted an entry that is of great interest to me, even if, as they say below, it’s not in the dictionary.
2016-11-26.headline_main: Variety: The Acrostic

2016-11-26.abstract: For many Cuban-Americans, still bitter over the revolution that tore their families from their homes, it was a celebration long in coming.
2016-11-26.snippet: For many Cuban-Americans, still bitter over the revolution that tore their families from their homes, it was a celebration long in coming.
2016-11-26.lead_paragraph: MIAMI — It did not matter that it was the middle of the night, or that it began to drizzle. When this city’s Cuban-American residents heard the news, they sprinted to Little Havana. They banged pots and pans. They sang the Cuban national anthem and waved the Cuban flag. They danced and hugged, laughed and cried, shouted and rejoiced.
2016-11-26.headline_main: Miami’s Cuban Exiles Celebrate Castro’s Death

Bui, was married Nov. 26 to David Elliott Purcell, a son of Carol Burke Purcell of McLean, Va., and the late Francis E. Purcell. The Rev. Timothy Mills, an American Baptist minister, officiated at a nondenominational ceremony at the Ritz-Carlton in San Francisco.

Kauffman of Philadelphia, was married Nov. 26 to Jonathan Grinberg, a son of Sima Davidson and Dr. Isaac Grinberg of Huixquilucan, Mexico. Cantor David F. Tilman led the ceremony in the planetarium at the Franklin Institute, the science museum in Philadelphia.

2016-11-26.abstract: Drones, mainly associated with missiles, are poised to deliver medicines in Madagascar.
2016-11-26.snippet: Drones, mainly associated with missiles, are poised to deliver medicines in Madagascar.
2016-11-26.lead_paragraph: When drones are in the news these days, the context is typically war or surveillance or the speedy deliver of packages to impatient consumers. Here, Heidi Hutner of Stony Brook University offers a “Your Dot” contribution on a recent test in a roadless region in Madagascar that could signal an exciting new frontier for this technology – helping deliver health care to some of the world’s poorest, most isolated communities.
2016-11-26.headline_main: In Madagascar Test, Drone Delivers Medicine by Air

2016-11-26.abstract: The president-elect has been critical of the détente, and sent mixed signals during the campaign about his intentions toward the island nation.
2016-11-26.snippet: The president-elect has been critical of the détente, and sent mixed signals during the campaign about his intentions toward the island nation.
2016-11-26.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Obama said on Saturday that the death of Fidel Castro was an occasion for Americans to “extend a hand of friendship to the Cuban people” and acknowledge the “powerful emotions” the revolutionary leader had evoked in both countries, seeking to use Mr. Castro’s fraught legacy to underscore his own efforts to bury decades of bitterness between the United States and Cuba.
2016-11-26.headline_main: Fate of U.S.-Cuba Thaw Is Less Certain Under Donald Trump

2016-11-26.abstract: The technology exists to prevent children from firing guns, but under gun lobby pressure, the industry has not used it.
2016-11-26.snippet: The technology exists to prevent children from firing guns, but under gun lobby pressure, the industry has not used it.
2016-11-26.lead_paragraph: The Department of Justice has issued official guidelines for the manufacture of smart guns — weapons that, like smartphones, have technology to allow only the rightful owners to use them. The guidelines aim to “shape the future of gun safety technology,” as called for under an executive order issued in January by President Obama, in the face of Congress’s refusal to deal with the nation’s horrendous toll of gun deaths.
2016-11-26.headline_main: Why Not Smart Guns in This High-Tech Era?

2016-11-26.lead_paragraph: Readers discuss identity politics and how it promotes or impedes our coming together.

2016-11-26.abstract: The president-elect’s campaign crusade against Sgt. Bowe Bergdahl makes it unlikely that the former Taliban hostage can get a fair trial.
2016-11-26.snippet: The president-elect’s campaign crusade against Sgt. Bowe Bergdahl makes it unlikely that the former Taliban hostage can get a fair trial.
2016-11-26.lead_paragraph: The case of Sgt. Bowe Bergdahl, an American soldier who, after leaving his post, was held hostage by the Taliban for five years, became a recurring theme of Donald Trump’s unruly campaign speeches.
2016-11-26.headline_main: The Soldier Donald Trump Called a Traitor

2016-11-26.abstract: My Indian family’s comfort is built on the work of other immigrants.
2016-11-26.snippet: My Indian family’s comfort is built on the work of other immigrants.
2016-11-26.lead_paragraph: Berkeley, Calif. — “Girls,” Mrs. Danilewitz called to her daughters, “Girls, I want you to meet this extraordinary lady!” My mother stood unsuspecting in the foyer, hardly taller than the two children who gazed at her now. I’d been studying for a biology test with their older brother, Justin. “Did you know,” Mrs. D. went on, “that this lady arrived in this country with no more than $6 in her pocket? And look what she’s made of herself today!” She clasped my mother’s hand. “Nimmu, what an inspiration!”
2016-11-26.headline_main: The Privileged Immigrant

2016-11-26.abstract: Questions without answers in Catholicism’s civil war.
2016-11-26.snippet: Questions without answers in Catholicism’s civil war.
2016-11-26.lead_paragraph: “This is not normal” — so say Donald Trump’s critics as he prepares to assume the presidency. But the American republic is only the second-oldest institution facing a distinctively unusual situation at the moment. Pride of place goes to the Roman Catholic Church, which with less fanfare (perhaps because the papacy lacks a nuclear arsenal) has also entered terra incognita.
2016-11-26.headline_main: His Holiness Declines to Answer

2016-11-26.abstract: Someone has to police the consumer debt industry. If Trump disbands the C.F.P.B., it’s going to be this guy.
2016-11-26.snippet: Someone has to police the consumer debt industry. If Trump disbands the C.F.P.B., it’s going to be this guy.
2016-11-26.lead_paragraph: Brandon Wilson is a former armed robber who, after serving roughly a decade in prison, reinvented himself as a successful debt broker. Basically, he makes a living buying and selling old, unpaid debts.
2016-11-26.headline_main: Will Guys With Guns Replace the Agency Elizabeth Warren Created?

2016-11-26.abstract: I had an unyielding week, scolded by Donald Trump at The Times and my conservative family at Thanksgiving.
2016-11-26.snippet: I had an unyielding week, scolded by Donald Trump at The Times and my conservative family at Thanksgiving.
2016-11-26.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — First I had to deal with the president-elect scolding.
2016-11-26.headline_main: Election Therapy From My Basket of Deplorables

2016-11-26.abstract: Mindfulness is supposed to ease the stress of modern life, not add to it.
2016-11-26.snippet: Mindfulness is supposed to ease the stress of modern life, not add to it.
2016-11-26.lead_paragraph: I’m at the kitchen sink, after a long day of work and kids and chores and the emotional exhaustion of a toxic election season, attempting to mindfully focus on congealed SpaghettiOs. My brain flits to the Netflix queue. I manhandle my thoughts back to the leaky orange glob in front of me. My brain flits to the president-elect.
2016-11-26.headline_main: Actually, Let’s Not Be in the Moment

2016-11-26.abstract: Bars used to be a hub for working-class politics. We could use them again today.
2016-11-26.snippet: Bars used to be a hub for working-class politics. We could use them again today.
2016-11-26.lead_paragraph: Frothy lager on tap. A communal “mustache towel” hanging by the bar. Partisan debate rattling the glassware. America’s saloons once served as boisterous “poor man’s clubs,” where 19th-century laborers could make their political voices heard. In the wake of the 2016 election, with both parties struggling to connect with a disaffected working class, and just about everyone in need of a drink, Americans might want to belly up to the once-maligned saloon.
2016-11-26.headline_main: The Saloon, America’s Forgotten Democratic Institution

2016-11-26.abstract: As the party seeks a unifying message, it also must decide how to best use its power in Congress.
2016-11-26.snippet: As the party seeks a unifying message, it also must decide how to best use its power in Congress.
2016-11-26.lead_paragraph: Having had more than two weeks to ponder one of the most humiliating presidential defeats in its history, the Democratic Party is moving to apply its lessons to the legislative battles ahead, as well as to the daunting but essential task of rebuilding the party’s fortunes.
2016-11-26.headline_main: Can Senate Democrats Save the Party?

2016-11-26.abstract: Working-class whites delivered three Rust Belt states to the president-elect.
2016-11-26.snippet: Working-class whites delivered three Rust Belt states to the president-elect.
2016-11-26.lead_paragraph: For the nation’s labor unions, the day after Election Day was going to be a victory lap. They planned to boast to the world that their vaunted get-out-the-vote operation had delivered the White House to Hillary Clinton by winning three crucial Rust Belt states for her: Michigan, Pennsylvania and Wisconsin. But the unions, to their shock and horror, failed to deliver those states — or victory — to Mrs. Clinton.
2016-11-26.headline_main: What Unions Got Wrong About Trump

2016-11-26.abstract: Long before the Islamic State — or the campaign to expel it — my beloved hometown was a place of music, culture and unity.
2016-11-26.snippet: Long before the Islamic State — or the campaign to expel it — my beloved hometown was a place of music, culture and unity.
2016-11-26.lead_paragraph: CHICAGO — The ancient Assyrians considered the Tigris River the division between East and West, and the city I come from in Iraq is called Mosul — connection point, in Arabic — because it connects these two sides. Nineveh, which lay on the eastern bank of the Tigris, was a capital of the great Assyrian empire. When Arabs arrived in the seventh century, they preferred to live at a distance from it, on the western bank, where the modern city of Mosul is today.
2016-11-26.headline_main: Memories of Another Mosul

2016-11-26.abstract: March. Fight. But go to planning meetings, too.
2016-11-26.snippet: March. Fight. But go to planning meetings, too.
2016-11-26.lead_paragraph: Every protest contains a contradiction: people stand up — through speech, demonstration, violent or nonviolent action — and urge the state to change. They break the rules in order to convince the rule-makers that they need to change the rules, which is itself a kind of state-approved process. However, at Standing Rock in North Dakota, Indians from all over North America have been protesting for seven months in some ways never before seen.
2016-11-26.headline_main: An Indian Protest for Everyone

2016-11-26.abstract: I grew up in a family that embraced extreme views. I’ve moved on. The country can, too.
2016-11-26.snippet: I grew up in a family that embraced extreme views. I’ve moved on. The country can, too.
2016-11-26.lead_paragraph: I could easily have spent the night of Nov. 8 elated, surrounded by friends and family, thinking: “We did it. We rejected a multicultural and globalist society. We defied the elites, rejected political correctness, and made a statement millions of Americans have wanted to shout for decades.”
2016-11-26.headline_main: Why I Left White Nationalism

2016-11-26.abstract: The “blue-collar billionaire” is looking plenty regal so far.
2016-11-26.snippet: The “blue-collar billionaire” is looking plenty regal so far.
2016-11-26.lead_paragraph: For a politician who won the White House by railing against the elites and demonizing the establishment, Donald Trump presented an odd argument for why Americans should believe, as he does, that his adviser Steve Bannon is no racist, anti-Semitic ally of the alt-right.
2016-11-26.headline_main: The Pretend Populism of Donald Trump

2016-11-26.abstract: Foster Campbell, a Democrat, is not expected to beat Republican John N. Kennedy in Louisiana, but that hasn’t stopped Democrats from around the country from one final push.
2016-11-26.snippet: Foster Campbell, a Democrat, is not expected to beat Republican John N. Kennedy in Louisiana, but that hasn’t stopped Democrats from around the country from one final push.
2016-11-26.lead_paragraph: NEW ORLEANS — The punk club was dark and packed, the lead singer of the band Hurray for the Riff Raff warming up a crowd of the young, the bearded and the well-tattooed. A little after 9 p.m., in came the headline act: a necktie-wearing cattle rancher, public service commissioner and United States Senate candidate from Elm Grove, La., who owns a half dozen hunting dogs and five times as many shotguns.
2016-11-26.headline_main: For Democrats, a Last Faint Hope to Gain a Senate Seat

2016-11-26.abstract: A senior administration official responded to The Times’s questions about the federal government’s investigation into the integrity of the Nov. 8 presidential election.
2016-11-26.snippet: A senior administration official responded to The Times’s questions about the federal government’s investigation into the integrity of the Nov. 8 presidential election.
2016-11-26.lead_paragraph: Following is the full text of a statement from a senior administration official, issued to The New York Times on Friday in response to questions about the federal government’s investigation into the integrity of the Nov. 8 presidential election. The government issued the statement to The Times on the condition that it be attributable only to a senior official.

Putin of Russia is working hard to destabilize America’s friends in Europe, a pro-Russian mercenary detained in Montenegro is slowly spilling his guts — and providing the first insider’s account of what the authorities in this tiny Balkan nation say were Russian efforts to sow mayhem.

I was in Miami when the announcement went out that Castro had had an operation and was temporarily ceding power to his brother. This being the first time Castro had voluntarily stepped away from his dictatorship, speculation ran wild. Miami Cubans took to the streets to celebrate the death of a tyrant, a symbol of death and loss for Cubans of all races and faiths.

2016-11-27.snippet: Two men were arrested on illegal gun possession charges after a shooting on Bourbon Street that also wounded nine people.
2016-11-27.lead_paragraph: One man was killed and nine others were shot early Sunday morning on Bourbon Street in New Orleans, a teeming tourist destination that was more crowded than usual after the conclusion of a major college football game.
2016-11-27.headline_main: Gunfire Kills 1 in French Quarter of New Orleans

2016-11-27.abstract: The Giants sent the Browns to 0-12. Four more losses, and Cleveland will become the second 0-16 team in N.F.L. history, joining the 2008 Detroit Lions.
2016-11-27.snippet: The Giants sent the Browns to 0-12. Four more losses, and Cleveland will become the second 0-16 team in N.F.L. history, joining the 2008 Detroit Lions.
2016-11-27.lead_paragraph: CLEVELAND — Like pushing on an open door, the Giants handled the winless Cleveland Browns on Sunday afternoon, with wide receiver Odell Beckham Jr. overcoming a thumb injury early on to catch six passes for 96 yards and two touchdowns in a 27-13 victory.
2016-11-27.headline_main: Giants Add to the Winless Browns’ Misery

2016-11-27.abstract: A Russian and a Norwegian are battling in a contest that is once again taking place during escalating tensions among Russia, the United States and Western Europe.
2016-11-27.snippet: A Russian and a Norwegian are battling in a contest that is once again taking place during escalating tensions among Russia, the United States and Western Europe.
2016-11-27.lead_paragraph: A Cold War battle has been playing out in Lower Manhattan for the last three weeks, in a soundproof glass chamber watched by partisans around the world. When the contest ends this week, victory will belong either to a resurgent Russia or to Norway, a wary neighbor along Russia’s increasingly militarized border.
2016-11-27.headline_main: At World Chess Championship, Familiar Overtones of East-West Politics

2016-11-27.abstract: Patricia Lewis, 68, is focused on enjoying her grandchildren after losing her health and career to breast cancer.
2016-11-27.snippet: Patricia Lewis, 68, is focused on enjoying her grandchildren after losing her health and career to breast cancer.
2016-11-27.lead_paragraph: For decades, Patricia Lewis toiled as a security guard for NYC Health & Hospitals, a duty she performed along with a second, and sometimes a third, job.
2016-11-27.headline_main: As She Fights Cancer, a Woman Strives for Normalcy

2016-11-27.abstract: The following tax-exempt, fixed-income issues are scheduled for pricing this week.
2016-11-27.snippet: The following tax-exempt, fixed-income issues are scheduled for pricing this week.
2016-11-27.lead_paragraph: The Treasury’s schedule of financing this week includes Monday’s regular weekly auction of new three- and six-month bills and an auction of four-week bills on Tuesday.
2016-11-27.headline_main: Treasury Auctions Set for the Week of Nov. 28

2016-11-27.abstract: This book by Arthur and Barbara Gelb expresses a professional admiration for Mr. O’Neill but goes into great detail about the unflattering parts of his life.
2016-11-27.snippet: This book by Arthur and Barbara Gelb expresses a professional admiration for Mr. O’Neill but goes into great detail about the unflattering parts of his life.
2016-11-27.lead_paragraph: The night that Eugene O’Neill’s five-hour drama “Strange Interlude” opened on Broadway in 1928, the anxious playwright stayed away. He sent in his stead not his wife, Agnes, but a woman with whom he had lately grown obsessed and for whom he would soon abandon Agnes — the glamorous actress Carlotta Monterey.
2016-11-27.headline_main: Review: ‘By Women Possessed,’ a Remix of a Flawed Eugene O’Neill

2016-11-27.abstract: The sport’s playing field has been leveled by the amount of money more and more universities are willing to spend. So choosing a competent leader has become critical.
2016-11-27.snippet: The sport’s playing field has been leveled by the amount of money more and more universities are willing to spend. So choosing a competent leader has become critical.
2016-11-27.lead_paragraph: The eminent college football program puttered along for a decade. There were a couple of 10-win seasons, but mostly inferior ones. Over 10 seasons, the team had four interim and permanent head coaches and, not accounting for N.C.A.A. sanctions, went 67-82. The punishment did not help, but neither did a general feeling of malaise and inconsistency — in short, the effects of suboptimal coaching.
2016-11-27.headline_main: In College Football, Getting the Right Coach Is the Top Priority

2016-11-27.abstract: Joe Corré, son of the Sex Pistols’ former manager, set fire to music memorabilia to protest Punk London, an event he considers too mainstream.
2016-11-27.snippet: Joe Corré, son of the Sex Pistols’ former manager, set fire to music memorabilia to protest Punk London, an event he considers too mainstream.
2016-11-27.lead_paragraph: LONDON — Joe Corré, the son of Malcolm McLaren, the Sex Pistols manager who defined the band’s direction in its brief heyday in the late 1970s, set fire to what he claimed was £5 million (about $6.25 million) worth of punk memorabilia aboard a boat on the Thames River here on Saturday.
2016-11-27.headline_main: To Save Punk’s Soul, a Bonfire of Some of Its Vanities on the Thames

2016-11-27.abstract: The Cincinnati Ballet performed this holiday staple at the Kennedy Center while New York City Ballet opened its seasonal tradition with “George Balanchine’s ‘The Nutcracker.’”
2016-11-27.snippet: The Cincinnati Ballet performed this holiday staple at the Kennedy Center while New York City Ballet opened its seasonal tradition with “George Balanchine’s ‘The Nutcracker.’”
2016-11-27.lead_paragraph: Tchaikovsky’s music for “The Nutcracker” is and isn’t familiar. You think you’ve known it forever — it’s quoted all across popular culture — and yet you have only to listen to the overture, where the sprightly melody is soon irregularly punctuated by staccato chords, to hear how multilayered it is and how unpredictable. No single version has all the answers — not even “George Balanchine’s ‘The Nutcracker,’” which opened with New York City Ballet in 1954 and today is a holiday staple for multiple companies from Copenhagen to Seattle.
2016-11-27.headline_main: Review: Pick a ‘Nutcracker,’ One From Balanchine, the Other Reimagined

2016-11-27.abstract: Mr. Bannon courted politicians who share his dark, populist worldview of a ruling class preying on working Americans and “the Judeo-Christian West” in a “war against Islamic fascism.”
2016-11-27.snippet: Mr. Bannon courted politicians who share his dark, populist worldview of a ruling class preying on working Americans and “the Judeo-Christian West” in a “war against Islamic fascism.”
2016-11-27.lead_paragraph: When Julia Jones arrived at her office in Santa Monica at 8 a.m. — by Hollywood screenwriter standards, the crack of dawn — she found Stephen K. Bannon already at his desk, which was cluttered with takeout coffees. They were co-writers on a Ronald Reagan documentary, but Mr. Bannon had pretty much taken it over. He had been at work for hours, he told her, writing feverishly about his political hero.
2016-11-27.headline_main: Combative, Populist Steve Bannon Found His Man in Donald Trump

2016-11-27.abstract: For the fourth Biennial in a row, no Miami artist was chosen; a Biennial adviser said the determining factor was art that addressed social upheavals.
2016-11-27.snippet: For the fourth Biennial in a row, no Miami artist was chosen; a Biennial adviser said the determining factor was art that addressed social upheavals.
2016-11-27.lead_paragraph: MIAMI — As the art world’s eyes turn toward this week’s Art Basel Miami Beach fair, you might imagine its homegrown artists relishing the moment. Yet more than a little grumbling can be heard here, much of it over the recent announcement of the 63 artists selected for the Whitney Museum of American Art’s 2017 Biennial.
2016-11-27.headline_main: Whitney Biennial to Miami Artists: It’s Not Us, It’s You

2016-11-27.abstract: Kristian House starts our solving week on the run.
2016-11-27.snippet: Kristian House starts our solving week on the run.
2016-11-27.lead_paragraph: MONDAY PUZZLE — Everyone needs a reason to get out of bed on a Monday morning, and that’s precisely what Kristian House has in store for us today.
2016-11-27.headline_main: Children’s Game

2016-11-27.abstract: Chico Mendes’s murder in 1988 became a turning point in Brazil’s environmental consciousness, and after it, a global movement to save the Amazon gained impetus.
2016-11-27.snippet: Chico Mendes’s murder in 1988 became a turning point in Brazil’s environmental consciousness, and after it, a global movement to save the Amazon gained impetus.
2016-11-27.lead_paragraph: Chico Mendes was hard to kill. No one knew that better than his enemies in Brazil’s Amazon rain forest. They had failed in half a dozen assassination attempts.
2016-11-27.headline_main: The Lasting Legacy of a Fighter for the Amazon

2016-11-27.abstract: The NES Classic Edition, a smaller version of a 30-year-old game system, is one of the year’s hottest gifts. But the trip down memory lane isn’t without headaches.
2016-11-27.snippet: The NES Classic Edition, a smaller version of a 30-year-old game system, is one of the year’s hottest gifts. But the trip down memory lane isn’t without headaches.
2016-11-27.lead_paragraph: When she heard that Nintendo was planning to reproduce its iconic Nintendo Entertainment System video game console for the holiday season, Emily Bradbury put a note on her calendar and set an alarm on her phone.
2016-11-27.headline_main: Nintendo’s New Console May Feed Your Nostalgia, if You Can Get One

2016-11-27.abstract: The Canadian prime minister has made reconciliation with native peoples a critical goal. But an environmental threat could scuttle his mission.
2016-11-27.snippet: The Canadian prime minister has made reconciliation with native peoples a critical goal. But an environmental threat could scuttle his mission.
2016-11-27.lead_paragraph: Billy Gauthier, an Inuk artist who lives in Labrador on Canada’s remote northeastern coast, began his hunger strike on Oct. 13 after a plate of salmon. The meal was highly symbolic.
2016-11-27.headline_main: Even as Trudeau Reaches Out to First Nations, Mercury Rises

2016-11-27.abstract: Demonetization will put only a temporary dent in corruption, if even that, and it may rock the entire economy.
2016-11-27.snippet: Demonetization will put only a temporary dent in corruption, if even that, and it may rock the entire economy.
2016-11-27.lead_paragraph: NEW DELHI — On Nov. 8, the Indian government announced an immediate ban on two major bills that account for the vast majority of all currency in circulation. Indians would have until the end of the year to change those notes for other bills, including newly minted ones.
2016-11-27.headline_main: In India, Black Money Makes for Bad Policy

2016-11-27.abstract: Who would any of us be if he hadn’t rearranged our destinies and caused this rupture in our lives?
2016-11-27.snippet: Who would any of us be if he hadn’t rearranged our destinies and caused this rupture in our lives?
2016-11-27.lead_paragraph: Oakland, Calif. — THE headline scrolled through the corner of my computer screen sometime after 10 on Friday night. Fidel Castro had died. It was news I’d been waiting to hear my entire life, and yet I hesitated.
2016-11-27.headline_main: The Little Fidel in All of Us

2016-11-28.snippet: Mr. Fillon, a former prime minister who pledged to limit immigration and control Islam, handily defeated Alain Juppé in a Republican Party runoff.
2016-11-28.lead_paragraph: PARIS — French voters chose a socially conservative, budget-cutting former prime minister on Sunday to lead the center-right Republican Party in next year’s presidential election. Once again, the outcome upset pollsters’ initial predictions, and it paved the way for a likely face-off with the country’s far-right party in 2017.
2016-11-28.headline_main: François Fillon Wins Center-Right Nomination for French Presidency

2016-11-28.abstract: A toxic political war over money, jobs and globalization killed the complex trade deal that was supposed to be a signature legacy of President Obama.

2016-11-28.abstract: Ratings are, once again, down across the board for NBC, ABC, CBS and Fox, but each network can make the claim that it has a new show with a strong pulse.

2016-11-28.abstract: The European Court of Justice will hear arguments that will most likely determine how the ride-sharing service can operate across the European Union.

2016-11-28.lead_paragraph: Ever since Uber showed up in Europe in late 2011, the American ride-booking service has faced vocal opposition.
2016-11-28.headline_main: In Europe, Is Uber a Transportation Service or a Digital Platform?

2016-11-28.abstract: A researcher who co-wrote a paper in the 1990s on a crucial artificial intelligence technique feels overlooked by today’s stars in the field.

2016-11-28.abstract: Lawmakers say they will try to force President Park Geun-hye out of office. Here is how the process works.
2016-11-28.snippet: Lawmakers say they will try to force President Park Geun-hye out of office. Here is how the process works.
2016-11-28.lead_paragraph: SEOUL, South Korea — South Korean lawmakers will vote on Friday on the impeachment of President Park Geun-hye, who is accused of helping a friend commit extortion. If she is forced from office, it will be a first for South Korea, but the process is long and uncertain. Here’s how it works.
2016-11-28.headline_main: South Korea’s Impeachment Process, Explained

2016-11-28.abstract: Mr. Weaver won a Tony for his role in Robert Marasco’s “Child’s Play” about the malevolent environment at an exclusive Roman Catholic school for boys.
2016-11-28.snippet: Mr. Weaver won a Tony for his role in Robert Marasco’s “Child’s Play” about the malevolent environment at an exclusive Roman Catholic school for boys.
2016-11-28.lead_paragraph: Fritz Weaver, a Tony Award-winning character actor who played a German Jewish doctor slain by the Nazis in the 1978 mini-series “Holocaust” and an Air Force colonel who becomes increasingly unstable as the nation faces a nuclear crisis in the 1964 movie “Fail Safe,”  died on Saturday at his home in Manhattan. He was 90.
2016-11-28.headline_main: Fritz Weaver, Tony-Winning Character Actor, Dies at 90

2016-11-28.snippet: The Chinese dominate the economy in Mandalay, Myanmar, a trading town known for dealing in minerals, timber and drugs.
2016-11-28.lead_paragraph: MANDALAY, Myanmar — From damp and drizzly London, the siren of British imperialism, Rudyard Kipling, wrote a poem that captured the palm trees, pagodas and temple bells of Burma during colonial rule.
2016-11-28.headline_main: Animosity in a Burmese Hub Deepens as Chinese Get Richer

2016-11-28.abstract: Ms. Oliveros also addressed the theme of gender inequality repeatedly and tenaciously.
2016-11-28.snippet: Ms. Oliveros also addressed the theme of gender inequality repeatedly and tenaciously.
2016-11-28.lead_paragraph: Pauline Oliveros, a composer whose life’s work aspired to enhance sensory perception through what she called “deep listening,” died on Thursday at her home in Kingston, N.Y. She was 84.
2016-11-28.headline_main: Pauline Oliveros, Composer Who Championed ‘Deep Listening,’ Dies at 84

2016-11-28.abstract: The country’s state-owned oil company, Pemex, is saddled with debt and struggling with production. As a Donald J. Trump presidency looms, fixing it is a top priority.
2016-11-28.snippet: The country’s state-owned oil company, Pemex, is saddled with debt and struggling with production. As a Donald J. Trump presidency looms, fixing it is a top priority.
2016-11-28.lead_paragraph: CIUDAD DEL CARMEN, Mexico — The town that oil built is emptying out.
2016-11-28.headline_main: Can Oil Help Mexico Withstand Trump’s Attack on Trade? It’s Hard to See How

2016-11-28.abstract: Shiffrin, who won her 10th consecutive World Cup slalom on Sunday, has ties to both sides of the United States.
2016-11-28.snippet: Shiffrin, who won her 10th consecutive World Cup slalom on Sunday, has ties to both sides of the United States.
2016-11-28.lead_paragraph: KILLINGTON, Vt. — Pauline Condron, the 95-year-old grandmother of the Olympic champion Mikaela Shiffrin, had never seen her 21-year-old granddaughter ski in a World Cup race until Sunday. Condron lives in western Massachusetts, and since 1991, skiing’s World Cup circuit had avoided the Eastern United States.
2016-11-28.headline_main: East or West, Hometown Favorite Mikaela Shiffrin Draws Cheers in World Cup Race

2016-11-28.abstract: A reporter born after her family was exiled from Cuba reflects on growing up in Miami, in Fidel Castro’s shadow.
2016-11-28.snippet: A reporter born after her family was exiled from Cuba reflects on growing up in Miami, in Fidel Castro’s shadow.
2016-11-28.lead_paragraph: MIAMI — I did not meet Fidel Castro in a history book like most American children. I met him in my house surrounded by “early exile” furniture, a term my mother favored. I bumped into him at the dining room table over a meal or in the living room while the grown-ups drank tumblers of whiskey or at the beach when my mother cursed him, toes in the sand, as she remembered Cuba’s idyllic beaches.
2016-11-28.headline_main: A Child Forged in Loss and Fury, in a City Far From Havana

2016-11-28.abstract: This week: when a text doesn’t mean what you think it means, stories of marine regurgitation, and a group of opera singers that no longer exists.
2016-11-28.snippet: This week: when a text doesn’t mean what you think it means, stories of marine regurgitation, and a group of opera singers that no longer exists.
2016-11-28.lead_paragraph: It’s one of the most commonly texted acronyms: “LOL.” In fact, from a collection of more than 44,000 text messages sent by teenagers in New York City, “LOL” came up about 5,000 times. It ostensibly means “laughing out loud” — or “lots of love” if you’re Winston Churchill — but a linguistics researcher from Columbia University challenges both of those meanings on this week’s episode of “Tell Me Something I Don’t Know.”
2016-11-28.headline_main: So Much More Than Laughing Out Loud

2016-11-28.abstract: Rural Ireland is the backdrop for this story of an unusual man named Pigeon and a woman dumped on his doorstep.
2016-11-28.snippet: Rural Ireland is the backdrop for this story of an unusual man named Pigeon and a woman dumped on his doorstep.
2016-11-28.lead_paragraph: The actor John Keating is a tall bag of bones with fright-wig hair and frightened-deer eyes, a look built for character parts. That he nabs the lead role in Laoisa Sexton’s “The Pigeon in the Taj Mahal” at the Irish Repertory Theater is reason enough to see it, even if the play’s protracted execution wears out the prickly charm of its premise.
2016-11-28.headline_main: Review: ‘The Pigeon in the Taj Mahal,’ With a Bride-to-Be and a Trailer Park

2016-11-28.abstract: Mr. Glass was nominated for an Emmy Award for supporting actor in 1982 for his performance on the series. He also played a mysterious preacher on “Firefly.”
2016-11-28.snippet: Mr. Glass was nominated for an Emmy Award for supporting actor in 1982 for his performance on the series. He also played a mysterious preacher on “Firefly.”
2016-11-28.lead_paragraph: Ron Glass, who portrayed Ron Harris, the dapper and intellectual detective on the ensemble television comedy series “Barney Miller” and who appeared in numerous television shows and films, died on Friday at his home in Los Angeles. He was 71.

One of their most popular players last season, Fitzpatrick may now be one of their least.
2016-11-28.headline_main: Ryan Fitzpatrick’s Steady Hand Is Upended in Jets’ Loss to the Patriots

2016-11-28.abstract: The police recently found a match for the fingerprints of a woman whose body was found in upstate New York. Then state troopers visited a man, now 65, who said he saw her leave with two “goons” one summer day.

2016-11-28.abstract: England’s Football Association announced an internal investigation into the claims after several former players came forward with accusations that they were molested as boys in youth programs.
2016-11-28.snippet: England’s Football Association announced an internal investigation into the claims after several former players came forward with accusations that they were molested as boys in youth programs.

2016-11-28.headline_main: Sexual Abuse Claims in English Youth Leagues Prompt Wider Inquiry by Authorities

2016-11-28.abstract: The suit, filed by two former detainees in C.I.A. secret prisons and the representative of a third who died in custody, centers on two psychologists.
2016-11-28.snippet: The suit, filed by two former detainees in C.I.A. secret prisons and the representative of a third who died in custody, centers on two psychologists.
2016-11-28.lead_paragraph: Nearly 15 years after the United States adopted a program to interrogate terrorism suspects using techniques now widely considered to be torture, no one involved in helping craft it has been held legally accountable. Even as President Obama acknowledged that the United States “tortured some folks,” his administration declined to prosecute any government officials.
2016-11-28.headline_main: Lawsuit Aims to Hold 2 Contractors Accountable for C.I.A. Torture

2016-11-28.abstract: It was fringe character week, as we left the main group behind entirely to spend an hour with Tara and Heath.

2016-11-28.lead_paragraph: It was fringe character week on “The Walking Dead” on Sunday, as we left the main group behind entirely to spend an hour watching Tara and Heath scavenge, frolic in a zombie sandbox and negotiate post-apocalypse morality.
2016-11-28.headline_main: ‘The Walking Dead’ Season 7, Episode 6: Hey Look, Another New Group!

2016-11-28.abstract: For all its comedic trappings, the finale traffics in a new level of heartbreak and honesty.
2016-11-28.snippet: For all its comedic trappings, the finale traffics in a new level of heartbreak and honesty.
2016-11-28.lead_paragraph: “I miss you,” Lawrence says over the phone to Issa toward the end of this week’s episode. This statement suggests that maybe Lawrence isn’t all that interested in the single life his friends introduce him to, full of easy sex, nights at gaudy strip clubs and a startling lack of empathy for the black women they take on as romantic partners. His phone call provides enough of a glimmer of hope to prompt Issa to leave Kelli’s birthday trip and travel home in the middle of the night. But their phone call proves to be more of a wistful goodbye than anything else, proving once again that, for all its comedic trappings, “Insecure” is far more brutal than it originally appeared.
2016-11-28.headline_main: ‘Insecure’ Season 1 Finale: Great Expectations

2016-11-28.abstract: “The Affair” got back to multistranded business as usual following its Noah-centric season premiere.

2016-11-28.headline_main: ‘The Affair’ Season 3, Episode 2: Helen, Alison and Furkat

2016-11-28.abstract: A new analysis of Google Books and The New York Times archives suggests that when things get bad, the words do, too.
2016-11-28.snippet: A new analysis of Google Books and The New York Times archives suggests that when things get bad, the words do, too.
2016-11-28.lead_paragraph: In the wake of the election, it’s clear American society is fractured. Negative emotions are running amok, and countless words of anger and frustration have been spilled. If you were to analyze this news outlet for the ratio of positive emotional words to negative ones, would you find a dip linked to the events of the past few weeks?
2016-11-28.headline_main: With Shifts in National Mood Come Shifts in Words We Use, Study Suggests

2016-11-28.abstract: After Juan Martín del Potro beat Marin Cilic to even the match, Federico Delbonis defeated Ivo Karlovic in straight sets.
2016-11-28.snippet: After Juan Martín del Potro beat Marin Cilic to even the match, Federico Delbonis defeated Ivo Karlovic in straight sets.
2016-11-28.lead_paragraph: Argentina won its first Davis Cup title on Sunday when Federico Delbonis beat Ivo Karlovic in straight sets to complete a stunning 3-2 comeback win over Croatia. It was Argentina’s fifth appearance in the final.
2016-11-28.headline_main: Argentina Rallies Against Croatia to Win First Davis Cup Title

2016-11-28.abstract: D.A. Pennebaker’s 1967 film of Bob Dylan on tour chronicles a poet in the making. And two HBO documentaries capture Cuba on the brink of change.
2016-11-28.snippet: D.A. Pennebaker’s 1967 film of Bob Dylan on tour chronicles a poet in the making. And two HBO documentaries capture Cuba on the brink of change.
2016-11-28.lead_paragraph: In “Dont Look Back,” D. A. Pennebaker captures a poet in the making as he follows Bob Dylan on tour. And just days after the death of Fidel Castro, two HBO documentaries capture Cuba on the brink of change.
2016-11-28.headline_main: What’s on TV Monday: Bob Dylan in ‘Dont Look Back’ and HBO Visits Cuba

2016-11-28.abstract: Juanita Castro, who fled Cuba decades ago and became a vocal critic of her brother’s regime, expressed disdain for those who rejoiced over his death.
2016-11-28.snippet: Juanita Castro, who fled Cuba decades ago and became a vocal critic of her brother’s regime, expressed disdain for those who rejoiced over his death.
2016-11-28.lead_paragraph: CORAL GABLES, Fla. — Juanita Castro considered her brother Fidel a traitor and had not spoken to him in 52 years, but, even so, she feels that a piece of her is missing now that he is dead.
2016-11-28.headline_main: Fidel Castro’s Sister, an Outspoken Critic, Takes No Joy in His Death

2016-11-28.abstract: We left Cuba and our extended family behind in 1980. Nothing can bring those lost years back.
2016-11-28.snippet: We left Cuba and our extended family behind in 1980. Nothing can bring those lost years back.
2016-11-28.lead_paragraph: Growing up, I’d break into a cold sweat anytime the rumor circulated that Fidel Castro was dead. To me that meant returning to the island that was supposed to be home, but that I barely remembered. “I don’t know anyone there,” I’d think. “Where will I go to school? Where will we live?”
2016-11-28.headline_main: What Castro’s Death Means for a Child of Mariel

2016-11-28.abstract: Maeve continues to move forward while everyone else moves inward.
2016-11-28.snippet: Maeve continues to move forward while everyone else moves inward.
2016-11-28.lead_paragraph: Among other things, “Westworld” is a metaphor for the act of creation — which, in essence, makes it a show about its own creation. We may have been promised the same thing as the guests: an Old West adventure, loaded with the sex and violence that we’ve come to expect from an HBO show. But the show has devoted itself to defying those expectations at every turn, by making pleasure another component to be analyzed, like a cold body on a slab. “Westworld” has a story to tell, but it’s also about storytelling, constantly forcing us to recognize the falseness of the stories that are given to us and the stories that we tell ourselves. Somewhere at the bottom of it all is the truth — “the center of the maze,” to use the show’s expression — but not even that feels like terra firma at this point. It could be just another rug for the show’s creators to pull.
2016-11-28.headline_main: ‘Westworld’ Season 1, Episode 9: You Broke My Mind
