2016-11-28.abstract: Mitch McConnell should help retirees who worked in a dangerous industry and deserve what was promised by contract.
2016-11-28.snippet: Mitch McConnell should help retirees who worked in a dangerous industry and deserve what was promised by contract.
2016-11-28.lead_paragraph: The troubled coal industry, which stirred such great political concern during the presidential campaign, is about to take on a decidedly human dimension in the Senate. A bipartisan push is underway there to rescue the failing pension and health benefits of thousands of retired union coal miners. Their benefit plans have become severely underfunded during the industry’s downturn, as coal companies declare bankruptcy and renege on obligations to workers at a time when there are fewer young miners to contribute support.
2016-11-28.headline_main: Retired Coal Miners Losing Their Safety Net

2016-11-28.abstract: The last thing the Pentagon would seem to need is more hackers. But Defense Department officials are inviting them in.
2016-11-28.snippet: The last thing the Pentagon would seem to need is more hackers. But Defense Department officials are inviting them in.
2016-11-28.lead_paragraph: In June 2015, the Office of Personnel Management announced that foreign hackers had stolen the personnel records of millions of federal employees, one of the most damaging cyberattacks in history. Just weeks later, the office of the Joint Chiefs of Staff shut down its unclassified email system for several days after officials detected that it had been breached.
2016-11-28.headline_main: Pentagon: Looking for a Few Good Hackers

2016-11-28.abstract: It’s not the money, it’s the incentives.
2016-11-28.snippet: It’s not the money, it’s the incentives.
2016-11-28.lead_paragraph: Remember all the news reports suggesting, without evidence, that the Clinton Foundation’s fund-raising created conflicts of interest? Well, now the man who benefited from all that innuendo is on his way to the White House. And he’s already giving us an object lesson in what real conflicts of interest look like, as authoritarian governments around the world shower favors on his business empire.
2016-11-28.headline_main: Why Corruption Matters

2016-11-28.abstract: Billions of dollars could result from an auction of public airwaves — money that could be invested to counter the decline in local journalism.
2016-11-28.snippet: Billions of dollars could result from an auction of public airwaves — money that could be invested to counter the decline in local journalism.
2016-11-28.lead_paragraph: With the demand for wireless broadband growing, the Federal Communications Commission is auctioning off a big chunk of the public airwaves. Billions of dollars are likely to change hands, a windfall that could transform local media across the country.

2016-11-28.abstract: Liberals and conservatives, on campus and off, have spent too much time in their own political bubbles.
2016-11-28.snippet: Liberals and conservatives, on campus and off, have spent too much time in their own political bubbles.
2016-11-28.lead_paragraph: The presidential election was the last thing on my mind on Nov. 8. I had essays to write and Italian vocabulary to learn. Sure, I kept New York Times and Wall Street Journal tabs open on my laptop, but I was uninterested in indulging in conversation about an election that most everyone could agree was a time bomb.

2016-11-28.abstract: Donald Trump and Congress want to repeal the Affordable Care Act, but they have no good ideas for replacing it.
2016-11-28.snippet: Donald Trump and Congress want to repeal the Affordable Care Act, but they have no good ideas for replacing it.
2016-11-28.lead_paragraph: What will happen if President-elect Donald Trump and Republicans in Congress carry out their pledge to repeal the Affordable Care Act, the 2010 health reform law? By most estimates,  up to 22 million people, many of them poor or older Americans, will lose their health insurance.

2016-11-28.abstract: Even as others deceive us, we deceive ourselves.
2016-11-28.snippet: Even as others deceive us, we deceive ourselves.
2016-11-28.lead_paragraph: Only a few days after the presidential election, the Oxford English Dictionary crowned its international word of the year: post-truth. The dictionary defined it as “relating to or denoting circumstances in which objective facts are less influential in shaping public opinion than appeals to emotion and personal belief.” To say that the term captured the zeitgeist of 2016 is a lexigraphical understatement. The word, the dictionary’s editors explained, had “gone from being a peripheral term to being a mainstay in political commentary.”
2016-11-28.headline_main: Fake News and the Internet Shell Game

2016-11-28.snippet: After almost being killed in New Jersey, a Guatemalan immigrant returned to his hometown to help provide jobs and training so people won’t have to leave.

We rarely hear about the immigrants who choose to go home voluntarily. Eduardo Jimenez is one such person.
2016-11-28.headline_main: Keeping Guatemalan Immigrants at Home

President-elect Trump said he could fix this problem by repealing Obamacare and replacing it with something better.

2016-11-28.abstract: I may miss the old disconnection of travel, but as a parent, I love staying in touch with my children as they go off adventuring.
2016-11-28.snippet: I may miss the old disconnection of travel, but as a parent, I love staying in touch with my children as they go off adventuring.
2016-11-28.lead_paragraph: I’m writing this from Madrid. I last visited this beautiful city during a 1970s year off from college; my boyfriend and I were on a long trip through Europe, the kind with backpacks, a tent and battered paperback books that you traded with other travelers when you finished reading them. Franco had died fairly recently, and Spain was in the midst of its first elections in decades. We had taken slow, unmodernized trains from Barcelona down south to Granada, then on to Seville and Cordoba. And when we got to Madrid, the first thing we did, of course, was head to American Express, where we exchanged our carefully stashed traveler’s checks and picked up our mail.
2016-11-28.headline_main: On the Road

2016-11-28.abstract: From the archives of The International Herald Tribune: The London “Times” newspaper is summoned by the Lord Chief Justice to state the detail of its circulation in November 1891.
2016-11-28.snippet: From the archives of The International Herald Tribune: The London “Times” newspaper is summoned by the Lord Chief Justice to state the detail of its circulation in November 1891.
2016-11-28.lead_paragraph: In the Queen’s Bench Division today, [Nov. 28] Mr. Lumley Smith appeared in the case of Romney v. Walter and another, in support of an appeal by the defendants, the proprietors of the Times newspaper, against an order in Chambers that they should give a better answer to an interrogatory as to the circulation of their newspaper by stating approximately what the circulation was on September 25, 1891. The defendants answered that the Times had a large and extensive circulation, but could not say the exact number without a troublesome and expensive inquiry from people having no interest in the matter.

The routine ends with simulated machine-gun fire and the woman, looking stunned and stricken, standing alone on the ice.
2016-11-28.headline_main: Holocaust-Themed Ice Dance in Russia Draws Condemnation

2016-11-28.abstract: A court thinks big to address poverty.
2016-11-28.snippet: A court thinks big to address poverty.
2016-11-28.lead_paragraph: As a family court judge in Flint, Michigan, I see poverty flood my courtroom in a vicious cycle of cases in dependency, delinquency, criminality, and then back to dependency. The mantra in family court is that no one should lose their kids because they’re poor. The sad reality is that this happens all too often when generational poverty creates what Nicholas Kristof calls a “broken class.”
2016-11-28.headline_main: A Baby Court Offers Hope for Families

2016-11-28.abstract: Leslie Bennetts’s “Last Girl Before Freeway” revisits milestones in Joan Rivers’s life, like her childhood, marriage and famous break with Johnny Carson.
2016-11-28.snippet: Leslie Bennetts’s “Last Girl Before Freeway” revisits milestones in Joan Rivers’s life, like her childhood, marriage and famous break with Johnny Carson.
2016-11-28.lead_paragraph: LAST GIRL BEFORE FREEWAYThe Life, Loves, Losses, and Liberation of Joan RiversBy Leslie BennettsIllustrated. 419 pp. Little, Brown & Company. $28.
2016-11-28.headline_main: A New Biography of Joan Rivers

2016-11-28.abstract: A man veered his car onto the sidewalk at the campus, leaped out, and stabbed several people with a butcher knife, law enforcement officials said.
2016-11-28.snippet: A man veered his car onto the sidewalk at the campus, leaped out, and stabbed several people with a butcher knife, law enforcement officials said.
2016-11-28.lead_paragraph: A student at Ohio State University intentionally rammed a car into pedestrians on a busy campus sidewalk on Monday morning and then began slashing passers-by with a butcher knife, the authorities said, injuring 11 students and faculty and staff members, and setting off panic at one of the nation’s largest public universities.
2016-11-28.headline_main: Suspect Is Killed in Attack at Ohio State University That Injured 11

2016-11-28.abstract: After decades of breakneck economic growth, the country’s wealth has ceased trickling down, bringing social mobility to a standstill.
2016-11-28.snippet: After decades of breakneck economic growth, the country’s wealth has ceased trickling down, bringing social mobility to a standstill.
2016-11-28.lead_paragraph: BEIJING — In the early 1980s, China’s top leader, Deng Xiaoping, is said to have issued his now-famous rallying cry in defense of a market economy. “Let some people get rich first,” he reportedly said, making the case that the Communist Party’s embrace of a freer market would generate new wealth that would eventually spread to all strata of society.
2016-11-28.headline_main: Stuck at the Bottom in China

2016-11-28.abstract: Troops loyal to President Bashar al-Assad drove rebels out of parts of the city, sending thousands of people fleeing for their lives.
2016-11-28.snippet: Troops loyal to President Bashar al-Assad drove rebels out of parts of the city, sending thousands of people fleeing for their lives.
2016-11-28.lead_paragraph: BEIRUT, Lebanon — Thousands of people were sent fleeing for their lives on Monday as rebel fighters lost a large stretch of territory to government forces in the northern Syrian city of Aleppo, in what could prove to be a turning point in the conflict, both militarily and psychologically.
2016-11-28.headline_main: Thousands Flee Aleppo, Syria, as Government Forces Advance

2016-11-28.abstract: Our country’s adolescent democracy needs the support of America — and its new president, the foreign minister of Ukraine writes.
2016-11-28.snippet: Our country’s adolescent democracy needs the support of America — and its new president, the foreign minister of Ukraine writes.
2016-11-28.lead_paragraph: KIEV, Ukraine — In the two years since the Revolution of Dignity, Ukraine has made more progress as a country than it had since declaring independence in 1991. We are finally tackling corruption in a meaningful way, and we have introduced a raft of reforms that will help the state to function better. After our economy contracted for two consecutive years, we now expect to see it grow again. And we have achieved all of this under the most challenging of circumstances: while fighting a Russian-led war that has cost thousands of lives, and with a Russian occupation of the Crimean peninsula and the Donbas region crippling our economy.
2016-11-28.headline_main: Ukraine Has Made Great Progress, but We Need Our Allies

2016-11-28.abstract: Koen Olthuis has built more than 200 floating homes and offices, and says the concept is a solution to rising sea levels.
2016-11-28.snippet: Koen Olthuis has built more than 200 floating homes and offices, and says the concept is a solution to rising sea levels.
2016-11-28.lead_paragraph: RIJSWIJK, The Netherlands — Early next year when a converted cargo container on a floating foundation of plastic bottles opens on the flood-prone shores of Korail Bosti, Bangladesh’s largest slum, few of its users are likely to celebrate the 320-square-foot space as a revolution. Yet, according to Koen Olthuis, the lead architect on the project, it is part of the greatest transformation in urbanism since Elisha Otis built the safety brake that gave rise to the modern elevator, skyscrapers and ultimately urban density.
2016-11-28.headline_main: A Dutch Architect Offshores the Future of Housing

2016-11-28.abstract: It’s O.K. to stop and catch your breath. We’re still here for you, recipes in tow.
2016-11-28.snippet: It’s O.K. to stop and catch your breath. We’re still here for you, recipes in tow.
2016-11-28.lead_paragraph: Sam Sifton emails readers of Cooking five days a week to talk about food and suggest recipes. That email also appears here. To receive it in your inbox, register here.
2016-11-28.headline_main: Take a Break

2016-11-28.abstract: In an exciting television doubleheader on Thursday night, the Rockets visit the Warriors after the Clippers visit the Cavaliers.
2016-11-28.snippet: In an exciting television doubleheader on Thursday night, the Rockets visit the Warriors after the Clippers visit the Cavaliers.
2016-11-28.lead_paragraph: The first full month of N.B.A. action will end this week. As if to celebrate, the league has given us a schedule filled to the brim with good games. I want to spend some extra time talking about them, and to point out an exciting statistic that suggests the improved quality of basketball throughout the league.
2016-11-28.headline_main: N.B.A. Schedule: Here’s What to Watch This Week

2016-11-28.abstract: Trying to keep up with the Joneses, when the Joneses’ real finances are unknown, is unwise, a financial planner reminds us.
2016-11-28.snippet: Trying to keep up with the Joneses, when the Joneses’ real finances are unknown, is unwise, a financial planner reminds us.
2016-11-28.lead_paragraph: You know what’s worse than judging a book by its cover? Judging a book by its cover, and then making financial decisions based on what you assume the book might tell you.
2016-11-28.headline_main: Stop Spending Based on Other People’s Wealth

2016-11-28.abstract: These Thai-style clams are made in a broth that is sweet, salty, sour and herbaceous.
2016-11-28.snippet: These Thai-style clams are made in a broth that is sweet, salty, sour and herbaceous.
2016-11-28.lead_paragraph: After the feasting — or between feasts, at any rate — there is solace and sanity in a bowl of soup. This has long been my strategy for counteracting the annual bouts of overindulgence and aiming once again for moderation in all things, edible and otherwise.
2016-11-28.headline_main: When It Comes to Clams, the More Broth, the Better

2016-11-28.abstract: The award-winning author, most recently of “Americanah,” is now the face of No7, the makeup brand owned by the pharmacy chain Boots.
2016-11-28.snippet: The award-winning author, most recently of “Americanah,” is now the face of No7, the makeup brand owned by the pharmacy chain Boots.
2016-11-28.lead_paragraph: Perhaps the most unexpected fashion icon of the year has just added another glossy credit to her name. Chimamanda Ngozi Adichie, the Nigerian-born novelist and feminist known for novels like “Americanah” and “Purple Hibiscus”; recipient of a MacArthur “genius” grant, the O. Henry Prize and the National Book Critics Circle Award (among others); and author of a viral TED Talk, “We Should All Be Feminists,” which has been viewed over three million times since its delivery in 2012 as well as sampled by Beyoncé, is now the face of No7, the makeup brand owned by the pharmacy chain Boots.
2016-11-28.headline_main: Chimamanda Ngozi Adichie Talks Beauty, Femininity and Feminism

2016-11-28.abstract: The ride-hailing service goes to court Tuesday to explain why it is a digital platform that would not be as heavily regulated as a traditional taxi service.
2016-11-28.snippet: The ride-hailing service goes to court Tuesday to explain why it is a digital platform that would not be as heavily regulated as a traditional taxi service.
2016-11-28.lead_paragraph: Uber abandoned its land war in China. Can it win a legal fight in Europe?
2016-11-28.headline_main: Daily Report: Uber Wants to Avoid ‘Transportation’ Label in Europe

2016-11-28.abstract: Gmail attempts to make life easier by scanning your messages and reminding you of pending events, but you can pick what you want to be nagged about.
2016-11-28.snippet: Gmail attempts to make life easier by scanning your messages and reminding you of pending events, but you can pick what you want to be nagged about.
2016-11-28.lead_paragraph: Q. This week my smartphone received an alert from Google listing the balances due on my credit cards. My response was “never” do it again, but I have to wonder about my personal financial/identity security. How did they get this information? Is it legal?
2016-11-28.headline_main: How Google Knows When Your Bills Are Due

2016-11-28.abstract: The Grammy Award-winning, melismatic-voiced music icon, whose new reality series, “Mariah’s World,” airs on E!, sketched her answers with a Pilot fountain pen in her kitchen.

2016-11-28.snippet: A reader offers his ideas, including public-private partnerships, community service projects and drafting young adults into national service.
2016-11-28.lead_paragraph: To the Editor:

2016-11-28.snippet: Alex Padilla, the secretary of state in California, replied to Mr. Trump’s allegation on Twitter, saying claims of “voter fraud in California and elsewhere are absurd.”
2016-11-28.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES — When President-elect Donald J. Trump claimed on Twitter that he was losing the popular vote because of major fraud by millions of voters, one of the states he pointed to was California, where the latest voting returns showed Hillary Clinton, the Democrat, crushing Mr. Trump.
2016-11-28.headline_main: California Official Says Trump’s Claim of Voter Fraud Is ‘Absurd’

2016-11-28.snippet: Flavorful pancetta and crispy fried eggs make this spinach salad a meal all by itself.

2016-11-28.snippet: This hearty main course salad pairs mature spinach — not baby leaves — with rich adornments.
2016-11-28.lead_paragraph: When boxes of washed baby spinach first hit the stores so many years ago, my intake of the iron-rich vegetable soared.
2016-11-28.headline_main: A Warm Spinach Salad, Wearing Pancetta and Egg

2016-11-28.abstract: The painting’s owners, Henry and Hertha Bromberg, sold the work in Paris in 1938 as they fled Nazi Germany; it was returned to their grandchildren.
2016-11-28.snippet: The painting’s owners, Henry and Hertha Bromberg, sold the work in Paris in 1938 as they fled Nazi Germany; it was returned to their grandchildren.
2016-11-28.lead_paragraph: PARIS — France on Monday officially returned a 16th-century portrait, attributed to Joos van Cleve or his son, to the descendants of Hertha and Henry Bromberg, a German-Jewish couple who were forced to sell the work of art in Paris when they fled Germany before World War II.
2016-11-28.headline_main: France Returns 16th-Century Portrait to Descendants of Jewish Couple

2016-11-28.abstract: At an energized conservative legal gathering, Justice Samuel A. Alito Jr. suggested that only resolve on the right could rescue free speech, religious liberty and gun rights.
2016-11-28.snippet: At an energized conservative legal gathering, Justice Samuel A. Alito Jr. suggested that only resolve on the right could rescue free speech, religious liberty and gun rights.
2016-11-28.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — A week after the presidential election, the leaders of the conservative legal movement gathered here for the annual convention of the Federalist Society. The mood was by turns somber and giddy.
2016-11-28.headline_main: Supreme Court Agenda in the Trump Era? A Justice Seems to Supply One

2016-11-28.abstract: These truffles pair coffee and chocolate deliciously.
2016-11-28.snippet: These truffles pair coffee and chocolate deliciously.
2016-11-28.lead_paragraph: Coffee and chocolate are a delicious pairing, as evidenced by this small box of truffles made by Delysia Chocolatier in Austin, Tex., using coffee from King’s Row in Hanover, N.H. King’s Row coffees come in blends devised by Craig Shelton, a James Beard Award winner who was the chef at the Ryland Inn in Whitehouse Station, N.J. The truffles have three flavors: dark chocolate with rum and orange; dark chocolate spiced with African seasonings; and milk chocolate, creamy and sweet, like Vietnamese iced coffee: Coffee Truffles by Delysia and King’s Row Coffee, $24 for a box of nine, kingsrowcoffee.com/confections.
2016-11-28.headline_main: Chocolate With a Buzz

2016-11-28.abstract: What began as a student effort at a lab in Seattle produced a test for chronic myeloid leukemia that works with a few spots of dried blood on a paper card.
2016-11-28.snippet: What began as a student effort at a lab in Seattle produced a test for chronic myeloid leukemia that works with a few spots of dried blood on a paper card.
2016-11-28.lead_paragraph: A rare but treatable form of cancer can now be diagnosed cheaply and easily with dried blood spots instead of whole blood, scientists in Seattle announced last week.
2016-11-28.headline_main: Summer Project Turns Into Leukemia Testing Breakthrough

2016-11-28.abstract: Advisors to President-elect Trump see little merit in NASA emphasizing “Earth-centric” science.
2016-11-28.snippet: Advisors to President-elect Trump see little merit in NASA emphasizing “Earth-centric” science.
2016-11-28.lead_paragraph: Update | Here’s my ProPublica article on NASA and President-elect Trump’s advisors.
2016-11-28.headline_main: Under Trump, Will NASA’s Space Science Include Planet Earth?

2016-11-28.abstract: “The Oxford Companion to Cheese” covers history, regional styles, local purveyors and more.
2016-11-28.snippet: “The Oxford Companion to Cheese” covers history, regional styles, local purveyors and more.
2016-11-28.lead_paragraph: This new guide to cheese from Oxford University Press is authoritative, but what is surprising is how local it gets. Calandra’s Cheese on Arthur Avenue in the Bronx is listed, along with such revered fromageries as Androuet in Paris. And just to show how American cheesemakers are at the forefront of the artisanal resurgence, the book was edited by Catherine Donnelly, a professor of nutrition and food science at the University of Vermont, with a foreword by Mateo Kehler, a founder of Jasper Hill Farm in Vermont. Hundreds of writers from 35 countries contributed to this 888-page doorstop of a reference book, with entries arranged alphabetically and covering topics like regulations, techniques, history, cuisines, types of rinds, Mexican cheeses (there are some 60 varieties), Chinese cheeses and cheese museums: “The Oxford Companion to Cheese,” edited by Catherine Donnelly (Oxford, $65).
2016-11-28.headline_main: For the Cheese Lover, the Ultimate Reference Book

2016-11-28.abstract: The freshly made loaves now ship nationwide.
2016-11-28.snippet: The freshly made loaves now ship nationwide.
2016-11-28.lead_paragraph: The bakery adjacent to Manresa, the acclaimed restaurant in Los Gatos, Calif., specializes in grain-to-flour breads. The flour is milled on-site the same day it’s used for whole wheat, sourdough and dense pumpernickel-buckwheat-rye breads, in addition to rounds stippled with fruit and nuts and an airy Pullman loaf. These breads are now shipped fresh nationwide. Warm them for 10 minutes in a 300-degree oven before serving: Manresa Bread, starting at $40 for four loaves with two-day shipping, manresabread.com.
2016-11-28.headline_main: Manresa’s Bread Without a Trip to California

2016-11-28.abstract: The private museum will leave Wynwood, in Miami, for the Allapattah district; Annabelle Selldorf’s architecture firm will design the new space.
2016-11-28.snippet: The private museum will leave Wynwood, in Miami, for the Allapattah district; Annabelle Selldorf’s architecture firm will design the new space.
2016-11-28.lead_paragraph: After 23 years in Miami’s Wynwood district, in 2018 the Rubell Family Collection will move to a new museum designed by Selldorf Architects, on a 2.5-acre campus in Miami’s Allapattah District, the family announced on Monday.
2016-11-28.headline_main: Rubell Family Collection Makes a Move

2016-11-28.abstract: This Berkshire pork roast from a San Francisco butcher is a fragrant, delectable dish for a celebration.
2016-11-28.snippet: This Berkshire pork roast from a San Francisco butcher is a fragrant, delectable dish for a celebration.
2016-11-28.lead_paragraph: This ready-to-roast porchetta, a boneless, rolled and seasoned piece of lean pork swaddled in pork belly, comes from a third-generation butcher, Thomas Odermatt, whose RoliRoti porchetta sandwich regularly sells out at the Ferry Plaza market in San Francisco. Mr. Odermatt, whose heritage is Swiss, ships his Berkshire pork frozen. Let it thaw for a day or so in the refrigerator, and you’ll be ready to go, with a hefty roast that emerges from the oven crackling, bronzed and succulent. The stunning centerpiece is certain to impress your holiday guests, and as it cooks, it will surely perfume your kitchen like nobody’s business: RoliRoti porchetta, $150 for five to six pounds, shipped frozen, 718-389-0985, heritagefoodsusa.com.
2016-11-28.headline_main: Porchetta as a Holiday Centerpiece

2016-11-28.abstract: If divestment or a blind trust does not solve the issue, Congress could approve actions in advance, adding transparency.
2016-11-28.snippet: If divestment or a blind trust does not solve the issue, Congress could approve actions in advance, adding transparency.
2016-11-28.lead_paragraph: The election of a billionaire businessman as president has created a host of extreme challenges, not the least of which is how Donald J. Trump will govern while dealing with the web of real estate and other investments he has built up over a long career.
2016-11-28.headline_main: Congress May Hold Key to Handling Trump’s Conflicts of Interest

2016-11-28.abstract: Tastings, cooking demonstrations and hundreds of products greet shoppers at this pop-up sale.
2016-11-28.snippet: Tastings, cooking demonstrations and hundreds of products greet shoppers at this pop-up sale.
2016-11-28.lead_paragraph: The products Amanda Hesser, left, and Merrill Stubbs offer on their Food52 website combine practicality with the kind of tasteful style that whispers “heirloom.” The kitchen and household goods are often exclusive to their company. For the holidays, the founders are flinging open the doors of their Manhattan offices and test kitchens for shoppers to peruse and purchase from hundreds of products. There will be tastings, cooking demonstrations, cocktails and snacks. Shipping will be free: Food52 Holiday Market, Friday to Sunday, noon to 8 p.m., 122 West 26th Street, eighth floor, food52.com.
2016-11-28.headline_main: A Holiday Market in the Kitchens of Food52

2016-11-28.abstract: The chef José Andrés is importing ajo morado, a milder garlic for gazpacho.
2016-11-28.snippet: The chef José Andrés is importing ajo morado, a milder garlic for gazpacho.
2016-11-28.lead_paragraph: The city of Cuenca is the heart of central Spain’s garlic-growing region, providing an essential ingredient for dishes like gazpacho and garlic shrimp. Ajo morado, cultivated in the region, is the garlic of connoisseurs. It has plump bulbs holding clusters of purplish cloves with a distinctive flavor: less sharp, with an almost citrusy complexity. It is now being imported by the chef José Andrés: Ajo morado from José Andrés Foods, $6.95 for four bulbs, tienda.com.
2016-11-28.headline_main: Purple Garlic From the Heart of Spain

2016-11-28.abstract: The veteran outfielder and three-time All-Star is a tireless worker for charities and youth programs in the Chicago area, where he grew up, and in New York.
2016-11-28.snippet: The veteran outfielder and three-time All-Star is a tireless worker for charities and youth programs in the Chicago area, where he grew up, and in New York.
2016-11-28.lead_paragraph: CHICAGO — Curtis Granderson, a very professional outfielder, gives me a walking tour of his old haunts at the University of Illinois at Chicago. He points out the baseball stadium with a backdrop of the soaring downtown skyline, and two new Little League fields with artificial turf and light towers.
2016-11-28.headline_main: Curtis Granderson Is a Man on a Generous Mission

2016-11-28.snippet: The discovery of a headless corpse in the Netherlands helped Belgium and its bigger Dutch neighbor resolve a property squabble that began in 1961.
2016-11-28.lead_paragraph: From Cyprus to Ukraine, Israel to the Balkans, conflicts over land have long turned bloody. But on Monday, the Netherlands and Belgium managed to settle a festering territorial problem, without firing a single bullet and with an unlikely spur: a headless corpse.

2016-11-28.lead_paragraph: The semiretired guitarist Eric Clapton, now 71, has settled upon a slate of live shows for 2017: two at Madison Square Garden in New York on March 19 and 20, and two at the Forum in Los Angeles on March 25 and 26. And that’s all, according to an announcement on Monday.
2016-11-28.headline_main: Despite His Own Protests, Eric Clapton Will Return to the Road, Briefly

2016-11-28.abstract: The bid by Edgar Bronfman Jr. and Len Blavatnik carried a 30 percent premium, and many shareholders might be glad to get out of a fading investment.

2016-11-28.lead_paragraph: Airbnb, the peer-to-peer accommodations site where travelers book everything from single rooms to entire villas, has spent the last couple of years branching out. It has teamed up with airlines like Delta and Virgin America to give miles to travelers who book stays. And it has teamed up with travel management companies including American Express Global Business Travel on its Airbnb for Business program, which includes homes with business essentials such as Wi-Fi and laptop-friendly work spaces.

2016-11-28.abstract: An English businessman who saw the low-key city of La Paz as an international second home destination says the going has not been easy.
2016-11-28.snippet: An English businessman who saw the low-key city of La Paz as an international second home destination says the going has not been easy.
2016-11-28.lead_paragraph: LA PAZ, Mexico — Jeffrey Curtiss’s obsession is a collection of 23 luxury condominiums on a secluded beach in La Paz, the old Mexican city on the Sea of Cortez. For 11 years Mr. Curtiss, who made his fortune in the trading and distribution business in Britain, has been building and marketing the project, Playa de La Paz, hoping to attract the type of high-end international home buyers who have traditionally bypassed La Paz. A first-time developer, he pored over every detail of the project and lived on site during construction, only to face the global economic crisis, Mexico’s drugs wars and countless construction delays.
2016-11-28.headline_main: A Resort Development Saga in Mexico

2016-11-28.lead_paragraph: Do one thing — and do it right. That’s the mind-set shared by the Parsons graduates Paloma Canut and Ana Marroquín, both from Madrid, who bonded over a love of shirts, and a frustration at not being able to find a high-quality one at a reasonable price point. So, when they decided to start their own line, Sunad, they knew exactly where to start.

2016-11-28.lead_paragraph: BERLIN — Bar Convent Berlin, a sprawling trade show held in October in a former train station here, heralded every sort of spirit. There was a booth pouring a new German gin. There was a stand mixing daiquiris with rum from Cuba. Nearby was a new German gin. Around the corner, a Campari bar was handing out Negronis. Further down the aisle was a new German gin.
2016-11-28.headline_main: Beyond Beer: Germany Goes All In for Gin

2016-11-28.abstract: After the murder of Chico Mendes in 1988, a new brand of green governance developed on Brazil’s rain forest frontier, but political instability poses fresh threats.
2016-11-28.snippet: After the murder of Chico Mendes in 1988, a new brand of green governance developed on Brazil’s rain forest frontier, but political instability poses fresh threats.
2016-11-28.lead_paragraph: I was happy to see this fresh Retro Report production on the legacy of Chico Mendes, the Brazilian rain forest defender who was slain by a ranching family in December, 1988 as land conflicts followed road building in the depths of the Amazon. Retro Report is an innovative journalism project revisiting stories long after the headlines have flowed by. The resulting videos provide an invaluable learning tool for students of all ages interested in media cycles and keeping an eye on what’s real. As I wrote a few days ago, such efforts are more important than ever given the fact-free nature of so much online discourse.
2016-11-28.headline_main: What Changed, and Didn’t, After the 1988 Slaying of a Rain Forest Hero in Brazil

2016-11-28.lead_paragraph: “Attention,” which comes near the end of “Starboy,” the new album by the Weeknd, traverses one of his most familiar subjects: psychological antagonism pegged to sexual dominance. Or maybe it’s sexual antagonism pegged to psychological dominance. Either way. “Only thing left is the sex now,” he sings with what sounds like resignation until a couple of lines later, when he adds, “Only see me on the TV or the bed now.” He’s too busy to be sorry.

2016-11-29.lead_paragraph: Back in January, Juan Martín del Potro was ranked No. 1,041 and Maria Sharapova had just reached the quarterfinals of another Australian Open, with all of her sponsors in tow.
2016-11-29.headline_main: In Year of Bright and Bleak Spots, Room for Surprise in Tennis

2016-11-29.abstract: Consider hiring a corporate monitor, an independent overseer who will issue regular public reports about any possible instances of conflicts. We have just the person for you.

2016-11-29.abstract: The announcement angered the movement’s Saudi-backed rivals and threatened diplomatic efforts to end a conflict that has ravaged Yemen for nearly two years.
2016-11-29.snippet: The announcement angered the movement’s Saudi-backed rivals and threatened diplomatic efforts to end a conflict that has ravaged Yemen for nearly two years.
2016-11-29.lead_paragraph: SANA, Yemen — The Houthi movement and its allies formed a new government in Yemen on Monday, a surprise that angered their Saudi-backed rivals and complicated United Nations efforts to end a conflict that has ravaged the Arab world’s poorest country for much of the past two years.
2016-11-29.headline_main: Houthis, in Surprise Move, Form a Government in Yemen

2016-11-29.abstract: Offering 60 channels for $35 a month, the service will compete with Sling TV, PlayStation Vue and others to lure viewers away from cable television packages.
2016-11-29.snippet: Offering 60 channels for $35 a month, the service will compete with Sling TV, PlayStation Vue and others to lure viewers away from cable television packages.
2016-11-29.lead_paragraph: AT&T unveiled a streaming television service on Monday aimed at the millions of Americans who have broadband internet but no bundled TV package, offering an extensive list of channels for less than most cable plans.
2016-11-29.headline_main: AT&T Appeals to Cord-Cutters With DirecTV Now, a New Streaming Service

2016-11-29.abstract: There are many reasons Donald J. Trump’s claim doesn’t withstand scrutiny.
2016-11-29.snippet: There are many reasons Donald J. Trump’s claim doesn’t withstand scrutiny.
2016-11-29.lead_paragraph: Donald J. Trump continues to say that there were millions of illegal votes in the November election, costing him a popular-vote victory. We’re resurfacing an Upshot article from November that debunked the claim.
2016-11-29.headline_main: Trump’s Claim of Millions of Illegal Votes? There’s Simply No Evidence

2016-11-29.abstract: A long and frustrating recovery has given way to a burst of scoring from Cammalleri, who has helped the Devils hold their own in the absence of Taylor Hall.
2016-11-29.snippet: A long and frustrating recovery has given way to a burst of scoring from Cammalleri, who has helped the Devils hold their own in the absence of Taylor Hall.
2016-11-29.lead_paragraph: NEWARK — Besides the fact that Devils forward Mike Cammalleri could not grip a hockey stick with his injured right hand, he looked and felt completely normal, and that just made everything worse.
2016-11-29.headline_main: Back From Injury, Devils’ Mike Cammalleri Fills Hole on Offense

2016-11-29.abstract: The six-term Republican congressman from Georgia has led opposition to the Affordable Care Act.
2016-11-29.snippet: The six-term Republican congressman from Georgia has led opposition to the Affordable Care Act.
2016-11-29.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — If President-elect Donald J. Trump wanted a cabinet secretary who could help him dismantle and replace President Obama’s health care law, he could not have found anyone more prepared than Representative Tom Price, who has been studying how to accomplish that goal for more than six years.
2016-11-29.headline_main: Tom Price, Obamacare Critic, Is Trump’s Choice for Health Secretary

2016-11-29.abstract: Mr. Issa defeated Doug Applegate, a retired Marine colonel, to retain his seat after his first truly competitive race in more than 15 years.
2016-11-29.snippet: Mr. Issa defeated Doug Applegate, a retired Marine colonel, to retain his seat after his first truly competitive race in more than 15 years.
2016-11-29.lead_paragraph: Representative Darrell Issa, a well-known Obama administration tormentor, has narrowly won re-election to his Southern California congressional seat.
2016-11-29.headline_main: Darrell Issa Narrowly Wins Re-election in California

2016-11-29.abstract: In Wisconsin, elections officials said on Monday that a recount of the state’s nearly three million votes would most likely begin on Thursday.
2016-11-29.snippet: In Wisconsin, elections officials said on Monday that a recount of the state’s nearly three million votes would most likely begin on Thursday.
2016-11-29.lead_paragraph: President-elect Donald J. Trump is well into filling out his cabinet and picking key advisers. But a move to challenge the vote tallies in three swing states — an extreme long shot to reverse his Electoral College majority — is advancing in the background, creating a noisy distraction on Mr. Trump’s Twitter feed and raising last-ditch hopes of some Hillary Clinton supporters.
2016-11-29.headline_main: Vote Recount Push Advances, but Reversing Trump’s Win Is Unlikely

2016-11-29.abstract: If the Syrian president defeats the rebels, he may preside over an economic wasteland hampered by a low-level insurgency and facing a challenge to find financial aid to rebuild.
2016-11-29.snippet: If the Syrian president defeats the rebels, he may preside over an economic wasteland hampered by a low-level insurgency and facing a challenge to find financial aid to rebuild.
2016-11-29.lead_paragraph: BEIRUT, Lebanon — With the Syrian government making large territorial gains in Aleppo on Monday, routing rebel fighters and sending thousands of people fleeing for their lives, President Bashar al-Assad is starting to look as if he may survive the uprising, even in the estimation of some of his staunchest opponents.
2016-11-29.headline_main: For Bashar al-Assad, Winning the Syrian War May Lead to New Troubles

2016-11-29.abstract: Congress will vote this week on a measure that is the product of years of debate over health care policy issues, including the unwieldy mental health care system and opioid abuse.
2016-11-29.snippet: Congress will vote this week on a measure that is the product of years of debate over health care policy issues, including the unwieldy mental health care system and opioid abuse.
2016-11-29.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — In one of the most sweeping and rare bipartisan acts of this Congress, lawmakers will move this week on a $6.3 billion bill to increase funding for research into cancer and other diseases, address problems in the nation’s mental health systems and enact potentially far-reaching regulatory changes for drugs and medical devices.
2016-11-29.headline_main: $6.3 Billion Measure Aims to Cure Ailing Health Care Policies

2016-11-29.abstract: Ms. Conway’s criticism of Mitt Romney was expected to draw fury from President-elect Donald J. Trump. But she is not a typical aide.
2016-11-29.snippet: Ms. Conway’s criticism of Mitt Romney was expected to draw fury from President-elect Donald J. Trump. But she is not a typical aide.
2016-11-29.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Kellyanne Conway, one of President-elect Donald J. Trump’s senior advisers, was about to board a flight back to New York on Monday morning when she caught a glimpse of the headline crawling across television screens in the terminal.
2016-11-29.headline_main: Challenging the Boss in Public? For Kellyanne Conway, It’s Part of the Job

2016-11-29.abstract: ESPN pays $1.9 billion annually for its N.F.L. rights, nearly twice what NBC shells out, but “Monday Night Football” is not the powerhouse it once was.
2016-11-29.snippet: ESPN pays $1.9 billion annually for its N.F.L. rights, nearly twice what NBC shells out, but “Monday Night Football” is not the powerhouse it once was.
2016-11-29.lead_paragraph: With ESPN’s “Monday Night Football” viewership still falling after the presidential election, I began to think about what it meant to be the network that pays, by far, the most for its N.F.L. rights.
2016-11-29.headline_main: ESPN Pays Top Dollar for Football, but Audience Isn’t Buying

2016-11-29.abstract: Bitter feelings about the dictator persist in Union City, N.J., where the once large population of Cuban immigrants has dwindled.
2016-11-29.snippet: Bitter feelings about the dictator persist in Union City, N.J., where the once large population of Cuban immigrants has dwindled.
2016-11-29.lead_paragraph: UNION CITY, N.J. — Along Bergenline Avenue, the once-elegant Cuban commercial strip in this working-class town, the mood on Monday was subdued. But the bitterness toward Fidel Castro, the Cuban dictator who died over the weekend, remained.
2016-11-29.headline_main: In ‘Havana on the Hudson,’ Few Are Left to Celebrate Fidel Castro’s Death

2016-11-29.abstract: Well-known artists staged an orderly protest outside the Puck Building, where Ivanka Trump resides, expressing objections to her father’s policies.
2016-11-29.snippet: Well-known artists staged an orderly protest outside the Puck Building, where Ivanka Trump resides, expressing objections to her father’s policies.
2016-11-29.lead_paragraph: The contemporary art world in New York is not known for its political cohesion or conviction, at least in recent years. But more than 150 artists, curators and gallery workers turned out Monday night to march in front of a Downtown Manhattan building where Ivanka Trump, the future first daughter, has an apartment and is believed to keep some pieces of a notable contemporary collection.
2016-11-29.headline_main: Artists Lay Their Fears at Ivanka Trump’s Door

2016-11-29.abstract: The South Korean electronics giant may create a holding company structure after an American hedge fund called for the company to shake up its operations.
2016-11-29.snippet: The South Korean electronics giant may create a holding company structure after an American hedge fund called for the company to shake up its operations.

2016-11-29.abstract: Jacob Stulberg feeds our puzzle craving.
2016-11-29.snippet: Jacob Stulberg feeds our puzzle craving.
2016-11-29.lead_paragraph: TUESDAY PUZZLE — This is the time of year when it seems almost impossible to get away from food. Personally, I don’t have a problem with that, being one of those people who not only subsists on the stuff, but who revels in it.
2016-11-29.headline_main: Classic Kitchen Volume

2016-11-29.abstract: Mr. Taimanov was a classical pianist and former Soviet chess champion whose lopsided loss to Bobby Fischer in 1971 cost him his government salary.
2016-11-29.snippet: Mr. Taimanov was a classical pianist and former Soviet chess champion whose lopsided loss to Bobby Fischer in 1971 cost him his government salary.
2016-11-29.lead_paragraph: Mark Taimanov, a virtuoso pianist and former Soviet chess champion whose lopsided loss to Bobby Fischer in 1971 in the quarterfinals of a major chess tournament cost him his government salary, died on Monday in St. Petersburg, Russia. He was 90.
2016-11-29.headline_main: Mark Taimanov, World-Class Chess and Piano Player, Dies at 90

2016-11-29.abstract: Mr. Esposito met Elvis Presley when they were serving in the Army on a base in Germany and went on to be a friend and personal organizer.
2016-11-29.snippet: Mr. Esposito met Elvis Presley when they were serving in the Army on a base in Germany and went on to be a friend and personal organizer.
2016-11-29.lead_paragraph: Joe Esposito, who was Elvis Presley’s right-hand man, close friend and road manager for nearly two decades, died on Wednesday at his home in Calabasas, Calif. He was 78.

2016-11-29.abstract: Mr. Hamilton, whose soft dreamy style defined his photographs fashion and advertising assignments in the 1960s, was the target of rape allegations.
2016-11-29.snippet: Mr. Hamilton, whose soft dreamy style defined his photographs fashion and advertising assignments in the 1960s, was the target of rape allegations.
2016-11-29.lead_paragraph: David Hamilton, the British photographer whose diaphanous images of prepubescent girls blurred the line between art and pornography, was found dead on Friday in his Paris apartment, one week after a former model accused him of raping her in 1987 when she was 13.
2016-11-29.headline_main: David Hamilton, Photographer Known for Nude Images of Girls, Dies at 83

2016-11-29.abstract: Derrick Rose finished with 30 points, but his Oklahoma City counterpart, Russell Westbrook, had 27 in recording his eighth triple-double of the season.
2016-11-29.snippet: Derrick Rose finished with 30 points, but his Oklahoma City counterpart, Russell Westbrook, had 27 in recording his eighth triple-double of the season.
2016-11-29.lead_paragraph: As each Knick took his turn to talk, it became an exercise unto itself. The Knicks had been defeated, soundly, by the Oklahoma City Thunder, 112-103, at Madison Square Garden on Monday night. It was a loss in which the Knicks lacked cohesion, marksmanship and, by their own admission, fortitude.
2016-11-29.headline_main: Despite Flash of Rose’s Prime, Knicks Are Dazed by Westbrook and Thunder

2016-11-29.abstract: The documentary, broadcast on a network owned by the Qatari government, accuses Egypt of abusing its recruits, and the country was quick to denounce it.
2016-11-29.snippet: The documentary, broadcast on a network owned by the Qatari government, accuses Egypt of abusing its recruits, and the country was quick to denounce it.

2016-11-29.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Yascha Mounk is used to being the most pessimistic person in the room. Mr. Mounk, a lecturer in government at Harvard, has spent the past few years challenging one of the bedrock assumptions of Western politics: that once a country becomes a liberal democracy, it will stay that way.

2016-11-29.lead_paragraph: SEOUL, South Korea — President Park Geun-hye of South Korea said Tuesday that she was willing to resign before her term ends, in an effort to head off a pending impeachment vote over a devastating corruption scandal.

2016-11-29.abstract: It’s hard to follow the world chess championship and not go back in time to the epic contests of the Cold War.
2016-11-29.snippet: It’s hard to follow the world chess championship and not go back in time to the epic contests of the Cold War.
2016-11-29.lead_paragraph: It’s a different world, of course, and a different rivalry, but it’s hard when following the world chess championship match between Magnus Carlsen of Norway and Sergey Karjakin of Russia, which goes into a battery of tiebreakers after the first 12 games ended in a tie, not to go back in time to the epic chess battles of the Cold War.

2016-11-29.abstract: Rolling back the Obama administration’s policy of pragmatic engagement with Cuba would be monumentally misguided.
2016-11-29.snippet: Rolling back the Obama administration’s policy of pragmatic engagement with Cuba would be monumentally misguided.
2016-11-29.lead_paragraph: As Cubans continued either to mourn or to celebrate the death of Fidel Castro, President-elect Donald Trump issued a vague ultimatum to the Cuban government on Monday. “If Cuba is unwilling to make a better deal for the Cuban people, the Cuban/American people and the U.S. as a whole, I will terminate deal,” Mr. Trump wrote on Twitter.

2016-11-29.abstract: With Trump aggravating religious tensions in America, a Muslim author focuses on training leaders to spread interfaith values.
2016-11-29.snippet: With Trump aggravating religious tensions in America, a Muslim author focuses on training leaders to spread interfaith values.
2016-11-29.lead_paragraph: This month, the F.B.I. reported that hate crimes against Muslims in 2015 reached their highest level since 2001. In New York City this year, hate crimes are tracking one-third higher than last year; against Muslims they have more than doubled.

2016-11-29.abstract: These hate crimes and incidents of harassment were all reported in the last two weeks.

2016-11-29.lead_paragraph: This Week in Hate tracks hate crimes and harassment around the country since the election of Donald Trump. The Southern Poverty Law Center  and other groups are keeping detailed counts of harassment and abuse. We will regularly present a selection of incidents to show the scope of the problem. This article, the first in the series, includes incidents reported in the last two weeks.

2016-11-29.abstract: Donald Trump’s victory smashes traditions of party loyalty, presenting opportunities between the extremes.
2016-11-29.snippet: Donald Trump’s victory smashes traditions of party loyalty, presenting opportunities between the extremes.
2016-11-29.lead_paragraph: Over the past few decades, party loyalty has been the defining feature of national politics. Especially in the House but even in the Senate, members deferred to their party leaders. Congress as a whole deferred to the presidency. Members of the president’s own party acted as his foot soldiers. Members of the other party acted as his opposition.

2016-11-29.lead_paragraph: Republican economic policy doesn’t have a good recent track record. The last two Republican presidents left office deeply unpopular, thanks to recessions. Ronald Reagan’s record was much better but still not as good as Bill Clinton’s.

2016-11-29.abstract: When Arthur Bondar came across the negatives of a Soviet war photographer, he realized he had stumbled upon an important cache of images of World War II that gave an intimate look at that country’s side.
2016-11-29.snippet: When Arthur Bondar came across the negatives of a Soviet war photographer, he realized he had stumbled upon an important cache of images of World War II that gave an intimate look at that country’s side.
2016-11-29.lead_paragraph: Arthur Bondar looked forward to childhood summers when he shuttled between his grandmothers, who lived in different rural areas of Ukraine. He wandered the countryside picking mushrooms and fishing, and at night he listened to their stories about World War II, when the Nazis pressed them into slave labor. He grew so fascinated by the Ukrainian wartime experience that when he became a photographer, he spent years documenting that generation of Ukrainian and Russian veterans.
2016-11-29.headline_main: Rare Photos Show World War II From the Soviet Side

2016-11-29.abstract: Hao Jingfang, the first Chinese woman to win a Hugo Award, reflects on the line between reality and fiction and giving voice to “invisible people.”
2016-11-29.snippet: Hao Jingfang, the first Chinese woman to win a Hugo Award, reflects on the line between reality and fiction and giving voice to “invisible people.”
2016-11-29.lead_paragraph: Sunlight is so scarce that it is rationed based on economic class. Schools are so packed that the poorest parents must wait in line for days to secure spots for their children.
2016-11-29.headline_main: Author’s Vision of a Future Beijing Looks to China’s Present

2016-11-29.abstract: Youngest-ever finalists — one from Norway, one from Russia — compete for the game’s ultimate award.
2016-11-29.snippet: Youngest-ever finalists — one from Norway, one from Russia — compete for the game’s ultimate award.
2016-11-29.lead_paragraph: Article: At World Chess Championship, Familiar Overtones of East-West Politics
2016-11-29.headline_main: Questions for: ‘At World Chess Championship, Familiar Overtones of East-West Politics’

2016-11-29.abstract: The trade embargo has failed. What Cubans eager for the end of the Castro regime want is for the U.S. Congress to vote it down.
2016-11-29.snippet: The trade embargo has failed. What Cubans eager for the end of the Castro regime want is for the U.S. Congress to vote it down.
2016-11-29.lead_paragraph: Chicago — In my dreams as a young boy, I was chosen by the C.I.A. to assassinate Fidel Castro; I would be a hero and set Cuba free.
2016-11-29.headline_main: The Dream of a Free Cuba

2016-11-29.abstract: From media pundits to tech companies, more and more people are preaching empathy — as long as it serves their own interests.
2016-11-29.snippet: From media pundits to tech companies, more and more people are preaching empathy — as long as it serves their own interests.
2016-11-29.lead_paragraph: Two days after Donald Trump was elected president, Mark Zuckerberg, chief executive of Facebook, sat onstage at a Ritz-Carlton outside San Francisco and spoke of his deep understanding of the feelings of American voters. He was appearing at Techonomy’s annual retreat, a meeting of thought leaders in the worlds of technology, government, academia and business, and he was responding to a common criticism — the notion that Trump’s unconventional path to victory had benefited from a detour through Facebook, where a “filter bubble” distorts the flow of information and fake news stories loom large. “There is a certain profound lack of empathy,” he said, “in asserting that the only reason why someone could have voted the way they did is because they saw some fake news. If you believe that, then I don’t think you have internalized the message that Trump supporters are trying to send in this election.” When asked to articulate that message, he dodged the question.
2016-11-29.headline_main: Is ‘Empathy’ Really What the Nation Needs?

2016-11-29.abstract: Should women and girls compete alongside or against men and boys in high school, college or even professional sports?
2016-11-29.snippet: Should women and girls compete alongside or against men and boys in high school, college or even professional sports?
2016-11-29.lead_paragraph: In 2014 Mo’ne Davis became a media sensation as the first girl to throw a shutout in the Little League World Series. Now Fox has a new show in its fall lineup that features a female pitcher in Major League Baseball. Will we soon see women pitching in the major leagues?
2016-11-29.headline_main: Should Sports Be Coed?

2016-11-29.abstract: Taryn Simon’s photographs — knowing, unsentimental and meticulously made — attend to the details of how power works.
2016-11-29.snippet: Taryn Simon’s photographs — knowing, unsentimental and meticulously made — attend to the details of how power works.
2016-11-29.lead_paragraph: A few weeks ago, I stepped into a gallery in Brussels to see an exhibition by the American photographer Taryn Simon. The walls were covered with large color photographs of flower arrangements, 13 in all. Each photograph was framed in wood, and embedded in each frame was a long caption. One began: “Agreement establishing the International Islamic Trade Finance Corporation. Al-Bayan Palace, Kuwait City, Kuwait, May 30, 2006.” Another: “Framework agreement for economic cooperation. Quito, Ecuador, Jan. 12, 2012.” It was these captions that made the arrangements legible, confirming that, far from being merely decorative, the flowers were charged with historical meaning.
2016-11-29.headline_main: Capital, Diplomacy and Carnations

2016-11-29.abstract: Santiago Taveras, of DeWitt Clinton High School, joins a list of principals tasked with turning around troubled schools, only to leave or be forced out after Education Department inquiries.
2016-11-29.snippet: Santiago Taveras, of DeWitt Clinton High School, joins a list of principals tasked with turning around troubled schools, only to leave or be forced out after Education Department inquiries.
2016-11-29.lead_paragraph: As a deputy schools chancellor under Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg, Santiago Taveras oversaw efforts to close many of New York City’s large and troubled public high schools. Then, in 2013, he did something unusual. He took a pay cut and became a principal again, this time with the aim not of closing a school, but of saving one: DeWitt Clinton High School in the Bronx.
2016-11-29.headline_main: Pushing for Change, Bronx Principal Is Undone by Investigation

2016-11-29.abstract: Stock traders have bid up equity prices based on a risky proposition: that Donald J. Trump will steer Republicans in a U-turn away from tightfisted policies.
2016-11-29.snippet: Stock traders have bid up equity prices based on a risky proposition: that Donald J. Trump will steer Republicans in a U-turn away from tightfisted policies.
2016-11-29.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Stock traders celebrating Donald J. Trump’s election have been bidding up equity prices on a risky bet: that the new president will steer congressional Republicans in a U-turn away from their tightfisted fiscal policies — and bring Democrats along for the ride.
2016-11-29.headline_main: Traders Bet on Big Stimulus Spending. Congress May Not Go Along.

2016-11-29.abstract: President Obama has visited the military hospital nearly two dozen times, trips that have affected him deeply and that have inspired the injured.
2016-11-29.snippet: President Obama has visited the military hospital nearly two dozen times, trips that have affected him deeply and that have inspired the injured.
2016-11-29.lead_paragraph: BETHESDA, Md. — President Obama stood outside the room, rubbed sanitizer on his hands, set his face into a smile and knocked on the door.
2016-11-29.headline_main: Obama’s Sacred Duty: Visiting the Wounded at Walter Reed

2016-11-29.abstract: For decades, the United States and Britain’s vision of democracy and freedom defined the postwar world. What will happen in an age of Donald Trump and Nigel Farage?
2016-11-29.snippet: For decades, the United States and Britain’s vision of democracy and freedom defined the postwar world. What will happen in an age of Donald Trump and Nigel Farage?
2016-11-29.lead_paragraph: One of the strangest episodes in Donald Trump’s very weird campaign was the appearance of an Englishman looking rather pleased with himself at a rally on Aug. 24 in Jackson, Miss. The Englishman was Nigel Farage, introduced by Trump as “the Man Behind Brexit.” Most people in the crowd probably didn’t have a clue who Farage — the leader of the United Kingdom Independence Party — actually was. Yet there he stood, grinning and hollering about “our independence day” and the “real people,” the “decent people,” the “ordinary people” who took on the banks, the liberal media and the political establishment. Trump pulled his face into a crocodile smile, clapped his hands and promised, “Brexit plus plus plus!”
2016-11-29.headline_main: The End of the Anglo-American Order

2016-11-29.abstract: Our correspondent returned to the Egyptian city this fall to find a place as full of despair as her mother’s of the 1960s was full of hope and anticipation.
2016-11-29.snippet: Our correspondent returned to the Egyptian city this fall to find a place as full of despair as her mother’s of the 1960s was full of hope and anticipation.
2016-11-29.lead_paragraph: ALEXANDRIA, Egypt — My mother spoke French with her Greek neighbors in Alexandria, at the time Egypt’s most cosmopolitan city. She skipped Catholic school to ride in a red convertible with a German girlfriend down broad boulevards. She water-skied in a swimsuit, enjoying the freedom of this city in the 1960s, when it was still a beacon of Mediterranean culture.
2016-11-29.headline_main: Remembering My Mother’s Alexandria

2016-11-29.abstract: Sorting through the confusing sets of numbers in Trump’s deportation plan.
2016-11-29.snippet: Sorting through the confusing sets of numbers in Trump’s deportation plan.
2016-11-29.lead_paragraph: Sorting through the confusing sets of numbers in Trump’s deportation plan.
2016-11-29.headline_main: Could Trump Really Deport Millions of Unauthorized Immigrants?

2016-11-29.headline_main: Donald Trump, Ohio State University, ‘Hamilton’: Your Tuesday Briefing

2016-11-29.snippet: Times columnists contend that the president-elect should give Congress or an independent overseer a role in monitoring any potential conflicts.
2016-11-29.lead_paragraph: Call it the Trump Effect. Donald J. Trump’s election is getting credit and blame for all sorts of events, no matter how tangential.
2016-11-29.headline_main: Morning Agenda: The Trump Effect, Time Inc. Rejects Offer, Law Bonuses

2016-11-29.abstract: Buy your ticket before you leave home, arrive at your departure city one day before your trip — and pack light.
2016-11-29.snippet: Buy your ticket before you leave home, arrive at your departure city one day before your trip — and pack light.
2016-11-29.lead_paragraph: If you think that traveling by train isn’t your idea of a fun vacation, think again, says Eleanor Flagler Hardy, the president of the Society of International Railway Travelers, a Louisville, Ky.-based travel agency specializing in trips by rail. “Traveling by train is a fabulous way to see any country unfold, and you can truly relax onboard because you’re not worrying about driving, directions or traffic,” she said.
2016-11-29.headline_main: How to Get the Most Out of a Vacation by Train

2016-11-29.abstract: I was a lapsed downhill skier. Then I moved to Europe and discovered that the Alps were all I needed to reclaim my passion for the slopes.
2016-11-29.snippet: I was a lapsed downhill skier. Then I moved to Europe and discovered that the Alps were all I needed to reclaim my passion for the slopes.
2016-11-29.lead_paragraph: One more run. We had to take one more run from the Zehnerkar peak down the steep, snowy trails, beyond the black strings of chairlifts and all the way into the Austrian valley below, where the high-speed gondola would gather us up like parishioners crowding into church and whisk us back to the top.
2016-11-29.headline_main: Skiing the Alps, Making It My Own

2016-11-29.abstract: Famously earnest, the writer David Foster Wallace said he liked Midwestern people, and got more work done in the gusty open spaces of Central Illinois.
2016-11-29.snippet: Famously earnest, the writer David Foster Wallace said he liked Midwestern people, and got more work done in the gusty open spaces of Central Illinois.
2016-11-29.lead_paragraph: There is a spare beauty to the Illinois prairie, with winds swooshing between its wide sky and paper-flat fields. Central Illinois will often surprise visitors who don’t realize there’s much between St. Louis and Chicago. But the writer David Foster Wallace knew this gusty stretch of the Midwest well. He felt at peace among the prairie lights of its university towns, which nourished his literary genius before his death in 2008, at age 46.
2016-11-29.headline_main: David Foster Wallace’s Peaceful Prairie

2016-11-29.abstract: The actress Felicity Jones, already well regarded, is set to launch into a higher stratosphere in “Rogue One: A Star Wars Story.”
2016-11-29.snippet: The actress Felicity Jones, already well regarded, is set to launch into a higher stratosphere in “Rogue One: A Star Wars Story.”
2016-11-29.lead_paragraph: Some weeks ago, Felicity Jones was strolling the streets of London when she was stopped by a woman she described as “very tall and very model-y looking,” who politely asked to take a picture with her. Ms. Jones, an Academy Award-nominated actress, gladly obliged, then walked a short distance before she was stopped by another passer-by. “Who was that?” this pedestrian asked her.
2016-11-29.headline_main: From ‘Rogue One’: A Rising Star in a Galaxy Far, Far Away

2016-11-29.abstract: If the president-elect keeps nuclear plants going and maintains momentum for wind, solar, and shale energy, the United States could outdo its Paris pledges.

2016-11-29.abstract: About two-thirds of the shallow-water coral on the reef’s previously pristine, 430-mile northern stretch was dead, researchers reported.
2016-11-29.snippet: About two-thirds of the shallow-water coral on the reef’s previously pristine, 430-mile northern stretch was dead, researchers reported.
2016-11-29.lead_paragraph: SYDNEY, Australia — Scientists surveying the Great Barrier Reef said Tuesday that it had suffered the worst coral die-off ever recorded after being bathed this year in warm waters that bleached and then weakened the coral.
2016-11-29.headline_main: Great Barrier Reef Hit by Worst Coral Die-Off on Record, Scientists Say

2016-11-29.abstract: Zulkiflee Anwar Ulhaque, who goes by the name Zunar, is under investigation for producing cartoons that purportedly defamed Prime Minister Najib Razak.
2016-11-29.snippet: Zulkiflee Anwar Ulhaque, who goes by the name Zunar, is under investigation for producing cartoons that purportedly defamed Prime Minister Najib Razak.
2016-11-29.lead_paragraph: HONG KONG — When protesters disrupted an art exhibition by Zulkiflee Anwar Ulhaque, a political cartoonist, at the George Town Literary Festival in Malaysia on Saturday, he assumed that the police would want his help identifying those responsible.
2016-11-29.headline_main: A Malaysian Political Cartoonist on Facing His Fears, and Prison, for Art

2016-11-29.abstract: The visit by António Guterres to Beijing was another chance for China to promote its growing role in global governance.
2016-11-29.snippet: The visit by António Guterres to Beijing was another chance for China to promote its growing role in global governance.
2016-11-29.lead_paragraph: BEIJING — China extended a warm welcome this week to the incoming United Nations chief, António Guterres, praising the world body and making clear that it wants a greater role there, at a time when Donald J. Trump’s election to the White House has many wondering whether American involvement will recede.
2016-11-29.headline_main: China Welcomes Incoming Head of U.N., Where It Wants a Larger Role

2016-11-29.abstract: Using complex and proprietary optics, the Imago camera creates life-size portraits directly on photo paper. A second Imago is in the works for Beijing.
2016-11-29.snippet: Using complex and proprietary optics, the Imago camera creates life-size portraits directly on photo paper. A second Imago is in the works for Beijing.
2016-11-29.lead_paragraph: Raymond Shi first encountered what he calls “the camera of truth” in spring 2015. On a business trip to Germany for his China-based company, an online photo lab, he detoured to Berlin to try out the Imago, a three-ton steel-and-canvas colossus that required him to climb into a brightly lit chamber to capture his image on life-size photo paper.
2016-11-29.headline_main: Taking a Selfie in Berlin, With a 3-Ton Camera

2016-11-29.abstract: A group called Veterans Stand for Standing Rock planned a nonviolent intervention to defend demonstrators from the police, organizers said.
2016-11-29.snippet: A group called Veterans Stand for Standing Rock planned a nonviolent intervention to defend demonstrators from the police, organizers said.
2016-11-29.lead_paragraph: As many as 2,000 veterans planned to gather next week at the Standing Rock Sioux Reservation in North Dakota to serve as “human shields” for protesters who have for months clashed with the police over the construction of an oil pipeline, organizers said.
2016-11-29.headline_main: Veterans to Serve as ‘Human Shields’ for Dakota Pipeline Protesters

2016-11-29.abstract: Three people died and 14 were injured as high winds and a drought fueled wildfires in East Tennessee.
2016-11-29.snippet: Three people died and 14 were injured as high winds and a drought fueled wildfires in East Tennessee.
2016-11-29.lead_paragraph: PIGEON FORGE, Tenn. — Deadly wildfires ripped through the foothills of the Great Smoky Mountains in Tennessee on Monday night and Tuesday, forcing thousands to flee as emergency responders sought to contain a blaze that conjured biblical comparison.
2016-11-29.headline_main: Gatlinburg Wildfires Force Evacuations: ‘It Was Like Driving Into Hell’

2016-11-29.abstract: Tuesday: The Democrats’ two-thirds majority in both houses of the State Legislature, when Hollywood’s moguls become mortals, and an encouraging rainy spell.
2016-11-29.snippet: Tuesday: The Democrats’ two-thirds majority in both houses of the State Legislature, when Hollywood’s moguls become mortals, and an encouraging rainy spell.

2016-11-29.abstract: The president-elect, still trying to choose among a number of possibilities to be his secretary of state, won’t pull back on his habit of overnight and morning Twitter posts.
2016-11-29.snippet: The president-elect, still trying to choose among a number of possibilities to be his secretary of state, won’t pull back on his habit of overnight and morning Twitter posts.
2016-11-29.lead_paragraph: President-elect Donald J. Trump named two new cabinet picks, Representative Tom Price of Georgia, for health and human services, and Elaine Chao, a former labor secretary and the wife of Senator Mitch McConnell, to head the Transportation Department. Meanwhile, ascendant conservatives have blocked women from military draft registration.
2016-11-29.headline_main: Trump Victory Tour Set as Cabinet Comes Together

2016-11-29.abstract: Conservative nationalists have won at the ballot box. But they are still struggling to put forward an intellectual agenda.
2016-11-29.snippet: Conservative nationalists have won at the ballot box. But they are still struggling to put forward an intellectual agenda.
2016-11-29.lead_paragraph: GOA, India — The three places to which I am connected by birth, origin and marriage — Britain, India and the United States — have now experienced revolutions at the ballot box. In each, an election has revealed that liberal, globalized coastal elites stand at a tremendous remove from heartlands in open revolt. The revolt does not look to the left for inspiration but to the right. Make no mistake: “Liberal” and “left” are now said in the same breath as “corrupt establishment,” and those with torches and pitchforks are nativists, populists and nationalists of every stripe.
2016-11-29.headline_main: Does India’s Right Wing Have Any Ideas?

2016-11-29.abstract: Judges must decide whether the popular ride-booking company is a transportation enterprise or a digital platform that may provide a range of services.
2016-11-29.snippet: Judges must decide whether the popular ride-booking company is a transportation enterprise or a digital platform that may provide a range of services.
2016-11-29.lead_paragraph: LUXEMBOURG — Uber asserted on Tuesday that it was helping to bolster Europe’s digital economy as part of its defense in a long-awaited hearing to decide how the popular ride-hailing service should be able to operate across the region.
2016-11-29.headline_main: Uber, Seeking to Expand, Defends Itself at Europe’s Highest Court

2016-11-29.abstract: Fidel Castro, a Cuban revolutionary who defied the United States for nearly 50 years, died on Friday.
2016-11-29.snippet: Fidel Castro, a Cuban revolutionary who defied the United States for nearly 50 years, died on Friday.
2016-11-29.lead_paragraph: Fidel Castro, a Cuban revolutionary who defied the United States for nearly 50 years, died on Friday.
2016-11-29.headline_main: The Death of Fidel Castro

2016-11-29.abstract: The house that once trailed behind Sotheby’s and Christie’s is now primed to compete with them, hiring their experts and offering more guarantees at sales.
2016-11-29.snippet: The house that once trailed behind Sotheby’s and Christie’s is now primed to compete with them, hiring their experts and offering more guarantees at sales.
2016-11-29.lead_paragraph: When the fashion designer Tommy Hilfiger wanted to sell five works from his collection of Pop and contemporary art at auction this fall, he considered Sotheby’s and Christie’s, but ultimately took them to Phillips, long considered a distant third behind those two behemoths. “I decided this would be the best house,” Mr. Hilfiger said in an interview. “They did a great job.”
2016-11-29.headline_main: Third Place? In Auction World, Phillips Is Making Strides

2016-11-29.abstract: Assailants disguised as police officers took hostages and killed seven Indian soldiers before being shot and killed.
2016-11-29.snippet: Assailants disguised as police officers took hostages and killed seven Indian soldiers before being shot and killed.
2016-11-29.lead_paragraph: NEW DELHI — Tensions between India and Pakistan were raised again on Tuesday, when a group of heavily armed militants disguised as police officers attacked an Indian Army unit in the northern state of Jammu and Kashmir, killing seven soldiers, the Indian government said in a statement.
2016-11-29.headline_main: Militants Attack Indian Army Base in Nagrota, Inflaming Tensions With Pakistan

2016-11-29.abstract: The 12-minute orchestral work Stravinsky wrote at 26 was rediscovered in 2015. It will be performed in St. Petersburg, Russia.
2016-11-29.snippet: The 12-minute orchestral work Stravinsky wrote at 26 was rediscovered in 2015. It will be performed in St. Petersburg, Russia.
2016-11-29.lead_paragraph: An early Stravinsky work that was performed just once, in 1909, and then disappeared during the Russian Revolution will finally receive its second performance on Friday. The recently rediscovered piece will be conducted by Valery Gergiev at the Mariinsky Theater in St. Petersburg, in a concert that will be streamed online, free of charge.
2016-11-29.headline_main: Second-Ever Concert of Stravinsky’s Lost ‘Funeral Song’ to Stream Free

2016-11-29.abstract: The move signaled a possible escalation of a campaign against a separatist movement, even though the legislator had not called for independence.
2016-11-29.snippet: The move signaled a possible escalation of a campaign against a separatist movement, even though the legislator had not called for independence.

2016-11-29.abstract: From the archives of The International Herald Tribune: President Johnson announces that the U.S. will raise its legations in the Hungarian and Bulgarian capitals to embassies, in November 1966.
2016-11-29.snippet: From the archives of The International Herald Tribune: President Johnson announces that the U.S. will raise its legations in the Hungarian and Bulgarian capitals to embassies, in November 1966.
2016-11-29.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The United States built more “bridges” to Eastern Europe today by elevating its legations in Hungary and Bulgaria to the rank of embassies. President Johnson officially announced the action from his ranch in Texas. Hungary and Bulgaria are similarly raising their legations here to embassy status. Diplomatic sources here said the moves came under Mr. Johnson’s declared intention to strengthen American relations with the Communist Eastern European states, which have gained a measure of freedom from tight Russian control in recent years.
2016-11-29.headline_main: 1966: U.S. Lifts Legations in Hungary, Bulgaria

2016-11-29.abstract: The crash of a plane carrying the Brazilian soccer club Chapecoense to a game in Colombia is one of several similar accidents stretching back decades.
2016-11-29.snippet: The crash of a plane carrying the Brazilian soccer club Chapecoense to a game in Colombia is one of several similar accidents stretching back decades.
2016-11-29.lead_paragraph: Plane crashes can be uniquely devastating when a sports team is involved.

2016-11-29.headline_main: Trump Picks Elaine Chao for Transportation Secretary

2016-11-29.abstract: The woman, Anna Yocca, who was first arrested a year ago, pleaded not guilty on Monday to new charges, which include attempted criminal abortion.
2016-11-29.snippet: The woman, Anna Yocca, who was first arrested a year ago, pleaded not guilty on Monday to new charges, which include attempted criminal abortion.
2016-11-29.lead_paragraph: A Tennessee woman who is accused of trying to abort her fetus at 24 weeks with a coat hanger last year is facing new felony charges, in a case that has raised concerns among some abortion-rights advocates over strict abortion laws.

2016-11-29.abstract: Kevai Jones, who became pregnant and dropped out of school, hopes to earn a high school equivalency diploma and eventually a college degree.
2016-11-29.snippet: Kevai Jones, who became pregnant and dropped out of school, hopes to earn a high school equivalency diploma and eventually a college degree.
2016-11-29.lead_paragraph: Much of Kevai Jones’s life has been spent in the Bronx, where she was raised by a single father and with the heavy guidance of her grandmother. Yet, Ms. Jones yearns for a life down South, after getting a brief taste of it twice.
2016-11-29.headline_main: A Woman Sees Education as a Path to a Better Life for Her Daughter

2016-11-29.abstract: Leaders of the African National Congress, after a debate among party members, reaffirmed their support for the unpopular leader.
2016-11-29.snippet: Leaders of the African National Congress, after a debate among party members, reaffirmed their support for the unpopular leader.
